text: What a great fun place to come with anyone. The food is excellent I definitely have tried almost all the things on the menu. The vegetarian selection is pretty good and don't forget about those drinks the white sangria is definitely my favorite. Fun place love the atmosphere great location.

Rates were good until they zap you with mileage charges for anything over 5 miles per day. This is lunacy. Then the clerk stated mileage charges were $1 per mile  for anything over 5 miles per day. Unbelievable. Firefly is owned by Hertz where I am a long-time Goldmember. Customer service apologized but would do nothing to fix this rate problem at Las Vegas McCarran Airport

Firefly recently started serving brunch, and I have been wanting to try it since they started. I finally decided to go to celebrate my 22nd birthday with some friends. The brunch was so good, and you can still order from the rest of the menu if you want. It is a tapas breakfast still, which at first I was a little skeptical about, but it ended up being great! I had their patatas bravas (Potatoes) and the carne asada breakfast taco. The tacos are like little street tacos, but they were SO good. I also tried one of the Pumpkin Beignets, they look a little bit like donut holes,  they didn't really taste like pumpkin, but they were still a tasty treat. 

Most importantly, for brunch they have all you can drink (with a 2 hour limit), mimosas, sangria, and bloody marys. I obviously had to try all of them. The mimosas were very good, I am not a big fan of bloody marys while I'm eating, but besides that it was a very basic bloody mary, still tasty. Their sangria is always good, so no surprise there. I like to get the sparkling white, because I'm not a big wine fan. We definitely stayed the whole two hours. 

Besides the food, the service was great! There were about 10 of us so we had a lot of people coming over to help. The manager even stopped by to wish me happy birthday which was very nice! I also got a birthday shot, great place to go to celebrate! I would definitely recommend!

*disclaimer: I had written this almost a year ago, and apparently forgot to submit it. I just noticed it was still in my drafts and decided I should still post it!

Outstanding!   We have eaten here many times for dinner and love it so much we wanted to have our wedding party here!  Everything was perfect for our group of 25.  Ragina is an excellent coordinator and Manuel and Fernanda were outstanding in taking care of us.  From beginning to end...we couldn't be happier.   Thank you Thank you!

Been here about 6 or 7 times in the last 12 months. Unfortunately it's been slowly getting worse every time I go. The last time was the worse. The food was cold/lukewarm the drinks watered down and we were basically told it that's the way the dish/drink is prepared. Even though its something I'd ordered many times. The rest of my party had been there independently of me and felt the same way some stating this would be the last time. The service was not at fault and she did remove an item from my bill I could not eat. But the food quality unfortunately as not as great as it once was.
This is the second time I've been to Firefly, and they were both events where they had an open bar and also a series of appetizers that I have to say leaving you very full and satisfied.

Great restaurant good food good service the only problem is it was very loud in there
For those who never been to a Tapas Bar don't order more than three tapas Per person three tapas is a lot of food we ordered five tapas for two of us and chicken and mushroom paella but we couldn't eat the paella as we were already full oh one more thing there is not enough parking in the so you have to go to the back and it's a long walk.
If you are staying by the convention center, this is the place to eat. Simply put, fantastic food.

I can't believe that before this weekend I have never been here. The food.... is AMAZING. Everything has so much flavor and just melts right in your mouth. We ordered so much food and there was not one thing we didn't like! 

We were a party of 12 with no reservations but were seated within 20 minutes. Staff was friendly. The vibe was amazing. Would definitely come back and recommend to everyone!

We went a a month ago to celebrate my partner's birthday. Carlos was our server and he was extremely professional and polite and made our experience very pleasant and enjoyable! The manager came by to check on us and after we gushed about Carlos he gave the table a round of shots!
Everything that other people recommended was superb.  Bacon dates, stuffed peppers, Diablo shrimp, manchego salad, Serrano sliders.   Just go with others recommendations and come with friends!

We live in a BIG little town. To be able to go to a bar/restaurant that attracts so many tourists and still be able to call it your local, speaks volumes. The food is fantastic and the drinks are not easily matched- anywhere else in this town. 
Let's talk about the staff: Where to begin- Omar,Danny, Daniel and Mariano - they all bring a little  something different to the table.  I cannot pick a favorite because they're all so GREAT! Danny makes a mean cucumber Bloody Mary - Omar is famous for his fun personality and mixology skills. ( this guy will make you a GREAT drink ) Mariano - ( Dimples ) and Danny of course .. you're all fantastic! 

Don't miss a trip here!

The tapas here are to die for.  We love the variety and the different flavors they have to offer.  The scallops and tuna tare tare were our favorites.  We had the paella which was great, but would have preferred to not order it as it was so filling we didn't have any room for more tapas.  We will definitely be coming back!
I love coming here for their amazing martinis and their tasty chicken dishes but one thing I don't like is sometimes I have to wait for a table for a very long time

Came here with my family on a Wednesday night. There is a couple parking spaces available in the front, and more in the back of the restaurant as well.

Atmosphere - The atmosphere is really nice. Modern decor and dim lighting. 

Service - We were greeted promptly and were seated within a couple of minutes. The servers were friendly and came by every so often to refill our waters and ask how the food was.

Food - Oh my god. Everything was so on point. We ordered a lot of food, but my favorites would have to be the Babyback ribs and the Apple and manchego salad. The salad was delicious; it had just the right amount of dressing to counter the sweetness of the apples. The ribs were also amazing! The meat was cooked perfectly and the sauce was drool-worthy. Everything was perfect. The portions are decently sized, allowing you to order a variety of tapas to try. And just to add on, the mixed paella was just as tasty. There was a perfect proportion of seafood, chicken, and rice. The flavors were incredible.
I would highly recommend this place. Yum yum yum!

Came here for Sunday brunch solo at 10:00 a.m., and sat at the bar. This place never disappoints.  Had the bottomless drinks, including the white sangria, red sangria,  and mimosa.  Your best bet is the red.  Also enjoyed the chilaquiles, carne asada breakfast taco, French toast, bacon and banana beignets.  So delicious!  The bartender was so gracious and attentive.  I've been here for dinner too.  Love Firefly!!!! Felt like I was in España having tapas.

The first time we ate here on vacation, we had the stuffed dates, warm spinach salad, chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms and Tierra y mar skewers. Everything was perfectly cooked. The filet mignon was cooked perfectly. The stuffed dates in the wine reduction are a must! The warm salad was amazing! We were not big on the chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms. It was hit and miss on whether or not there was enough stuffing in the mix. 

We loved it so much we came a second time and ordered all the same dishes except we had lamb instead of the stuffed mushrooms and we ordered TWO of the stuffed dates (so friggin good!). The lamb was the first dish we had that we were not impressed with. We love lamb and eat a lot of it. This was tough and lacking flavor. The lentils that come with it were great though. The cook on the Tierra y mar the second time was off too. One of the shrimp tasted raw. Meat was tougher. I think it is probably different chefs on different nights? We were not as thrilled the second night.
Beautiful restaurant and attentive staff. But watch out, this is a hot spot! You'll have to wait for a table. Don't worry, it's worth it!

Favorites were goat cheese with sauce and melt in your mouth chicken tinga empanadas! My husband had the blood orange mojito which was a bit on the sour side for me but he enjoyed it. He ordered the filet mignon which he devoured!

Wanted to try something different and avoid the overpriced touristy restaurants of the Strip.  This place fit the bill.  The food was excellent - so many different choices which was great because two in our party were vegetarian.  We did not have one thing that we did not enjoy.

My husband and I loved the Bacon Wrapped Dates and the Steak and Mushroom Skewers.  Our friends loved the Empanadas and Manchego Mac and Cheese.  We had a bunch of other stuff too - seemed like the plates just kept coming and coming!  

We shared two pitchers of Sangria - delicious and just enough to get the warm fuzzies without being over the top.  

The service was excellent and food came out promptly and at good intervals so we were never without tapas on the table...but never overwhelmed with too many plates at a time.  Just a great experience.  We will definitely go back again.
Place is great, food is awesome! Great service ! Don't listen to the bad reviews from long ago! This place is awesome

Customer service, food and drinks are always excellent. Every time we visit Las Vegas we make it a point to have dinner here. We recommend it to everyone that visits Las Vegas. My husband is very picky when it comes to everything and he always walks out raving about this place so I know they are doing things right here. This place is so good he signed up for a Yelp account so he personally can give it 5 stars (very unlike him).

Probably one of the greatest secrets in Vegas! I took 16 people to this restaurant it's off the charts. The food is unbelievable, the service Exquisite, the prices so affordable, and the atmosphere sexy and exotic. We loved it every single one of us you have to go to Firefly on Paradise because you'll go back every time and we are from Colorado and California.

I love the variety of food choices here. Great atmosphere, location, pricing, and the staff is always professional. You can go dressed up after a show or dressed down from running errands. It's appealing to all walks of life.

LOVED this place. We got amazing tapas in a lovely setting for a great price with great service. The tuna tartare was outstanding. Definitely get the bacon wrapped dates, and the pork empanadas were to die for. Great ambiance, easy parking, really nice servers. I would recommend making reservations, especially if you're going on a Saturday night as we did. They utilize Open Table for online reservations, so it's super easy. I really wish this place had a location in my city.
The bartender gives the men free beer & she's nice to look at. The food was good and the atmosphere was good.
My girlfriend and I come here all the time and the service is awesome. Omar, Luis and Patrick are the best bartenders we've come across!
It hadn't impressed me. Its good, thats all. Its more appetizers than main dishes, and the plates didnt come together, my boyfriend was done before I even started.

Loved the small plate concept. 
Stuffed Peppers, filet-sausage skewers, basically everything was great. All the desserts were great as well. We had fun sharing everything and trying a little of everything. Mario gave us great service.

Amazing!  A great experience. Food and service were exceptional.  Do yourself a favor and skip the overly priced Chef themed restaurants on the strip and get to Firefly.  Order anything that sounds good and you will love it!  Shrimp diablo, apple salad, petite filet, scallops, bacon wrapped dates all phenomenal!  The only thing that was just ok was the pork empanda.  Had sangria and flan for dessert.  Great.  Love this place.  Will be back.

Nahum , Gabriel nd Marco are amazing at the firefly restaurant ! We had a bachelorette party here for lunch nd the tapas were great . The sangria will get your party started and the great service will make your day ! Love it !

My husband and I just went there for lunch today and it was extremely disappointing. We ordered a veggie paella because we missed the paella we tried there couple years ago. So after 40 mins passed, the paella came with so little rice, and it was really more like a stir fried veggie instead of paella. Paella is a rice dish, there should have been a reasonable amount of rice but there was really not much rice! I remember they gave more than that years ago. And I have eaten paella in various restaurants, so I know how a paella should be. The paella today at Firefly was absolutely ridiculous. It was like a stir fried veggie with little rice sprinkled on it and then stirred together. We felt totally cheated. We didn't send it back because we didn't want to wait another 40 mins. And we totally lost faith in this place so we didn't bother to ask them for making a new one or ordering some other tapas instead. I ended up not touching the paella after 2 bites, and my husband ate the whole thing; he was able to finish it by himself because there was hardly any rice to make him full. the menu said paella is meant for 2-4 people, so u can imagine how little rice there was when my husband could finish it by himself! Compared with the paella we got there years ago, we couldn't finish the whole thing together years ago, while my husband can finish the sorry pathetic "paella" today by himself. It was really jacked up and we got out of there as soon as my husband finished it, and now we are sitting in another restaurant to get fed. We will not go back to Firefly again, it was not like what we had years ago. I never see any paella with so little rice in it in my whole life! Totally not an honest business. $20 for a stir fried veggie looking paella was totally wrong!

Food is amazing, even the bread! Order the shrimp diablo, bacon wrapped dates, chicken & chorizo stuffed mushrooms, and I can't forget the patatas bravas!!! I eat this every time I visit. It's a must each time I'm in Vegas!!!!

I wouldn't go back. I don't mind overspending when the service is really good but service for me was way below average. Don't even think about ordering a steak if you happen to love steak sauce because they don't have any. I'm not sure the scallops were in fact scallops. $11 dollars for 6 small white squishy flimsy somethings but I'm not sure what.

This place used to good not sure what happened. Lamb chops were flavorless, soup was bland, and the service was terrible. Gazpacho was the worst! Barely ate anything we ordered. Don't waste your money.
It would be 6 stars if it was available.  Ivan served us today, and was excellent, courteous and fast.  The food is always perfect and Firefily* has the best Sangria on the planet.
Came here with a group of 11 girls for my cousins Bachelorette; Food and service is amazing!! Loved it can't wait to come back to vegas to eat here again!

I go here every time I come to Vegas. It's a great local spot without all the annoying drunk tourists. Unbelievable service and food. 

I highly recommend the stuffed dates. Sweet dates stuffed with Bleu cheese and wrapped in bacon.

The shrimp ceviche is amazing. Good portion, too. 

Get the clams with chorizo. So good!

Firefly is my go-to place! I love the stuffed dates, apple cheese salad, and the chicken skewers. The food is consistent and the delicious bread and almond butter is always complimentary. 

I don't, however, recommend the paella because it is more like a risotto than paella. The flavor is good, but the texture is not what you would expect with paella. Maybe they are just rushed the day I had it. 

Prices are very reasonable.

Best service! Drinks are never empty as their very aware of your experience. It is very clean, the servers are very hospitable and has a fun atmosphere. I recommend a pitcher of red sangria!!!! I always get the tres leches cake. No else can make it this good! The bacon wrapped dates are a must!!! I honestly love their new location as it's much roomier and more fun place to visit. Thanks Firefly!

This place is fantastic as a couple or in a bigger group.  Great tapas, great menu of either adventurous or more standard choices.  Reasonably priced.   Suggest you order a couple and then keep adding on because you get full pretty fast.   With so many new and different dining choices in Vegas I always tell myself to try someplace new, but every trip I find myself back here.  Never disappoints.

Firefly made my wedding meet and greet amazing!! Carlos, Lalo, Jesus, and Gabriel made sure we had everything we needed!! The food was awesome and the drinks were even better!! Make sure you check out the bigger and better Firefly on Paradise!!!!

Total redemption from the management team at Firefly.  Thank you Tabitha for reaching out.  Last night was no less than perfect service from Irina and staff.  I also tried the beet salad and the lamb chops with lentils which by the way is now one of my favorite dishes.  Thank you again for providing a great atmosphere and delicious dishes!
Grwat food. Love it. They have the best food in town. If you come to vegas stop in abd dine in

Firefly is an AMAZING place to eat and drink.  Service is always amazing and our server today, Patrick, was crazy good.  Come by and see him at the bar for some delicious mojitos and good conversation.  Try the Chorizo stuffed mushrooms, steamed mussels and Passion Fruit mojitos. Freaking bomb!
One of the best stops off the strip in Vegas! A must stop for amazing food, quick and awesome servers.

The ambience was appealing. Whether you'd dine as a couple, in a group or solo, it has appeal for all. The prices were fair across the menu.
The service was ideal. Our waiter took the time to answer our questions about the unfamiliar dishes on the menu and he gave adequate suggestions based on our tastes and food familiarity.
We ordered all Tapas for meal. 6 different types, a couple that were house specialties. The white anchovies and stuffed dates. They were superb. A pitcher of White Sangria was tasty and accompanied all of our Tapas selections which included lamb, beef, veggies, seafood and chicken. Everything prepared had excellent eye appeal and flavor and each portion was comparable to the price. We shared each Tapa dish evenly. The warm bread kept coming. Because it was our wedding anniversary a wonderful flan was comped by our superb waiter.
We came home to L.A bragging to our friends and family about our new food spot in Las Vegas. We will surely return there.

I have been going to Firefly for years.  It was recommended to me first by a close friend that worked in the restaurant industry in Vegas as a locals place. I went to the original location one block away and since the move, have been to the new location a few times now.  I make it a point to visit this place each time I visit Vegas on business or pleasure.  I recommend this place to all my friends, family, and co-workers.

On my recent visit on 12/28/13, my family (4 of us total..kids were 10 and 14) enjoyed:

1) Red Sangria - Get a pitcher(s) of this stuff.  It is the nectar of the wine gods.  It is a perfect blend of sweet and tart on a hot or warm day and compliments all the dishes they have well.

2) Tapas Style - Since moving to the new larger location, they changed their menu and added more flare.  
  - Tomato-basil soup and grilled cheese is light, flavorful, and refreshing.
  - Shrimp ceviche is cool refreshing, seasoned well and balanced in flavor.
  - Stuffed Dates had a smoky bacon wrapped around a semi-sweet date with an almond inside.  It was a great combination of flavors and the crunch added a nice texture.
  - Firefly Fries are a large portion of garlic and parmesan goodness.
  - Manchego Mac 'n' Cheese was the kid's favorite.  Fresh and homemade with real cheeses.
  - Chicken Skewers was another kid's favorite.  There was a roasted garlic cream that added some good flavor to the chicken.
  - Serrano Sliders were really tasty and tender.  We added some of the onion straws it came with as a garnish in the slider to kick it up a notch.
  - Merguez...my wife doesn't like sausage but this lamb sausage was great.  Not very gamey but a good rich tasting meat complimented with red peppers.
  - Lamb Chops - It was like eating candy...it was lamb as it should be with a base of seasoning that brought out a slight pleasant sweetness.
  - Camarones a la Diabla - Shrimp in a spicy sweet sauce.  Hands down one of the best dishes there.  The sauce is so good...ask for extra bread for dipping.
  - Desserts for us consisted of our favorites...flan and tres leches cake.  The flan is traditionally made and the flavor of the custard has an almond taste to it...the tres leches cake is moist and sweet to eat.

3) Service - The servers, runners, and bussers were fantastic.  Our drinks were always filled, table was clutter free, and our server checked in at the right moments.  

4) Ambiance - The new location is much easier to get in and out of.  The décor and layout of the restaurant was very open and relaxing.

Overall...great job on the new location and new menu!

This place was great (food/drinks/prices), our waiter was not so great. The lady who bussed our tables was AWESOME and took the time to tell us all her favorite things on the menu.

We happened to be there on latin night which was really cool, it was so packed there was nowhere to sit on the patio, but it was no big deal because we got a great view of the amazing dancer. 

Best shrimp tempura I have ever had! Will be coming back to try more items
Great place to have tapas food just great I love there bacon dates and sangria  and calamari and like there new location.
Long wait, and service is good, depending on the waiter's mood. They have really good appetizers, and the mixed paella was worth the 40 min wait.

This was my first visit to Firefly.  This place was really, really great. I has a very nice atmosphere, great food, and the service was impeccable.  We had a large party, and they added the automatic gratuity; this is usually very annoying to me.  However in the case of Firefly, they earned it and I was happy to sign the bill.  I am a fan, you should certainly check them out when in LV.
It's the bomb and Alberto is the best! He is amazing! The food was great, clean restaurant and excellent service

I LOVE this place!  Colorful, Fun atmosphere!  Bacon wrapped Dates, amazing!  
Great place to take out of town company!  Not the standard chain place!

The new location behind its old location is perfect! Still same spot basically with more room and better service. I love the tapas and the atmosphere and i have been goin to firefly for 6 years now. The food is always great and i leave there full and satisfied. And you get alot for what u pay for. The desserts also are so delicious. Enjoy

One night in Vegas  so we wanted our choice to be perfect. We really love tapas and Firefly was close but more importantly yelp reviews were compelling. Went in with high expectations and boy we were not disappointed! The padron peppers were delicately fried (no hint of greasiness!) and piping hot. Some peppers were spicier than the others so order them if you like spicy. Our server was so pleasant and welcoming! He recommended several dishes , one of them the Camerones Diabla which was beyond delicious with the most complex sauce that was finger licking good. The refreshing artichoke toasts with a tasty aioli and the white anchovies with avocado were second to none and great palette cleansers because both are topped generously with fresh, chopped basil. Lastly, we ordered the eggplant cannelloni - 3 delicately rolled eggplant stuffed with airy goat cheese mixture - wow! We ended with the cherry bread pudding with port reduction and ice cream...it was beautifully plated . It was a feast for all the senses.  Oh, don't forget the sangria- we had the red and it was so flavorful with a perfect balance of alcohol and sweetness. 
I wish we had another night because we would go back to try more tapas that we could not devour tonight. We have been fortunate to dine in some great places and when you come across friendly and attentive staff...neat setting...and food you would pay double for in other cities..Firefly is your kind of place! We look forward to an encore in the near future!!!!

Dates wrapped with bacon. And lamb chops. 

Heavenly and I would go there everyday if I could. 

The bartender was super nice and polite.

Truly outstanding! I liked it so much I went back two days later. Just down the street from the convention center, so skip the blah convention food and go here. The portions are generous, and the food is wonderful. Not to be missed are the stuffed dates, spicy shrimp, apple salad, and filet mignon. The bread comes with spicy butter that is amazing. The sangria is tasty too. The service is great as is the ambiance. It's a little noisy but it feels festive there. I can't wait to go back!

We asked for a quiet area for our business dinner and got it. What a fabulous meal! The food was exceptional and affordable. Scallops were perfect, dates were delicious, lamb was exceptional - I highly recommend.

Finally made it back for my two favorite items here at Firefly. 1 is the Mango Mojito and next is the order of the stuffed dates then shortly the Sangria. Mission accomplished and then off to my next adventure. If you have time try the tuna tar tar it is so refreshing

I have never heard of this place before and after coming here one night with a group of friends I left thinking, "Why haven't I heard of this place before?!" We came here for my friend's birthday before hitting up the club and you know what? I really liked the idea of having tapas. Because I mean, who would want to go out after a full meal?

Anyways, I only ordered the Firefly fries and Chicken and Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms. Even with the small selection I chose, I was not disappointed. They even serve this bread with this sweet tasting butter which I could not stop eating! I even soaked them up with the sauce for the Camarones a la Diabla which someone else ordered. 

I really wanna go back and try more things on the menu. I wished I had tried the dates that everyone says is to die for! I'm definitely going back soon.
Good food, nice staff, allergy friendly and a cool decor. I really enjoyed the octopus and the ceviche, really good portions for being tapas.

Love this place! Every time I visit Vegas, I make sure to have dinner here. Huge selection of great food and spirits!! I have been here when it has been packed and when it has been slow and received great service both times.

One of the best meals in Vegas! We order multiple plates to share,  the bacon wrapped dates were first, savory and sweet. The we're the fries, I recommend the parmasean dipping sauce, we have to get a second (it was that good).  The Pork chops and chicken were flavorful, the mac and cheese was a must! Service was a little slow and the server could have been around more the food made it with it!

I will keep this review short, simply and sweet.

I love this restaurant!! I wish we had one in California because it is down right delicious. Everything we tried was amazing and the tuna tartar was the best - I had TWO! This will be a MUST place to go to whenever I am in Vegas. I even dare say that it is a lot better than some high prices, high rise, five star restaurant's I've been to on both the strip and downtown.

But remember this is a TAPAS restaurant which means that plate sizes are finger food sized and not very large. It is a good place for groups but if you are all looking to stuff your face then this is not the place for you. If however you are looking for a sleek and posh restaurant with amazingly high quality food and flavor this is THE place!
Had the petite filet and it was amazing!! The flavor was mouth drooling! Also had the white sangria which was delicious as well! Definitely going to be back! Decor was cool too

One of my favorite places to hit when in Vegas.  Superb food - high quality and very creative.  The mojitos are fantastic.  Only gripe is the long wait during peak times, but, hey, the secret is out, right?

Wow, first time here in all my years in Vegas and I must say very impressed.  Great drinks all around and the bartender was definitely and expert in his profession.  I'm sad I didn't came on an empty stomach as the food that kept walking by looked fantastic. I will for sure be coming back for a full experience.
The best Mojitos I've had in a while! The food was very good and so was the ambience. Small shareable plates. Bacon Dates were my favorite!!

Our uber driver recommended and he was right!  This was a great restaurant which my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed!  

The camarones diablo was to die for, as was the pork empanadas!  My husband loved the dates wrapped in bacon!  We also enjoyed the sliders-superb, delish!
Best Sangria I have ever had.  Nice change from ordinary Las Vegas chain restaurants.
Best tapas I've ever had. The infused vodka is delish as well. Service was great. Delivery of the food (staggered) was perfect.
I've bn coming to this bar/restaurant for many years.  The food is great & the bartender Daniel is the best .. Actually the whole staff is great ..

Great affordable tapas!

I love their sparkling sangria and their honey almond butter. I ate two platefuls of it this time around. 

My go-to's are the the tuna tartare and the mixed paella. Make sure you order the paella early on so you don't have to wait too long. 

This time we had Jaime serving our table along with our main server and he was amazing. Someone give him a promotion! He never let me see the bottom of my water glass and that is very rare. He even stopped another server from taking away my lemon wedges because he knew I wasn't done with them. 

Good food, good prices.

I'll keep this one short lol

AMAZING FOOD!!! I didn't know I could get full and happy off of tapas!!! Everything tasted great! I couldn't pick one thing over the rest to recommend because it was all good! Portion size was perfect for tapas! 

Staff was friendly and engaging, the atmosphere was fun though a little loud for lunch time (probably because my husband, 4 month old and I got seated next to a party of 20!), the food was amazing, the drinks were good and the price was to be expected. You definitely pay for the quality and portion size. 

Overall, I would definitely recommend this place!!!

I ate here this past Friday night as a party of 6. The ambience was nice, service friendly, and food was very good. However, all 6 of us suffered from very violent food poisoning. I'm at the 48 hour point and am still recovering. The other location in Las Vegas was shut down due to not following health codes. (Thus why this restaurant opened) Looking at some other recent reviews I noticed others mentioning stomach aches. Under no circumstances will I ever eat here again as no food is worth this amount of discomfort. Eat here at your own risk!
Nothing bad food wise, but nothing to bring me back. Mediocre service and food. Asked for salt and pepper....get it?

One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas for food quality... you would not believe the price. The service is amazing, everything our waiter recommended was on point. The food and drinks were brought out faster than our go to breakfast establishment. Don't be deterred when walking by with the noise or appearance, the
Back has a quiet area. This place is sensational. Also the mojitos are banging!

This is a mixed review, the food was great, I ordered the mushroom tart and the chorizo clams. Both were great, especially the clams which were full of flavor. But the service was bad, they mess upmost of the other orders, and we're slow and inattentive. The water tasted off, as most likely they used the pitcher for something else, and did not wash it.

LOVE this place.  everything we've ordered has been amazing.  we would go here every week if we lived close!  the new location is a lot bigger. there is also a large patio sitting area with some lounge couches too.  the last time we went we received EXCEPTIONAL service.  can't wait to go back, we want to try everything on the menu it is so good :) i honestly think it is my favorite restaurant!

Great food.. Service was alright. Everyone helped us BUT our server. It took 20 minutes for a shot of alcohol to get to our table. Other than that nice place and atmosphere. I took my boyfriend here for his birthday.
It is good! Food is delish tried mushrooms, Mac and cheese, scallops, and lamb chops. Service was super good and very professional. Can't wait to go back!

My wife and I had date night here on a Friday night.

The food was great, we were seated quickly and everyone was pleasant. They even had non-alcoholic beer, which is a plus because I was the designated driver.

The food was great, fresh, and you can't beat the price. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.

The only set back was that it gets a little loud, and the seating doesn't allow you to sit closely to your date. So, I had to cup my ears to listen to my wife tell me how her day was. Probably better for a social night out, than a date place.

I am looking forward to returning soon.

My boyfriend and I went for Valentine's Day and had a great experience. It's our 3rd or 4th time here and each time has been a solid 5 stars!!! THIS PLACE IS TOP NOTCH AND WON'T DISAPPOINT!! We have been when it's slow and busy and even when it's busy the wait for dishes isn't bad. Reservations *highly recommended* in the evenings! 

Tierra y Mar Skewer is PERFECT!! The steak is tender, the sauce is tangy. I hate shrimp and it's still delicious! The sausage completes the dish!!! 

We've had the apple and manchego salad as well as the chopped chicken salad and both were unexpectedly delicious. The apple and manchego has a delicious, tangy bite. 

My boyfriend got the Beef Wellington, which was one of their specials. I wasn't the biggest fan but it's not really my cup of tea. He loved it and it was only $15! Great way to try a dish and be able to do smaller portions. 

Ceviche of shrimp is the last dish I'd recommend. I'm such a snob when it comes to ceviche and Firefly's is always delicious!!! 

Lastly try the damn passion fruit mojito! I usually don't care for flavors in mojitos or margaritas but passion fruit is the way to go! We got a pitcher this time because of the deliciousness factor! 

If you are scared to try something, look at the yelp photos! It helps!!!
The portions are huge! We ordered a few because we expected them to be small, but we were stuffed halfway through the first ones!
Loved every damn minute. Third time here, no disappointments- from the hostess to the valet, all dedicated and on point. We will be back tomorrow and every other visit to Vegas.

We had a wedding reception in their private banquet room with 46 people. We planned the whole thing via email, and they were great! They responded right away and were so easy to work with. The food was awesome too, everyone loved it. 
There's a lot of options for banquets, we got unlimited 6 tapas of our choice, open bar for 2 hours, and dessert. The price could not be beat!! I want to go back before I leave!
Great food clean environment, Antonio our waiter was amazing, very attentive. Delicious Sangria!! Filet mignon was exquisite.  My new favorite place!

Great bar with huge liquor selection. He tapas menu is also huge which I live and bow tapas should be. You can order alot of different dishes to try. Prices have gone up and the portions are bigger. Even their dessert menu had plenty options. Disappointing that they early happy hour is only on drinks and not food. Only their late night happy hour includes food. 
Lamb chops were good with a nice rub...didn't need the sauce and the sides it came with. The anchovy toast were really good. The lamb sausage sucked! Dry and very gamey, needed more herbs. Tuna tartare was very good. The octopus wasn't as good as the 1st time I had it.

Frustrating place to dine.  We were with a group on the patio. When we tried to order food, they told us we have to order inside. We went in and sat at one of the 2-tops in the bar, and were informed that we cant order from the bar unless we sit at the bar. Finally a waiter came over and took our order.  Then the waiter from outside informs us that if we need anything he will take care of us and not the waiter who took our order.  Wow!!!  Last visit here.

Seriously...the BEST EVER! We are foodies and it's not often that I say I would eat here over and over! The flavors, service, relaxed atmosphere and options are phenomenal - can't even put into words! This is one of my most favorite places to eat! Must experience!!!

Went for my 30th birthday with a group of friends and family and this place far exceeded all expectations. The food and service was phenomenal. The staff was very attentive and went above and beyond for service. The bacon wrapped dates are amazing! All of the food was exceptional. No one in our group left hungry or unsatisfied. The atmosphere is great, the evening was so enjoyable. There is not one thing I could think of complaining about. This was just a great time and I would highly suggest this restaurant  to anyone.
This food is incredible! The servers are friendly and attentive! Pepe, Alejandra and Vanessa are the best!! :)) my favorite place to go after work!

We were driving by trying to find a restaurant n found this one... it was amazing from the appetizers to the main course. Customer service was over a 10 . Very friendly waiters. Will defiantly make it our place to eat everytime we come down from LA.

Delicious! Just stick to the drinks and tapas. If you are on a budget and want to feed a large group then order the big rice entrée, however the flavor is not great and is the reason for only 4 stars.

I came at dinner on December 18 2015. It was great to have come.
Great atmosphere, great food.  The Shrimp Diablo was delicious, great service.  Will definitely come again.
Place is very nice and clean. Food is good and they have varieties, small portions as it is tapas, great customer service... that pudding was awsome.

My wife and I, hosted a small wedding reception in their semi private area.  They handled the event with exceptional service by their staff.  

I would recommend the venue for this type of event.

The only downside was that I happened to chop down on an olive.  I expected it to be pitted, and I found it to have a pit.  Unfortunately, my tooth was not receptive.  Firefly handled it in a very responsible and professional manner.  

Great time was had by all.

This place is amazing. Every time my wife and I are in Vegas, we have to come here. We usually start with the Red Sangria which is delicious. We then go to the tapas menu which is excellent and affordable. Our favorite starter is the Stuffed Dates with goat cheese. We then go with the calamari, lamb chops, chorizo and clams, shrimp tempura, etc. There hasn't been an item on the menu that I do not love or would not try. Good food. Loud, but that means the place is lively. We converse with other people about the food and get excellent recommendations. Not to mention the excellent staff. They are both courteous and professional. We love this place.

I live in California and needed to arrange a wedding rehearsal dinner for my nephew.  His fiance had suggested Firefly.  She said the food was great and she and her family enjoy it.  I looked them up online and and came across the event section, I sent a quick email for someone to call me.  That day, the event coordinator Regina Simmons contacted me.  We corresponed via email text and by phone.  We were a party of 35 and were able to have the private room in the back.  

On our way to the venue I sent Regina a text that we were on our way.  Once seated our waiter, Jesus was on it.  We had water bread and drink orders.  Oh did I mention that I left all my centerpieces there and Regina and her staff decorated for me.  She even ordered linens and napkins to match our rustic chic wedding decor.  Everything looked beautiful.  

Within 10 minutes of settling in, BAM!!!!  The food, oh the food.  We had artichoke toast, the bacon wrapped dates, salmon toast, beef and chicken skewers and the diablo shrimp.  Everything was delicious.  The service was awesome and the food amazing.  The value was definately there.

Parking, use the valet parking, it's FREE!!!!!

When we were leaving, the place was bumping, it was a great vibe and great mix of people.  I will definately be back on our next trip.  Can't wait to try new items. (Will definately order the bacon dates again)

Thank you Regina and the Firefly staff for making this event special and memorable for my nephew and and now new wife. 

Gracias por todo!

Came late night with a party of 13 people called ahead and they had a table ready for us. Since it was late we were able take advantage of happy hour prices on a few items which was great, we ordered a few pitchers of Sangria and variety of tapas everything was excellent, the tapas that stood out to me were the may y tierra skewer, patatas bravas and my wife enjoyed the croquetas. Service was good and attentive would definitely go back

Came here for a dinner in one of their private rooms. Since I was fasting I needed to eat vegan to which they were very accommodating. The potatoes brava were really good along with the winter veggies. People at the table enjoyed their food. I would recommend

My girlfriend and I love coming to firefly on our nights off together. We always sit at the bar and make sure to come when Athena is working. She always makes sure we have the best time and have everything we need! Her food suggestions are always on point, not to mention the delicious drinks! She works so efficiently and never makes us feel like she's rushed. We will definitely keep coming back here.
Firefly...there is no substitute for this place.  Bacon wrapped dates, Sangria, Tuna tartare, filet skewers...this place never disappoints.  Be sure you say hi to Athena at the bar - she rocks.
We had great service with drinks and water always staying full! All the tapas were delicious and their vegan menu was great for all our vegan friends.

A friend of mine was in town and I took her here based on the yelp reviews.  It was my first time as well and I had high expectations based on the reviews.  This place did not disappoint!  The food and the drinks were fantastic!  We ordered a pitcher of sangria to split.  So yummy!  I just kept drinking more and more....They have this amazing garlic bread to start, with some sort of sweet butter.  AMAZING!  It was addicting and I had to stop myself from eating the whole thing.  In addition, my friend and I ordered the firefly fries, steak and mushroom skewers, and ham and cheese croquets.  All of the dishes were phenomenal.  They have a lot of different options for tapas and they all sounded so good but we had to stop after 3 since we were getting real full. 

The service was also great.  Our server always came by to check on us and our glasses were always filled.  This place looks to be a great place for groups to eat and drink together.  We came around 7:45-8pm and were seated right away.  It wasn't too busy.  However, as the night went on, it seemed to start getting really busy and louder around maybe 9pm with a lot more groups.  Something to keep in mind.

I can't wait to come back here and take my husband so we can try some more tapas (looking forward to trying their paella)...and so I can drink more of that delicious sangria of course ;)

Best place for tapas the stars wrapped in bacon are my absolute fav along with the mussels in a creamy tomato sauce is also amazing but the thing I go for is the sangria it is to die for every time I go on vacation to Vegas I make sure I stop here it's a must

Great cocktails but bad service.  Sat at the bar and pretty much had the menu thrown at me. It took about ten minutes for the bar tender to notice me after I had a chance to review the menu. It was my first time there and probably my last. Sucks because I was really excited about going there.

This place have stale food which is microwaved when you complain it is cold. I could not believe they reheated our skewers in microwave instead of making new ones. these came out chewy and cold inside. It is pathetic, how can they charge $15 for a plate and not have Courtesy to at least make there edible. I saw lot of people here either they are tourist who do not know any better or people who have never been to true tapas place.

My husband and I spend our summer's in Vegas. We have been coming to firefly for years. The new location is bigger and very nice. Our favorites include the tomato basil soup and tuna tar tar, and for dessert we love the tres leches chocolate cake! We have tried probably 3/4 of the menu and those are must haves!

I cannot find one bad thing to say about this place!  We had our 20th Anniversary party here, after doing our vow renewal at Little Chapel of Flowers this past Saturday.  The Chapel went faster then we thought it would and our reservations weren't until 7:00pm and we were done by 6pm!  With 30 people standing around I called Firefly and they were SO accommodating to see if we could get in early!  We got there at 615pm and the room wasn't quite ready but no worries, we all went into the bar area and ordered a drink.  About 15 minutes later we were ushered into a really cute room with a long table and then drink orders were taken and then appetizers started to flow!  We did the multi-course sit down for 30 people ($35 a head) and a two hour open bar.  The food was SO good and I'd never been here before, was totally off of the Yelp reviews that I picked this place!  The manager and our coordinator were amazing, always ensuring we were happy and that everyone always had a full drink and food in front of them.  I guess the only thing I could say is that I wish the glass door to the room stayed closed, it got a little loud, and my dad was having a hard time hearing, but that would be THE only thing I could say!  This place has amazing service, awesome food and wonderful people working here!  Next time we are in Vegas we will be back.............with less people but we'll be there!!!!  THANK YOU SO MUCH FIREFLY!

We haven't been to Firefly in awhile, but thought we would give the new location a try.  It is awesome!  They have made a few changes to the menu that are great.  Specifically, they have mini Italian Beef sandwiches Chicago style.  As a Chicago native, I thought they were spectacular.  The new restaurant is roomy and has great ambiance.  Our interest in Firefly definitely has been renewed and it will be back on the list of regular places we frequent.

Room for improvement: The service was a bit slow, especially since we went on a Friday night and the place was not packed.  We prefer to order a couple plates at a time. Though we told our waiter this, he was not very good at checking back regularly to see if we were ready to order more.  Also, something has to be done about the noise level.  I suspect that due to the low ceilings and type of flooring there is nothing to absorb the noise all the patrons make.  It was very difficult to carry on a conversation due to the loud crowd noise.  If the place was packed, it would have been unbearable.  I hope management will do something to help minimize.  If the noise issue is resolved I would give it a 5 star rating.

Overall: This is a must on any trip to Vegas.

This is easily one of the best meals I have ever had in Vegas. Huevos estrellados, Chicago beef bocadillos, baby back ribs, baked tetilla, and baked goat cheese. The huevos alone made the meal worth it. Their sangria is nice, not too dry or sweet and my cocktail was also very good.
Why has no one forced us to try this place before? Truly amazing food. We had 6 different plates and dessert. The service was great too. We don't live close, but worth the drive.

SOLID. 

From LA, and we have choices. This place rocks.
Great atmosphere, amazing food.

We only had a party of two, but Best for groups of four or more so you can try more of the amazing tapas plates.

Hello Nutella banana sandwiches. Lamb chops, steak and mushroom skewers. I will miss you when I leave :)

Garbage place... trying to give it another chance, after the salmonella infestation... and they fail miserably 
How can you serve cold fries, frozen stuffed piquillo peppers bland steak skewers and zero service....
Is time to close the curtain Firefly
3rd time in 3 years when I visit vegas.  Always great food and decent service.  Dj and dancing Friday nights on the patio
Great Spanish tapas style restaurant. Food was great price atmosphere  and cocktails great also .  Must visit place in Vegas.  I'll definitely  be back. Even on a Monday night.  It had a good vibe.

We had a wonderful dining experience. I would definitely come back and recommend to my friends while visiting Vegas. I did take the time to read previous reviews for ordering recommendations. Let me just say that everything I ordered was quite savory. We did start with the stuffed dates and paradise mojitos. Let me just say they were amazing. I also ordered.. Steak & mushroom skewers, baked goat cheese, spicy beef salad (I wasn't absolute fan ..but the rest the table was), mushroom tart (perfect) , chicken tinga empanada (yum) , baby back ribs (also not my favorite but very tender) , camarones a la diabla (loved) , and last but not least ceviche of shrimp (also very delicious.) I can't wait to come back. I wish there was the location in San Diego,  California. The wedding party I was with was very satisfied, we had a great memorable time.

Very tasty food and excellent people management! We had a booking for 20 people, and as soon as the staff noticed it was a wedding party tequila shots were suggested :) The waitstaff were very patient when dealing with a large number of people and their separate orders for food and drinks. The food itself was delicious and very reasonably priced.
A must try. The best food in town. I could eat it everyday. I wish there was more locations so I didn't have to drive far.

Having sent two weekends in a row on business in Las Vegas I had the opportunity to explore a number of the finest and also most expensive restaurants in the city.  What a total surprise and pleasure it was to dine at the Firefly.  A reasonably price restaurant with nothing but the freshest and finest food.
If not for a personal friend, who also happens to be a manager of one of the better hotels in Vegas, I would never have had to pleasure to experience their excellent food.  No wonder my friend said that the Firefire was one of his favorite places to dine.
Firefly is absolutely great and the tapas are amazing. Nahum, our server was so charming, informative and very friendly.  I felt like everyone there was dedicated to making our dining experience perfect.
If you are ever in Las Vegas this is a must stop.  It is just bit off the Strip but well worth the time.

Went here last Saturday night. We sat outside on the patio. The patio was so dark, it made reading the menu difficult to say the least, and I have 20/20 vision. Next visit, I'll make sure to sit inside.

THE SERVICE - awful, confused, unattentive. Our tapas arrived long before our silverware and plates, or water. I tried flagging someone down 3 TIMES to no avail. Finally, I had to pop into the bar area to request plates, silverware, etc. Not very good. Then, it seemed like we had several waiters, none of which communicated with each other. After we were almost finished with round one, another waiter brought bread to to the table and seemed quite confused that we were almost finished with the plates already on our table. So, word to management.....  TRAINING AND COMMUNICATION.

THE FOOD - wonderful! We ordered the stuffed dates.... OMG!! We ordered an additional plate! We also ordered the pulpo, the lamb sausage, manchego Mac n cheese (holy lord that was good!), patatas bravas and a couple of  other plates that escape my mind and a pitcher of sangria. The sangria was pretty tasty.

The quality of the food saved the experience. I will return to Firefly, I only hope that the service is better, otherwise, that will be the end of it, good food can only take it so far if the overall experience is not that good.

Nice place inside and good food selection but they have the slowest service ever. There were around 20 people in the whole restaurant and our to go lunch order took 40-45 minutes. The excuse was that it got busy all of a sudden, lame. It's Father's Day on a Sunday and I can't imagine how much slower it'll be later on. Another party walked out to the front to pay their bill because they had to go and their service was slow too!

Probably the best place to eat not on the Strip and the best tapas my family and I have ever had. 

Ambience: (4/5)* My family and I came in at an awkward time (around 3:30PM) so the place was practically empty and I can't say how it gets later in the evening. The lighting is also very dark and it was hard to read the menu. 

Service: (5/5) Our waitress/hostess was super nice and very helpful in offering recommendations since the menu was so huge and there was so much to choose from. In addition, they brought out the food in just the right intervals so just as you finished a plate another one would come out. 

Food: (5/5) Try as much as you can because we ordered around $200 of food and everything was delicious.

I recently used Firefly for my wedding cocktail reception.  We did a destination wedding with only 18 of us, so I wanted somewhere small, with drinks, and food for after the ceremony before we all took off to party on the strip.  This place fit the bill perfect.

The Food - It was amazing.  We only had the passed appetizers, but if this is any indication of their menu, then omg we are definitely going back for dinner the next time we're in Vegas. We had the bacon wrapped dates, the ham and cheese croquetas, and the steak and mushroom skewers.  Everything was delicious!  Our guests had nothing but good things to say about the food.

The atmosphere - The decor was nice and fit the theme of the restaurant.  Everything was clean and well presented.  The area where our reception took place was private and well decorated.

The staff -  The staff were awesome.  Everyone was polite, attentive, and very professional.  When we arrived at the reception there wasn't any seating or low tables.  I asked one of the staff if we could please get some chairs.  We got a full seating, I was so thankful as we had people who needed to sit and ladies in heels looking for a rest.

Booking our space was easy.  We worked with Regina who was friendly and responded to my emails quickly.  We were able to make last minute adjustments to the reception due to last minute changes with our guests.

Why 4 stars.  I held back a star due to how our reception ended.  As we were winding down staff started coming in and moving tables, clearing our cake, and bar service ended.  The clean up went on for about 10 minutes before the staff came over and very politely asked us to please wrap it up.  Our reception was from 5:30 - 7:30, and I checked my phone thinking we must have gone over our time.  It was 7:20 when I checked and I estimate they began cleaning up around 7:10.  While not the end of the world, I was a bit miffed that time that I had paid for was basically shorter than I expected as staff closed our reception down about 20 minutes early.  Again, not major, but if I were to ever do it again I would make it clear I want my space for the full time.

I still highly recommend this place for dining or an event.  I know that I will be back when in town again.

Firefly is always a must for me when visiting Vegas. Great food and good prices.
The atmosphere is very cool and lounge-like, with low lighting and great music playing. It's right off the strip, but it's more popular for locals, so the vibe is laid back.

Now for the food!

The salmon toasts, veggie empanadas, and calamari were excellent! I went with my sister and a friend, and we ordered 6 savory apps and 3 desserts to split, and we had plenty of dessert left over. I absolutely recommend the mini cheesecakes and lemon berry tarts for dessert, and the goat cheese and eggplant cannelloni as a starter. 

The house shandy is an excellent choice of drink; they mix up the traditional beer-and-lemonade cocktail by taking a light Belgian beer, mixing with fresh strawberry bitters, and adding a bit of Amaretto to top it off. So refreshing and so delicious!

We always hit up Firefly before a night on the strip; it's a tradition now to make it our first stop to kick off our annual Vegas weekend.
We had a party of 15 and service was great, very attentive waiters water and drinks are always filled. Food was delicious definitely coming back for more!

I was visiting Las Vegas from LA, and was trying to find a good restaurant that wasn't a severely overpriced hotel "experience" where I would end up paying $50 for a mediocre appetizer.  

I found this place from the Yelp reviews and after glancing at their menu thought it looked perfect.  We went on a busy night but we were seated quickly and given plenty of attention from our waiter.  

The food was incredible.  Creative combinations and it was fairly enough priced that we could order 6 or 7 different things without feeling the sweat of the final bill.  I didn't have a single dish I didn't think was worthy of coming back for, and as we were on our way out the manager greeted us and asked about our experience.  After telling him exactly how much we enjoyed the food, he invited us to come back tomorrow and try some flights of their new dishes on the house.  Our schedule was already pretty booked, so we thanked him and declined, but the gesture was really nice.

This will be a permanent stop for future Vegas trips, and if they opened one in Los Angeles I would be there in seconds.  Skip the money-trap places surrounding the big hotels, this is way better.
Good is delivered fast. Order as you go. You cant go wrong with any item on this menu. Firefly rocks!

The ambiance was exquisite carrying me to a land among the beaches of Peru dining on the delicacies of the local Quechua people with Coyotes Milk (Lemon Huice to cook the raw pesca (fish)) marinating the ceviche which upon entering my womb of a mouth felt like a thousand lovers making sweet French kiss genuine love to me.

Amazing dinner! Food tasted fantastic, great portions, great atmosphere, good beer selection, very prompt service even on a very busy night! The GM even came by several times to make sure everything was ok - what a great guy. Will definitely eat here again!

My husband and I were looking for a great place to have either a light dinner or tapas and a few drinks. The drinks and food are not only fantastic, our server Nahum was amazing! His recommendations were right on and his service was excellent considering we'd order each appetizer one at a time before deciding what we wanted next. The only note is if you are looking for a quiet place to have a romantic dinner this is probably not for you as it's a little loud inside the restaurant...it didn't bother us at all, but a warning if wanting a more intimate setting. The prices were great as we had 2 drinks from the bar each (so 4 total) and 4 small plates and our bill was only $65, a completely great deal in Vegas!

we were in Vegas with a few friends and we were looking for somewhere nice and relaxing to have a great and tasting dinner. we found firefly on yelp,read the reviews and saw the pics and I was convinced.. We made a reservation which was super convenient, we were seated within 15 minutes..place has a very trendy vibe,bar area was very appealing,and it is more on the louder side but it's only cause everyone is genuinely enjoying themselves... We ordered a few beers and a pitcher of sangria,very very tasty and refreshing.. We ordered tapas, our faves were the ceviche ,and lamb chops= super yummy.. The reason I gave it 4 stars and not 5 was the service, our waiter seemed to have forgotten about us by mid dinner. Overall a pretty good experience, and I will definitely come back when in town.

Excellent place for lunch or dinner. It has become my go to place when in Vegas. Great sangrias and great food. You'll love the tuna tartar; highly recommend the pulpo asado and chorizo clama. Looking for something bigger than their tapas, they also make an excellent paella. There so much positives I can say, but just go try it and see for yourself.

Firefly is by far the best place I have ever eaten at in Vegas. PERIOD. It's a hidden gem visited by many locals and a place where you can practically order anything on the menu and not be disappointed. Living in Los Angeles, whenever I happen to come to visit Vegas this is always the first place on my to do list. The food and service are exceptional and always consistent. The prices are very reasonable for the quality of food!! This place is perfect to come with family and friends.. Considering that it's a tapas style restaurant everything could be easily shared and leave you completely full and satisfied. Make sure to call in advance to make a reservation as the place gets very busy late in the evenings.. Especially weekends. The crowd favorites seem to be the stuffed dates, ceviche, baked goat cheese, tuna tartare, firefly fries, and the Camarones A La Diabla! I can't even get started with the Garlic Bread that they serve complimentary once you arrive.. HEAVEN! If your happening to question coming to this restaurant don't even think about it for one more second! Just go.. You won't regret it!

DIVINE!!!
Best Tapas EVER, ties with the classy stuff in Barcelona!!! 
And I've seen a few, trust me!!!
DEEEVINEEEE!!!

Firefly is a great place to meet someone for a bite to eat that is staying on the strip.  It's close to the strip. The food is good.  I dined on the outside patio and was surprised that the street noise was minimal.  My sister and I could converse in normal voice.  The service was just right and not over-attentive.  When you want something different from the status quo, try this place.  

Phil V

My hubby and I love spanish tapas!! Its hard to find a reasonably priced in Los Angeles or Orange County California. So I was excited and we enjoyed all the food immensely. They were even very considerate of my hubby's shrimp allergy and made the paella with a chicken/beef broth ( I think). Next time we are in LV we will absolutely eat there. I also enjoyed because my daughter was able to eat a variety of things too.
Excellent place for tapas !   Came here on a Sunday and ordered off the Brunch menu !   Definitely enjoyed the food as well as the atmosphere!  Will be back again ! Thank you :)
Wow! We were there last night and the food, service and ambience was fabulous! Only here for a week and I hope to hit Firefly again

Loved the pulpo asado, bacon wrapped dates and tuna tartar. We are going back for lunch tomorrow to try more. There were mostly locals there, so we think we found a gem near the strip. After dropping $40 for two in the food court at Caesar's on nasty-tasting crap, this was a very pleasant surprise!

Walking into the new location, it just didn't feel like Firefly. There was no squeezing up to the bar, waiting outside, or squeezing you way through the place on the way to your table.  It certainly lost its coziness.  My friend and I had a lengthy discussion noting all of the differences and how we didn't know how to feel as 'it's just not what it used to be'

Then the bacon stuffed dates came out, and all of a sudden, it felt like Firefly again, and we started to appreciate all the improvements including the significantly larger space and improved decor.  Food and Booze were still as good as ever.
omg this is the best place I have ever eaten. every dish was better than the last. great drinks. great service. I go back everytime I am in town.

A good tad bit noisy, but awesome food at great pricing.  The drinks were awesome as well; not watered down and incredibly great pricing.  (Example:  we paid $11 for a glass of cranberry& vodka and a Midori sour.  2 hours later, we paid double for the exact same drinks at a Latin Club although the drinks weren't bigger or better tasting). The Ceviche was amazing.  The Spicy Shrimp tasted perfectly sweet yet had a nice follow up "bite" lol.  The stuffed dates lived up to their reputation.  We are definitely coming back to this place!!!
Amazing food, amazing sangria. Lobster corn dogs blew my mind. Definitely try the place
Everything I ate was delicious. I had shrimp tempura, lamb chops, and dates.

I literally go here every time I'm in Vegas for the bacon-wrapped dates. They are perfection. If you want some quality and sharable food, you have to go here. It's just a mile down from the Convention Center, so it does get busy when tradeshows are in town, but it's still possible to get reservations same day. It's a nice change to the steakhouses everywhere. :)

Ummmm... racism is wrong. I don't like writing bad reviews. Before I start, this review is not about the food -- which was excellent. The one star review is about several members of the staff. 

I was there on my birthday, dressed up in a pretty dress and my guy friend was wearing a nicely pressed button down shirt. I'm pointing this out because the staff treated us like we were filthy street people. The staff was literally fawning over every table around where my friend and I were sitting -- yet they were beyond rude to us. At least four times they tried to take plates away long before we were finished, brought the check before we asked for it and while we were still eating, then trying to take the plates away again while there was still food on them! Two nearby tables had the opposite experience. The waitstaff was attentive, smiling, and even engaged in polite little chats. I thought maybe they were the owners or friends of owners... until I realized the waitstaff was being that way with almost every single other table! They were being NICE to them!

Here is the sad fact: My friend and I are not Latino, sorry but there is no other way to say it. We are white people and there were only a handful in the entire restaurant. VERY DISAPPOINTING to be treated that way because of our skin color. As delicious as the food was, I will never go back to Firefly. 

It was when we were leaving that I realized what was going on. Here is why: someone had accidentally left a car key near the front door. So I walked it over to the bartender who wasn't even taking an order or making a drink -- he looked at me with a quick little nasty expression, then ignored me. All I was trying to do was return someone's lost key. I had NO other interactions in the bar area while at Firefly, so there was zero reason why the bartender would give me a dirty look.
This was so good! I was feeling a little chilly, so I had the tomato basil soup. I was not disappointed!
My go-to-place when friends visit from out of town.  Bacon wrapped dates, ham & cheese croquetas, shrimp diablo and blood orange mojitos are personal favs.

Came through after reading all the amazing reviews with a group of 12 people in town for a conference. The service was outstanding and the food was even better. The ribs fell off the bone and the Mac and cheese was killer. One of the tapas we ordered came out very late, but the staff took care of us and even brought out dessert for one of our party who had a birthday. If you only have one night in town and have a group of people I HIGHLY recommend Firefly.  Also we let them know we needed separate checks ahead of time and it was no problem.

My favorite place for Happy Hour!!! The bartenders are entertaining, and curvaceous.  If you don't believe me just ask for Haley.  Food and cocktails are not the only thing that is appealing for happy hour. Stop by and see for yourself!

We chose this restaurant based in the Yelp reviews. The first plates we ordered were the stuffed dates and ham&cheese croquetas. The dates as mentioned numerous times on Yelp were great and I don't like blue cheese. The croquetas were okay. They were more like a cheese stick and I wouldn't order them again. Next we ordered chorizo plate and chicken skewers. Chorizo plate was good with thinly sliced cold cuts, mini pickles, and capers. The roasted garlic cream sauce on the chicken skewers was very tasty. The assortment of vegetables with the skewers was also very good. Lastly, we ordered the flan and flourless chocolate cake. Both deserts were very tasty and we would order them again.
The best in las Vegas.... I love it their customer service is awsome... I order "camarones a la diabla"... I been a customer since 2 years ago. I always go 2 times a month...
Always delighted to come here with great company. The attention, the sparkling sangria and tapas are great. Highly recommend. Let this Latin night get started. Woot woot!

Yummy food, great ambiance, terrific service. I will be back!

Loved all dishes, but the apple manchego salad is DA BOMB!

This place is definitely one of the must go places in Vegas. All their dishes are small so you can try tons of dishes. You have to get the bacon wrapped stuffed dates and the sangria. The steak is huge a good portion and cooked to the proper doneness (medium rare)!! And they start you off on the best note with their delicious compound butter. Atmosphere is loud, fun and exciting! Staff was really good, friendly and helpful, even to my party of 15.

Firefly has delicious and varied tapas (small plates), which is a great way to do dinner. Their sangria is refreshing and cold on a hot day, with the ice that some reviewers complain about adding a bit of welcome hydration.

But one of the best reasons to come here is for the lovely shaded patio just off the Strip. For a city known for its great weather during much of the year, it's surprisingly difficult to find outdoor seating in Las Vegas.

I brought a visiting girlfriend here not too long after this location moved and I had to come clean with her about the place's summer debacle with the health department. I saw her eyes pop out of her head, but she calmed down once I reassured her that this venue came back with a clean bill of health. And let's be completely honest - after a complete PR meltdown with a grip of guests falling sick, the place can't afford another screw up, so it's probably more paranoid about sanitation than a mom in a daycare center. 

We came just in the nick of time for happy hour and grabbed a couple of glasses of sangria before ordering usual staples like stuffed dates, shrimp ceviche, and steamed mussels. All a big win in our book, plus the service was fast but not at all rushed. Firefly is a great place to grab a drink and a few small bites, or to order a lot of dishes and sample everything. You know, European dim sum! 

Parking is a bigger fiasco than it was at their original location in that it is now a small lot in the back, so consider yourself warned!
Came here 2 years in a row during CES. Great tapas, everything we ordered was excellent. Stuffed dates were to die for.

Used to be better. 

Great service. But locale had a Bucca Di Beppo feel. 

Patatas bravas leave much to the imagination. 

Octopus rather bland. 

Over-cooked bacon wrapped dates. 

Good calamari. 
Nice artichoke toasts.

My husband and I stopped by in between lunch and dinner and grabbed food at the bar.  Wide variety and selection on the menu, and a decent amount of vegetarian options as well. Servers were friendly and attentive, and food was really good! If you are looking for food options off the strip, highly recommend. They have a fairly large seating area with nice ambiance, so it would be a nice place for a large group dinner.

I've been here countless times and I've never had a bad experience!

Positive - Great atmosphere. Great menu choices. Seriously, try them all! Good sangria, too, both white and red. 

Negative - A bit pricey. Service can sometimes be a bit slow.
Excellent Sangria! Cool atmosphere! Good place to go for a first date! The food was alright..some tapas better than others! Probably go back with a date...

Excellent small plate meal with unusual choices allowing sharing and tasting of a big variety of offerings. Despite being a very busy place(noice level is only caveat) the dishes arrived quickly and wait staff very efficient and friendly.  All dishes were carefully prepared and original in flavor and spices. Really nice dessert selection.. go for it!

Food is great, but the wait was horrible. And it is LOUD in there. You can't hear across the table. They served food to us in sperts over an hour period. So a couple of us didn't have any food while others got theirs and finished and had to wait for us. The plates are so small that you can only share a tiny bit. Food tasted wonderful though. It was 2 hours before I got my food. Not a fun experience.
Greqt service from Arturo and another guy. Very attentive and I was happy every minute. Great food!!! I'm so happy and I'll so be back for sure!!!

After a long road trip we stopped to grab a bite. Delicious! We had the tomato bread with Serrano ham, chicken croquets, shrimp ceviche, chicken tinga dish, and a flan. Amazing food, flavorful, fresh, was brought to our table at an amazing speed. The waiters and waitresses were extremely attentive, our drink never went empty. I'm sad I found this gem of a place so far from where I live. But any time I'm back in Vegas this will be my first and last stop.

Best Tapas Restaurant in Vegas (and elsewhere).   Food is delicious, service is quick and prices are extremely reasonable for vegas. 

 Worth ordering were the dates, diablo shrimp and the apple and manchego salad.

This place is amazing. Being from the east coast we have tons of Spanish Tapas places but firefly gives their food a different touch. We were a large group and ordered about a dozen different tapas. Everything we ordered was delicious. The camarones al ajillo had a more spicy touch than spanish people are used to and i loved it. Great atmosphere with great drink selections and spanish beer. The manager Eduardo was extremely gracious.  I will definitely be going back and recomending to friends. By far the best place we ate during our recent Vegas trip.

We absolutely love this place!  The food is absolutely fabulous!  We had several meat and seafood dishes and they were all amazingly delicious.  The ambiance has a very Spanish air to it which is very charming.  The service is also excellent and accommodating. The drinks and food menu is very extensive and authentic to Spanish cuisine.  Only a hop and a skip from the strip and plenty of parking.  We'll definitely be back on our next trip!!

I was very hesitant on going to their restaurant after what they have gone through in the past but I did go after all. The food was good but the service was not and I was kind of disappointed but at least they offer nice variety of drinks
Despite their horrible reputation.  I've never been sick here and I love the Sangria and petite filet mignon! Salsa night on Friday is so much fun.

Service, food, ambiance and location is good.  This is the first time I have been to this new location and I was surprised how big this location is compared to the restaurant they used to have.  This restaurant was one of my favorite spots to go to when I used to live here.  I will definitely be back next time I home. Great spot for any occasion.

I really enjoyed coming to this restaurant. The ambiance was really nice. Food was reasonably priced and they have a wide selection of dishes. It was my first time trying Spanish tapas but I loved the experience. I will definitely be back again.

I had my bachelorette party dinner here - and it was amazing!  The food was amazing, the drinks yummy (and strong!), the vibe inside was classy, and the prices were good.  We made a reservation in advance through the Firefly banquet contact (the information is easily available on their website) and did a pre-fixed menu of family style tapas for a great price!  We did the Tapas Banquet for $33 and with (copious) drinks on top of that, it came to $60 pp including tip.  If we had had the same dinner on the Strip, we would have paid more than twice as much!  
Firefly was super easy to work with in making the arrangements.  

What also was great is there were great options available for my vegan and gluten-free friends, in addition to the yummy food for us meat-eaters.  We also had a ton of leftover food that we had boxed up and ate the next day as hangover breakfast food.  

This worked out super for us based on our bachelorette party schedule, which was as follows:  
6 - 7:  Pre-dinner light drinks at The Platinum Hotel (we booked the Marquis Suite, which easily slept 6 ladies with space to spare!), 
7 - 8:30 Dinner at Firefly (we ubered there from the hotel, about $6 - 8, the uber ride was about 4 minutes), 
8:30 - 10:30:  Back to the hotel to freshen up, pregame, and do some bachelorette games, 10:30 - late:  We went out clubbing to Tao in the Venetian

The overall night went great, and Firefly was one of the best parts!
SANGRIA, SANGRIA, SANGRIA thats all I really have to say. If you don't go for the drinks then go for the bacon wrapped dates. They're the best in Vegas.

Excellent service and the food is amazing I come here a few times a month with my girlfriends and it never changes. The atmosphere is great. I always order most if the same food. Stuffed red peppers to the steak and mushroom skewers are all fantastic

Delicious!  We loved every dish that we ordered from the beet salad, warm spinach salad, spicy lamb sausage, to the chicken and mushroom paella!  The timing of the dishes was perfect, which is so important with tapas.  We would definitely go again and will be recommending it to all of our friends!!
Every tapa we ordered was amazing! So flavorful and unique. A little heavy on the sauces, but delicious! Stuffed bacon dates, goat cheese pesto, ahi tuna, seared shrimp and flan!!!!! Yum!!!
Nice cozy place, great service. Food comes out fast and is consistently delicious. Would definitely recommend. My favorite is the bacon wrapped dates and the sangria by far.

Lots of variety and great food. A group of 4 visited and tried the servers suggestions as well as some of our own choices. The bacon dates and Diablo shrimp were our favorites. Lots of flavor and a great meal.

We went there last night .....
We call first to se if we need a reservation the girl over the phone was super nice *****+ Jessica I think was her name .
We got there sat at the patio  nice ambient. 
We mentioned that we gave a Groupon  ..
Well I use those before always is a funny reaction with the server but not there we got super service! 
The mojitos strong  and nice flavor
