We try 9 diferentes tapas all delicious but we did not like one of them they replaced with out a question .
THANK YOU JESUS ... that happen to be the server name 
Even the mgr was nice and friendly .
Great great experience ..
Haley gave us incredible service tonight. Friendly and attentive. Easy on the eyes too.
Great place off the strip. The food was amazing and debated about giving it 5 stars or not. I'll be back.

Oh man....this place is delicious. We visited as part of a package deal, and had VIP seating with all you can eat and drink. We were able to try a lot of their different dishes. EVERYTHING, was amazing. Our waiter was so nice and on top of things. Loved the food and the overall experience was one of my favorite parts of our trip to Vegas.

I'm borderline obsessed with this place. I love everything here! The vibe is fun the service is impeccable and the food is delicious. The banana Nutella sandwiches are basically gods gift. I love that the plates are small so you can sample lots of things too. Despite the small plates you will leave full. I really enjoy this place was and every time I dine here.

The sauces are the stand-out. This place has beautiful , flavorful, different sauces for the dishes. Nothing is hashed out here; every dish was fresh and plump, except when it was shatteringly crisp. We ate here twice; sangrias are fruity, mojitos are refreshing.
WOW!! So good! Everything I tried was great! Service was great and they had a gluten free menu!! BONUS!

Ten years ago, I lived in Madrid for a year or so. I got real used to the tapas bars in the city. Though it isn't authentic, it is Delicious! I tried the pulpo, bravas, tortilla espanola and paella. All if it was perfectly seasoned and we'll presented. A must for every las vegas excursion.
Funky atmosphere,  great food at tapa portion size. Would dine again for dinner and plan to dance the night away afterwards.

Food was amazing as always. Stuffed dates and chopped chicken salad. Yum!!! Mango mojitos are to die for. We needed a pitcher. This place never disappoints me. Great service. Fast and friendly service. I highly recommend this place and I bring all my out of town guests to eat here. I have introduced many locals to here as well. Many memories and great times. Thank you to Nahum our server he was great!!!
We shared a total of 6 distes and Everything tasted the same. Looks like they use the same seasoning on all of their dishes. Not sure how ppl like this place, not authentic or even good tapas.

I love this place! Some of the best food for the money in Las Vegas and without the craziness of the strip. Apple and manchego salad as well as the dates are super delicious. Nothing I've had though is bad! I always make sure to eat here at least once when I'm in town.

Went 2x while in Vegas. Had almost everything on the extensive menu. They were fast with the food but it didn't taste like it had been pre made or sitting in a warmer. Very reasonably priced!
My favorite dishes were the bacon wrapped dates, ceviche and potatoes. 
Great choice for an off the strip late night dining experience.

Delicious tapas and drinks at a reasonable price? I'm there! 

Called Firefly in the afternoon on Sunday and was able to get a reservation for 7pm for 4 people that night. Parking was easy to find there's a medium lot in the back of the restaurant. The interior has a clean and modern night club type feel. We arrived at 6:45pm and was seated right away in a booth. 

We ordered the stuffed dates, padron peppers, boquerones, petite filet, merguez (lamb sausage), and chicken paella. The only underwhelming dish was the peppers I would skip those the next time. But please do yourself a favor and get the petite filet! It was super flavorful and perfectly medium rare. I've had a lot of stuffed dates but this one was one of the best I've had. The paella is AMAZING. Perfectly cooked and not too salty. Chicken can be tough if cooked for too long but this chicken in the paella was tender and juicy. For dessert we ordered the cheesecake and flan. They're both good but the star of the dessert was the little cookie that came with the flan! They should have a dish with a bunch of those little cookies. On a side note we ordered a pitcher of red wine sangria to share. Delicious and smooth! You can't go wrong with the drinks here either. 

Definitely try this place out when you're in Vegas! It's a little off strip but it's so worth it. Didn't feel overly crowded and the food was amazing. Looking forward to trying this place again.
Very good loved the dates and other tapas. The Ginger Martini was yummy!  Our server Nahum was very friendly and helpful when answering our questions.
Wow it was none of the best meals ever. By far the best was the ceviche, Diablo shrimp and the mango ribs outstanding.
We look forward to eating at Firefly on almost every Vegas trip. Love the tortilla a la espanola.

I have loved this place since I moved to Las Vegas in 2006. Everything I've ever ordered has always been delicious. My favorites are Firefly fries, Firefly fish sticks, Spicy Beef salad, and steak and mushroom skewers. It took me 4 years before I tried the bacon wrapped dates. They are amazing and a must have!! Sangria is the best I've had anywhere. I love all 3 versions: the original, white, and sparkling. For dessert, try the banana Nutella sandwich! 
The only downside is that I live in the NW and this location is just too far to visit often. I wish the Sahara location didn't close down. So basically, my only complaint is the location.

Get here, any way possible. Worth the walk if you have to! Delicious food, attentive staff, great ambiance. Potions were big, much more than we were expecting with tapas. Best food and lower prices. Will come back every time I'm in Vegas!

Great food, the best blue berry mojito ever, we got ceviche, tuna tartare, and tierra y mar ,,,, to die for, I love the lemon berry tart, but my bartender suggested the new pumpkin bread with vanilla ice cream,,,, it was excellent ,,,,, all the Staff was so friendly ,,,, from the hostess to the busser , servers and thanks to the bartenders ,,, Omar, Tina, Danny for the great  service,,,!!!!, you guys made our night !!!!

Oh my GOD that was the best Tapas experience I have had ever!!

On the recommendation of the bar tender I started with Stuffed Dates and added the Tierra y Mar Skewers.  Awesome combo!

Highly recommend if in a meat (with a little seafood) and red wine reduction mood!!

Ordered a Sangria that was not as flavorful as hoped (but still potent).  Next time I'll find a good Cabernet.

See you again in two weeks!

Wow! 

This place was all around fantastic. 

We ordered the red sangria, which was lovely. It had flower petal tastes incorporated...that's a first for me. Never had that flavor in a sangria. It was great. We ordered a couple mojitos as well - they were good, but the sangria just blew em out of the water.

We were vegetarians and I went here after reading someone else's review that said they had vegetarian options. He was right on the money! It had a good number of vegetarian options - and they were willing to customize the almond stuffed dates to make em veggie-friendly as well. And all the dishes were excellent.

Honestly, I'd have given these guys 4.5 stars, but I rounded up cuz the food & drink were so good. The -0.5 stars would have been for 2 things :

1) for loudness. Try asking for outdoor sitting to help with that (it seemed quieter outside). There was a longer wait for outside seating when we went
2) When we did ask to move from inside to outside the waitress insisted that we'd have to close out our bill and then move and re-open a new tab. I get that we'd have a new waiter/waitress (i.e. I don't want someone else getting my tip?) , but as a customer, that should be transparent to me. They should have been able to figure it out between themselves, and leave me out of the picture.

Having said that, this place is a must visit for me now.. I'm going here (and asking for outdoor seating) next time I visit the area!

Fire Fly has an awesome food menu and and even better sangria. The stage is great and helpful Joaquin and Athena are great bartenders. This is must go restaurant and the night time atmosphere is great.

Firefly catered a rehearsal dinner at my house. The guests could not say enough about how delicious the food was! Carlos, the manager, was wonderful to work with, and gave great recommendations and advice as to what to serve and how much. Even the delivery was perfect!  Jonathan was so nice and helpful!  I totally recommend Firefly for any event, and I will use them again!  Can't wait to go eat at the restaurant!

This is our first dinner stop whenever we arrive in Vegas, especially now that Firefly is at their new location.  We like the variety & quality of their tapas along with their white Sangria to wash it all down.

Vegas is Vegas.  There are many ways to do Vegas.  Getting off the strip, even if for a moment, is a must for me.  This place, is worth leaving the strip for.  No lines, quiet, you know... a normal dining experience. Lets get down to the food.  It was good... Very good.  I have only been here once, so that is why the 4 out of 5.  We had the apple and manchego salad.  How can such a simple salad be such a great food experience?  It is... trust me.  Get it, enjoy it.  We had the mac & cheese, albondigas, and baby back ribs.  Yes, we got our food on.  The drinks were good too.  Go here.  Eat well.  Drink well.  Live well.  

Décor: 3 out of 5
Food:  4 out of 5
Drinks:  4 out of 5
Service: 4 out of 5
Cleanliness:  4 out of 5

This is a great place with awesome food. A taxi driver recommended this place and we are so glad he did. Everything was very nice. Service was on point and the menu provides everything for everyone. I will definitely cone back again when in town.  You must check this out!

Great place for tapas! With a bottle of Estrella or glass of Cava I'm reminiscing Barcelona. Sure there are some tapas far from your typical Spanish flare but they did a great job with the selection. My 2 faves from my 1st encounter: boquerones and the beef & mushroom skewers.
I could easily divulge in a liquid meal of sangria but then I'd be missing out on all their delectable goodies!  They have a VEGAN/VEGETARIAN menu!!!  All ya gotta do is ask for it.  =]

Delicious!! Fair price with good portion for 4 of us :D
We ordered one pitcher of sangria, stuffed dates, lamb chops, tierra y mar skewers, babyback ribs, tuna tartare, fried calamari, and seafood paella for about $150 including tax and tips!!
Good customer service!!
Enjoy the atmosphere and environment!!!

I don't have to write a long review to how delicious the food is.Just read some other reviews and you will know you should try Firefly. Because you are missing out on a great restaurant. You wont be sorry.

Had a group dinner here during a convention week for my staff, 14 people. They were super easy to work with figuring out a plan, and the food was amazing. Everyone was happy from carnivores to the vegetarian of the group. The ribs are to die for, very tender with lots of umami flavor. The tres leches cake is also not to be missed. Good sangria and mixed drinks too. Overall a great dinner and experience.

This place is great. The service was fantastic. we came with a large group for one of my friends birthdays and they gave a round of shots. We also did the bottomless mimosas and they have a dude playing the guitar and it is great. The atmosphere is fun.

The garlic bread and almond butter is always delicious but I was disappointed with my tapas this time. I ordered a mushroom tart and it was super greasy and the tart was hard. I looked frozen and re-heated. It was hard to cut pieces to eat it and I've had this dish before, it's always been light and flaky. I also ordered flan and that was so-so. The flan caramel was runny but it was ok. The presentation was nice. 

I will say, though, the new location is very nice and stylish.
Great food. We ordered a variety of selections and it was all good including the deserts

The place is nice, the food is okay, a bit pricy but tolerable. I would come back only if it is for something flashy and fancy but not quite satisfying, like catching up with this ancient friend from high school, whom you've not seen for 20 years since.......high school.

Wow! If you are in Vegas, definitely come here.   Hubs and I had an early dinner here on a Saturday and it was amazing! The apple manchego was fresh and light.  Artichoke toasts were good as were the stuffed dates. The weakest thing we had were the scallop 'escargots', they were basically a vehicle for the garlic sauce, but they were still tasty.  Great atmosphere! Friendly service! Come!

Firefly is my go to place for a late night munch.

FRIDAYS: Friyays are Latin Nights! They move the table and chairs out on the patio deck and make it a dance floor. There is sometimes live music from a band or just a loud DJ playing the best of Latin music. It gets really cramped and full on Latin Nights. Parking is hard to find because people love to dance and drink!

FOOD: Their tapas menu is amazing! Bread and sweet butter is served complimentary with a sweet butter(bread can be hard if you come late at night). My favorite dish here is the Mac n cheese. It is prepared with small shell pasta, yummy cheese, and baked to perfection. I LOVE the Mushroom Tart here because it is a dish you can't find anywhere else in Vegas. It is a flakey dough with a mushroom sauce on top. If you want more mushroom dishes, the stuffed mushroom is also really great. I would recommend more dishes but honestly their menu is pretty big so your best bet is to be adventurous and order a dish from each section of the menu since it is tapas:)

DRINK: They have a full bar offering whatever you're craving for the day. So you can even go here for drinks if you're not feeling hungry.

ATMOSPHERE: This place has a really great Latin setting with Latin music and Latin food. Great place for a date or just to hang out with friends.

TIP: Be careful of your own sensitivity to foods. Latin foods can be raw because that is how the food is supposed to be prepare (many customers complain when they get sick from raw foods but it's not the restaurant's fault).

We are BIG Tapas fans but have trouble finding the real thing.  We found it at Firefly. 

Great service from Eder and wonderful food.

The Summer salad features thinly sliced french green beans,  marinated in a balsamic dressing surrounded by halved red and black cherry tomatoes and a few dollops of smooth, lucious burrata cheese.  Delicious! 

The Albondiga -meat balls in tomato sauce- doesn't sound exciting but it is irresistible.  Serrano ham and Manchester croqettas- sublime.  Crispy outside soft and delicious inside.  The red Sangria was perfect.
We had other dishes and all were top notch.  

The Flan was a spectacularl end to a perfect meal. Smooth and creamy and not too sweet. The tiny bit of lightly sweetened tart berries was just the right foil for the creamy flan.

I recommend Firefly wholeheartedly!

So good and fun!  We had 3 kids with us and decided to go on an early dinner and everything we got was good.  We ordered the meatballs twice.  The filet was not pictured.  Here's a list of items we got, mushroom tart, octopus, scallops, tomato soup, meatballs, empanadas, tuna tartare, and chicken skewers.  Definitely will go back and recommend to anyone who enjoys tapas.
Jesus was great. The manager was very engaging. All the food was delicious. Party of 11. The girls really liked the pomegranate mojito's. Will go back.

Firefly is my favorite place to eat right now.  We have gone for tapas and last time, we went for paella.  The paella is superb but more rich and buttery than I am accustomed to.  

Order the clams and chorizo and get some extra bread because the broth is the elixir of life.  Pork empanada is another favorite from a large menu of small plates.

There is something for everyone in your group and sharing is the order of the day.  I always go when I travel to Las Vegas.

The food is simply great. Every time we go to Vegas, we make a point of visiting this great restaurant. I can say I had tried almost all the items on their menu and there was not one item that I didn't like. 
Go for the tapas plates and remember that sharing is caring !

This has been one of my faves since I first moved to Vegas way back when! I live in Cali now, but as soon as I cross the state line, Fire Fly, is one of my first stops. Where to begin . . . The service, Naum, is the man with a plan!!!! He is the best and always on point with the most excellent service and attitude. The sparkling white peach sangria (pitcher) is a must have and we drink every drop of it, even eating the blue berries too! 

Now let's start with the food, I have had 90% of the menu and everything is delish! My faves hands down is: camarones Diablo,  fire fly fries, filet mignon slider, lamb skewers, empanadas, calamari, ahi tuna, paella, Mac n cheese, and the stuffed dates! You cannot go wrong here. Nice atmosphere, music, food and people! Cheers!
Perfect place to get a good meal and get away from the casinos.  Good fast service, lots of great appetizers.  Ceviche, skewers, spicy salad and patatas bravas were plenty for two people

What can I say? In 12 years of going to Vegas, this is my favorite place to eat! And the funny thing once I bring a friend with my, next thing I know, they are bringing their friends and clients there to eat! if I am in Vegas for a week, I'll probably eat there twice. 
So many amazing dishes on the menu. And the sangria is the best! 
In fact, if I did not live 2700 miles away, I would eat there once a month at the very least. I live in a little town called Waxhaw and what my town needs.. is a Firefly!!! Hey Firefly, how about opening up a Southeastern location in the coolest little town in the Carolinas? Please?

From SF- 2nd time here and this time for my birthday-hubby's present for me!!!! Love love love this place. pitcher of Sangria....of course!!! but try infused vodka martini! Soooo awesome. Food-gotta try stuffed dates- of the hook! We had 4 other dishes- -also of the hook! Thanks to our friend Andrew for recommending this place! Also our server, Lalo, thank u for taking care of us and for my birthday flan!!! U r awesome!!!!

FireFly is a great place to eat with 3+ hungry people. Their small plates are perfect for sharing and with 6-8 dishes on the table there's plenty of food and variety. The octopus is great, so is the tuna tartar. Steak and chicken skewers were very good as we're the ribs and goat cheese. Service was friendly and fast.

Great service from Daniel! Came in during happy hour and he was on top of everything. Served our food, poured our drinks, and had a great personality. Food and drinks are always great here and inexpensive during happy hour. Thank you for having such great menu options and great service!

This review is for the wine and the bread. We ordered 4 dishes. The spicy shrimp was ok. The lamb sausage smelled rotten and I wouldn't even take a bite. The clams were fishy and the octopus was mushy. I'm very surprised considering all the good reviews I read before we came here. I'm so disappointed.

i liked the new location.  sangria was excellent as usual.  we had an assortment of tapas, too many to recount.  the food was excellent as usual.  we sat outside on the patio which is bigger than the old location.  i enjoyed it.

Tapas but really better than I ever had in Spain. We were a group of four and each dish was the perfect size to split between us for individual portion tasters. We ordered two dishes each. We were all starving when we came in and left with full stomaches. This is my second time being here and it's been excellent both times. Get off the strip and come here. Totally worth it!!!

Seriously GREAT food. Awesome service. Waitress and bus man were on it. Prices reasonable. If/when I come to Vegas again I'll come here for sure. To die for dishes include: Stuffed Peppers and Garlic Lemon shrimp.
I hate when I get a recommendation from Yelp for a good restaurant and it's actually bad. No flavor, nothing I ordered was good. Ugh!

The curse of small plates is; you always want to eat more. Combine that with a (my) large appetite and and my size 48, 20 pants are starting to look wider than tall. Samantha and Jesse, our wait crew, worked in perfect sync to fill my gaping maw. I must have looked like a baleen whale feasting on its catch, as I unmercilessly shoved boquerone after boquerone into my face hole. Plate after glorious plate was delivered to my table, the kitchen became a revolving door of delicacies, one could almost hear "Yakety Sax," (the Benny Hill Show song) playing in the background. I simply had to refuse desert, lest I explode like some character from a Monty Python skit...

We discovered Firefly because it was the closest restaurant to our hotel. We were pleasantly surprised at the wonderful selection of tapas. My favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, tuna tartar, and the infused vodka martinis.
If you only eat one thing in your silly, stupid, little life, eat the bacon wrapped dates at this restaurant. Ridiculous.

This is my go to place for visiting family and friends.  Fire Fly is perfect for a meal or just a nibble.  Tapas places are plenty in Vegas but none can hold a torch to this best kept secret of our city.  The menu is affordable and delicious, the drinks are made with love and respect, and the Staff can hold its head high!  P.S. Date Night Must!!!!
Amazing experience! Will definitely come back. Enjoyed all tapas plate. Wife came back for lunch after our great dinner we had.

What a bad experience!

Fireflys has been one of my favorite places for about 4 years now, even after all that occurred with the closure and allegations. 

This time 13 of us went out to celebrate my friends bday. 1st they brought out all the food except my boyfriends, which arrived 10 min later. 2nd my boyfriend almost chocked on a piece of metal. It was clearly a piece of the metal lid of the wine bottle. (Not my bfs day!) 

We told the waiter who called the manager! Wow! What a joke!!! He treated us like if we wanted the meal for free (we didn't even ask for anything). He never apologized however proceeded to tell us that the sangria is filtered 3 times. I don't care!! Hello! He was rude and defensive. We all work in hospitality and honestly wanted to laugh in his face. He asked us what type of sangri we wanted, he would replace the pitcher. (I hope!) we sAid white and he sent out red!!!!!! We told the waitress who called him over and he gave us the nastiest attitude. Wow!! Will not go back! Service went bad in that place. The manager seriously needs as Forbes training.

I really loved eating here. It as a last minute decision and definitely worth it. The meatballs were unbelievably good and just melted in the mouth. The ribeye was phenomenal and the sauce on it was excellent. I would recommend going here. I will be going back next time I am in Vegas.
This place was delicious. They just didn't have any of the beers I wanted. They said they ran out of my selections. That's why I only gave 4 stars.

tapas and sangria are always a good time! love the ambiance and bringing friends here for the first time. they have all loved it and returned. the new location is quite larger but still has a great vibe! 

a few of my favs:

apple and manchego salad (green apple, manchego cheese, smoked almonds, lightly dressed)

stuffed  dates (bacon-wrapped, smoked almond, red wine reduction, blue cheese)

pulpo asado (grilled octopus, potato, tomato, paprika-lemon vinaigrette)

albondigas (meatballs in sherry tomato sauce, parmesan)

chocolate "tres leches" cake

this is the perfect spot for a date, birthday dinner or just catching up with a friend.  highly recommended you can't go wrong here!

Very good tapas.  We went with the Tuna Tartare, Stuffed Dates, Patatas Brevas, Mushroom Tart, Fried Calamari, Grilled Scallops, Albondigas, Ham and Cheese Croquetas, and Serrano Sliders.  It was a great meal that my wife and I shared.  My favorite was the tuna tartare, my wifes favorite was the mushroom tart.  All the food was great, aside from the calamari which was overcooked.  The service was great and the staff was all very attentive to our needs.  We really wanted to try some dessert but as you can see we went all out for our main meal/s.  I definitely will come back to this place next time I am in Vegas.

Not as good as I had hoped it would be. Paella tasted like there was far too much tomato paste, and we didn't get one crispy piece of rice.  We would have made our server aware of this, if he had ever come back to our table, besides to ask if we got our bill after we had already paid. It was also a let down that the old scallops were off the menu; new version was not as good. Other apps (dates, stuffed mushrooms, beet/pear salad) were just OK. I've had my fill of Firefly.

We had a large group at this amazing restaurant and our experience was EXCELLLENT! We had two top notch servers taking care of our large group. They went above and beyond the entire night. Many thanks and KUDOS to Neo & Marcus. I've been doing large group dinners for over 20 years and can't say I've ever had anyone as spot on as these two guys. I'll also add, all the food we had was great, but the Paella was over the top DELISH!!!
Will definitely repeat, again and again. I highly recommend for any type of group event!
Great Tapas.... Not "authentic", they have a blend of traditional and American "Tapas" dishes, but everything was very good.  Would recommend in a heartbeat!  Order the Sangria.

Loud!  Very loud.  parking in the rear.

Great bar staff!  I was very happy sitting at the bar and ordering from there.

As for the price, I mean, it's Tapas...  It's not going to be cheap.  It's also meant to be social and shared.  I had some pretty typical dishes (apple manchego salad, stuffed dates, croquettes, and the shrimp ceviche)  They were all very good but I fully admit that I didn't stray too far from my likes.

This is one of the best tapas places I've been to. We walked about 30 minutes to get to this place, but it was worth every step. It is not directly on the strip and appears to be more of a local spot. 

Service was perfect. The food was perfect. Portions and timing was perfect. The sangria (we had the red) was a complete pitcher and not filled with ice....that was good. ;) 

I didn't feel so guilty with my over consumption of food and wine after we walked back to the strip after dinner.  

This is a fabulous find if you are not afraid to venture off the beaten path. We will definitely return on our next trip.

Came here for brunch with friends and let me just say: get that Croque Senora! Much good. Very wow. Even came with two tapas sides (apple salad and patatas bravas were the ones we opted for).

My friends insisted that their standard tapas must be tried, so we did a combination of brunch dishes and tapas, which was a fantastic choice. There was not a single item that did not taste good. Even the complimentary bread with butter was bomb diggity. I especially enjoyed their scallop escargot, which came out piping hot, silky soft, and swimming in little pots of garlic herb butter. The ribs and goat cheese plate was also delicious. By far the best tapas I've ever had.

And did I mention the absolute BESTEST sangria ever?! Because if you've been looking, this is where it lives. So come for the Sangria and definitely stay for the food.

Fantastic cocktails. 

Good selection of tapas and a handful of full meal size plates. Offers paella but me he advises it takes 40 minutes to prepare.

Stuffed Dates - excellent, would get again
Baked Goat Cheese - good, Italian tasting
Empanada (pork) - pass
Baby back Ribs - good, mango salsa had an unexpected kick.

FOOD

Artichoke points- very good, light flavor (order)
Ribs- tender, but meh (skip)
Mushroom toast- puff pasty with a nice sauce, big portion (order)
Dates- good (order)
Calamari- standard (skip)
Shrimp, a la diabla- good sauce, shrimp cooked well (up to you)
Tierra y mar- very good cuts of meat, chorizo is quite tasty (order)

ATMOSPHERE

We ate on the patio, which was nice. Good music as well.

SERVICE

We did not wait at all on a Sunday at 9:30pm. There were three waiters buzzing around. Good service. Ribs took 10-15 minutes to prepare.

PRICE

We were a party of 4. Without drinks, including tax, the bill was $73. With tip, we paid $87. That's about $22 per person.

OVERALL

I'll be checking out other places first, but I'll find my way back one day.

We come here twice a year with about 25-30 people. The service is always great, the food is amazing and we all have a really great time!! The place is always packed on the weekend so make reservations!

Really liked this place.  Service was good.  Really worth it to get off the strip and have a nice meal without the whole strip experience.  Tapas selection was good.  Good for kids, assuming they will eat the tapas.
Needed a late evening light meal after getting to Vegas. Found that Firefly was near my hotel, which is near the Convention Center. The food was very good as well as the service.

Came here twice this trip! Ordered tons of tapas and let me tell you! They were all just perfect..the meats succulent, tender and full of flavor! And for the non-meat eaters, they have quite a few vegetarian options. This will be my go to whenever I'm in Vegas! And the service was awesome!
This place is amazing. Amazing food, great drinks and over all fun place to be. Found out about from some locals and feel like We had the inside track to great food at a good price! We will be back.

when it came time to pick a group dinner for my bday, i knew i wanted to go off strip since i dont really get the chance to

ordered a feast for 10:
-tomato bread
-shrimp ceviche
-tuna tartare
-patatas bravas
-stuffed dates
-shrimp, filet, chorizo skewers
-calamari
-shrimp in lemon garlic butter 
-albondigas
-empanadas
-chicken and mushroom paella
-mixed paella
-sangria

everything was amazing and glad everyone in my group loved it too

Cool place with a fun vibe. Perfect tapas place that embodies the small plate concept really well. Dishes are flavorful and authentic. Great music too. We went late at night and it was still bustling with a lot of people. There was also a separate area for dancing for which I believe there is an entry fee. We had 6 plates between 3 of us and were pretty full. Octopus, clams, lamb sausage, lamb chops etc were all delicious. Plenty of more diahes to try for which I am going to go back next time I am in Vegas.

Yummy food and variety! Caters to both vegetarians and nonvegetarians. For nonveggies, I recommend the grilled scallops, bacon wrapped dates, chicken empanadas and the chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms. For veggies, the patatas bravas, mac n cheese, and the parmesan fries were my favorite. Those fries were just amazing - very well seasoned! And the red sangria was better than the white but definitely not the best I've had. The ambience was great - djm with red and black decor, which matched perfectly with our bachelorette party attire theme of red and black :) only downside was that it's off the strip and it was a pain getting a taxi from there. May want to get a taxi number and call them in advance.

This place has probably one of the best mojitos in town. I am not a big fan of cocktail drinks but I constantly crave their mojitos here. Especially during the summer time. The strawberry one is really good. Food here is pretty good too. The portion sizes are not really that big considering their prices. I do like their complimentary bread and butter. Sometimes they do "forget" to serve it so make sure you ask for it. I love their fries. The menu has a pretty good selection of tapas. Not a lot of entrees though. I honestly haven't tried anything from here that I did not like. I just wish that their portions were bigger or the prices were a little lower. Try this place. And do not forget to try any of their mojitos. Outside seating during the summer time isn't bad either because they have mists to keep you cool.

Maria & Chino were awesome and took care of me! The strawberry mojito was perfection and fresh! They had an extensive gluten free and vegetarian menu. I ordered the baked tetilla, stuffed dates and stuffed peppers. It was mild in spice, but still delicious!

As I write this I believe this is the last Firefly left in the area. It's a shame because the ladies absolutely love this place and it's always a winner for date night or nights out with friends. Tapas is a lot of fun, and this location is in a newer building with tons of seating and not far from the strip. The Firefly name has unfortunately been marred by multiple restaurant closings from the health department, so they've gone from three or four locations down to only one. It's a little pricey, but you plan to spend a little and you won't have any surprises, and there are plenty of great menu options to choose from.
The new place is very nice. Great bar, great staff, great food. A good variety on the menu. TVs in the bar and a good Happy Hour.

The food here is the best. Every tapa is we had was delicious. The dates was the great. The lamb chops and lentil were the best. Along with the steak and mushrooms. Steak was tender and the mushrooms were great. Dessert was great. Have to try to chocolate cherry bread pudding. This will become a place I visit every time. The service was top notch. Our server Mario was outstanding and very knowledgable with his recommendations. Will definitely come back.

Kind of mixed review here. We had a large group, they were extremely easy to deal with. We did want something not too expensive, they did an amazing job with this. The food was quite good, but not amazing. Spanish food is not my favorite either, but it's decent. Overall they were great to a large party. Kudos.

Food: 3.5 stars
Service: 2 stars
Atmosphere: 1 star

You will leave this place with ringing in your ears. It is as loud as a night club, which makes for a totally unromantic, get-me-outta-here dinner experience. Service was rushed and felt IHOPish. Food is nothing special, and when you can't hear yourself think, you don't really care what it tastes like. Sangria was too sweet. Definitely not worth going when there are so so many dining options.

Read the reviews on Yelp, and decided to give it a try.  Glad we made reservations.  Place was packed mainly with many groups and some couples.

All the food was delicious.  Our waitperson, Irina, and her main helper, Jesus, were attentive and personable.  5 Stars to them.

Only negative was the noise.  It was hard to listen and talk.  Would have rated it a "5" if the noise level wasn't so high.

We had the chicken & mushroom paella (if you like paella, make sure you order it as soon as you sit down - takes awhile to prepare), beet salad, warm spinach salad, merguez (lamb sausage) and chocolate tres leche cake.  It makes my mouth water, just writing this down!

This place was highly recommended to be by a few people, and I had really high expectations. The bad part about high expectations is that most of the time they are not met. However, Firefly went above and beyond, and I absolutely loved it.

This restaurant serves Tapas, which is basically small plates and/or appetizers. Our table decided to just order a bunch of these small dishes and share them all, which was nice because it would have been so difficult to just select one! Everything we ordered tasted fresh and amazing, and have AMAZING flavor - from the stuffed dates to the mac n cheese to the tuna tartare. For us, they brought out the dishes one by one, so we were able to focus on one dish at a time, passing it around the table for everyone to serve themselves. It is quite a different experience than most restaurants, but I definitely enjoyed this method. We also ordered a pitcher of Mango Mojitos, which we SO yummy. The mango did not taste artificial at all. 

The atmosphere of this restaurant is pretty modern and artistic. We had a unique dinner because we were able to experience both the inside and outside seating. At first, we chose to sit outside because there were beautiful round fairy lights, and the inside seating seemed a bit to dark for my liking.  We really loved sitting outside, until the thunderstorm started! We were quickly moved inside, just before the large amounts of water soaked through the thin cotton overhang. The inside has a great ambiance - dark and candlelit - but I did like the outside more, before the storm obviously. 

The staff was very accommodating and helpful, especially when we had to quickly move inside. They said "grab your drinks, and we will take care of the rest". It was very nice of them to brave the storm outside which got crazy pretty quickly.  Our server was also very friendly, and was helpful with our questions about the menu. This is amazing quality food for not that expensive, ESPECIALLY for Vegas.  I don't know if/when I will be back to Vegas, but if I do, I will definitely be coming here again!

This was a fantastic place to grab some delicious Tapas with a friend.  We ordered more than needed but everything was delicious!  The service was amazing and the food just kept arriving at short intervals.  The atmosphere was fun and festive although a little too loud for easy conversation.  Firefly will definitely be one of my top go-to places in Vegas.

Went here mid day and ate at the bar. Great friendly& fast service. Tapas were top notch.
Truly a gem off the Strip. Will be back next time we are in Vegas.

Maybe we went on an off night? Everything we ordered was just bleh. The service wasn't terrible but I did feel like we had to flag down our waitress a lot. There are so many better restaurants in Vegas.
Not only was the food great, but the service was magnificent. Food came out quickly, and soft drinks were refilled constantly. Will definitely return.
I have tried Camarones a la diabla (spicy shrimp), Smoked Salmon Bagel, Chicken Skewers and all of them were tasty.
Love this place when coming to Vegas. Great food, prices and atmosphere. Know they recently had some issues and closed a location but I'm sure they're even better now.

This is our go to place every time we visit Vegas. The new location is awesome! Waaaay better than the old location. Seems like there's more room. Tables are spread out and spacious, not how it was cramped and cluttered before. Food is always good! I recommend checking this place out. Best tapas spot!

Tasty tapas restaurant off the strip. Their food is very good, especially the complimentary bread with the addicting honey almond butter! I could eat the bread and butter all day! Like more tapas restaurants, you'll need to order multiple items to get full, if that's your intention. The Sangria is recommended, also. There were 3 of us and we each ordered 2 dishes plus a pitcher of sangria. The sangria might have caused us to feel full but it was worth it. I ordered the skewer and the potato dish. I don't recall what my friends ordered. There is a dance floor adjacent to the entrance and it's a pretty lively place. I would recommend this restaurant if you want to get away from the strip.

When I first arrived at Firefly I didn't see the signs for parking in the rear so I thought it was really empty.  I parked in the rear and had to walk past the dumpster with a man rummaging through it.  

I sat at the bar.  The redheaded server was very sweet and know her menu items.  I was especially impressed when she told me what looked good out of the kitchen that night.
I started with the Salmon Toasts.  They had very good flavors but tasted very similar to bagel and loxs(should have listened to the waitress).
The second dish I ordered was the shrimp Diablo.  The sauce was a perfect mix of spicy and sweet.  The shrimp were cooked perfectly.  
The third dish I ordered was the lamb chops.  They too were delicious.  I would not recommend them if you're in a large party.  
Overall the food was good.  The service was great.  One critique would be the presentation of the dishes.  They could have made them look a little better with the small plates.

Omg what a fantastic treasure! I'm vegan & my girlfriend is GF & a carnivore. ;) We love to share food but can't always do so. This wonderful restaurant accommodated is both. We had the vegan paella, fries, so many delicious items, clearly labeled. Wonderful servers. Just an amazing experience. I literally went here three nights in a row! They even brought us olives when they knew we couldn't have bread. A++ service!

Hands down one of the best restaurants in Vegas! Try the camaronnes al ajillo, you will not be disappointed. Prices are very fair for the quality of the food being served. This is not a place to leave stuffed without spending some money. It is rather a place to eat quality food.
We got the mushroom tart & the petite filet. Both were great. The Petite Filet was surprisingly big (and amazing). Can't recommend highly enough for Tapas!

Mac & cheese is the best I've ever had!

I always have a good time when I'm here with friends, good atmosphere and I love small bites :) i'd say Im 70/30 with the menu. I either really like what was ordered or I don't care for it at all. But overall a good spot to eat with friends

First, the place is HUGE. I loved the layout, as there are different spaces: Dining, plenty of bar area, and a large patio. It's all very spacious and when the weather is nice, the whole place feels very open and airy when the patio doors are open.

The food was great as I remember it from the previous location, with their signature items such as the bacon wrapped dates. We tried a handful of plates and with each tapas order, we were impressed. I can't even really repeat back to you everything we had but there were plenty of delicious and savory options. We tried so many and didn't feel like we broke the bank in the end. We opted for two desserts, one that was the flourless cake and both desserts sent us straight into a food coma as desired/expected.

We visited on a Saturday night and the one thing that was a little annoying was how loud the music was. There was a nice mix of songs - some Spanish, some radio hits, some rock - but it was all very, very loud. At one point in the beginning of the meal, we considered asking to move to the patio because it was just so so loud inside (seated at the bar). Since it's a very open layout, maybe that wouldn't have even helped.

Luckily, sound did not disrupt our dining experience!

We went at 5:30 and took advantage of the remaining 30 minutes in the happy hour which was totally worth it. Pitcher of sangria (red) regularly $33 for $18 - very tasty and strong. Solid and large selection of tapas. We ordered the Gazpacho, Pulpo asado, Camarones Ajillo, Huevos estrellados, Veggies and lentils. From the happy hour menu we had bacon wrapped dates, veggie, cx and pork empanadas. Personal favorites are the pulpo and empanadas. It's off strip, which was nice break from the hustle and bustle.

Firefly has become my favorite Spanish tapas restaurant in Vegas! I love love the tapas on their menu. My absolute favorite would have to be the baked goat cheese, unbelievably melts in your mouth. The ambience is dope on the weekends with Spanish music/dancing and all the beautiful Spanish women. Great place to come for some Spanish food and drinks! Glad I found this gem.

I usually don't post anything about restaurants I've been to, but in this case I had to. The food was delicious and Mario was a wonderful server. We've never been here before and weren't sure of what to order. He suggested some of his favorites, we tried them and we're glad we did. Next time we're in town, we'll come back here for sure!

Right on! Knowing that Firefly Tapas reopened was fantastic news to me. I used to frequent their location on Eastern at the base of Anthem over the past years and when they closed, the dark clouds covered my blue Firefly sky. I have not had the opportunity to check out the Paradise location but when I was given the opportunity to on Friday night with other Yelp Elite friends, I jumped on it. 

The vibe is pretty busy, sexy and swanky. The amount of people who were there was like visiting a popular New York restaurant on a Friday night. It was wall to wall humans but due to the size of the location it was better than said NY location. Although we had reservations, we waited at the bar for our table. It wasn't bad because I got to catch up with friends and drink a Ginger Smash. Excellent pre-cocktail by the way.

We ordered tapas. Lots of Tapas. Shared those lots of ordered Tapas. One thing I have always liked about the Tapas experience is that you can just try a bit of everything. Can one get full from trying a bit of everything, of course one can! I have always enjoyed their bacon wrapped dates. When they first closed I was sad, so sad because I have not found Bacon Wrapped Dates that even nail Fireflys. The added smoked almond does it for me. Most places don't add the almond so it just mushes. The ham and cheese Croquetas, stuffed peppers and beet salad are also a fabulous choice. I recommend those for tapas  ordered. You really can't go wrong with anything on their menu, so fun to explore Spanish style tapas here. 

I hope to come back down soon, there are a lot of tapas that I want to try or revisit!

This is my favorite place to go for drinks and appetizers. On Fridays the paradise location has salsa nights. It's a plus to get to see people dancing and having a good time. Love the stuffed dates, apple salad, empanadas and beef sliders. You have to try their sangria, they offer a white and red sangria. They have different flavored mojitos which taste amazing.
Love this place,I go every time I visit Vegas. Did brunch yesterday for the first time and everything was great!! The best sangria I've had.

5 stars! Yes! Why? Everything was on point! Food beer, service and price. I had four dishes.... Dates, chorizo clams, pulpo (octopus) asado, and albondigas (meatballs)! All were exceptional! And I am from LA so I know good food. A serious must try . Or I should say don't come at all so I can have the place all to myself! I have never been to an establishment when I didn't have any negative criticism. Karen and Omar at the bar were amazing! I'm coming back tomorrow. Shhhh but don't tell anyone!
This place was seriously amazing. One of my new favorite restaurants in Vegas. Can't wait to go back.

We were looking for a decent place to dine at midnight. It's Vegas, so I figured there had to be something open. They served tapas until 2am and had excellent reviews, so I initially thought it was perfect! However, I came across multiple articles on how this restaurant just couldn't get it together with health inspections and multiple cases of food poisoning. I was skeptical, but I still decided to take the risk! 
We ordered the firefly fries - good for a big group to share, but not worth getting for 2 with all the other options. The Tierra y mar skewers with salsa verde was "ok" - I wouldn't order it again. It just wasn't special and I've had better. The manchego mac n cheese gave me a mini heart attack with every bite, but those basked pasta shells were delish! The chicken tinga empanada was excellent, but it left me wanting more of it! The camarones a la Diabla had a real sweet and spicy kick to it. It tasted like it had quite a bit of siracha. It was tasty, but not my favorite. 
The last item was the bacon wrapped dates. I do not like dates, but these bites were little pieces of heaven. Sweet and salty, with an almond crunch in the middle. I still couldn't believe how good it was. I don't like dates, but I liked these! It comes with 5 per order, so perfect for 2-3 people. 
The evening was topped with the trio of gelato - vanilla and chocolate were good, but not as good as the pistachio flavor! Love love love! We also ordered the chocolate tres leches cake to go. Our server said it was a must have, so I wasn't leaving without it. Hopefully, it's still good tomorrow! 
I gave this review 4 stars because of a couple things, the hostess wasn't very friendly (our server was good though) and there were so many options on the menu. They should really cut it down and focus on the items that are really good. Not everything we ordered was that good, I will only rate a restaurant give 5 stars when ALL the food is excellent. 

I might go back next time I'm in town, in depends how good this chocolate tres leches cake is.
Got the Mac and cheese which was delicious and filling. This place has small appetizers and off the strip in Vegas. Don't get the chorizo mushrooms too tiny. Overall good outdoor patio and vibe

This is my "go to spot" off the strip each time I visit Vegas. It's rare to find a gem on the strip so why not look outside the strip. This place is marvelous. Their old location was about 500 ft away and that's where it was love at first bites. Tapas style makes it easy to have a variety of flavors and share amongst family and/or friends. There are many choices to choose from that consist of seafood, beef, veggies, and much more. Some of my favorites are the ceviche, stuffed mushrooms, tuna tartare, tomato basil soup, tierra y mar skewers, baby back ribs with mango sauce, the pork chops are a must, and the empanadas with roasted pork are yummy. Whatever fulfills your pleasure, I'm sure you'll find it here with the endless choices. The table set up is the perfect setting that gives you plenty of room to work on multiple plates at once. The atmosphere has a romantic setting for date night during the week. But the beat picks up Thursday through Sunday and the place gets a little loud, but that's what makes this place a great experience. The staff is great, the vibe is trendy, and music sets the tone for a wonderful evening. If you want to avoid the larger crowds, I suggest to visit during day and the food will be just as delicious as it is at night. Also, if you're staying anywhere on the strip, you're a short $8 taxi away from most hotels on the strip. Oh yeah, the drinks are amazing too and you must try the red sangria. I better stop here and leave a few things for you to discover yourself here at Firefly.

So far I've found three places in the country all named firefly. All unique and amazing. This lives up to the name. Craft cocktails. Awesome apps and small plates. Well crafted menu that changes seasonally. Worth a stop. For sure.

This is seriously the BEST TAPAS EVER!!! Definite must! Everything they brought out was better than the last. The fries, tomato basil soup with grilled Brie cheese sandwich, the Mac and cheese, the scallops, the ribs. AMAZING!!!

This place has been my favorite place since they were in the smaller building just right next door. I am glad that they have moved to a bigger restaurant.
Being that this is me and my now husband favorite place to eat, we love the atmosphere, but of course the food and the RED SANGRIA. 
Being said, we just had our wedding reception there in the patio area. The outside is very nice, the hanging light bulbs, the red and black walls, everything about it made my reception amazing. Ana, Alejandra and their staff was amazing. 
Instead of ordering per person, we ordered from the tray menus. We ordered about 5 trays for each 15 different tapas. My guests loved the food and they got really full and the food were still coming. LOL. But they were able to take to-go, which is good, so food doesn't go to waste. Plu, our 4 year old son has severe food allergies to all 8 allergens, they were able to accommodate that and my son loved his baked chicken. 
I also was able to do my own kind of decorations, i was also able to hire a DJ, a photographer and a photobooth without going through there vendors. I had a Sweethearts table, a guest sign in and Cake and Sweet Bar. By sketching out how the tables are going to be set up, i was afraid it was going to be tight, but it wasn't...i was able to have a decent size dance floor and still had space to walk around. 
I didn't want a big normal wedding reception, I wanted something different, and I am glad I chose this place. For anyone who is trying to do an event, nothing big or extravagant, I recommend inquiring with Fireflys.
Love this place! This is the 2nd time coming here on my trips to Vegas. Delicious tapas. Highly recommended.

I was there tonight and i really enjoy the food and the service was amazing ....and really fast .....I really recommend this place....,. it's my favor place !!! And the manager was very nice and polite !!!!

Friend and I ate here while visiting from out of state. Just looking for different places that had offered lunch services. After reading the reviews on here we took the chance and glad that we did. The service was great. It was fast. Our waiter Mario had taken our order not long after we sat down and it was great that he kept checking to see if we were okay or needed anything else even after service was picking up. He was great enough to let my friend and I know that if we were to come back for dinner same night to come in early, make reservations to avoid wait time as to they do get busy. I would highly recommend this place if you are in the area.

This was my first time back to Firefly since the relocation. I know it was a hot spot at the other building, but I really hated going there because it was so cramped. And parking was a pain in the butt.

I'm very impressed with the new building, it's spacious and very nicely decorated. 

  I heard some things about the previous location being closed because it was unclean, but I felt really confident eating here, everything was 'sparkling clean'. The waitstaff was pleasant, and very quick on service. And for me (as it always was) the food was just amazing.
  We got a pitcher of the blood orange mojito as suggested from friends, but It was to strong for my taste and over priced. We will stick to the good stuff in the future (Big firefly sangria fans here) 
  Our favorite  things to order from here are the Bacon wrapped dates (YUM), The mac n' cheese, the sliders, and the stuffed mushrooms. My bf is obsessed with the stuffed peppers also. Im not a cream cheese fan, but I take his word they're good. Also tried for the first time last night Tres Leche
  The reason for the loss of a star is although its delicious I feel its a tad over-priced. Still, doesn't keep me from coming back though ;) (just not as often)

this place gets really busy, definitely make a reservation before you make the trip to vegas, cant just pop in when you find it on yelp. The quality of the dishes was pretty hit or miss, and since its vegas, everything is overpriced. great place for a big group birthday dinner or something, but it is a bit off the strip and it probably wont live up to your expectations.

Firefly never hesitates to impress with their menu and service! Last night I brought a group of about 40 colleagues from all over the US for a private event. Ana did an excellent job making sure that we had everything we needed prior to the event, and was very conscientious about the guests who had food allergies or dietary restrictions. Every dish was phenomenal - they have won the hearts and tummies of my colleagues! Neo was our bartender, and was so pleasant to everyone, and made some great drinks. Marcos made sure that we had what we needed, and did his best to keep up with clearing away what we finished, and that nothing was wasted. This has become one of the Vegas team's favorite places!

My wife and I went here on a Sunday Afternoon. It was actually less crowded then I had expected but we made a reservation in case. The goat cheese was delicious as was the Filet mignon and the Chicken Empanadas. The stuffed mushrooms were not the greatest becuase they were a little dry, but overall the food was great!

The blood Orange mojito was a little sour to my taste so I added some club soda which made it better! Overall decent lunch place

Been wanting to try this place for a while now. 

Deducted 1 star because it took a while for the hostess to realize their was people waiting by the stand and it was confusing. Most of the night people would just walk in think ing they could just sit anywhere or were actually looking for the hostess. 

4 stars for the food and ambience. Very trendy, but somewhat casual atmosphere. This is definitely a "Date Night" Restaurant. Gets loud with large groups, so you may need to speak up with whoever you're with. The service was awesome! Our waiter was kind, he broke down ingredients and flavors in a lot of the dishes and helped determine some of the tapas we may enjoy. I ordered the Sparkling Red Sangria, very good. They have a lot of space for large and small groups. I noted one booth had a curtain with it, so even if you wanted to have a more intimate dinner you definitely could.

Favorite Tapas include Camarones Al Ajillo, Firefly Fish Sticks, and the Baby Back Ribs

You can easily do quite some damage at this restaurant and you're bill will reflect that. Walking away, I paid close to $75 on the bill for 2 people. So you can only imagine what you can do with more food and drinks.

All in all a good experience, and would like to return.

This is a 4-4.5 star eatery that gets extra credit for extremely good service. GREAT meals, solid service and surprisingly fast turn-around make this a location that I and my news crew always visit whenever we have a Las Vegas event. We've been there through both locations and the resultant visits have only gotten better with time. An outstanding restaurant. We will be back -- again and again.

So I wrote a really scathing review of this place before it moved and when I walked in, I told the concierge. I basically got treated like garbage by the bartender because (I'm pretty sure) I didn't fit their hipster classy crowd. They reassured me that the place has vastly improved.

I came with Angela and Kent. We ordered about a dozen dishes here. I'm only going to mention the two that we would order again. The stuffed dates and the spicy beef salad. Everything else we had wasn't even ok. We also got seated outside and there were only two servers outside and we actually waited 5-10 minutes until we got our drinks! Seriously, have you ever waited that long for alcoholic drinks in Vegas? Yeah, it's like we walked into some pocket dimension not in Vegas. Our food also took a long time gettin' to. Even the bread and butter they give you, I had to ask for twice before we got them and they took their time also. What really made no sense was that we got our dessert before we even were served all our main courses! WTH? That's a first, never happened to me. 

I will say that the sangria is pretty awesome here and the pear-ginger martini was pretty outstanding. Only reason why I'd ever come back, the drinks. But then again Angela made a good point that you can find better in Vegas if you looked hard enough. Yeah, probably so it's a question of whether I would go out of my way to come here just for the drinks. Nope.

So I'm really, finally done with this place. I was done before they moved and now I'm done again with this place.

Ahh! One of my favorite places EVER.

Every time we come here I get Sangria.  They have red, white, and sparkling.  They are all delicious, but I think sparkling is my favorite.  **Half off pitchers of sangria during happy hour!

They bring you complimentary bread with almond butter.  AMAZING!! Seriously. I would order this stuff if it wasn't given.  We always ask for another order.

My top 3 tapas are the firefly fishsticks, the ham & cheese croquetas, and the salmon toast.  I was really excited for the parmesan fries, but they aren't very good.  I have tried them twice and both times they were soggy and bland.  I also really like the babyback ribs (with mango BBQ sauce), the lamb chops, the petit filet mignon, and the fruit & cheese platter.

My boyfriend loves that they have Pacifico here.  He loves the stuffed peppers, bacon wrapped dates, and the tierra y mar skewers.

I like that this place is tapas style that way we can get a wide assortment of food.  I'd suggest getting at least 3 dishes per person as they are pretty small.

We have tried a couple desserts here but weren't very fond of them.  Last time we tried the flan.  We have had the banana nutella sandwiches twice and both times they were made differently.  The first time they were delicious.  They were fritters stuffed with bananas and strawberrys in them and nutella on top.  Last time we went they were literally nutella sandwiches, which we can make at home.  I don't know why they were different.. Maybe because the fritter styled ones were at the Sahara location?  But no more desserts for us, we'll just stick to the tapas.

Service is usually pretty good.  The food comes out as it is prepared.  We will continue being repeat customers.

Bacon wrapped around your dates!?......end of review.
Came here with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday, the choice was perfect, elegant, clean, affordable and with a menu so intensive anyone would surely find something to their liking. I had the fried calamari, pardon peppers, the dates wrapped in bacon and the paella which was very delicious and loaded with seafood. The peppers were medium to mild but you may end up with a very spicy one, but as Forrest Gumpzalez once said "life is a plate of peppers, you never know which one is going to burn you". I asked the waiter if they could fry the calamari in tempura mix instead of their regular mix and they did which means that everything is made to order and not frozen ready like other places do.
 I also ordered the sangria and a mojito and they both were perfectly done, a harmonious mixture of fruits and wine made this sangria one of the best I tasted. 
  Service was great..at the beginning and then it slowly became nonexistent, but to be fair I think we might have overstayed our welcome. I blame it on the sangria. 
Tip was included on the bill as any establishment would do for parties of 8 or more but we added some more to cover lingering fees.
Great times and great food will surely keep me coming for more and if you keep on making good drinks as good as your dates wrapped in bacon, you'll definitely have me wrapped around your sangria for sure.

This restaurant was amazing. First of all we completely forgot what tapas was for a second and ordered too much food. However, it did not matter. Everything was cooked to perfection. My favorite was the garlic shrimp, steak and mushroom skewers, and lamb chops. We also had vegetables, a salad with green beans, tuna tar tar, fried calamari and a couple of other things. I have in to the sangria with white wine and it was delicious. I have a tapas place in Chicago that I love and this superseded my standards. The staff was really nice and friendly. Our waitress seemed a little timid but she took care of everything for us. Amazing. I will visit here every time I come to Vegas.
great eats. such a great afternoon of food with friends. service was great. super fast.

This was an excellent experience all around. Food was delicious and plenty of variety and plates to share. Eduardo the manager was excellent, professional, and attentive to our table the entire time. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone passing through Vegas -may it be couple or family- looking for a great reasonably priced place with good food service and vibe!

Just walked out of this place been sitting for 10mins and still not been greeted by a server. Then a table right next to us just got sat and instantly got greeted with a beverage order. Management really need to get on top of this.

I've eaten here twice, both times my meals and service have been excellent. There's a ginger pear martini that you need to try! I was dining with a vegan and pleasantly surprised that there were plenty of things we could order that everyone in my party of 3 could enjoy. But the item worth raving about is the carrots. Carrots? Yes! The carrots! We ended up re-ordering more carrots during our meal because they were the star of the show, they ate more like ribs than anything else, deliciously roasted in a BBQish sauce. If you do anything here, get the carrots. I promise they'll blow your mind. Patio seating during the evening (in the spring) is lovely.

It's hard for me to want to go anywhere else when in Vegas because this place is so good! We love Omar at the bar too. Such great service! We had the filet and warm spinach salad and they were both so delicious. I could eat the artichoke toasts everyday too. So good! The only thing that I didn't love was the chicken skewers, but it wouldn't stop me from going back.
Every single plate is a hit! I cannot complain about this place. I'm originally from Los Angeles, CA and every time I come to Vegas I make sure to come to FireFly.

Yes, this place has had its health issues (or rather one giant Godzilla-sized ISSUE). You are either going to get over that, or not. Having worked in the industry, I can confidently say that a place that has undergone such public humiliation is not going to drop the ball again. I am sure this place is now cleaner than one of those crazy decontamination suits in Outbreak. But, unlike that movie, Firefly does not suck. This place is the bee's knees. Try getting quality tapas at such a very reasonable price elsewhere - I dares ya! This new location (about time!) is much larger and nicer than the last joint. The once overly packed patio area is now open and spacious, and the same goes for the interior. The cramped bar has been traded for a full encompassing rectangle of drinking goodness. And the food lived up to the atmosphere. The bacon wrapped dates are a stalwart, and not to be missed. My only knock is the bread. I have never cared for it - hard and flavorless (closer to a cracker than bread). Although, it could be a blessing in disguise, as skipping he bread leaves plenty of room for countless small plates. Hopefully people start coming back and filling up the patio again, as it would be tragic for Vegas to lose this local dining icon.
They served a paella for us at 1 AM. Where else would you find that? It was exquisite. Great service, and close to the strip. We're coming back on our next visit to Vegas. Thank you guys!

I was really excited to try this place out after checking out the menu. The decor is quirky and artsy, and I saw rave reviews about some of the dishes and the sangria. I was with a large group for work, so we literally ordered the whole menu. Here's my takeaway. 

Hot: Tuna tartare, artichoke toasts
Mild: Shrimp tempura, camarones al ajillo
Cold: Ahi tuna skewers (not great flavor)

My favorite parts of the meal were the sangria and the dessert. Not that alcohol and dessert being the favorite part of a meal would be surprising, but that was definitely the high point of the day. The cheesecake and the flan was great from the dessert platter, and the banana nutella sandwiches were delightful.

Based on the prices, small quantities of food, and bland flavor, I probably wouldn't put this high on my Vegas to-do list. There were definitely a few plusses for me, but overall it was a bigger miss.

A must stop for us every time we are in Las Vegas!!

5/5 Customer Service
Always welcoming, always ensuring our cups are filled with water. 

5/5 Food
I can't say enough about the delicious food! Prices and quality are always great. Our go to's are always;

Ceviche ; super limey just how I like it. Big chunks of avocado and shrimp. Just delicious.

Shrimp A La Diabla; sweet and spicy and just the best. The sauce is thick but not overwhelming. We usually get two of these dishes as my husband and I don't want to share! 

Tierra y Mar: Yum yum! Chorizo, shrimp and filet mignon skewer with a salsa verde drizzled on top. Another must have a must order 2! 

Bacon wrapped dates: I don't need to say anymore. Get them. 

We had our toddler with us this time so we explored beyond our usual 4. 

Mac & Cheese: This was a large portion and just so so good. I know you can't really get too crazy with Mac & Cheese but it just tasted different, ans super cheesy. Our toddler loved it.

Albondigas: He really enjoyed these too! The spices where perfect and not too overwhelming for a toddler. 

See you next time Firefly!
A lot of fun... Good vibe.  Always a little crowded ... Staff has a lot of energy.  Get off the strip and enjoy firefly.

Delicious vegetarian experience! So glad we finally tried Firefly! I had scoped out their menu quite a few years ago and don't recall as many vegetarian options as there are now!

Every bite and sip was flavorful! We started with sparkling sangria and infused vodka martini. Perfect drinks! We had the veggie empanada, grilled cheese w tomato soup, lentils w veggies, manchego mac n cheese, and baked goat cheese! All flavorful! What I love about tapas is there's always room for dessert. Don't miss the chocolate tres leches cake, yum yum and more yum!

Our server was patient and caring. The runners and bussers all efficient and friendly. We've already added it to the list of places to return to next time in Vegas.

Great location, close to the Encore. Great outside seating area, super friendly and accommodating staff. Tapas were good with a great array of choices. Wine selection was limited although vast. I wasn't familiar with a lot of the options and the staff could not describe the wines. Still a keeper!

Best tapas restaurant in las vegas.  I can't get enough of Firefly and you can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  If you want to impress your gf, wife, date, etc., take her here next time you're in Vegas.  It's just a few blocks from the strip but worth the drive.  It can get pretty crowded during dinner time, so you might need a reservation if you're not prepared to wait.  I highly recommend their bacon wrapped dates, even though the portion size on this particular dish is pretty small.

No words to explain this restaurant. food, environment, and staff are great. we had the Pulpo Asado, ham and cheese croquettes, shrimp a la diabla and tomato and basil soup and a many many cups of water due to a wild night in Las Vegas..

Right off the strip, this place is a great place to get a meal away from the over priced, commercialized eateries on the blvd. They have a great selection of tapas, a full bar, and plenty of seating for large parties.

I tried: bacon wrapped dates.  AMAZING
calamari-pretty good, but the dipping sauce could of been better.
Ahi tuna tartar- with bits of avocado. 
Sliders- tasty!
Machego Mac n cheese- probably the best thing I had there.
Spicy beef salad-I wish they used other greens beside the iceberg lettuce, and the beef could of been more tender.
Sangria- good, get the pitcher!
Awesome  Service and amazing food, in in town for a conference and wish they could bring it to the Bay Area.
Great food ,good service but the noice level was so bad we could not have a proper conversation. Will I go back don't think so .

Time and Time again!! This place is always outstanding ! I've been coming here since they opened their original location and I have never been disappointed. Tonight was no different . Brought 4 friends ( one with a corn allergy ) who have never been here . They loved it all as much as me . Special thank you to Neo our waiter and Jaime our chef who were amazing. Paid such great attention to us and her allergy . Can't wait til next week , cause I'll be back for more as usual .: 
Gracias !!!!

Whoaaaaa this place surprised me forsure! Came here for lunch with a couple friends for the first time and ordered some of the popular items. 

Bacon-wrapped dates: I was terrified to try this.. Because dates... But they were delicious ! Perfect balance of sweet and salty. 

Chorizo and clams: much bigger portion that I expected. Essentially an entire meal on its own! The sauce is amazing and they give you a healthy serving of clams! 

Mac n cheese: what can go wrong? one of my favorites! 

Lamb skewers: totally shocked me and definitely my favorite dish. Again, portions were great and this can also stand as a meal on its own. The lamb was not gamey at all and cooked perfectly! Also lentils were flavorful and filling. 

Tuna tartare: comes with taro chips that compliment the raw tuna very well! I wish there was a little citrus but it was still really good.

This is one of the few restaurants I've been to where everything I tried was amazing. I can't wait to come back here !

All the positive...

Unless you're in Espana, great tapas are hard to come by--BUT not at Firefly! 

This is a go-to spot in Las Vegas, especially since it is located a little away from the chaotic strip (and there is parking). I visited Firefly both times I was in Vegas since my cousin who is a local introduced it to me. My go-to's are the tuna tartare w/ taro chips, bacon wrapped dates, and ham and cheese croquetas. The gelato was nothing great but I would recommend the flourless chocolate cake for dessert! The portions are small and don't leave you feeling gross after eating--which you don't want to feel like when you're in Vegas heat and going to be walking around all day/night. You just get a good taste of everything. 

Not so positive but still ok...

The chicken-skewers here are nothing spectacular, and my friend ordered the sliders which I thought were average--but I'm not a sliders fan to begin with. I'm not a fan of the sangria here but it's also partially because I've been making my own sangria. It seems like the fruit hasn't been properly soaked in liquor, more wine needs to be added, and they could def use more variety of fruit besides apples/oranges (cheapest fruit you can find -_-).  

Overall, I'm such a fan of the tapas I listed that I would come back anyways esp for a midday lunch or light dinner. Cheers!
Love Firefly, great tappas and mojitos.  Cant go wrong,

This was an late night choice after an event at the Hard Rock Hotel~ a little timid after the issues over the summer....but the worries were for not~
     GREAT HOSTESS~ friendly & personal it was a bit noisy and she did try to seat in a more quieter area.
     SUPER SERVER~ Jessica, I think. Very helpful and personable and even tho it was late she was friendly.
 We ordered the garbanzo beans, FRICKIN INCREDIABLE!!!!!! More addicting that BBQ Potato Chips for me~ just DEEELISH! Ordered the dates, husband ate those said they were quite good. These are highly recommended on Yelp! The chicken Tinga Empanadas also FAB! And the sliders all . The Machego Mac & cheese disappointing, try something else as they have numerous options.
    DEFINATLY will return, however the location on Eastern is more convenient from home for us.

Good food, drinks, and dancing? Firefly is your spot. This place is the spot to go to if you wanna dance, get your drink on and have a good meal off the strip. i would make reservations because they get packed. Service could be a little better, but overall i was happy. 

I loved my eggplant tapa--i highly suggest this. the eggplant is cooked so well, and the filling is creamy.

the patatas are a must get too, a good snack to share with a spicy kick.

the mussels are okay, tasty for sure but i feel ive had better. 

everything is reasonably priced, and theres options here for everyone--veggie and meat eaters alike!

Mediocre food, super fast service, good sangria.

Unimpressed with the four dishes we had. Lamb chops were good. Polpo overcooked. Again; very fast service. Fed and full in under an hour on a Friday night.

I had my wedding dinner at Firefly on Saturday. 
I must say they are not the best at returning phone calls and emails and I was ready to take off a star for that but... 
They made me look so good on Saturday! Service was absolutely impeccable, thank you Ana and Neo! 
All of my guests raved about the food and even drinks. 
Lol seeing their faces when they found octopus in paella was priceless. Btw we ordered 4 course menu which started with bread and butter with olives, followed by stuffed dates ( the bomb!!!) and some kind of delicious meatball tapas. Garden salad was generously sprinkled with pine nuts, yum. 
For entrees we had were ribeye( tender and delicious), roasted chicken and paella. Tres leches cake for dessert. All served family style 
All of the above for $40 pp plus drinks, way below the banquet prices everyone else charges( by Vegas standards). 
Highly recommend for events and will come back next time I am in Vegas
service good but a little slow.  Food was soso, nothing special.

Well we saw the good reviews on yelp so we decided to try it out. I have to say, I really enjoyed the place. We made reservations for 5:30pm on a Wednesday. I know it was early, but I like to eat an early dinner. This was a birthday also for my friend so this is where we went.
When you pull in the parking lot, there is some street work going on and the parking lot seems plain. Most of the parking is in the back. Not really impressive looking. But when you walk in the front door, it is like an oasis. Beautiful inside. VERY nice.
I had checked the menu ahead of time and about the last 50 Yelp reviews so I had written down the accumulation of the six most recommended food items. You will need about 3 items each for a man my size (6'1 225 lbs). My friend got a red wine sangria, which I tasted, it was VERY good. I'm not a wine drinker either. I'd probably get the sparkling sangria next time. I got the strawberry mojito. Good but too sweet to have with dinner. 
We got and shared the:
Bacon wrapped stuffed dates. Everybody says to get these. These and the sangria were probably the most listed items on the prior 50 Yelp reviews. I didn't see it. They were ok, but not to die for. Would I eat them again? Oh yeah. Would I order them again? No. 
The petit filet. This was the most expensive item at $12.50 and a very small piece, but very good piece of filet. It sat on a bed of tomatoes and spinach and diced potatoes that was very good. Wouldn't get it again as money can be better spent.
Chorizo and chicken stuffed mushrooms topped with melted cheese. Yummo! I would get this again. I am half Mexican though so I may like chorizo more than most.
The scallops escargot. There are NO snails in this, just made with garlic and butter. You get 6 decent size scallops cooked to perfection. I would totally get these again. Gotta try these.
Camarones a la diabla. Fantastic! The best thing we had. Decent size shrimp, cooked perfectly, in a sauce that is hot, but not too hot, and sweet also. The sauce is so good that you want to dip the bread they give you into any remaining sauce. Five shrimp came in a serving. 
Tierra y mar skewers. These are skewers that are maybe $8.50. So $4 cheaper than the petit filet. On each skewer is a chunk of filet, a shrimp, a chunk of tomato and a piece of chorizo. You get three skewers and if you combine the amount of filet on each skewer you get more on the skewers than in the petit filet. So get this instead of the petit filet and save. 
We both had the chocolate and cherry bread pudding for dessert. We could have shared one dessert but weren't sure how big it was. It was a big serving of bread pudding and a rather large scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. No bourbon sauce. But like I said, even if there are three of you, just share one as you will already be full. If it is not someone's birthday, I'd just skip the dessert.
My TIPS:
