Ask for Alejandro, as he was a superb server. He was always around if you needed him, but never a bother. 
TIP 2: order all items at once as they bring them out as they get cooked. Ours were staggered and since they are small plates, the most we had at once at the table were two items out of 6. 
TIP 3: get the tierra y mar skewers instead of petit filet.
TIP 4: get the sangria. It really is that good. 
TIP 5: Make a reservation. We got there at 5:20pm on a Wednesday. Maybe 1/4 full at most. By 5:45pm it was 3/4 full and by 6pm it was completely full. On a Wednesday. It's a nice place and worth it. We were dressed fine and we were in shorts and Hawaaian shirts.
Our bill with two drinks each and 6 Tapas and two desserts was $86.75 and with tip $102. If you cut out the desserts, that would be $17 less after tax and tip. Which would bring the bill down to $85 for two. Of course if you drink water instead of the 4 alcoholic drinks, that would save a lot more, maybe $30 more when you think about the tax and tip.... but I want the two drinks. hehe.

I came here this past week with my coworkers while we were visiting for a trade show.
I have several friends that live in Vegas and love this place. Also checked out the yelp reviews and saw the raving reviews. After 11 hours of walking and working, I was SO EXCITED to get my tapas and sangria on. 

I WAS SO DISAPPOINTED. There were 4 of us and the waitress suggested we each order 2 dishes. 8 dishes came out and all 8 dishes were sub par. All the proteins we ordered were either over cooked or over salted. All the veggie dishes we ordered were uninspired or under seasoned. 

The saving grace was the sangria. The red sangria here was amazing. You can definitely taste the fruit coming through the wine. so yummy! Maybe if I had a couple more glasses before the food came out I would've enjoyed the tapas more. The ambiance here is also really cool and casual. 

I'd probably only come back here for drinks and bar food.

In town for a conference. This was a short distance from the hotel. The best tapas ever!!stuffed dates. Croquettes, empanadas. It just got better and better.

Out waiter Mario was attentive and helpful. We may have eat there again tomorrow!

Man, it seems quite out if place for me to drag this restaurant like I am about to do (because they have so many positive reviews and were able to do something right to get the place re-opened)...oh, well..here is my experience..

Friends and I went this past Saturday night to celebrate a bday. The mango mojito was amazing...the drinks were all delicious and the bar staff were friendly despite being busy. We got our booth and started to order plates to share..some were better than others but I especially liked the fish sticks...very meaty. So, we are just chatting at this point and I go to put my arm up on the back of the booth when I see a full grown COCKROACH (NOT A WATER BUG, A ROACH) crawling FROM the direction of the kitchen and along the wall. We all shriek (involuntarily) and call the waiter over. He sees it and tried to kill it but it crawled down somewhere and he moved us to a center table. Of course, we are disgusted and shaken. He brings over the rest of our drinks from the table and tries to bring the food over..I was like..."no we don't want that now." 

The manager was called over and began to spin a story and try to do damage control. We told her we appreciated it, but our experience was ruined and we would not be paying full price (in my mind I was thinking we'd pay half and that'd be fair). They said their place is pristine and gave us a tour of the kitchen after 20 minutes of telling us we could  (if it was as clean as she swore, why did we have to wait so long?). The floor was sticky, there was clearly a second kitchen, but she insisted it was a hallway (lie, we saw servers coming from that area with trays and trays of food all night). 

The meal ended up being on the house but we still tipped our waiter because, after all, he just brings the food. As we are exiting (not making any sort of fuss), the hostess rolls her eyes at us when we say good night! Really?? This is a FILTHY freaking restaurant and you have some ill feelings towards some dissatisfied customers? Some nerve! I have gone to firefly when there was a location in Henderson and enjoyed myself immensely. I WILL NEVER EVER EVER DARKEN THIS RESTAURANTS DOORWAY AGAIN. It was filthy, and their staff are (obviously) poorly trained! 

Hostess tip: just smile and say good night! We tipped you anyway, and clearly you did not deserve it.

One of the tastiest places in Vegas! Every dish explodes with flavor! 

Service is great!

Firefly is perfect for groups, but definitely make reservations!  Firefly's ambiance is high-energy and a bit romantic, as evidenced by the dim lights and curtains dividing areas.

We made reservations for 8 people at 6:45 and were seated right away in a booth that comfortably fit all 8 of us.  It was especially nice because we were seated in a little nook that gave us privacy, and more importantly, a quieter area so that we could actually hear each other.

Disclaimer: I am not a sangria connoisseur, so my taste is not very discriminating.  I ABSOLUTELY LOVED the sparkling wine sangria; I regret not getting a pitcher.  It went down just like juice.  It is on the sweeter side, so beware if you like a more mild sangria.

As for the tapas, I had the tuna tartare and the petite filet.  The tuna tartare was pretty bland and rather oily, however, I was impressed with how fresh the fish was!  This was the first time I had tuna tartare, so maybe that was how it was supposed to taste, but I would not get it again.  However, I loved the pairing with taro chips (disclaimer: I may be a little partial because I am from Hawaii) because it was a little different and made up for the oiliness of the marinade.  The petite filet was DELICIOUS!  It was cooked perfectly, moist, and soft.  I absolutely loved the red wine sauce, as well as the fact that it came with mushrooms!  It is a must have!

My friend had the firefly fries, which I heard good things about.  However, I thought it was also rather bland and oily, and did not eat too many of them.  

All in all, I would definitely return for the sangria and because of all of the enticing tapa options!  There are so many other tapas I would love to return to try.  Additionally, I didn't save any room for dessert and the banana-nutella sandwiches are calling my name!  Firefly is perfect for groups of friends to catch up!
Amazing food!  Worth the wait (expect a wait).  Great atmosphere, great menu selection especially for family style dining and don't forget to enjoy a pitcher of sangria with your meal!
I stop by this restaurant every time I go to Vegas. Never a disappointment. I love the tapas (all of them) and the service is always excellent.

I had my wedding dinner at firefly on November 2015. I had a total of 35 guest, and let me tell you people it was the best choice I had  on taking them to Firefly. 
Not only the food was delicious but the staff was greattt... they handled all my 35 guest very well..lol..
I wanted to thank the staff that took care of us on that night... thumbs up for you all..

Love it love it

This restaurant was Amazing and not on the Strip. The food was fabulous and our server Alejandro was amazing..... I love how all the servers worked as a team to bring out the food..... Baked Goat Cheese, Tuna Tatars, White Sparking Sangria, we had so many wonderful dishes I cannot even name them all..... it was definitely worth the drive
I love this spot!!! My girl loves the Sangria, and you can't go wrong with the Paella. They kill it. Service isn't 100% though, had to ask a few times for some things. Otherwise good spot.

It almost saddens me to see all these other reviews for it leaves me with no new accolades to shout.  My daughter had her wedding reception at Firefly on Saturday night.  We'd pre-selected our choices of appetizers and the dinner to be served.  The service was beyond exemplary.  Regina coordinated the tables, the serving, the bar.. Neal kept a smile on the face of all our guests with his maintaining the desires of the thirsty.  I'm sorry I did not get the names of the other servers but I do thank them all so very much.  Now the food.  Wonderful.  We ate and ate and our guests all were thrilled with everything.  It was such a great evening.  The room was perfect and I had a great time.  Thank you so very much for your part in making this day so special for all of us.

Friday's is Latino night at FireFly and it's loads of fun.  Easy access to parking and the patio is very lively. The ambiance throughout is perfect. It's a great place for couples or larger groups. The tapas are delicious. Try the Salmon Beagles and the Ahi Tuna Skewers with a nice glass of Liberty School Cabernet Sauvignon and it's a sure combination that will get your happy mood started. Daniel and Omar our bartenders where great, very helpful and super quick. I really enjoyed the music, it made me want to get up and dance the night away. Thank you for a lovely experience.

Do yourself a favor and order their sangria. It's great. That alone was worth the "off-the strip" uber fee. A friend, who lived in Vegas at the time, invited us here many years ago. We had a great experience then and it's still great now. The tapas style menu is not too small and if you choose right - you can have a very yummy experience. I'd honestly come here for the sangria alone.

Tapas have never tasted so good in Las Vegas. My reasoning is, why should I spend $$$$ for the smallest tapas I will ever get on the strip? Granted there are delicious and amazing tapas restaurants on the strip, but FireFly is kick ass! 

The food! The food is delicious every single time! Incredible portions! You get your money's worth. The service is great and they make sure you're doing alright. I like the decor a lot. There's a reason there is over 1,000 review for this place.

This is what you must order: the bacon wrapped figs, the tuna tartare, the shrimp ceviche, the empanada, camarones al ajillo and go for a dessert! 

This is my second 5 Star Las Vegas Restaurant review. I am very fortunate to have the means to travel and enjoy incredible restaurants.

I'm one of the lucky ones...

I ate here twice back in the day, and never had an issue or any negative repercussions.  In fact, we really enjoyed it.

Now, I'm simply afraid to return...

What a great place!!  Let me just say the service was exceptional.  The food delicious we tried so many different ones it was great would definitely recommend it to everyone and try everything we just about did!!

I'm giving 2 stars because the drinks were good. The food was smothered in cream sauces. The surf and turf I ordered came with raw shrimp and beef. Don't understand why this place has a high star rating.
Hands down, my favorite place to go to in Vegas for a nice dinner. Swanky atmosphere, good service, and great food. Their pitcher of strawberry mojitos is my fave!
Enjoyed this place!  Group of 10 people had wonderful time.  Varieties of tapas dishes and drinks were excellent.  Must try the bacon wrap dates!!

This has always been one of my favorite places in town, despite all the bad press.  The food has always been great, the service wonderful, and the 3-day marinated sangria (as well as the pitchers of mojitos) goes down WAY too smoothly.

I'm not one to review anything, but I have to for this. This place is amazing! Bartenders are nice and cool ass people. They got latin nights on Friday? Come on man; hot a** females? It's good stuff. I'd recommend this place to all of my friends.

Central location, great vibe, large patio and vast menu, this place does have something for everyone - however, you have to know to ask when it comes to special diets.

Only after we ordered their Firefly fries with cheese on the side and my friend stated that I was vegan was I offered the vegan menu..and our server was vegan. How did she not think to offer it from the start? Yes, there is a menu that features vegetarian, vegan and GF options. I've suggested they offer it to guests when giving the standard menu. Hope they run with that.  Think they'd have a lot more people talking about their attention to dietary preferences.

So from my humble vegan opinion you should have the artichoke crab cakes and heirloom carrots and go from there if you are still hungry. Both are amazing and my non-vegan friend even agreed. 

From my humble beer lover opinion they have a nice selection of drafts and of course their sangria is kinda famous in this town.
Authentic food, sangria excellent, got the pitcher and it's so good, just like the sangria we have in Spain. Spanish decor, very nice ambiance. I come here everytime we are in Vegas!

Hadn't been here in awhile, used to come quite frequently though. It is conveniently located down the street from LVAC so we stopped here for dinner after a workout. I would probably pay money for the  complimentary bread and butter! We ordered wine and 7? Plates. We got chicken skewers , stuffed peppers , spicy beef salad , summer veggies , apple machango salad and I might be missing one? Either way we devoured everything in an hour between two girls :) the service was great! We sat outside and although it was quite busy our server was attentive. Ended spending about 100$ with tip.

love this place. ate there 4 times on recent trip to Vegas. the tuna tartare with the sesame topping is my favorite  but all the food is good and a good value. went to jaleo as well on the trip which is also tapas at the cosmo and spent 4 times as much and thought the food at firefly was better. 

my wife really liked the tomato soup and grilled cheese with bruyere cheese
the free bread is amazing with the almond butter. 


criticisms: 
some days the tuna was fresher then others and some days it was cut a little sloppily. ask people if they want more chips to start because its never enough.

the stuffed mushroom didnt seem to have alot of flavor for having chorizo in it. needed more salt both times imo. 

the stuffed almond dates which have always been one of my favorites seemed greasier then past years when ive come

all the meats and kabobs were awesome. cooked well. good portions. staff was friendly

Since moving to Las Vegas 6 months ago, I have gone here more times that I care to admit. I have tried almost everything on the menu and am NEVER let down! This is a great place to go with friends because everybody will find something they like on their massive menu. It's affordable, easy to get in even on a weekend night, and just an all around great atmosphere. Plus you can sit outside at night under strings of lights and heat lamps - it really doesn't get better than that!

Menu Highlights:
Stuffed Dates
Mac n' Cheese
Stuffed Peppers
Serrano Sliders
Padron Peppers
Baked Tequila
Tuna Tar Tar
Boquerones and manchego mac and cheese were pretty good! Tres leches cake was also nice. Should have gone with the full pitcher of Sangria. Can't wait to try the paella next time.
Great food! We stayed on the strip and went looking for good food that wasn't an arm and leg. This place did not disappoint,  we got three drinks and four tapas for less than $90 not including a tip.

Loved this spot in Vegas.  Our friends who are locals always come here, and we wanted to order the whole menu.  We had the bacon wrapped dates, some shrimp tapas dish amongst other things. Definitely recommend. Ambience is nice and service is great.

My favorite bar in Vegas is firefly! The food and drinks are DELICIOUS! My only problem is they don't offer any industry discounts! My friends and I always debate Firefly or Blue Martini and we usually end up at Blue for the 40% off drinks with a work badge. Come on Firefly step it up a bit! A small discount goes a long way ;)

I am so glad I found this place on yelp. Stopped here for dinner before heading back to Orange County, and the place blew our mind. Went with a group of 5 people and we ordered a bunch of tapas to share family style. Everything we ordered was on point delicious. What makes this place even more amazing is the service they have. The entire
Staff is so happy to serve. They greet you with a smile, they serve your food with a smile...everyone here is so happy. Definitely will be stopping by every time we're in Vegas. We had the fried calamari, Mac and cheese, tuna tartare, firefly fries, Tierra y mar skewers, mushroom tart, muscles, and beet salad. Along with the free bread they serve with almond butter. Awesome! Best place we ate at during our Vegas trip. Love love love this place! Must try!

You must try this place!! 
The sparkling sangria is you die for.   I couldn't stop drinking this.   
The tapas;
1) artichoke toast 
2) bacon wrapped dates. You have to try these.  
3) tuna tartare melts in your mouth and the chips are so crispy. 
4). Order the Paella it is worth the wait.    We had the mixed Paella.   
This place is a must come and eat while in Vegas.

This tapas restaurant is really very good. They have big selection of dishes, and of the ten or do we tried, everything was perfectly cooked and seasoned--ranging from the warm spinach salad to the boquerones to the pulpa. One great thing is that they are fine working with even the most limited diet restrictions--our server checked on dishes and made sure everything was up to par for me. And she did it all graciously, which isn't always the case at restaurants. 

The wine list was a nice treat, with a range of inexpensive Tempranillos and Malbecs, a change from the spendy wines everywhere else (if I wanted overpriced wine, I'd never leave Anchorage). They had a delicious sparkling sangria, too, which is never heard of before. 

I liked the atmosphere: dark, comfy, and great Spanish art all around. The music was fun. The space was big and accommodating. 

I'd love to go back when I can eat everything again. My one and only criticism is that the flavors of what we had and what we're on other menu items was a little one-note, without much expansion beyond red peppers and garlic, both of which are good, but a little variety for the palette always helps.

I went to Firefly with some family visiting from out of town. I have experienced tapas restaurants before but never this one. There were four of us and we chose two dishes each and then shared them around the table. Everything was well prepared and tasty. If I had to pick a personal favorite from our choices, I would be between naming the goat cheese or shrimp. That said, everything was good and with multiple choices everyone at the table found things they liked and things they really liked. We finished with a dessert sampler that was also very good. The service was prompt, courteous, and helpful. The price was in line with expectations, about $120 for four satisfied people with tip. Overall, this was a good lunch experience. The only negative is that it is right behind the LV strip so traffic can be a little daunting. That's not the restaurant's fault though. It just is the way of life in Las Vegas.
Always amazing food, super fun atmosphere, and all exponentially magnified by impeccable service with Neo. I love this place.
The firefly in vegas is awesome!  Cool place to eat tons of appetizers and I recommend anything with Shrimp!!!  Great drinks too!  Very cool place

Well well well firefly has done it again! 
We came here for my sister in laws bachelorette pre-party dinner and Eduardo was Amazing!! We had such an amazing dinner great service and great food ! 
Thank you FIREFLY

I enjoyed two trips to Firefly while visiting Las Vegas recently for a conference. Our group of three had an especially pleasant experience on a Friday for lunch. Our group of 8 found the restaurant to be surprisingly loud on a Monday night, but maybe that's just Vegas at night. Both times, though, the tapas were yummy and the service good.

Yeah we will be coming back... 

The stuffed dates wrapped in bacon with a wine reduction sauce is the way to start it off. Other notables are the Camarones a la Diablo and the paella. 

We had several plates between the four of us and ended with the great paella. I must come back for happy hour when prices are less.

This place is always on point. Been coming here for the past several years and service never cease to disappoint. Food always good and bar tender Omar always takes care of us. Would recommend to anyone.

I hadn't been to their new Firefly location since the whole health department incident, but I got a Groupon and thought I'd role the dice. Wow, am I glad I did!

The new location is very nice!! It's not as dark as the old location but dim enough for mood lightning. The waiter, runners, and busser were on point! Dirty plates taken quickly, we were regularly checked up on, and the food... Whhooooweee, the food!!!

We got bacon-wrapped dates (a must), chicken & chorizo stuffed mushrooms, tierra y mar skewers, and calamari. All were soooo good!! We also got a sangria pitcher that was delicious! 

We were stuffed but opted for the passion fruit (lilikoi) cheesecake bites and the lemon-berry tarts. Both were amazing. The passion fruit cheesecake may have been my favorite all night. I'll def be back!!

I was brought here by my friends who are locals. This is hands down some of the best food I've ever had! Everyone must try this place. It's about one mile off the strip, so everyone should be able to reach it.

Having traveled all over Spain and also having eaten at Spanish restaurants all over Southern California, I expected to find the typically understated and demure, simple and clean tapas I'm used to. Not So! This is bold and flavorful. It's Innovative, it's creative, it's Spanish fusion.

The Food Style:
This is gourmet at at an affordable price. IMHO the chef is a genius. Each small tapas plate is unique and individual, no two dishes are the same. Again, they are flavorful and bold, never bland. They display complex and contrasting flavors that are complimentary and blend seamlessly together to form a cohesive unit. Because each tapas plate is a small bite, the three of us were able to try 9 plates + 3 free bread and olive plates (The honey-almond-butter is amazing). This meal was like an amusement park for the taste buds.

I don't eat much meat, so we stuck to seafood and vegetable dishes. It's great for vegetarians.

My Favs (all 5 stars): The stuffed peppers, the roasted eggplant cannelloni, the manchego mac 'n' cheese, grilled scallops with saffron potato puree, and steamed mussels (incredible sauce). They give you as much free bread with honey-almond-butter and olives as you want. My friends raved about the bacon-wrapped stuffed dates, which are arguably the most popular item on the menu (I don't eat bacon).

Others (4 stars): Tortilla espaniola, patatas bravas (great brava sauce).


To Drink: A pitcher of Red Sangria. This is the real deal and very very tasty. It tastes like a fruity Merlot, not like some frou-frou fake sangria cocktail you get at chain restaurant.

NOTE: some tapas are better than others, but you have to be adventurous and start trying. Use the tips above. The only one I wouldn't order again was the seared ahi tuna skewers. They didn't have much flavor and the texture a little too tough to chew.

Ambience: somewhat dark and intimate, warm decor, comfy booths. 

Service: Excellent. very friendly and attentive. They easily accommodate special requests.

Prices: $35 per person after tip per person for 9 plates and a big pitcher of sangria, and we were all STUFFED. 

PROS: The Amazing Gourmet Food; great for vegetarians; affordable prices; delicious sangria; comfy booths;  great service too; close to the Strip (about 1 mile)

CONS: NONE

BOTTOM LINE: Come here, or you're missing out! I would consider driving back to Vegas from LA to eat here.
Good spot for after work drinks, atmosphere is pleasant and the staff is on point, try the stuffed dates #lifechanger

Our favorite restaurant in Vegas. Come early as it gets packed. Went with my wife and parents last week and had an excellent experience. We ordered Tapas to share and all were great. Shrimp tempura. Clams with chorizo. Fish sticks. Mixed meat skewers. One other I forgot. Stella on tap and attentive service. Reasonable check. You can't ask for better.

A bit off the strip, but that is where a lot of the good places are too. This one of the good deals, and especially check out their happy hour. It is an easy drive off the strip,  about 5 minutes away from the madness :)

The restaurant itself is spacious and the servers are very attentive. They even helped out finding a glutenfree alternative for my friend.

So, happy hour here includes a lot of the good stuff on their regular menu, Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates? The squid was not that good but the fries, the meat balls (watch out they are very hot), the huge baby back ribs, salads, bread and what not.  

The portions were huge and the servers were always around making sure we were ok. 

Absolutely reccommended but remember, do not compare to expensive high end restaurants. Still, they are not that different from Serrano at Aria when all comes to all.

Not only the food but the service and recommendations that we got from Alex was excellent! It was our first time on this place and Alejandro explain really well our options and we like all the tapas and paella that he recommended.  Thank you Alex! 

We will return on our next trip to Vegas for sure!

I've been coming here for around 7-8 years and for me is a Vegas must (my favorite off the strip). Honestly, I prefer the old location, but I'm happy they have a bigger space now. The tapas here are incredible!!! Mushroom tart, Serrano Ham Sliders, Scallops and ended with the Banana Nutella Sandwiches. All amazing! Typically, I get these with cheese in them because they mainly use Manchego which is my favorite. So, I highly recommend the Mac and Cheese and the Manchego + Apple Salad. We didn't drink this time because we had to immediately drive, but both the white and red sangrias are to die for.  Pitchers on pitchers! Go here, you won't be disappointed!

Tapas 

Great bread that keeps flowing.
Diablo Shrimp awesome. Sauce
Chorizo plate. Good selection
Steak salad. Had to get something green

This is one of my favorite places to eat off the strip! I've been here several times and every time I have loved it! Everything I've had there has been great. The sangria is great. My favorite is the stuffed dates and Nutella & banana dessert! But it is all delicious! I can't wait to go back again!

Tried to go there yesterday afternoon and upon arrival the chick that was opening was super rude, so we bounced. No acknowledgement, no "hey" or "hi" nor "thanks for opening the door (as she was carrying out a sign)." 

We've gone to firefly several times over the years and their customer service has remained iffy. The food is good, but the service is shyte. 

Firefly, we like your food, but your hostess' have remained problematic over the years.

We had 4 tapas: Mac n Cheese $9, Calamari $10, Veggie Empanadas $6.5, Tierra y Mar Skewers $11.  A plate of bread which came free was super delicious.   Tierra y Mar Skewers was the best among 4 menus we ordered. The server was very friendly, atmosphere was nice but a bit noisy.

Absolutely delicious! We had the gazpacho, the mango bbq glazed ribs, the croquettes de jamon y queso, the Chicago bocadillos, and the seared Ahi tuna skewers. This was shared between 5 hungry people and we are stuffed. If you are in Las Vegas drive to Paradise just south of Sands Dr. and try Firefly. You won't be disappointed!

I loved this place! The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the wait time to sit and the wait time for your food are a little out of hand. 

*Tip* Before you read the rest: If you're looking to try the Paella, order as soon as your butt hits the chair. It is to die for, BUT you have to wait 45 mins while they wait! 

We went to Firefly for Valentine's Day, and it looks like we weren't the only ones that had that idea. We had to wait for about 45 min - 1 hour to be seated. Not bad for a popular restaurant, I guess, but definitely longer than I'm used to. Especially since there was just the two of us, not a large group. 

We tried a chorizo plate ( i forgot the name of it :( sorry)  It had an over-easy egg on top of chorizo and potatoes. It was warm, and spicy and the runny yolk was just icing on the cake. 

I did order the Paella and it came sizzling in a plate. It was the best Paella I've ever tasted, almost worth the wait. It was seasoned just right. I was so full from the other tapas, though,  that I ended up just tasting it and taking the rest of it home. 

Order the sangria! i got the white sangria. It was white sparkling wine, peaches, grapes, oranges. It was sweet and refreshing and with just the right amount of alcohol to make waiting for my paella bearable...

Great tasting food, cozy atmosphere. Attended a work dinner here for 50 people so everything was served family style and I didn't catch the individual item names. I ate veggie rice, roasted chicken, and artichoke appetizers -- all of which tasted really amazing. Service was very courteous. Have no idea about prices because I didn't pay for anything, but the food would be worth a good amount.

the place itself is nice. date night ambiance. food is very flavorful and great for sharing amongst friends. they had a dance floor outside that looked fun. only bad part is the parking situation and getting in/out of the parking. not enough room for all the people that were there. come early to get a spot.

STAY AWAY! This WAS the best restaurant. Service sucks now, we never even got waited on, we had to keep asking the bar back for things. My chocolate martini tasted off, and I've probably had 1000 from there. Possilby sour milk, but who knows since bartender didn't talk to us once even though we sat there for over an hour. Food was so-so, it's gone downhill. It's so sad, this was my favorite restaurant. I was willing to support them through their transistion of closing additional locations and focusing on their main location but they ruined that. I heard they are closing but have to complete their lease so the employees have already checked out.

My friend and I went here for happy hour and had some really great tapas and pretty good sangria. Our server was friendly and attentive, and he helped us pick some really good food. Four regular tapas plates plus dessert was more than enough and the price was pretty dang good. The sangria pitcher was both tasty and generous. We especially recommend the carrots!

You will not be disappointed when you hit this tapas place off the strip.  Food and service is outstanding.  I highly recommend to people who are not too hungry and are looking for some snacks and spirits.

Cool ambiance, and always cute ladies here.
Tapas are pretty damn good.
I haven't tried one thing that I didn't like yet however haven't came and been really hungry.
Ribs bomb, Mushroom puff pastry thing delicious and I don't even like mushrooms.
Steak with potatoes and mushrooms good
Drinks are solid.

Food was excellent!  We had a group of four and all of us equally loved our food.  We were, however, extremely disappointed in the service.  We asked to be away from the noise as this was a reunion and the hostess was extremely rude about our request.  The server was not friendly, did not engage in conversation, did not come and check on us nor refill our drinks and we had to request another server to find him to bring us our check.  We will return for the excellent food and prices but hope our next experience with the hostess and wait staff is much better.    Five stars for the food, one for the hostess and waiter we had.

I was here about 2 years ago with a large group of friends and I wasn't impressed by the food at all nor the service. The service was slow and of course with large groups they either forget your order or missed something.

Another wonderful night at firefly. We come to Las Vegas every year for a convention. We came here last year and it was wonderful so we decided to try it again. Our waiter Mario was such a sweetheart. He was super efficient and polite.  The food was wonderful as always. This time one of our plates was a garden vegetable salad with dried cherries and heart of palm. It was fabulous! The roasted dates are always one of those things you just have to get. The manager Eduardo came to our table several times just to make sure everything was alright. It didn't hurt that they we both adorable. Very efficiently run and all the staff are just so nice!Thank you again for a wonderful evening.

I was relatively unimpressed. The food was just mediocre, though the portions were great for sharing amongst the 4 of us. Some of the better dishes we had were the shrimp tempura and the beef and mushroom skewers. The calamari would have been better if they had used the same batter as the tempura. We went at an odd hour, so the place was pretty dead, but it's definitely spacious and would be great if they hosted weekly salsa nights or something, I'm not sure if they already do. The staff are very friendly and you can tell they really want you to have a positive experience. Unfortunately, I don't think I will be returning because there are plenty of other great choices in the vicinity.

There is a big convention in town and the were busy. Still, we were on time for our reservations but they weren't ready.  Although we waited nearby, they forgot about us until we reminded them. Our table was in the middle of the room and we had trouble holding a conversation because the room was so loud.  We had a long time to wait as the drinks took forever to arrive.

The servers were pleasant and the food arrived quickly.  The dates, albondigas and carrots were pretty good.  The beef salad and fries were okay. The patatas bravas were not crisp and were a bummer.
The tapas were amazing. Good customer service. Food was a lil slow but overall fairly nice
Food was amazing; superb flavors and presentation. Service was friendly and attentive. Atmosphere was inviting and cosy and modern.

My favorite eating place in Vegas. I usually order the baked scallops with basil or pesto, bacon wrapped red dates, beet salad, petite fillet mignon. Fried calamari, lamb chop, and shrimp diablo are also good, mussels is a little salty for me, white sangria taste better than the red, ask for extra bread to dip the sauce. 

This place never dissapoints me. It's a must have when I'm in Vegas (coming from Los Angeles). Great food, reasonable price, nice ambience although a little bit noisy. Which restaurant is not noisy? People eat, talk, drink, laugh.

What a great restaurant! Decided to try it out and so glad we did! Such s great menu! I love the idea of small plates this way you get to try many different things! Their stuffed dates are too die for! The prices are pretty good too! Looking forward to taking a bunch of people and trying more of their yummy dishes!

The best! A must in Vegas. Great service. Prices.  Food. Options. Love love love 

You wont be disappointed
Firefly met expectations! I saw it recommended by Food Network. Anyway the two dishes that get my stamp of approval are the Hearts of Palm Crabcakes and Veggie Empanada. Good job Firefly
Great spot to try out if you're in the strip. They serve small Spanish appetizers (tapas). A little overpriced but they have an amazing ambiance.

THINGS I LOVED

Artichoke Toasts: (hearts, aioli, basil, pepper) I couldn't get enough of these. Definitely do yourself a favor and order yourself a handful...for yourself alone lol Very generous chunk of an artichoke heart on a little soft toast. Really thought the use of a non-toasted piece of bread was genius. 

Stuffed Dates: (bacon-wrapped, smoked almond, red wine reduction, blue cheese) Like candy for adults that kids would probably enjoy too.

Scallop "Escargots": (scallops baked in garlic-herb butter) Don't be fooled or worried, depending on how you feel about snails, but there are no escargots in this dish. I believe the name comes from the traditional escargot plate it's served in. Either way, it was delicious. That garlic-herb butter, I must have the recipe. Very balanced, not overly buttery and a beautiful blend of herbs. 

THINGS I LIKED

Baby-back Ribs: (mango BBQ sauce) These ribs are better the next day. Either I coincidently picked the one rib that wasn't off-the-bone tender that night or something else but I thought the flavor was subdued. Not the next day, full of flavor. (Maybe I had so much to eat that my tongue got flavor profile overload?)

Paellea Mixed/Seafood: (shrimp, mussels, clams, calamari, chicken or tilapia, chorizo, and vegetables) We ordered both the mixed and seafood. Only difference is the chicken or tilapia. Honestly, I don't think you'll even notice because it's not like they give you large portions of either meat choice but the paella also was not that great when I ate it at the restaurant but the next day it was a recovering hangover's best friend. I will say, it says it feeds 2-4 but that's if you order this and only this. We ordered thirteen different varieties and multiples of each plate so by the time the paella came out, 40 minutes later, we didn't even finish one paella plate and we had a group of 12. 

Camarones a la diabla: (shrimp, sweet and spicy sauce, grilled bread) Flavor was good but very strong. I would pair it with rice if I could.

Serrano Sliders: (mini burgers with Serrano ham, cabrales blue cheese, crispy onions) Another good drinking/hangover meal.

Sangria: Flavor and wine-full lol

THINGS I WOULD PASS

Tuna Tartare: (marinated ahi tuna, avocado, sesame dresing, taro chips) The tuna was fresh, I'll give them that, but you'll definitely need to add a little citrus juice to kick up the taste. To me, served as-is, it was on the mellow side with the star of the show being the taro chips. I didn't know you could fry taro root.

Steamed Mussels: (steamed in white wine heirloom tomato, garlic, herb butter with Parmesan crostini) I would definitely pass on this dish. A bit lackluster and the mussels are so small. For almost 10 bucks, it was disappointing.

Ham and Cheese Croquetas: (Serrano ham, manchego cheese, aioli) Filler food. You should order something else with more flavor than waste space in your stomach for I say. They weren't bad, just tasted like potatoes. 

Chicken and Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms: my least favorite order. No flavor, all I could taste was mushroom. Boring zzz

Firefly Fries (parmesan, herbs, aioli) So SALTY. Could not eat more than two but other people liked them.

We really enjoyed eating here. We were a group of 7 for a bachelorette party and they did a phenomenal job of keeping our table well stocked with food and alcohol. It seems like they were well equipped to deal with a large group and keep everyone happy. There is something for everyone (including people with allergies and vegetarians).

Firefly was delicious! Usually tapas are a no-go for guys, but my boyfriend seemed to like this place. The portions are fairly generous if each person orders about 2 plates each to share. Here's what was memorable:

Bacon Wrapped Dates: Salty, sweet, juicy and the crunch of the almond inside the date. This was delicious. I could've eaten more of these.

Tuna Tartare: A nice cold dish to contrast with the other things we got. The tuna was in generous chunks and the taro chips were light and crunchy.

Pulpo Asado: Tender octopus. Not overcooked. Full of flavor from the ingredients cooked with it. 

Scallop Escargot: Think of how escargot (snails) are usually served, but with scallops instead. So they're soft without the chew usually expected with escargot. Generously sauced with butter and herbs, it was easy to want to use the complimentary bread to sop up the sauce that remained with these scallops.

Mushroom Tart: This was unexpected, but it's mouth-watering. I thought this might be dry because of the puff pastry, but surprisingly, they were generous with the sauce/mushrooms so it's not savory. 

Making reservations on a Saturday night is a smart move and highly recommended.

Okay the food is good! Not the best I've ever had but it was good. Waiters seemed a little freaked out because I was with my potential sugar daddy. They were still attentive and nice. It seemed pretty average tho. I sat outside in the patio and they had those fans that have mists or whatever. And you know it gets hot in Vegas lmao. But yeah nothing too special to be honest with you guys. 

The salads were good, I'm not a salad girl but I'll f*ck up a salad there for sure. The empanadas have a freaky texture but they're packed with flavor and I know you're asking hey why is this place average tho ..

Listen up it just didn't wow me like I thought it would.
Excellent place for tapas.  Bacon wrapped figs are delicious.  Cool vibe, after hours place to wind down and complain about the shit you had to deal with today...
Service was great as was the food.  It could have been a little hotter at times but overall a nice change of pace to the normal LV fare.

Overall a very terrific place. We went for dinner yesterday (a Tuesday) and it was pretty crowded. Every table had people at it, which is always a good sign. When we arrived, my group of 3 was seated immediately. We each ordered 2 plates per person of tapas. Each tapas plate was unique and served rather promptly. The filet in my opinion was the best. We each got dessert as well, and my only issue with the restaurant was that we each ordered an individual scoop of ice cream. I think the waitress tried to play matchmaker and put 2 of the scoops together in one bowl and another scoop in an individual bowl. This made everyone feel very awkward. Overall though, the atmosphere and experience was pleasant. It was pretty affordable too, it only cost $72 for all 3 of us to eat.

Great service, great food, try the sangria. 
If anyone is considering going it might be best to make a reservation, they're that good. 

Also they have valet.

Hey in life everyone deserves a second chance. 

I remember before moving to Vegas I read an article about a restaurant that received the worst nightmare it could have as an establishment. Like everyone else who searches a business on Yelp, of course we look for the negative or 1 star reviews. Aren't we all entertained by bad press? 

Fast forward my friend randomly took me out the first week I moved here.to a salsa night. The meals that night were pretty fantastic I must say. Loved the Sangria and all was well until my friend mentioned about the history of the restaurant.. then BAMMMM! In my mind I was thinking "No F*in way this is the restaurant I read about in the paper?!... You bring me HERE!?" 

Good times. 

Any who, I've been here maybe a handful of times since then and I haven't been disappointed thus far. Most of the time I don't order myself so I can't give any recommendations except for the awesome sangria and comped bread with orange butter. 

There is a latin night on Fridays and it's pretty neat. I prefer the old school salsa dancing and they play a few here and there but it's mostly merengue, cumbia, and latin electronic music (it exists folks). 

I'd definitely go back.. sometimes through failure companies can figure out what went wrong and ensure it doesn't happen again. Business is going well.. so either they got it together or we just love Firefly to not care!

One of my favorite local spots here in Vegas great service!
sangria and mojitos are a must please go check this spot out.
I used to give this place 5 stars but it has gone up in price, down in quality.... I would say it is a good deal for LV but only that....given the exorbitant costs of LV this isn't saying much.
Been here a few times with friends .. Loved it in the beginning  until I got sick from the food the last time I was there. I recommend but just be careful.
Great friendly tapas place. Local and tourist alikenenjoy thisbcool place. Friendlynservice from staff, fast service. Great food.
Nice outside seating area which is covered with mist machines. The service is quick and attentive. The food is excellent with many great options to choose from. And yes, the bar is on point!

Firefly on Paradise

Location/Parking: If I said it's "on Paradise" you would probably smack me, so whatever. Google it.

Atmosphere: We saw a bit about Firefly on Paradise on the show Restaurant Stakeout a few months ago and wanted to give it a try. What a find! This is the kind of place you want to spend 3-4 hours at a time, nibbling on small plates of awesome deliciousness and drinking countless glasses (and by glasses I mean bottles) of wine. It's beautifully decorated with dark, bold reds, striking paintings on the walls, eye-catching chandeliers, and a big open dining room with several smaller sectioned off tables for privacy. Great place to meet up with friends or to have a first date. 

Cleanliness: No issues. This place is spotless. The bar is clean, stocked, organized, and well lit. Glasses and silverware are always sparkly and shiny.

Service: Attentive without hovering. You can take your time ordering and no one is rushing you to take your plate away as you nibble. You can linger as long as you want before and after your meal. It's nice.

Food/Drinks: We always get the house Cabernet and it's always delicious. Only $5 a glass and it goes great with pretty much everything on the menu. 

6/6/13 - We had the house Cabernet, Warm Spinach Salad, Chicken & Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms, and Baked Tilapia cooked with lemon, butter, and garlic. The bread is delicious. Fantastic meal!

11/1/13 - Tried a more expensive Cabernet and it was really nice. Had more bread than I care to mention, Artichoke Hearts, Lamb Chops, Chicken Tinga Empanada, and the Manchego Mac 'n' Cheese. Yummy!

5/29/14 - We had several glasses of the house Cabernet, bread, Chicken Tinga Empanadas, Ham and Cheese Croquetas, Stuffed Dates, and Lamb Chops. Delicious!

5/30/14 - Had the house Cabernet, bread, Roasted Eggplant Cannelloni, Boquerones, Petite Filet, and Serrano Sliders. Outstanding!

5/31/14 - Third night in a row. This is craziness. We had the house Cabernet, bread, Tortilla a la Espanola, Pisto, Camarones al Ajillo, and the Garden Variety Salad. Another winner!

8/4/14 - Came back for our wedding anniversary. Had countless glasses of the house Cabernet, Steak and Mushroom Skewers, Chicken Skewers, Bacon Wrapped Dates, and the Firefly Fries. Tasty! I could come here every night for a week.

Happy Hour: I don't think there is one, but who cares? It's all tapas and it's all cheap, so stop your bitchin'.

Price: Surprisingly reasonable for a place this nice. Anywhere from $5-$10 a plate. Really good quality dishes.

I've been here six times so far and it never gets old. It's forever staying on my short list of places I have to visit in Vegas.

This was as good as the best reviews here. No disappointment ,everything was perfect. We had the bacon wrapped dates, superb, the baked goat cheese, couldn't get enough. The fish sticks, wow. Sangria cool refreshing and tasty.
My favorite place to take people in Vegas. They have something everyone can like, and its a lot of fun ordering a bunch of stuff that everyone can try. Great fun and great food.

As I finally get around to writing my review about my favorite place in Vegas. This place was introduced to me about 6 years ago and I make sure I go every time I'm in Vegas.. Not even the food poising outbreak at the old location could stop me lol! We tried going the Friday night when we were in town and it was slammed packed. We went back the next day at about 2 and there were only 4 other parties in there at the time.. I stuck with the same dishes that I normally ordered, but my girlfriend was trying new things. I like the tapas style, bc it allows you to be able to share and try more things at once.

Bacon wrapped dates- these things are worse than a crack addiction, I'm assuming lol.. The bacon and the blue cheese go great with the dates. And it doesn't hurt that the bacon is crispy!

Shrimp ceviche- nice fresh taste, lots of shrimp and flavor. The avocado is always a nice touch.

Menchago mac n cheese- cheese cheese and more cheese. You know it's good when the cheese is still bubbling when it gets to the table.

Stuffed chicken and chorizo mushroom- the mushroom add a great texture, the the flavor of the chicken and the chorizo are on point.

I suggest you try the place out.. It not on the stipe but it's not far at all. Give it a try, I'm sure you will like it

Yelp 100 Challenge 2016- 7/100

***Firefly is a decent and not too expensive alternative to the many overpriced Las Vegas restaurants on The Strip; unfortunately, there are some mediocre tapas here to go along with their good tapas and service was poor on my visit***

The Strip is filled with overpriced restaurants that churn out mediocre food.  Whether you are going to a fine dining restaurant or a cafe charging fine dining entree prices, chances are you are going to leave the restaurant feeling like you did not get much for your money.  Off The Strip though you will find more local spots and more bang for your buck in good quality and not outrageously pricey restaurants like Lotus of Siam (some may find Lotus of Siam pricey, but it is nothing like the Vegas fine dining spots charging sometimes twice as much as what that restaurant would cost in Los Angeles or other cities).

Firefly is off The Strip and it is a local spot.  It is a longstanding tapas restaurant with a huge following and maybe even a bigger menu.  With the big menu, it is not surprising that some dishes shine while others underwhelm.  Here is the rundown:

(Anchovy toasts with avocado) I liked these toasts.  It was nice having the flavorful anchovy as well as the creaminess from the fresh avocado.

(Bacon wrapped dates stuffed with blue cheese and smoked almond, red wine reduction) The bacon was crispy and the date was sweet and I liked the blue cheese.  The crunchy almond was kind of odd and I did not like the red wine reduction--unnecessary and it kind of made the bacon wrapped dates overly sugary and soggy if you did not pluck the bacon wrapped dates out of the dish as soon as they came out.

(Camarones a la diabla, shrimp, sweet and spicy sauce, grilled bread) The shrimp was nicely cooked and plump and the sauce had a good amount of heat (a little too BBQ sauce-like though)

(Artichoke toasts, aioli, basil, pepper) The artichoke hearts were good--not as good as the anchovy toasts but still satisfying.

(Heirloom tomatoes, burrata, butter lettuce, basil, balsamic vinaigrette) The heirloom tomatoes were surprisingly juicy for not being in season and the burrata was very creamy (almost as good as the more expensive burrata at Mario Batali's B&B Ristorante in The Venetian / Palazzo).  Unfortunately, the butter lettuce was drenched in balsamic, which made this good green into nothing more than decorative garnish for the plate.

(Empanada with pork, red pepper cream cheese and aioli) I am not familiar with empanadas, but I thought these were good.  They have several other types of empanadas available.

(Padron Peppers) These flash-fried peppers had a nice light outside skin and some good heat.  They would be a nice addition to many dishes.

(Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms) A surprising amount of heat.

(Albondigas, meatballs in a sherry and tomato sauce with parmesan) These meatballs were average stuff in a simple tomato sauce.  I would have preferred freshly grated parmesan to the melted parmesan cheese here (which felt like it had been melted a long time ago and had been sitting around for a while).

(Camarones al ajillo, shrimp, lemon and garlic butter sauce) The shrimp were fine, but I thought the lemon, butter and scampi-like sauce was just okay.  Still, it was not too heavy or oily (I think many would like it).

(Steak and mushroom skewers, filet, roasted garlic cream sauce) I thought these were average; the meat was a tad dry.

(Fried calamari) Standard calamari.

Desserts were satisfying.  The caramel flan had a good flavor and the right texture and while the ice cream did not have an incredibly creamy consistency, the portion was generous and the flavors were pretty good (chocolate, vanilla, pistachio).  The chocolate tres leches cake definitely had the expected moistness of a tres leches cake as well as a light chocolate flavor.

Prices were reasonable.  The food was decent and you do not have to pay the outrageous prices that you have to pay on The Strip.

Service was poor.  The staff was pleasant and the food came out at a quick pace, but the staff was not attentive.  After putting in our order, the staff was pretty non-existent so getting drinks and water glasses refilled and receiving the bill took way too long.

Firefly has a dark and loud atmosphere.

Firefly is a good spot if you want a decent meal in Las Vegas but do not want to pay the typical outrageous Vegas prices.  It reminds me a lot of Long Beach's Cafe Sevilla in terms of menu choices and the quality of the food (though that Long Beach restaurant has much better service).

Firefly has its own parking lot (I believe it might be valet parking though).

Great tapas place, they have a large menu including cold tapas, hot tapas, seafood tapas and meat section they also have large plates like the rib eye with large side of Parmesan fries my favorite tapa was the Tierra y mar skewer (surf and turf or combine skewers) with Spanish sausage shrimp and filet mignon with tomatillo sauce on top, pork empanadas are so good and bacon dates are delicious! Serrano ham with cheese and the plate of chorizos is also really good to pair with wine this time I seat at the bar Joaquin Maria and chino took care of me they're really nice their service was quick and they make very good drinks thank you Maria for the recommendations on food thanks Daniel (or chino ) for my old fashioned was on point (bomb bro) and Joaquin I have no words to describe the amazing drink the one you just made for me thank you buddy!   Oh btw it was a drink with mescal, cilantro, bourbon liquor and other secret ingredient

So I'm biased, despite the recent bad press here this will always be my favorite spot. The servers are always pleasant and knowledgable and the blueberry mojitos are on point! We came for happy hour and had a pitcher of blue berry mojitos, stuffed dates, baked tetilla, Serrano sliders, fireflys fries, diablo shrimp, and chicken rings empanadas. The empanada was one sliced in half so it was a small portion but the taste was delicious the pitcher lasted us the whole meal (and it was happy hour 50% off drinks) and our server was Gabriel and he was absolutely amazing I recommend you as for him

great and more spacious new location on Paradise just feet from the old one.  Great tapas style dining.  Every one of some 10 dishes we tried was very flavorful and well done.  Just order a few at a time so you dont go overboard.  Outdoor area available.  Friendly hostess, waiter and staff.  Will go back.
Great service and even better food. Two kids and three adults and we loved everything with not a single complaint. It's off the strip but not too far and that's kind of a plus anyway! Delicious.
Friendly, fast service and pretty good food. Spare offerings for the price but you pay for ambience.

Very cool spot off the strip for a great brunch, lunch or dinner. The cold tapas plates were my favorite, especially the chorizo meats and the shrimp ceviche. Great selection of beers on tap and a full bar. Added bonus was the band, complete with kettle drum, playing on the patio on Sunday afternoon. Definitely a must-visit!

LOVE.
Pure deliciousness. What a treat!
We were with a huge group so I think we ordered everything on the menu and everything was incredible. There was nothing I didn't like. What stands out a week later is... the artichoke on crustini, burrata-tomato-lettuce thing, meatballs, and the steak skewers. But really everything was great. Also the SANGRIA is amazing. We were very happy. They also didn't seem to mind that one of our friends was beyond drunk as we all laughed hysterically. Very fun night. 

So sad there's not one in California. 
Boo.
Nahum,Gabriel and Marco Thank you for Everthing!!! The food was the delicious and the services excellent!!!

I've been a regular for many years & I enjoy the food & the fun vibe of the place every time I go. Yes parking there isn't the best but I've had worse. It can also get very busy which is annoying but that means it's popular! 
The food is amazing & sharing small plates is always fun. The service this time was excellent! Two hot Latinos, always fun! The pitcher of sangria always gets me tipsy & I try as many things as I can! 
I also want to comment on the usage of the color red here, it's super sexy! 
I wouldn't do a business dinner here because it's always loud but it's great for everything else!
Gluten free friendly yippee they have a huge menu for us!!! The food is so delicious and it comes out hot!!! The red sangria is the bomb!!!

Food was great!  Stuffed dates have changed my life!  Service was a little sad.  I had pre arranged a set menu, the wait staff did not seem to be aware of the arrangement.  They rarely came to the table to check on us, we had to track them down for refills and we had to ask for things multiple times.

This place has an amazing Happy Hour! The white sangria is wonderful and the bacon wrapped dates are delicious! Oh and definitely get the tuna tartare! The service is stellar and the prices are pretty great too!

Shout out to L.C. for another great suggestion for some savory tapas!

We met up on a Friday night for my first go at Firefly.  Luckily we were seated in a nice comfy booth because the place filled up really fast.  After eating here I knew why.  When dining with my Yelp friend I knew I would be trying a lot of food and stuffed to the gills.  

Upon putting our food order in, the food just seemed to roll out of the kitchen quickly and efficiently.   We started with the Chopped Chicken Salad.  It certainly wasn't the type of salad I was expecting but it was enjoyable.  The salad scoop was surrounded by endive leaves which made for a lovely presentation.  Plus it made a nice chicken salad 'boat' for consumption.  

Next I tried the Stuffed Dates.  Holy Buckets. It was my first time having dates with dreams of having this hot tapas again.  The bacon wrapped date with smoked almost and blue cheese was divine.  Since we were all sharing I couldn't eat the whole dish as much as I would've liked to.

To appease the men at the table, Chicago Beef Bocadillos were before us.  The shaved beef sandwiches were topped with house made giardiniera.  The beef was tender and full of flavor.  The giardiniera just made the sandwich better and earned a thumbs up.

The pork stuff Empanada was also a good choice.  I wish there were more on the plate for sharing like some of the other tapas but we all still had a little taste of hot pastry.  

Of course we can't skip dessert when they offer a Dessert Platter.  Flan, chocolate tres leches, cheesecake and a berry tart make up this delicious sampling of treats.  The chocolate tres leches stood out as the star on this platter.  The cake was soaked in goodness that you just shouldn't pass up.  

Service was ok as our waiter seemed to disappear for lengths of time.  I was guessing because it was a busy Friday evening so I might try another day of the week for my return visit. I left full with a smile.  See you next time!

I knew the vibe was bad ass when I walked in the door...Music and people laughing and handsome waiters just taking care of business...It's relaxed loud and if you want GREAT FOOD  and superb service this is that place...The chefs definitely know what to do on seasoning and marinating the meats. Just one small thing and that was the empanadas were really small however they did not disappoint..I will be coming back as a regular..I want to try the entire menu..Thank you for the great attitude and making me and my daughter and son in law feel we were valued!!!
Food was very average here. The ambience is good. The Tapas were good, the rice wasn't that great. I enjoyed coming here one time.
The food is 5 star, but the service is sub-par. Am I invisible? You're at half capacity!

I love firefly and it's a great place for girls night or a lively happy hour joint. 

We called to make reservations and we were seated within 2 mins of arriving. The ambience is calm (unless you come on Latin Night) with dark lighting giving it a nice intimate feeling. 

We ordered several different items but like everyone else, the all time favorite is the bacon wrap dates. If I could choose one tapas to have for the rest of my life, it would be these, but I would probably become overweight extremely fast! 

It's a great restaurant considering majority of the items are small allowing you to try more food items at once. They also have larger entrees which are just as good. 

The only downside to this place is parking. Parking is so limited it forces you to valet and sometimes valet is full! Please note a few years ago they were shut down due to health concerns, but I have yet to experience that. Fingers crossed that I never do!!!

My husband and I have an arrangement where we alternate who plans Valentine's Day each year. I have even years and it was my turn this year. So, upon doing lots of research, I came across this gem. I have been missing paella like crazy ever since I had the opportunity to study abroad in Spain and wanted to introduce it to my husband since I knew he would love it as well. I am happy to say that I finally found a place that can handle my craving for paella. It was delicious! The atmosphere was amazing as well. We are now seriously considering making this restaurant a Valentine's Day tradition xD

Great food! We tried the steak and mushroom skewers, the patatas bravos, the shrimp ceviche, the sliders, and the stuffed dates. All were good and surprisingly the dates were our favorite. Also, the best service we have had over the 6 days we were in Vegas!

Fun place, excellent Tapas place in Las Vegas, Oscar Martinez and Carlos Villanueva are wonderful servers.  What a wonderful evening and service after driving for 8 hours from Bryce Canyon thru Zion National Parks. 
Reasonable prices and excellent food
Mixed paella was very good. Would've been better if a little crisper. Octopus was tender, eggplant with goat cheese excellent but needed more sauce. Overall one of the best tapas places in Vegas.
Yummy sangria and the bacon wrapped dates are amazing! They have a great happy hour from 3-6pm.

Second time here and it will not be the last. Happy hour is the time to go. Enjoyed all the food. Service was a little distant and I'm still not sure if I enjoyed that or not. The food I did enjoy and the atmosphere.

Food was good, but service was aweful!!! The server was impatient, and did not bring what was ordered. She literally sighed when we asked questions about the menu, and said " we should let her know when we are ready", without answering any question we asked. 

I won't go back.... Not worth the trouble of crappy parking, bad location, and horrible service! Too bad, potential, but horrible execution.

I can't believe I lived out here for almost 6 years and never came here before! Talk about an amazing place to go with a group of friends! We must have ordered 10 things off the menu and every single item was beyond amazing! The sangria, the best I have ever had! It gets very crowded, so come early. The inside gets VERY loud, we sat outside and it was beautiful!

Everything about this restaurant keeps me coming back. Their dishes are phenomenal! My favorites are the bacon wrapped dates, the lamb chops with lentils dish and a jar of red sangria for endless refills . Also, they turn the outside patio into a salsa dance floor every Friday between 11pm-2am. Go check it out!

Service is great, drinks are good, food is only ok. Stuffed peppers and dates are the best thing there. However, the entire restaurant smells like an old dish rag. It makes me wonder how clean things are...

Yum, yum, yum. I want more. Everything we ate was AMAZING. We ordered so many items, I cannot remember them all, but everything was delicious. I do remember the bacon wrapped dates, they were mouth watering!  I highly recommend this place.  Great food, great vibe.  I don't live in Vegas, but when I visit, I MUST go here!

Edgar Sanchez (manager) knows how to take care of the Las Vegas locals which is rare these days. The suggestions for a combo of flavors was spot on. And our server was fast and efficient.  Definitely return visits are coming, especially for the Sangria.

Mike V
SLS Las Vegas

We had tickets to see a show at Westgate and wanted to grab a bite before the show. We had eaten at firefly years ago when they had an anthem location, but had not been back since. Based on yelp reviews, we thought we would give the paradise location a try. When I was about 15 minutes away, I called for reservations but was told that we couldn't get a reservation until 730. Clearly this wouldn't work. I asked about walk-ins. The young woman I spoke with told me I could have a 15 to 20 minute wait. I thought this was worth the chance and so we went. When we got there we found the restaurant nearly empty and had no problem getting a table immediately. Not sure why the hostess was so discouraging on the phone. We decided to order the chicken and mushroom paella ($24) with chorizo (extra$4) despite being warned that would take about 40 minutes to prepare. No problem, I nursed my beer and 40 minutes flew by. The paella was it worth the wait. Could've used a little more chorizo, but that's a minor complaint. Huge portion. More than enough for dinner for two. We've already made plans to return for dinner with friends in about two weeks.

I came in for lunch and sat at the bar since I was on my own. The bartender greeted me immediately and got me a drink. Since it was my first time I asked her for recommendations. Everything she suggested was delicious. I was by myself, so I couldn't get much, because this is a tapas place so it would be better to go with a group, if possible. The three tapas I got were the apple manchego salad, the tuna tartare, and the manchego mac n cheese. Omg! The salad was so refreshing, the tuna tartare was delicious, a little spice and I love that. A little more avocado would have been right up my alley. And the Mac n cheese, total guilty pleasure. You can never go wrong with Mac n cheese. I will be back, soon, to try the other dishes.

Eh. 

I used to adore this place. If I was able to Yelp Firefly years ago, I would've given it four stars. 

I've been eating at Firefly for over ten years. I brought my boyfriend there last night because I used to love the cozy, intimate atmosphere and great food, and I wanted us to have a cute date night before he flew back East. 

It turns out the restaurant moved (to the old Z Tejas Grill building down the street?), which is a much bigger space. The atmosphere is gone. It's now a busy, loud restaurant like any other place in Las Vegas. I realize that the old Firefly was popular and always packed, so I see the need to expand. They just lost the charm in the process. 

I suggested we order the Serrano sliders, mushroom tart, and Manchego mac and cheese, because I've had them before and they were always great choices on the menu.  I felt like even the quality of food has changed, because I wasn't really impressed by any of the dishes.  

I gave Firefly two stars due to the fact that they changed so drastically, and not in a good way.  The food was not terrible, but it wasn't as flavorful and visually appealing as it was in the past. The mac and cheese was excellent, but the sliders and mushroom tarts were bland.  The chicken empanadas were boring and the lemon tart dessert tasted like mass produced tarts defrosted and topped with a few berries and whipped cream. 

I doubt I'll ever come back here and that makes me sad.

What a find (thanks, Yelpers!) This place earns top honors on a multi- week, multi-state trip. Ambitious but reasonably priced selection of a remarkable array of tapas items. Portions generous by tapas standards, and the quality of each dish was outstanding, from ingredients, to preparation, to presentation. This place knows it's stuff and the wait staff is well versed. 2 ridiculously good lamb chops for $12, bacon wrapped dates with blue cheese in a wine reduction sauce for $6.50,  a generous serving of Ahi crusted Tuna for $10, spicy filet mignon salad for $11. We went twice, 4 the first time, 6 the second everything each of us choose off a menu sporting a huge number of mind boggling good things was delicious.

We ordered a whole bunch of appetizers to share. There wasn't a single one that I didn't like. Really like their Sangria too. Great place to go with a bunch of friends to drink and try a bit of everything.

Amazing service from Alejandro!
Bacon wrapped dates, blood orange mojito, green apple salad, tuna tar tar, empanadas all AMAZING!

This is a really solid value just a few blocks off-strip. I've been here a couple times over the years. The first visit was on the suggestion of a local. Their cocktails are spot-on and available by the pitcher. Their sangria is good without being overly sweet, and their passion fruit mojitos gave us a nice afternoon brunch buzz.

There is a huge selection of tapas and plenty of vegetarian choices which makes it easy for me to dine with a group. The only one I haven't liked is the tortilla espanola. All the others have been quite tasty, especially the empanadas. I would definitely make a repeat visit.

How lucky am I to have a dear friend who is a long time resident of LV?  I'm in town for a few days and she suggested we meet for lunch at Firefly.  Over 50 visits here and I had never before heard of it.

This place is Great!  Indoor and outside seating with a very large variety of food selection which include made to order paella.  Service was very good and the prices are quite reasonable.

We love this place.  Its a go to every time we visit Vegas.  Love all the food, the service, the sangria.  ZERO complaints.  Wish I was fatter, so I could eat more.  Its very sad when you go here and realize you can't eat anymore and have to surrender.  We have had numerous dishes here and all are great!

Came to what it used to be my favorite place in Vegas. 
Had go get up and physically go ask for a server to give me water, my food got cold because they brought it all the same time. As I am writing this it's been 20 minutes since I been done eating and no one will get my check. 
Service went down hill here, even from the hostess up front having an attitude about sitting me and my wife down. (They used to be friendly). 

- Update; a manager (seemed like a manager, skinny lady with short hair) came to grab the check and I told her about shitty service and she just ignored it. 


Don't come here ever.

I have been to many restaurant in Las Vegas, but Firefly I would have to say is one of the few that has made me feel as comfortable and extremely happy with the service. Not only did I love the food, it is the perfect place to come and hang out, relax and be with friends and family at any time. Extremely great service, great food and the prices are not expensive at all. I love this place and will definitely be coming back very soon. Highly recommend it, not only is the food good they also have great drinks and the happy hour is the best!!! You can tell management work hard and love their work place.

One of my favorite restaurants in town. I'm a fan of  tapas. I've been here more times than I can count and have never been disappointed. Some of my favorites tapas are the stuffed dates, manchego and apples salad, and the Del Mar skewers. They also have amazing mojitos.

YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY TAPAS!

Chicken Tinga Empanadas must be the food of the gods! Such delicious crispy exterior, flavorful and tender chicken filling. NOTE: a single order is only one empanada.

Manchego Mac n' Cheese is another winner. Ooey gooey cheesy Mac with a crispy top layer. 

SIZING NOTE: this is a tapas joint, so dishes are small. Go for 2-3 dishes per person for a comfortable meal size :)

So far among all the food joints and eateries I have been to since Sunday in Vegas I would say this definitely would top the list according to the price and taste of the food so far. I would really recommend this place and yes it really gets busy super fast so reservation would be nice but they have a big space so no worries. Food comes fast and great taste too. Trust me I am a vegetarian and we were a big group of 16 with vegan too and abundant options too. The staff are amazing,  friendly, kind, and attentive 
Our server, Alejandro was friendly and patient with our group which wasn't easy it was like herding cats, lol  thumbs up...

Sorry no photos as we were so busy enjoying the food.

I've been coming here since 2012 and I've never been disappointed! I'm so glad this place is open and successful in their business the food is great! So many flavors put into each plate. And oh my gosh the almond butter is to die for ((if any foodies can figure out the recipe please let me know )) anyways this place is great whether you're dressy or casual! Each plate is priced differently so it depends on what you order my friend and I spent 50$ all together for 5 plates :) the camarones a la diabla is so gooooooood and it's not really spicy it actually has a Sezchuan taste to it. Well that's my opinion anyways if you like a sweet chili sauce then you'll love the shrimp  can't wait to be back here soon!

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. My wife and I have been coming for years.

We arrived in Las Vegas and went straight here for dinner. We had the stuffed mushrooms with chorizo, stuffed dates, manchego cheese / apple cheese salad, ceviche and camarones diablo. All delicious and reasonably priced.

The drinks are refreshing and delicious. I started off with the Passion Fruit Mojito and ended with a Watermelon flavored mojito. Both delicious but entirely different flavors. The passion fruit sour and watermelon sweet.

The waiters and waitresses are very knowledgeable and service was impeccable. Can not wait to come back once visiting Vegas again.
Excellent food. So many different types of  Tapas to choose from.  Your palate will enjoy every bite. I will be back the next  time we visit Vegas.
I love this place!  The tapas were delicious! Each was so tasty. We ordered four tapas and shared (there were three of us) it was enough to feed us all! We will definitely visit again and again!

Oh my goodness gracious!  Aside from Brazilian bbq, never dined at an establishment where you get to have your cake and eat it too.

My wife annoys periodically when she asks what I'm having to share.  Secret alert...  not into sharing.  This place Im good with it.  You order a bunch or appetizer portions and get the best of both worlds.  After that satisfying need was met, the quality of the food was ridiculous.

Amongst 6 people eating, we had the to die for chicken skewers covered in a light, but incredibly tasty garlic sauce.  Mouth still humming!  Eder and team made me feel right at home.

Then we filet, tiara y mar, filet and steak and mushrooms.  We left beyond satisfied and full.  

This place is off the strip in Vegas and proportionally priced reasonable.  Happening place as well!  Good music good vibes.

Coming back next time!!!!!
camarones a la diabla is a must! i literally did not let the server take my plate away...that how much i loved their sauce.

This place is awesome, all finger foods, great for an outing with the friends or family. The chicken skewers, and stuffed dates are to die for and the mango bbq babyback ribs are some of the best ribs I've ever had. Prices are ok, but all in all this is a super enjoyable spot, and I highly recommend.

Wow.... From the hot thin slices garlic bread to the fiery shrimp Diablo, your taste buds will scream with delight.  The ceviche had large pieces of fish and had the perfect acid balance.  The stuffed bacon wrapped dates are a must order.  Don't forget to order a traditional mojito and a flan for dessert!  Can't wait to come back!

This place is one of my favorites! And being I was introduced by a friend, makes it even more special. Firefly specializes in tapas. Best way I can explain tapas are little plates personal size, of appetizers. It's so fun because you all order different things and you pass around and try. They also have an extensive drink menu...but since my drink of choice is diet coke with lime... I'll leave it at that . Some of my favorite things to try... first and foremost- bacon wrapped dates- seriously , they will change your life! I always order these! Loved the apple slaw salad thing.. The best review I can say is. Don't be afraid to try... get some items that you wouldn't normally eat! There is not a bad thing on this menu!! Also.. get dessert, I'm thinking it was the chocolate tres leches.... amazing!!!

WOWZA. Every time we come to Vegas, Firefly is our go-to dinner. I'd highly recommend coming here with a group of people, as it makes things more fun with getting to try a little of everything if everyone orders 2-3 tapas a piece. The pitchers of mojitos are a must. Some memorable items not to pass on include the bacon-wrapped dates, the calamari, and the shrimp ceviche. This time we went with the mixed paella, and it was enough to feed 4 people although there were only two of us. The service here is outstanding every time we come. From what I heard this last year was hard for Firefly because of a salmonella issue and scared off a lot of customers. As a veteran industry worker, this was sad to hear, but it happens to everyone, and I can't give enough kudos to the Firefly owner for stepping it up and resolving the issues immediately and moving forward. If I could offer any advice to the restaurant from a customer who just dined at the new location for the first time it would be that my experience was less intimate than at the older location. There is too much bright light in the building, and that needs to be addressed. A big part of why we come is for the intimate low-lit vibe with some gypsy kings on the loudspeaker. This time I was sitting next to the kitchen with a spot-light on me listening to top-40. Still giving you 5 stars because I'm a die-hard fan of the food and service. Get the ambience back and I'll be a lifer.
Everytime I visit Las Vegas I make sure I'll stop by at this restaurant. AMAZING food especially the PAELLA, stuffed dates is one my faves and the skewers. Love their sangria too.

It's hard to find good affordable food in Vegas or a smoke free enviroment. 
- Great Tapas and cocktails at great prices. 
- Smoke free enviroment.
- I've been 3 times, short wait each time, but not bad
- A little noisy, but you can still have a nice conversation
- Look up while waiting in the foyer for some interesting artwork

Firefly, this hurts me more than it hurts you.  Trust me on this.

I live in Southern California, so Vegas is like our back yard playground.  For the past few years, I have raved about Firefly; this semi, off-the-strip restaurant that didn't have a celebrity chef's named attached to it that still offered innovative and delicious food.
