I would recommend this place to all of my friends and I initially gave them a 5 star review.

But a lot has happened since the first time I fell in love with Firefly.  

(1) The were shut down for Salmonella poisoning
(2) They closed down their first location
(3) Moved to a larger, new location
(4) Food quality went down the toilet

I took my husband to Firefly and all day, I had hyped up this amazing restaurant ... the "best tapas" I told him.
Oh man, the disappointment was equivalent to that of a kid finding coal under the tree on Christmas morning.

The food was salty and mediocre. There were some dishes that we didn't want to finish -- and these are tapas, small plates.  

Also, service was sub par.  They appeared to be slammed with guests or under-staffed.  It was difficult to catch the attention of any server and had different people serving us each time. Who was our waiter again?

Honestly, like I said before, I mean it when I say that it hurts me to write this review.  I would love to have Firefly back to the way that it used to be.  Somewhere, after the Salmonella poisoning and the move to their new location, they seemed to have lost their good taste and service.  

There are so many other places to eat in Vegas-- don't waste your time here.

I would just like to say that I LOVE THIS RESTAURANT! I discovered it a few years ago and every single time I come to Vegas I make it a priority to come and eat here. I live in Southern California, don't get me wrong, I frequent a few tapas places, but firefly really has it going on! I am obsessed with the bacon wrapped dates, the fantastic chorizo clams, stuffed peppers, MAC n cheese, petite filet is bomb!!!! Even the butter for the bread is amazing!!! I just got back from my bachelorette party out there and I am telling you that even my burbs were delicious after dinner. Haha!!! I can't wait til my next visit to Vegas so I can indulge in all the deliciousness firefly has to offer! To add one more thing... The berry infused vodka drinks they have are tasty and get you smashed! Until next time xoxo

Beware!!! 

Please note that this is -by far- the one & only one star review among the others (all of them are 5 stars & I don't like to make negative reviews. But this one, deserves it)

We found this place on Yelp and checked their menu. Then we walked there like half an hour. We found out that their actual prices are more than 30% higher! (Some are even more than 40%). We asked why & they blamed it on Yelp that they had no control over changing the prices on the system and offered 10% discount. We just left the place as we didn't like their approach to their customers. Then we found out that we were not the only ones who are misled.

There are lots of quality options in the area with great taste & worth the price.

Firefly is ALWAYS a must when in Vegas. I just wish they had HH on the weekends. 
You can never go wrong with the calamari,  steak & mushrooms, ceviche,empanadas....I could go on.
Next time...Im gonna stick it out and wait 40min for the paella!!
Very impressed by their service. We had a big group of 90 and sat in the patio. The staff was amazing .
Good eats great service and sangria was refreshing...decor a bit outdated but so what?

Great restaurant with a variety of hot, cold tapas, beverages and a friendly staff.  We had the chicken empanadas,a little spicy kick, but flakey crust and great sauce.  Shrimp ceviche was fresh and tender, lime marinade and fresh herbs was great.  Grilled spicy octopus was tender and smokey with a little kick of spice - yum..sangrias were ok...

Super awesome atmosphere. Came for lunch on a Saturday and it was pretty empty but the food was great. I had the red sangria which was perfect! I started with amazing gazpacho. So delicious as well as the baked goat cheese. This was much larger than we were anticipating and could feed more than 2 people easily as a starter. We also had the artichoke bread which was delicious and the chicken tika empanadas which were pretty good. The menu is pretty large and I would love to try other options. There was so much so it was difficult to decide what to get! I will be back and can't wait to see what it's like for dinner.

Story Time - My bro and I were in Vegas for 3 days of golf. We asked the concierge at the hotel to recommend a restaurant in Vegas, not necessarily on the strip. He gave us two to pick from. Battistas www.battistaslasvegas.com/ - "Italian Food" and Firefly "Tapas".   

We navigated to the Strip and ended up closer to Battistas.   The smell of the food was great, but there was no ambiance and having Chablis as the included wine was not working for me.  So, I pulled my brother out of there pronto and we drove to Firefly.

When we arrived at Firely, we walked in to ambiance and vibe.  Yes, this place had a buzz and I knew I had made the right decision.  No wait on a Monday night, yeah.   

Our server was excellent and somehow we merged our picks from the great tapas on the menu for one of the best meals I have ever had.

From memory, the following were our choices.

Heirloom Tomato Salad  -  One of the best salad dressings (the cheese they use in combination with the balsamic dressing was out of this world good).

Risotto Stuffed Peppers - Amazingly simple, but just the kind of Tapas I love.   

Ahi Tuna with Mango on skewers -  If there was a flaw in anything, the mangos were a bit unripe, but it was still really good.

Lamb Chops -  Small lamb chops.  I do not each red meat, so this was for my bro.  But, I am not religious and had a nibble, they were amazing and the sauce was great.

The garlic butter with the bread was so good, I have to mention that too.

The food was so amazing, we came back the next night after playing 36 holes of golf.   We were a solid 40 minute drive away, but the food was so good, we had to come back.  Unfortunately, we tried to broaden the orders and made a few choices that were not as good.  Gary ordered the fried calamari, but in hindsight, it is always good and it was not something that stood out with so many other amazing choices on the menu.   

In any case, if you are in Vegas, you gotta visit this great spot!

i can't come to vegas and not stop here.  their drinks are amazing and whenever i am not in town, i am dreaming of their excellent mojitos. my favorite is the paradise.  i also enjoy their vast menu selection, their top notch service and the atmosphere.  they have recently expanded and there is even more seating- which has cut down on the wait time.

Firefly has set my standards for a great tapas bar really high! I have yet to find a tapas place in LA with food, atmosphere, and pricing as great as this place! If your going to be on the strip this has got to be one of your stops for a girls night or dinner date trust me everyone will be thanking you later!

Atmosphere is fun and flirty here! Love the accents of red and the lighting, service was also really good- our waitress was very accommodating and despite how busy they were her service stayed considerably great throughout the night. 

Sangria!!!! About every table had a bottle so we knew it was good, we got both the red and white fruit sangria- I preferred the red but both were bomb! I really can't wait to try their Mojitos next time :).

The tapas here are 5 stars worthy and the price just can't be beat!!!! Love that each person can order a few things to try something different. It was perfect for a large group because it ensured that everyone would find something they liked & the tapas style makes people more open to sharing lol. 

Recommend: 
- the mussels in their broth are outstanding, everyone was jealous they missed ordering this one, it's definitely a meal within itself bc you won't be able to resist dunking your bread into it.
- calamari was good, great dipping sauce.
-ahi tuna tartar was fresh & light
_clearly there are so many things on the menu id say almost everything looked worth trying once!
Sooooo delicious. Try the watermelon mojitos, goat cheese, peppers, paella, tempura, mixed grill, and filet

What a beautiful place!
Delicious food! Thank you for having vegan options! The staff, especially GM Carlos, was so friendly and accommodating! One of my best experiences in Las Vegas so far!!

Firefly is quite amazing if I had only one complaint my complaint would be that they serve too much food with each Tapas dish and I couldn't taste as many dishes as I wanted to. While it's true you can't order anything that's bad on the menu there are a few more items that pop out with perfect pitch.  It would be a crime to come to this restaurant and not order the stuff dates. They easily nail the perfect sangria but don't let that stop you from experiencing the infused vodkas. I highly recommend this place bring your friends and have a wonderful time. If I ever make the mistake of getting married again I'm definitely going to have this place cater my wedding

G
Service was great but the food was mediocre. Had the bacon wrapped dates, beef and mushroom and some beef and sausages. Probably wouldn't go back.

Seriously unbelievable.  Not only was the service spectacular, but the food was outrageously delicious.  The chorus of ooos and ahhhs from our party every time a new dish was tasted was almost ridiculous, but it really was THAT good.  There was a sizable wait when we arrived, but we easily found a few seats at the bar.  Definitely a good choice!  Our service was spot on: the bartenders had amazing recommendations for drinks and tapas, and they took great care of us.  

The highlights of our meal were the shrimp diablo, clams with chorizo, chicken tinge empanadas, white sangria, and the apple/manchago salad.  I've never been so impressed by a salad before!  We had a slight hiccup when a bug flew into my glass of sangria, but our bartender wasted no time and replaced our entire pitcher.  Above and beyond!  

A wonderful restaurant, spectacular food, and top-notch service.  We will be back!

Place is totally incredible. Local joint with great cocktails and tapas. Just off strip in comfortable and lively atmosphere. Ceviche, tuna, grilled octopus, papas bravas, petite filet are all excellent every single time.
Make your reservation now! This place has spoiled me for food. Everything we ordered was delicious and memorable. This is a foodies paradise.
Super busy when the party arrived but we found out why real soon. Amazing tapas!!!! Definitely worth it!

This place was above and beyond our expectations! The food was incredible but the service was even more fabulous. They were incredibly accommodating with our special request, and the manager even came out to check on us. We had the fried calamari, delicious and a healthy portion, the croquettes like Amsterdam! The bacon wrapped dates are to die for, the scallops in garlic butter amazing and my Moscow mule was just what the doctor ordered! We even got to try a dessert sampler which was over the top. Highly recommend checking out this place it's delightfully non Vegasy.

If your in need of lunch and your at the convention center and you can't  eat convention food. Walk here, takes 15 minutes as a casual walk. Small plate tapas menu. Sangria is served. Same side of the street as the convention show

I've never thought to go off the strip for food, but I'm so glad I took the recommendation of a friend and came here. The tuna tartare was AMAZING and the bacon date bites were such a surprising flavor. Definitely definitely coming back here and dragging all my friends off the strip to make a stop.

Traditional tapas dishes with flamenco music and patio dining? Why didn't I come to Firefly sooner?!* Sampled several dishes, was mostly pleased with the flavors and quality. Servers are professional but are assigned far too many tables, and I imagine it only got worse- they were considerably busier by the time we left.

BOQUERONES ($7): 4  tasty toasts with a mix of compatible toppings including anchovies, avocado, roasted red peppers, and a lemony drizzle. Bright and fresh! 
BEET SALAD ($7.50): roasted red and gold beets with vin-dressed greens and pecan crusted goat cheese. Definitely my kind of dish.
STUFFED DATES ($6.5): wayyy too rich for me, but I can see why they're a favorite for others
STUFFED PEPPERS ($8.5): piquillos with mozz and garlic cream cheese, in a tomato sauce with crispy fried and fresh green onions. Think of a classy version of jalapeno poppers, but with a different kind of pepper. Almost too cheesy for me, but good.
PULPO ASADO ($10):  I didn't like this at all.  Potatoes and tomatoes were not enough to save the unappealing octopus. Menu claims it is grilled but seemed boiled or overcooked, unfavorable texture.
ALBONDIGAS ($7): dish of mini meatballs in sherry sauce, basic but successful.
MERGUEZ ($10): two links of spicy lamb sausage with a heap of roasted red peppers and two tiny slices of bread. Sausage and peppers had a good kick to them, but the lack of accompanying bread made it hard to enjoy this dish without chopping it up and rearranging like a stir fry.

Difficult to give a rating: I usually round down but this 3.5 is going up because I definitely want to come back for paella and sangria. 


* Rhetorical question: their negative reputation precedes them, unfortunately. Lots of locals still associate the restaurant with their old (but serious) salmonella outbreak from 2013, but if you look up the stats on SNHD, they've received As on all inspections for nearly two years. It might be time to give them a try again.

Was not impressed with this place at all. Only reason I'm giving it two stars is because the stuffed dates were okay. I got the empanadas and it came with a single empanada that was cut in half. Not to mention it wasn't even good. The salad was soggy and resembled something you could buy from Walmart or McDonald's. Would not recommend and I'm not sure why it's rated so highly.

We absolutely love this place!  Planning a trip back to Vegas just to eat here.  The bacon wrapped dates are incredible.  The filet mignon is to die for, melts in your mouth. Prices are great, this place is a gem.

This is one of our regular go to spots when we are in Vegas. It is stylish, and even though they say they're Spanish, it is more Latin American Fusion food. The service is on point and the prices are not bad for what you are getting. The Sangria is amazing, and the Tuna Tartar is one the best I have tasted. The Paella is good also, but you really need to make up your mind on that one as soon as you hit the door, since they make it fresh it takes about 20 minutes from order to your table. Will we go back yes!

The tapas here are amazing, my spouse and I are from out of town and we try to visit Las Vegas in a yearly basis to see family and friends. This is a must go spot for us every time we are in town. The sangria here is to die for. The goat cheese fish was rich and the sauce added the right amount of acidity to cut through the richness. Most plates come with enough to share between 4 people. I recommend this place all the time to friends and family. See you again soon Firefly!

Just behind the strip is the street Paradise. Along this street sits this restaurant called Firefly. Tapas, Paella, y Sangria plus a lot more. Firefly has become a must visit anytime I'm here in Vegas. The small plates are always my go to. With so many options they have something for everyone. 
I do have a few favorites, "huevos estrellados" and "scallop escargots" are at the top of my list. I do try new plates when I'm there, the goal to at least try them all once. I'm sure anyone who goes will also have favorites. So take some time off from the strip and enjoy some great food.
Awesome sliders, heirloom tomatoes with burata cheese, padron peppers, cod and Spanish red wine!  Server is beyond super friendly and service awesomely fast!  Ask for Alejandro he is the best!

I LOVE this place.  I am probably the only person in the world who does not eat bacon, so I have never tried their bacon wrapped dates...but apparently, they are to die for.  I always get the stuffed piquillo peppers and artichoke toast.  I love the steak and mushroom skewers and veggie empanada,   I had to deny them one star because they changed the way they make their blood orange mojito.  I was told by the manager this was due to to people complaining that it was too sweet.  Well...if you don't like sweet, get a regular mojito.  They made me a new one the "old way" but it wasn't the same.  This was a year ago.  And although I have returned several times since, I have not ordered the mojito so not sure if it is still the new and unimproved version.  It would also be nice if happy hour included food too...but their tapas are reasonably priced, regardless.

This was our first experience with a tapas restaurant and we loved it. Food was delicious, staff very friendly and informative, prices reasonable. Can't wait for our next trip to Vegas so we can visit Firefly again.

I still like the original Firefly best. But alas, they moved on to another Paradise location, pretty much next door to where the original was. Sure, it's bigger and newer. But it's just not the same. The prices have dramatically increase over the years. Most tapas have gone up $2-$3.50 each. So it's no longer as cheap as it once was. But nonetheless, it's still a decent cost-quality trade off. So, in other words, the food is tasty and the prices ain't bad (even if they are steeper than they used to be).

And while I miss the old place, I do have to admit this newer version is quite nice. It's just intimate enough, just dark enough, just decorated enough, etc. And the bar area is huge and really nice space. Fair warning: Happy hour can make the bar area quite crowded. I also really like the patio area too.

The service we experienced here was fabulous. Very attentive and friendly.

The menu has just so many good items. The flavored mojitos and sangrias are all amazing. And I've never had a bad or even so-so tapa here. The stuffed peppers and mac 'n' cheese will forever be personal favorites. And then there's the steak and mushrooms skewers, the petite filet, the shrimp, the mussels, the gazpacho, the dates, the meatballs... It's all good eats.

So yeah, it's still a top Vegas restaurant for me.

We did not wait 40 minutes for paella. We waited only 35. Anyway, I enjoyed it and left with a big round belly. Definitely not for four, maybe three, considering the paella were actually finished by two of us. :) The only complaint I have is the noise level. We could barely hear each other across the small table. What can you say? Happy crowd.

This place was great and an incredible value. The tapas were excellent and the menu was extensive. The tapas weren't traditional Spanish tapas (at least as I know them) but everything we had was delicious. Highly recommend.

I've been here many times and the food is always excellent! The selection covers a wide range of dishes and the seafood selections in particular are always tasty. The last trip we had the baked goat cheese and three out of four in our party felt it was the best dish of the meal. Both the calamari and octopus were tender and delicate. The chocolate tres leches cake is a can't miss favorite.
Love their food, Sangria is my favorite!! Great service, beautiful people and fun atmosphere!!

Went here on a recommendation of a friend and we're so glad we went! Great priced platters and my favorite was the sparkling wine mimosas. We bought a pitcher it w as so good! Great value for what you pay, we received great service and will definitely come back again. My favorite was the shrimp diablas and the bacon wrapped dates!
Super great food, and service. Free bachelorette shots! Sangria was amazing. Authentic espresso. You can't go wrong!

Very contemporary and good looking restaurant.  Attentive service, and good food,. Not great..But good.  We had the seafood paella, and while it was good it was just ok. I will be back because I really liked the ambience maybe it was an off day?

Stupid good.
This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.
Its not stuffy formal, its not crazy casual and the food is always just amazing.
Bacon wrapped dates in a port wine reduction with blue cheese . . . seriously????
I ate 3 and then felt bad about it so, I asked my friend if he wanted another and at the slightest hesitation I grabbed it . . . sorry, you hesitated.
Great food.
Reasonable prices.
Do yourself a favor and GO!!!!!!

Nice atmosphere not far from Stratosphere hotel. Quintessential tapas menu with thoughtful dishes and nice flavors. Fair prices and good service. Still doesnt top my favorite tapas place in Massachussetts but still a nice experience.

The food is hit or miss.  From all the good reviews I was expecting spectacular, but I got average at best.  I ordered some calamari to go and when I ate it the food was way under-cooked and rubbery.  I called up and left a message, explaining what happened and they offered me a refund, but I declined and told them I would like the calamari again, but this time cooked right.  I cooked up some Fettuccine Alfredo and picked up the calamari and it may have been a little less rubbery, but it was still undercooked and I could not eat it neither time.
Service was fantastic. Food is good, although some details hold it back from being great (some dishes were too salty, others were a little bland or watery).

All time favorite restaurant in the world! They moved but just a few doors down. Great new spot. Happy hour is to die for! Still have the amazing filet mignon mini burgers but are called Serrano ham sliders. Rico our bar server was very nice funny and helpful with a few tough choices. Haven been here in 5 years because we live in Seattle but cannot wait to come back! Cheers!

Best tapas bar I've been to! The food is great, service is on point, and drinks are strong. The tapas menu is extensive and everything we had was so Yummi. Definitely try the shrimp ceviche and manchego mac and cheese!

I was surprised to see this new, bigger location. I really like the intimate setting of the previous spot but they did a good job with this one. Obviously, the demand led them to a bigger space, which makes business sense. 

We sat near the bar... they have TV's with sports on, which takes away from the experience in my opinion. Whenever I have had tapas, it's usually an intimate spot with your wine or sangria, your tapas, and your friends. This was almost like tapas in a sports bar!

As for the food, I can't find any reason to complain. I thought the bacon wrapped dates were pretty much dead on. I didn't expect the chicken salad to be as good as it was. The steak skewers were really good and also the empanadas hit the spot. 

Although the setting may not be what it was it is nice to see the quality of the food to be where it always has been and that it didn't disappoint!

Went here with some coworkers two nights ago to unwind and dance, they turn the patio into a dance floor on Friday nights. The music was good, but I didn't like the $10 cover charge, which went to the live singers rupturing my ear drums because they didn't equalize or something.

There were a lot of people and everyone was good at dancing. I just dont think it was worth the cover charge.
Yay, I would recommend that place without any hesitation. We had an amazing evening, sharing tapas and the drinks were good.

Went their last night for the white party and had a great time. A lot of people I haven't seen in a long time. I always order their red sangria and again it's was great. Fast and friendly service at the bar even though it was a very busy night!

What can I say bad about my favorite Las Vegas restaurant?  
Oh- it is so busy no one goes there anymore. 
Seriously, make your reservations in advance.  And it is noisy place, mostly due to the fresh Sangria that hoes down like water on a hot day.

I like Firefly regardless of their 2013 Salmonella outbreak. Yes that was horrible, but it's been 2 years. Plus, this is a brand new restaurant and it's time to get over that.

Some friends and I came for dinner one night before seeing a show. We ordered a pitcher of red sangria, which was delicious. It has fresh cut up fruit and brandy, yum yum. It's safe to say I had a nice buzz going on after a couple drinks. Firefly is all tapas, or small plates. These are good for sharing which is why I like going with a group. My favorite thing on the menu is the stuffed dates. They are wrapped in bacon, and stuffed with blue cheese. Fun fact, I don't even like blue cheese, but the combination of these things is AMAZING. Do get these, and thank me later. 

To be honest, I can't remember too much else because that brandy got ya girl feeling randy, or something like that. LoL. If you haven't done so, give this place a shot, I think you will be pleasantly surprised.
The tapas are the perfect size. And the variety of options is excellent. We ordered the garden salad, lamb chops, and stuffed dates. Even the kids liked the food (no burgers were ordered!).

This was an alright place.  Review is as always only based on the food.  The parking was complimentary.  

Bacon wrapped dates: soaked in sauce and hence made the dish soggy.  Bacon was somehow over cooked and yet the dish came out lukewarm.

Empanadas: pretty heavy and salty.  The sauce on the outside is probably unnecessary as the dish is already flavorful.  The empanadas breaking was cooked well.

Serrano ham sliders:  a little salty as the ham itself is already flavorful.  There is a spicy kick that is offset well by the bleu cheese.  

Chorizo clams: broth is great.  Still  n the salty side but you get some more bread to dip into the broth.  Worth it to just be able to dip the bread.

This was enough food for two people so not bad

3.5 stars: I probably wouldn't come back often but the price and food was fair and service was pretty good from the waiter

Firefly is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. I love love love this place.

I usually enjoy coming during dinner hours. The lights are dimmed, the ambience is chic, dressing up here is welcomed but you can also be casual. 

The tapas here are so damn good. The scallops "escargot" are buttery and cooked just right. The camarones aljillo, tuna tartare (with taro chips), shrimp ceviche, steak and mushroom skewers MUST TRY THESE), and any of their empanadas are always what I order right away. Did I also mention they have bacon wrapped dates? Try them. They sound weird, but so worth it.

If the party being seated to eat is more than 6 people, gratuity is already included in bill. 

I come to Firefly at least once a month and I can honestly say, despite it's salmonella outbreak a few years back, I'm still a loyal food-goer and will always be willing to throw some dollars on their pitchers of sangria!

TLDR: decent prices, solid shrimp, limited selection, and horrible charcuterie selection

This place was worth a shot, but I think it needs some help with ambience. When you first walk in it feels sexy and intriguing, but the further into the restaurant you go the more it feels like just a dimly lit casual restaurant (NOT a compliment). 

Nonetheless, the servers were pretty nice, and the dishes came out at a good pace. It was definitely a very solid dinner, if you count only the "easy" dishes. In other words, their kitchen is fine in terms of using skill, but for things like charcuterie where sourcing really matters, they weren't great.

This is one of few Yelp reviews I have ever done... FIREFLY IS AMAZING! We were seated outside and our server Alejandro was fantastic. He provided great recommendations and was very attentive.

We were there for an early happy hour dinner on a Friday night. We had Mojitos, Red Sangria, Fire*Fries, Stuffed Dates, Albondigas, Veggie Empanada, Serrano Ham Sliders, and Stuffed Peppers. I can't stop telling people about the great food. Every bite was better than the last.

Highly recommended for a great meal and great service  at an affordable price.

My review is based mostly on the food here -- it's good but not out of this world. The concept of tapas and sangria paired with decent service is sure to be a hit with a majority of people however I just didn't get what all the fuss was.
The tomato bread was amazing and the Serrano sliders tasted so good. Every thing I had was delicious.
Gooooood foood! Great atmosphere good for group get togethers or even a date :) and also excellent service

My girlfriend had been dying to try Firefly for quite some time and kindly decided to take me for a belated birthday dinner. We were able to make reservations through open table via the yelp app (very cool and super easy)! Based upon reviews of Helpers and friends Firefly was surely a place that would please our curious appetites.
The service we received was attentive and extremely helpful. Our server had us stop ordering after we selected 6 items suggesting that it may be too much food for 2 people. I had a craving for a cocktail and order the Cherry Mule. It was such a creative take on the Moscow Mule with the twist of adding the St. Germaine's lovely flavor. Thebread and butter was absolutely a great pairing. The butter was sweet and the bread was slightly salty. Our server recommended the figs which we loved! They were stuffed with candied walnuts and sprinkled with cheese as well as a great lightly drizzled sauce. Next were the tuna tartar & ceviche. The tuna tartar was accompanied by fried taro chips and not only did it look good it was also very filling. If I had to pick a favorite of the Tuna Tartar and the Ceviche, then it'd be the ceviche hands down. It was so flavorful and refreshing! The next item was the spicy beef salad and item did not disappoint with its slight kick and yummy dressing! We decided to try out the Diablo shrimp and octopus. Of the 2 dishes I'd recommend the shrimp over the octopus since octopus seemed to have too much going on. We decided to add another dish for good measure. I must confess that Chicken AND Chorizo was my absolute favorite dish!!!! What an amaze combo of tastiness! 
To end our meal we ordered the gelato trio and chocolate trees leches cake. The chocolate tres leches cake was ok. I've had better versions in Santa Ana and at other establishments, but the Gelato Trio was spot on!

The food here is always very good. The bacon wrapped dates I've always been one of my favorites. The sangria is very refreshing. I would've given it five stars but gave work because the service on this trip is not so good. The server system was excellent I waters were always fall. However the server himself acted like he had somewhere else rather be. I will continue to visit firefly for the great quality food.
I have been to Spain and had tapas before this place is as good as it get in the states. The name is perfect cause it is fire!!!!!

Great food and service . Mario and Gerardo were incredible servers. Will be back again really soon
Recommend highly

came here a few weeks ago when attending the NFR. a group of friends recommend this place to us, and also dined with us. the cocktails are amazing, and strong!! super service too!! we all orders 2 plates, and shared. everything ordered was fantastic, and fresh! ! we ordered more plates til all was satisfied, and tipsy!! wonderful! !

I have been here a number of times and have not been disappointed. I've tried about half of the menu and the food has been consistently great! The sangria is delicious. Nice outdoor seating area. Between the price point and the food quality, absolutely worth getting off the strip to eat here.

This place was delicious! Our waiter was sloooowwww but the food was so amazing we didn't care too much.

Our favorite was the steak and mushroom skewers. So incredibly tender and the sauce was divine!

YUM!
Wonderful if you are in the mood for tapas. Fun and lively place and you get to eat so many different things.

The place is great, the music is great, prices are great. We came here last night around 11:00pm and everything was good until we ordered the paella. It had lots of hairs, long hairs in it.... we we're pretty full, but we could've eaten more. We sent it back, however the manager came to our table and said: "Just so you know, I'm going to take it off the check but back in the kitchen no one could've drop a hair there" she didn't apologize, in the contrary, she insinuated that we, as customers, put the hairs on it. We thought it was very offensive. We were ordering lots of drinks and by that time we ordered a bottle of wine... We were there to eat well, spend money and have a good time and it was just offensive to hear that. Even if we could've been "those" type of customers, she should've just apologized. Very disrespectful. Our server was really nice and came back and apologized for everything, which was the only thing we wanted to hear.

Fun atmosphere. Good food. Free parking. (Free valet) They moved a heater towards us because we sat outside. That was very nice of them. Inside the restaurant at 7pm on Friday night was pretty loud. If you want to go somewhere to have a meaningful conversation you might want to go elsewhere depending on the time and day you go there. The food looked and tasted great. I'm definitely going back there again.

I love this restaurant! The food is excellent. For a Celiac like me, it is a wonderland. The fries with Parmesian and herbs are cooked in a designated gluten free fryer. So many other foods to choose from! The Gf menu is huge!!!

Best meal I've had in a long time!  Service was great.  My friend and I sat outside on the patio and it was so fun, the ambiance was nice.  Our order came out one dish at a time --which was great because we were able to enjoy each tapas and not feel rushed.  This is an great restaurant and I highly recommend it.
Amazing restaurant. Absolutely delicious. I've been to Spain and have to say their tapas are pretty similar to what I've had there. Definitely coming back. Also a plus - service was amazing.

So my future sister-in-law made reservations here for her bachelorette dinner on a Saturday at 7:30. We arrived at 7:30 or 7:35 and were seated at about 7:45. The ambiance was nice and I as digging the vibe. We were seated and were kind of discouraged right off the bat when the servers were around our table but no one came to introduce themselves, ask for our drink order, or if we wanted to start off with any of the tapas. Thirty minutes later we flagged someone down to ask if we could order drinks and food... And had to flag people down for another thirty minutes afterward. The restaurant was quite loud and busy, but other tables were being served and we were right next to the server station and bar and couldn't get anyone to take our order! After I explained that it was my sister-in-laws bachelorette the staff became more attentive. The saving grace was most definitely the food and mojitos. The bacon-wrapped dates and ceviche were amazing, as well as the pork empanadas. 

All in all, the food and drinks were delicious but the service leaves much to be desired. We are visiting from the east coast and my future sister-in-law was bummed that we were being looked over on what was supposed to be a fun evening out. The photographer that snaps a picture of you while you're trying to enjoy your food really brought us down a notch too. She then comes back later and tries to sell you the photos for $15 apiece... What?!? It really cheapens the entire experience. I get that it's Vegas, but there is a time and a place and it isn't while we are eating.

Probably everything you order off the menu would be good!  We had a party of 16 people, and I had no idea what we were ordering, so I just threw out some dishes I saw that caught my eyes - fish sticks, clams, mussels, and paella.  

Everything was delicious, and I mean EVERYTHING!  The tuna tartare and the ceviche were on point!  We had two birthday boys with us, and the restaurant treated us with a few pitchers of sangrias, two birthday shots, and two tshirts for the birthday boys.  

Don't have anything but good thing to say about this place.  I know this is the new location, (I've never been to the old location) but the place seems nice and clean.  

Our party had a great time! Definitely be back next time we're in town!
Love this place the food is amazing the staff is even better!!! Very personal super friendly my kinda place to get a drink and relax!!

Loved finding this unique and tasty restaurant off the strip for our vacation! The food was a  pleasant twist on the authentic flavors. Since my husband has taken trips to Spain this was a real comfort food trip for him. 

Be sure to try different tapas and share them in the standard Spanish tradition. We also enjoyed the Paella. A must for Vegas.

Food or Familiarity


If we could give zero stars
We would, if based on food alone
All precooked bland flavors
Save the filet mignon and tomato basil soup

In fact the only reason for the second star
Was to express 
How kind and inviting the staff are

They even messed up sangria
The whole point of sangria
Is to make use of average wines
A box of rubbing alcohol water and old fruit

If youre looking for tapas
Julian Serrano at the Aria

Solid Spanish tapas restaurant! We came on a weekday afternoon for a late lunch, which was nice because there weren't many people there and our server was quite attentive. We originally wanted to get the paella, but we didn't want to wait, nor did we have the appetite for the dish (it feeds from 2 to 4 people and there were only 2 of us...), so we ended up opting for the tapas. The tapas were delicious! The stuffed dates were delicious! Bacon! Dates! And a toasted almond in the middle! The croquettas were of course delicious! I'm not sure how that dish can ever go wrong. The stuffed peppers were super cheesy and good. My favorite, though, was probably the baked tetilla. This is essentially a large pot of baked cheese. Oh so good! The cheese also has some tomatoes and chorizo, so each bites has a bunch of flavors and stuff mixed into creamy baked cheese.

Great place. Good food, good prices. The manager Eduardo is a total pleasure. I wasted money on cigarettes that I didn't get and he went out of his way to make it up to me without reimbursing me for my pack. Good times

Neo and the entire firefly team made our wedding reception absolutely amazing. Food and drinks were delicious , service was top notch  we had reserved the private room and they assisted my bridesmaids with set up and were more than flexible . We ordered the three course meal and everything from cheese platters, filet Mignon , paella was perfect . Prices super affordable ! We live in Texas but def want to come back to eat at firefly again

Honestly one of my favorite tapas places ever. It's close, it's convenient, the food and service is good, and the prices aren't bad. Unfortunately, their old rep is preceeding them, but I've never had food poisening here, and neithet have any of my friends or family. 

The happy hour here is great. The pear martini is delish. Not too sweet. I really like the sangria, I usually get a pitcher. Sometimes two. :P

The boqueronea are toasts with anchovies, avacado, and lemon drizzle. Super super good. Nice and fresh. Not too heavy.
The roasted eggplant cannolini with goat cheese is also quite good. I'm a sucker for goat cheese.
The beet salad is probably my favorite. Also has nut crusted goat cheese. 
The stuffed dates are probably the most popular dish, and for good reason. They have an almond inside with of course...goat cheese. So delish. These are pretty rich, however.
Stuffed peppers have mozz and cream cheese. It's like jalapeno poppers but fancy.

I've also had a few of their salads, the steak one is my fav. Just look at the menu. You'll know why.

All in all, a great place to come after work for happy hour or before a night on the town.

Ambience is great. Good I was not surprised. I was expecting authentically Spanish tapas and you can always tell by their tortilla española, it was fair quality.
I would recommend for drinks, the sangria is pretty good and one glass got me buzzed.

Cool little tapas restaurant, came in a large group for an event.  We had a private room which i though was weird that the tables were all squished in together, yet the room could have accommodated more tables spread out.  But it turned out fine and everyone had a great time.

We had the "Tapas Banquet"
Toasted bread, Olives and almond butter
artichoke toasts -  artichoke hearts, aioli, basil and pepper 
Stuffed dates - smoked almond, red wine reduction, blue cheese wrapped in bacon
Baby back ribs - with mango BBQ sauce
patatas bravas (spicy potatoes) - Roasted potatoes with spicy aioli
steak and mushroom skewers - Grilled Fillet, roasted garlic cream and red wine reduction.
camarones a la diabla - shrimp in a sweet and spicy sauce.
Chocolate très lèches cake.

My favorites were the Mango BBQ baby back ribs, i didn't taste any mango but it was definitely really tender and fall off the bone, and the BBQ sauce was delicious.  Bacon wrapped dates, smoky/savory and sweet at the same time too.  I think my favorite of all was the spicy potatoes, so good, i love a good tangy aioli and especially a spicy one it went really well with the potatoes, I'd put that sauce on a burger or even their fries any day of the week.  At first bight its really hot, but it wasn't the kind of hot that multiplies as you eat it.  I think as the dinner went on i got used to it so i just kept eating more and more of it.  So good!

Service was great, they explained everything and offered to take pictures of our group, refilled waters and drinks promptly.  Im sure everyone had a really good time.

This place is our new spot! The Fly Tai is super addictive and hits the spot! The service is so on point that they refilled my bf's Arnold Palmer 3 times throughout our dinner, immediately provided a new knife for me when mine fell, and quickly came to retrieve each dish and glass that was no longer in use (Thanks Mario and Lenny). I have tried so many dishes, I wouldn't know where to begin! All I can say is that when a restaurant has a separate vegetarian menu and the dishes come out delicious and in under 20 minutes - I'm impressed!

I heard they had some issues before, but they have truly made up for what ever errors took place in the past and have continued to surpass my expectations for service, food, and ambiance on multiple occasions.
Solid small plates and a nice patio. We were there for lunch but would love to come back on a Friday night for the entertainment. Nice to get away from the strip and find a decent restaurant.

We booked a large party at this venue. They were very accommodating and the food was excellent. The wait staff was very attentive to us. On our way out everyone was complimenting how great the food was, none of us disliked anything that was presented to us. We weren't sure what we were in for but our expectations were define my y surpassed. We really enjoyed the continuous flow of food. They even told us if there was anything we didn't like or wanted more of something they would be glad to swap it out. Really great experience and would definitely revisit them on our next trip to the area.

Food was good. Happy hour specials on beer and wine were decent. Over-all, a tad expensive for what it was. We sat at the bar, 2 people working behind the wood. The guy was ice cold, . a bit useless. He seemed to like to chit chat with colleagues/co-workers rather than entertain guests. The young lady working was quite welcoming, we tipped based on her service. I hope she doesn't have to share it with him. Not a bad experience but I wouldn't return on my next trip.
three words...absolutely freak'n awesome! The bacon wrapped dates are fantastic, and the red sangria was fabulous! Great place.

Been wanting to try Firefly and so happy we finally get to. 

First off, drinks - The sangrias are delicious and refreshing. We got the red and sparkling sangrias and the sparkling is definitely a winner

Bread with almond butter - The almond butter was soo good! Creamy with a little kick

Bacon wrapped dates - Must try! Sweet and salty combo was great! Theres a surprise nut in the middle.

Tierra y mar skewers - sooo good and tender with a chile verde sauce. Comes with sausage, filet and shrimp

Scallop Escargo - Garlic butter sauce is delish I wanted to drink that sauce

Steak skewers with gravy sauce, Yum!!!! Meat was very tender and flavorful

And last but not least Paella - Very tasty and plentiful. Flavor is good and it has a little heat.

Service is really good. Servers are nice and attentive. We'll be back here every time we're in Vegas!

Had firefly cater an event for my company. At first they were a little tough to get ahold of but last minute they really came food (otherwise I would have left a 5 star reveiw). The food was amazing, the service from the delivery crew was amazing as well. The pricing was pretty good too!

I would use them again! Everyone was very pleased!

I have got to call this place out on their TEEEEEEEERRIBLE service! I am a local and since this place has been around it has always had the worst service in Vegas! The service at the old Sahara location was good so it must be the management here that is the problem. I came in here on a slow day during non-happy hour prices and I still got bad service as usual. Im so mad i tipped 20% i shouldve talked to the manager lady that was there but she seemed to be really snobby and also not really worried about helping her team. 
1 star for the food
1 star for the decor 
-1 star for the service
-1 star for the hospitality 
-1 star for the value

I'm happy the place is bigger and there's actually parking! 

I Wish the service was as fast as it used to be.... They get your order and that's about it... Not good with the follow up service! 

Slightly disappointed they switched their shrimp cerviche order!!! And things are now even smaller.... I used to love their bread and now that's even different! 

Oh good luck getting a refill! 

I just want to old firefly service back, this is too commercial for me.
Fantastic food.  Wonderful service. Even though close to closing, food came out fast and everyone was  very helpful and nice. Only thing that kept the 5th star was some of the sauces tasted overdone.

Love the new location! Clean & modern. Great service, the dates and steak salad are my favorite dishes. 


Only reason for 4 stars is they don't offer a medium size plate- just small bread plates and they are too small. Also, under out table the area was wet and dirty from the previous customers. 

A nice change from the busy strip!

If you want a 5 star meal at a reasonable price you HAVE to stop here for dinner. We went down to Vegas for my wife's birthday on a foodie bender. We ate at some of the "nicest" places we could find (not trying to be snooty, just dropping a benchmark for everyone) Firefly was our favorite spot on our four day adventure. The service was outstanding and the food...ohhhh the food...

We started at the bar with the house infused vodka..I knew we were off to a good start when it hit the lips. I initially thought there couldn't be any vodka in it because it was so smooth and at six dollars, I guess I was still in the twelve dollar mind set for hotel rum and cokes. 

We were quickly seated by Irinia Omar, who became known as the Tapas wizard. We're passive aggressive in the fact that we like to order a few dishes and then have our server pick a few. There were four of us just to complicate things a little more. Some servers balk at this and are very hesitant to offer their opinion, let alone make the final call. After a few quick questions Irinia smiled and headed off. Then the onslaught of food began..the tomato bread followed by the tuna tartare, and chorizo plate set the stage in the chilled Tapas department, then the fun began. The stuffed dates, baked goat cheese, grilled octopus, spicy shrimp, scallops, empanadas, and lamb chops were to die for. We regret we didn't try at least one Paella (that was our choice ) but by the end when the desserts came out it really didn't matter. 

At this point in the night after the onslaught of tapas and a few samples of the cocktail list, we were now in a battle against the food. We had to almost force down the desserts, the tres leches and bread pudding won. 

The manager, Jon was very personable and friendly and made sure our group was taken care of and was overly apologetic when a group of twenty seated beside us quickly grew to the unplanned group of thirty and we volunteered to move tables to allow everyone to be seated.  Jon runs a very clean and efficient restaurant, and is quick to jump in and make sure his customers are enjoying themselves and are full. 

If your in Vegas and you want an awesome and unique meal put Firefly at the top of your list. You won't be sorry. I would put Firefly up against ANY of the other "well known" establishments in a food off any day.

Tried this place out with my wife. Seemed nice and I really wanted to like it. Our waiter was absent for the duration of our dining experience. Bread was stale and tough. The blood orange mojito was highly recommended to us so we decided to try it. For $30, I thought it would be savory. Unfortunately, it tasted like some juice mixture I made in high school. It was barely drinkable and tasted like bottom shelf liquor. Not worth the money. The food was just ok, for small plates, could have been better. I just wish the service had been better to reflect the food and create a better experience for us.  Menu is very boring and the ambiance is very pretentious.

This was the last time I visit this place, sad to say we you need to move on...

I have been coming here for years every time I stay in Vegas I try to come here to eat at the tapas. My favorite believe it or not is the filet mignon and the mushroom Chicken chorizo. By the way don't forget their bread and their butter it's also really good will continue to come love this place

Hell yes to Bacon Wrapped Dates!
Heck yeah to the Beet/Pear/Goat Cheese Salad...
AND to the Scallops done Escargot style. 
Eh on the Tuna Tartare; a little too stringy for my taste; but yummy to the tarot chips. 
Oh! and the Sangria, steeped for 3 days, is fantastic. Little edible pieces of fruit vs the 'here's  half an apple' you find in some pitchers. 
Lots more to try, we'll definitely be back!

Come here for a party! LOL It was my first time having TAPAS and I came with 20 people.  Quite big location, I love the inside decor it's dimly light and has a red ambience to it. There's a huge bar in the center if you prefer ordering drinks or some small dishes asap. Servers were very friendly and accommodating. I was worried that since we had such a large group it would take a while for all our orders and it was a busy night but, absolutely no complaints! All food came out on great timing and was fresh and so delicious. I didn't get to post all pictures of everything I ordered because it was so good everyone ate it too quickly. 
**I recommend the stuffed dates & manchego macncheese #perfection 
Their paella is also very delicious! Order that first because it takes 40 min to cook and serves between 4-6 people. 
Overall it was so much fun for a birthday dinner/party  10/10 experience 
I'll definitely be back again with more friends, probably during their happy hour from 3-6
Place is amazing. Great for a group meal. Lots of options and very accommodating. Def recommend this place for any meal.

Its been a favorite of ours for years. Having gone back recently after a while, it's a new location!!! Right next door to the original spot but upgraded in every way ;) hooray! Still amazing service, delicious sangrias, and goooood food.
Oh wow!  Choco tres leches.  Brought 1/2 dozen buddies with me and we all had a blast, everyone was impressed.  Each dish was better than the last.  We'll definitely be back next month.

Love love love firefly ! 
I love all the different kinds of food they have to choose from....the waters are really nice and friendly and the food comes out quick ......
Thank you for great dining every time we come .....
And for anyone that might be second guessing about going because you might not find something for the little ones...We have 4 kids and they find something to eat every time we go .

I always order red sangria (the best!), bacon wrapped dates (sweet and savory), shrimp ceviche (fresh and light), Mac n cheese, (cheesy and creamy), tres leches (flour less cake soaked in sweet milk! Mmm). I feel better it is a new location.  Our service this last time was extremely delayed.  She also forgot to put in an item. We did not receive it until we finished  eating everything else we ordered.

Wow! This place was a great find!

I had been told by my coworker to check this place out if we wanted to escape from the Vegas strip for a little while and this place did not disappoint! Incredible tapas, the perfect portions to share and the most delicious sangria! The bacon wrapped dates were amazing and I had the cheese fondue dip with chorizo that was out of this world!

You can tell that this place is filled with locals and it is such a great break from the intensity of Las Vegas. The atmosphere is fun but not overwhelming and filled with cigarette smoke. Our server Neo was wonderful and so attentive even though we had a very large, distracted group. When I'm back in Vegas I will definitely stop by again!

Love the food here. Have been many times! Try the steak skewers, bacon wrapped dates, shrimp and much more! The only thing that is disappointing, when you order a red bull vodka and they serve you some crappy energy drink w vodka. Yet on their bar counter tops they have a Redbull logo? See attached picture. Maybe get rid of that if you can't service it.

Amazing! Came here for my birthday dinner celebration and had one of the best meals ever. Great food, drinks and vibes. Highly recommend and will definitely be back. Our sever, Eder, took amazing care of us and made the experience all the better.

I have always enjoyed Firefly from the many years I've been patronizing this business. However, now that they have released a Vegetarian and Vegan menu I am ecstatic about dining here all over again. The atmosphere is always fun and inviting, the food is delicious, and the alternative menu has many great options for those who are meat conscious.

I'm an avid firefly food-lover so I was happy (oh, and my stomach was too) to find out that they didn't close down. They literally just moved down the street! The new place looks great and service was awesome! And, most importantly no change in food quality! 

Same great food but new and improved place! Where all the locals go and you can chill with friends over tapas and sangria! What can be better? Definitely a spot to hit up during your stay at Vegas!

I love all about this place. I always order from tapas menu. Yes, it is tapas but it will fill u up. 
I almost try all their tapas menu, moving forward to the entree soon. As of their cocktail, it always good.

We ordered Stuffed pepper, Patatas Bravas and Chicken tinga empanadas and they were fantastic.. I can definitely say one of the best tapas to try in Vegas.  Drinks?.. Do try their Sangrias (Sprakling and Red) ..

Sehr leckeres spanische Küche. Viele Tampas......und kleinere Gerichte........sehr freundliches Personal 
Geheimtipp für Vegas

So this is their new location, the other one on Paradise got closed down because their food had salmonella. 

The new location looks fabolous!! its really nice and intimate inside and the bar is really pretty. We went here for a birthday party and they served the red sangria, omg to die for. Really good and lots of fruits. They also served artichoke hearts on sourdough bread really good. Bacon wrapped dates omg this is the best thing i ever tried. So yuumy. they also order the beef kabobs, the meat was really tender and not chewy. For dessert we had the tres leches chocoalate cake. OMG OMG!! seriously..First time i ever had a tres leches cake and omg i freaking love it. You have to try it. 

The waiters were really good on making sure my water was full and to take the dirty dishes away. Really good service and i would deff recommend this place. 

Lets just hope they don't close down again. 

FYI the Firefly in Anthem is closing because they got a C grade. YIKES!
No complaints here. Groupon has a $79 deal for 2 pitchers of Sangria and 8 tapas. Ceviche apple salad and calamari were muy bueno.

This place is definitely a favorite of mine! When ever someone asks for a good place to go or i have family or friends visit this is the place i recommend. The environment is beautiful! You can dress up or down for this place. Service is wonderful, food and drinks are DELICIOUS!!! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE coming here!!!
Very good service and flavors. A full menu. Perhaps a bit noisy.
amazing food! seriously! so damn good. the service is also excellent. cocktails are delicious! BEST TAPAS EVER!

We made a reservation for my first time here. Arrived 5 min before reservation and was seated 5 min after reservation time. We ordered the fried calamari, Chicago beef bocadillos, and the mixed paella. The bocadillos were okay, too salty for my taste. The paella was delicious! The rice was cooked perfectly, and I loved the flavor of the dish. The service was excellent. Had refills before I could even ask! I really appreciated the attentiveness and friendliness of all the servers. Only downside was that the atmosphere was very loud with the music, and it can sometimes be hard to hear.
Love the food here and the eviroment, however the staff sucks! They took forever to get out orders and refilling our drinks. Service or taste for me.

I am a little torn on this one. I love tapas because I can never decide between 2 or 3 things, but the price seems a little high! I recommend the Chicago beef bocadillos, stuffed dates, and the apple manchengo salad. 

Their sangria and mojito pitchers are the best bang for your buck but are still a little overpriced. One pitcher of sangria is $30. If you have 3 people, I guess that isn't that bad.

Overall, it is a great place to hang out and get some food.

While driving on Paradise Road on the way to the Cosmopolitan to check out China Poblano 2 weeks ago, I saw this resto's and it immediately reminded of when my co-worker told me about this place. So, I made a u-turn and my wife and I ate dinner her instead. We had the following:

Smoked salmon bagels $9

Patatas Bravas $7

Fried Calamari $10

Ahi Tuna Skewer $10

Chicken Tinga Empanada $7

Vanilla Yogurt Mousse $7

First of all, we were told that this is a spanish style resto with emphasis on tapas. All of the food tasted pretty good. The bagels were great mostly bc the bagels were toasted perfectly and that caper dill cream was pretty tasty. The patatas bravas was pretty much an elegant version of roasted potatoes. I wish the friend calamari came with a acidic sauce like a tomato-based sauce bc eating it with tartar sauce can get pretty heavy. The Ahi Tuna Skewer was the best tasting dish for me. The ginger soy glaze on it actually reminded me more of Hawaii than Spain.  The Empanada was pretty good...light and fluffy and not greasy at all. Im glad it came with a side salad. The vanilla yogurt mousse was ok. It was like not as heavy melted ice cream mixed with fruit. The crispy sugar cookie sticks that came with it were probably one of the best cookies i've ever tasted and made a good dipping partner for the mousse. Overall, I would say this place is pretty good. I'll be back to try their paellas and update this review....

The only criticism is that it is very loud... hence the 4 stars. We ordered from every category 
Chilled- ceviche of shrimp, my daughter liked it however I did not like all of the lime flavor, but that's a ceviche, the shrimp was huge and in abundance so if that's your thing order it
Hot- manche go Mac n cheese. Delicious and creamy very tasty for a mac n cheese
Seafood-our favorite!!! Scallops escargot, everything about it was delicious we even put the remaining sauce on the Mac n cheese we loved it so much.
Meat and poultry- steak and mushroom skewers ordered medium they are very tasty with lots of flavor and very tender. 

Mojito and Sangria was nice and refreshing

LOVED this restaurant! I have never done the tapas style dinning and I really liked it! I got to try so much more from the menu and let me tell you its heavenly! Next time I'm in Vegas I am definitely stopping here!

Goodness on a little plate, or two, or three.

I had the Tuna Tartare and calamari; both are great.  Service was great, very helpful and suggestions were on point.

It's off the strip, so prices are reasonable and not crazy busy.

Would go again, just to try more plates.

Cheers and enjoy!

Celebrated a co worker's birthday dinner here. Spanish tapas that was a fun way to try the large menu selection. Overall, great service that accommodated large party (13+) and the food came fast and furious. Fan favorites were paella, tuna tartare, bacon wrapped dates, and many more!

excellent service and great tasting food.

just came back from Spain and I must say their tapa dishes taste better then few restaurants I've tried in Spain.

ordered

tun a tartare--love the taro chips

stuffed dates

baked cod

scallops escargot

chicken chorizo stuffed mushroom

desert platter-------amazing! love everything on the platter!

We were here, again, in between appointments and everything was awesome as usual. My only complaint would be that sitting inside of the restaurant doesn't feel as classy as it did sitting on the nice patio. The booths/tables seem older and just don't match with the quality of food. This time we tried the stuffed peppers that were great as well as a chicken dish that was just amazing. My lamb rocked, just as it always does!

My wife and I had a great meal here. This location has some unique flavor combinations that I would recommend to all. Starting with the bread they serve with all plates included roasted red pepper infused butter. Awesome!! Stuffed picquillo peppers with a garlic cream cheese over a tomato sauce. Wow!! Chicken tinga empanadas are a must try. While Spanish food is not generally spicy the tinga sauce does have a bite to it. I do like eating spicy food and requested something hot to complete my meal. The server,Mario, had no problem with the request and brought back roasted and chopped sorrano peppers. Really good customer service. This is another one of my must try locations to all of you visiting Vegas.

Place is outstanding! Great for groups! Bacon wrapped dates are to die for. Tapas portions are small, so order more than one of each. Every meat option they serve is incredible. Nice to get off the strip for a really delicious meal and some peace and quiet.

this is my first time at Firefly and in my opinion the ambience was great the crowd seemed to be having a fantastic time the service was respectful punctual and consistent I would definitely recommend this place again and again the food was amazing

Food was good, sangria was great, service was excellent. Went here for lunch. The atmosphere lends itself to be an upscale place in how it's lit and decorated but there are hints of being a bit like just a bar (smell, colors, etc). Overall, it was a pleasant experience.

Almost everything we ordered was delicious, and we ordered around 15 tapas. This place is a gem, especially for overpriced food served at big hotels in Las Vegas. I hope Firefly on Paradise will stay true to their quality and continue serving delicious food. Next time we are in LV we will definitely come back with our friends.

The only negative is Citrus Bliss drink ($10) -- they have to improve their cocktails if they expect people to order more of them. This one had very artificial taste, as if they added dry 20 cents mix to it so we just put it aside. In house made white wine sangria was fresh and tasty, but I would prefer it with less ice in a pitcher.

The amazing thing about ordering tapas is that you don't have to commit to a huge meal which can be hit or miss. Instead, you order a lot of different tapas for the table and have fun sampling differed food. Highly recommended!

My all time favorite restaurant in Vegas!
Great customer service and amazing food. 
Order the sangria by the pitcher for sure. 
The bacon dates are delicious but I've really never ordered anything I didn't love. You have to try the truffle fries, they are so good and great for sharing with the table. 

Make a reservation, they get really busy on weekends or when there are conventions in town. The wait has been well over 2 hours before.
Came here for lunch since everyone recommends it. Now we see why. Great fast service snd amazing delicious food!

This place is just awesome. The food and the vibe here are always good.

I've been here on multiple occasions. This place just never seems to disappoint.

Nicely decorated interior. Place was packed. Nice vibe. Very loud. Very large interior with small tables and booths. So be sure to make a reservation. 

Service was good. The waiter didn't balk at our massive order for two. Be careful though when ordering the Paella. It takes a long time to cook.

We ordered the entire menu it seemed liked:

Combo Paella - Bomb! But takes forever to come out. Order in the beginning. 

Stuffed Dates - Fire!

Tuna Poke with Chips - really good

Serrano Ham - really good

Fruit and Cheese platter - So good, I don't know why it's on the dessert menu

Beef empanada - Fire!

BBQ ribs - Fire

Lamb Chops - Bomb!

Han Croquettes - Would have been good but were cold

Fried Calamari - Good

Ricotta cheese served hot - Fire!

Steak/Shrimp/Pork skewers - So Good

Mushroom Pastry - Ok

Bread pudding - Really Good

Nutella sandwiches - ok

Ice cream - Really Good!

Red sangria - Bomb 

Overall a great place

Great place, really happening.  We found a spot in the bar area.  It was around 7:30 p.m.  and it was crowded.  We had a few tapas, I loved the stuffed dated and one of the stuffed peppers.  Also the steak tapas were really good.  I ordered a Ginger Pear martini, very nice.  This place gets pretty loud, but still fun.  Service was good, my husband loves this place, he brings people every time he is in town, so it was my turn, haha.

Chicken paella was mostly all rice, empanada was extremely oily, and salty and the pork stuffing was overcooked and dry. Service was ok, sangria was good. 
Won't be back.

Came here early on a Sat night before a show at Brooklyn Bowl. Arrived around 6pm and although the large dining room looked like it had space, we opted for bar seating and found seats immediately.  The tapas here are at least twice the size of a normal order and easy to share. We enjoyed a bottle of wine, the bacon wrapped dates, pork empanada, clams and chorizo, the octopus, and the lamb chops. Every option was cooked to perfection and delicious! We made the mistake of ordering a little too much just because of the portion size being larger than anticipated. It provided the substance we needed before a night of drinking at a concert. The icing on the cake.. our wine and feast were all for under $100!  I think I just broke $100 with a $20 tip. We will definitely be back because the service at the bar was fantastic, the food was on point, and because there is so much more that we would love to taste from this menu.  Off the beaten path.. and well worth it!!

I love this place for their sangria ! 
I would always hang out with my husband to have drinks . Tonight we came for dinner . We had a bad experience with our sever,  Irineo . He would talk to us but was always looking away , was in a rush to take our order .  But our busser Jaime was very attentive to us . Brought us water , was always around to see if we needed something . While our server was sitting down at a table. Which I believe was his friends table . Didn't care to come around at all . My husband and I are also servers so we know how this industry is . I wish we could have more people / servers like Jaime, that's are very humble and care about customer service !

This place is great! Fast, delicious and good service 

Highly recommend the sangria, albondigas, boquerones, and stuffed figs. 

Empanada was good. 

Tuna tartare was okay, as well as the gelato.

Neil our server was really attentive and friendly. I'm only giving 3 stars because the food was just ok. I felt like every dished lacked something. It was alright. Nothing special. Met up with a friend. we got two cocktails, the fries, meatballs, and apple salad off happy hour. I ordered the tuna tartare off happy hour. It was good, but like I said nothing special.

Nice atmosphere, nicely decorated, good music but a bit loud, wish they stuck more with the Latin music, it was only about half the tracks, otherwise the songs were a bit random, nothing bad though.  For a drink I tried the cherry mule, as I suspected it was pretty sweet but good flavor, would have preferred a little more ginger beer. For food we tried the baked cod which was fsntastically amazing. Albondigas (meatballs) were also pretty tasty. Chicago beef bocadillos, something went horribly wrong with this, one slice of meat was downright terrible, tasted really old with a bad texture, not good at all. Petite filet was pretty good but I've had much better, was good flavor but not super tender. Not sure the mushrooms and cream cheese paired all that well either but it was good overall. Chicken skewers were good but underwhelming, not what I was craving.  Service was excellent, didn't feel like bringing up the bad price of meat but I'm sure if I did they would've handled it.

Came for dinner. Interior was very nice and server was friendly however we were seated in the middle area near where the kitchen is and the servers kept on hitting the back of my chair when they walked by. It happened at least 8 times while sitting down so I moved my seat and a server noticed and asked about it. I said it was fine since I moved my chair but shouldn't the servers notice if they hit something as well? Food was good so points for that but it's really unnecessary to walk so fast when it wasn't even a full house. Anyways my favorite dishes were the Bacon Wrapped Dates and Scallop Escargot. Everything else I'll take a pass on, even the complimentary bread was not memorable, it was hard and stale.

A great starting point in Vegas. The Tapas are outstanding. The drinks even better. Sit at the bar while waiting on a table. Great Mojitos (Great Pours!!). The process is just order once you finish the selection you made as these are small portion dishes. Would suggest starting out with the warm spinach salad, then onto one or two of the different tapas. So stop by this place before you explore Vegas.

We were staying at the hotel right nextdoor so it was very convenient. We had 2 pitchers - one of the white chardonnay sangria and the other was mango mojito. We also had some tapas - stuffed bacon wrapped dates, artichoke toast, tuna tartare, firefly fries and ended with the passion fruit sorbet. IT WAS ALL SO MINDBLOWINGLY AMAZING. Service was fantastic, we never had to pour our own drinks. They were very helpful and extremely friendly as well. Everything was very reasonably priced as well! It wasn't cheap cheap but it wasn't exorbitantly priced either, I would definitely return next time I'm Vegas!!

I came here because I'm one food borne illness away from my goal weight!!!  Okay actually I like the food here and since it is tapas style I can put a variety of things in my mouth.  Most of the time I come in here and drink a lot so I can pretend I'm a rich old lady and the Latin staff are my hot pool boys.  That's what I love about firefly's atmosphere!

We were told this place was a good spot with a lively nightlife. When we went there only people that were there were having dinner. We went to the bar and had a drink. We ordered the infused vodka with blackberry and lychee. It tasted like syrup. We struggled to finish our drink. We didn't have any of the food. I am just rating the bar.

Loud and very busy - however, if you want to escape casino crowd, this restaurant is conveniently located on Paradise road, within walking or short taxi ride distance from many hotels on the strip.
Very good selection of drinks, from sangria to signature cocktails.
Food is served tapas style with lots of tasty options. Bacon wrapped dates, baked tetilla cheese, empanada - everything was very tasty.
Service was friendly and prompt.
Recommended.

The food and drinks were great and we are trying to have a great birthday  party. When we were done dancing we sat down and a couple came to us and  told us we needed to move that the chairs belong to them. The tone he used was rude and he was talking down and yelling us to move and get our of the chair. So we got up to avoid more conflict but he was still talking to us in a rude tone. Then his friend eas talking more trash and loud enough fIe me tp hear thsy she wanted me to say something again so she could hit me. One of ours friends  came to tell him not to talk to us that way he wanted to fight him and then his friend had more words and threatened us and continued wanting to fight. I went and got management and told him what happen. 
Management  had  three people leave and the host for salsa dancing went and brought them back in after the fact. The host then goes up to us and told us to stay on one side of the floor or she was going to call the police. We went and got management to come to tge bar and they appeared to be in shock. I ask them to explain to me why host was allowed to do that and they were unable to explain why.  We spent over 1500.00 tonight and was treated  very poorly. The host who is not an employee of fly flies  choose to keep non paying customers over paying. The fact we were planning on spending more money before the drama over 2 chairs. We won't be coming there for another event we will spend our money at another location.

Yup... it's that's good.
Steak and Mushroom skewers in a red wine reduction sauce
Camarones Diabla
Bacon Wrapped Dates
Apple Salad
Empanadas
Sangria

But the biggest plus... for anyone staying on the strip and eating in those expensive hotels is the price. Extremely reasonable for the quality of food. Best deals can be found by getting into Uber and getting off the strip.

I really don't know why this place has such a high rating. The food wasn't good, everything is like homemade with a lot of oil or butter, don't go here to attempt to eat healthy. Quality of food was prob the worst I ever had. 

I'm not trying to be mean, everyone was really nice but I just don't understand the food ....  

It's not even bar food... very confused but I guess a lot of people like it
Love their tapas! A huge selection to choose from, if you go early there is no wait, I was there at 530ish and went straight to a table. Service is always quick and food is good!

Literally every dish here is fantastic.  Service is fast and attentive.  Sangria is a must.  Can't go wrong with the empenadas, Serrano sliders, bacon wrapped dates and much more.  Definitely will be back.

Dreadful. Tapas are not meant to be mass produced. Dates, chicken tinga empanadas and baked goat cheese were good. The rest were truly mediocre ... pulpo, papas bravas, garlic shrimp, pork empanadas, etc. skip this one !
Very nice tapas restaurant.. food is innovative and tasty, great cavas... I only took one star out because of the noisy environment inside.

We came here to celebrate my sisters 30TH birthday! they were super great with us bringing a cake for her. They cut and served it for us. The food here is pretty good! i just wish they brought out our dishes in pairs or all together, since we were a party of 6 we ordered multiple dishes but we all didn't get to try the food at the same time. not a big deal though.
We sat out on their patio which is great! covered and with fans and cute patio string lights (my fav)
I would definitely recommend this place! check it out if you're ever in Vegas!

The tapas in LA area are much more flavorful. Why is this one 4 times the price? Oh wait never mind...

They tried to make a pimento kind of butter with their bread but it was more than a little sour. I don't know how. We ordered our food and my  ceviche tasted like old fish and was also pretty sour. My veggie empanada was a really weird combination of things thrown together that tasted old. And the paella, although cooked fresh, was not very flavorful. 

The servers kept ignoring us, although I wouldn't think a table of 9 is easy to miss. When they took the orders, we did ask ahead of time to split it 3-way for it to be easier. When I told her my order, I said the ceviche and veggie empanada... When the food came out, they gave us an extra plate of tartare and said I ordered it. When I said no and repeated my order, she insisted I said so, even though my eating buddies said no as well. Even more so she avoided our table, and then the new waitress came over 3 times to fill 10 ml of water (it was about an inch tall in the glass). But even then, when we told her our needs, service came really slowly (I believe water girl isn't supposed to do more than fill water and run small errands)... Probably because the other one didn't want to help us out. 

I wouldn't come back here again. I can't stand mediocre, overpriced food. We each ended up paying more than a buffet per person (except for the two girls who didn't order).

Great food, nice atmosphere! Very personal staff along with good customer service. BEST sangria in town!  A nice place to share good company and good quality food from all around the world. Definitely give this place a go if you haven't already you won't be disappointed!

Food wasn't the best. Decent but not spectacular. Fun lunch with small portions to share. Chicken skewers were flavorless and steak was very rich. Restaurant was real dark, service was slow, but price wasn't too bad.

Well rounded menu, with many different options. I ventured in for lunch, based on their Yelp reviews and I wasn't disappointed. The portion size was nice, as one dish was plenty for lunch. I ordered the steak and mushroom kabobs...delicious!  This would've a great place to go with a big group. I can only rate the one dish I enjoyed, but I can't wait to try more.

Firefly serves excellent tapas. The staff is friendly and the service is great.  We walked there (about 25 minute walk from center of strip) and returned by taxi.  We will definitely return next time we're in Vegas.

This place is mostly for locals only and it's off the strip. But any can will take you right away. The quality & taste of food as well as service is excellent and the price it's super cheap. It's Spanish cuisine and mostly tapas so there's plenty to order and taste. Portions are reasonable to sample and share. Try the chorizos, tortilla española, figs w bacon. There's plenty cold and hot tapas to choose from. Also try the sangria. At the end of the men you will leave full, happy and without breaking the bank.

Shrimp Ceviche - delicious. 
Fried Calamari - lightly fried and the spicy tartar sauce was yummy.
Firefly Fries - came with parmesan cheese on them and an aioli sauce on the side, heaven.
Garlic Bread w/ sweet creamed butter - bread was soft and the butter was mixed with some sort of spices... sad when we finished the plate.
White Sangria - sweet and tart, not disappointed.

FINALLY
Dessert Platter!
