Caramel Flan - I HATE flan, this one changed my mind. Did not have a rubbery consistency which is what usually turns me off.
Lemon Berry Tarts - sweet and tart, perfect. Lemon Berry glaze on the tart was delicious.
Mini Cheesecakes - creamy and came topped with a strawberry. Yum.
Chocolate Tres Leches Cake - amazing.

Food was so delicious and the service was fast. Irina was our waitress tonite and her busboy was ON HIS GAME. our glasses for water were rarely empty more than 2 minutes.

I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND THIS. Another bonus perk is that it's a quick walk from the Fairfield Marriott

Ate there last night with couple of friends. Food was excellent. The service is excellent. It's a tapas house so everything is a small plates serving. But the serving sizes are just right share with three other people at the table. We got six different entrées they were all good I could particularly liked the shrimp tempura but all entrees were good

I am so confused by these raving reviews. This place is pretty but the food was terrible.  Prices are now twice of what the pictures of the menus on yelp show.  The now 33 dollar pitcher of sangria tasted like rotten fruit, boxed wine, and the cheapest brandy.

OMG. I'm going to talk about food. I just had the BEST Pulpo Asado. Without a doubt the BEST Pulpo/Tako dish I have ever had. I am a foodie and I have opposable thumbs therefore I am making this food texture comparison the Pulpo was like veal. 'Like buttah'!!!!!!!

So I have to update my review because I'm blown away. Aldo was the busser and he took care of us so well. He was completely on top of our refills and clearing our table and he took our order a few times. Thank you so much Aldo for redeeming firefly for me. The food was also fantastic as always but really tonight was all about how fantastic Aldo was.

This place is awesome. The food, the ambiance, everything. I would definitely recommend the Chorizo and Clams - so much flavor! My boyfriend and I had fun picking different dishes. They have a very large menu but everything we ordered was cooked perfectly and tasted great. Firefly is my new favorite restaurant!

This is still one of the best places to eat in Vegas. Had like 10 appetizers. Too many to describe individually, but all I can say is that it was all amazing. From the sangria to the food to the dessert. One thing make sure to make a reservation.

This little hidden gem is found right outside the strip.  The service was amazing, the food was AMAZING!! We will definitely dine here again when we come back for another Vegas trip! Everything was so fresh!  Pictures are posted for some of the amazing dishes we enjoyed that afternoon!

Even if you you didn't score 2100 on your  SATs , there is always hope that you can get a good paying job as a valet at even a mediocre place like this and maybe  earn  
$ 60 K.a year.Ya'know this aint the Wynn or Caesars but of course they have a valet too even for this small lot. Just  sayin'.
As far as the place, this is the new location much improved ambiance, further back from the street, bigger, nicer, cleaner than before. Same menu and maybe a little too friendly waiters. This is primarily a local joint , but visitors have caught on too.
It's a tapas bar with some good selections;
The standouts;
Suffed dates: smoked almonds, blue cheese, dates and awesome sauce.
Stuffed peppers: w/ cheese herbs
Baby back ribs: fall off the bone tender
Tierra Mar skewers ; Surf 'n Turf for us fogies- were recommended but  a bit too many things goin' on for my taste.
Summer Salad with heirloom tomatoes- for Vegas OK - but not primo  by west coast standards.Greenhouse stuff , not the aroma you expect.
The interior is full of options, inside, outside, bar, tables what ever you like. The best thing is that with a group of people everyone will find something they can own and get behind.
Beers , or a pitcher of  white or red sangrias ,you can't beat that for  $ 28-
The place beats the pants off the typical Strip crowd, it's easy, and can be quick or slow as you like. Great early or late- you could do a lot worse.  It's more about the company you 're  with than the restaurant IMO- this place will support whatever is you are trying to make of the evening.Salut.

Ive only been to 4 tapas places in my entire lifetime, this one was memorable! We celebrated a bachelorette lunch here and the girls liked sharing the different plates we got. For me, The highlight picks were the paella, mac and cheese and egg and potato (i forgot the name!) The environment is nicely deco'd and theres a lot of seating. Customer service also good! Great tapas place to try in the area. I take one star off because they didnt have reservation slots through open table at the time i needed.

The dates are amazing. Sweet baby Jesus the pork empanadas were one of the best things I have ever eaten. The service was excellent. Also they serve PITCHERS of mojitos. Any flavor you like. Local friend recommended and it was phenomenal. Affordable and less than a $10 cab ride from Bally's.

Excellent service and delicious food! 

We avoided going to the Vegas buffets and decided to eat here instead. 

I don't think you could go wrong with any of the dishes! It's that good!

Just to give you an idea, I came with two friends and we ordered 8 small plates. We were full!

I would definitely come back!

The bacon wrapped dates were to die for. Those are worth making a trip to vegas for. Overall a very good alternative to getting food at the strip. You can have a really nice meal and not feel like you're spending an arm and a leg.

Everything I try here is delicious!  Come early and it much quieter!! You have to try the dates, mac n cheese, peppers, tuna tartare is my favorite. 
Love the tre Che for dessert.  It a great first date or anniversary experience!!!

Rick Harrison of Pawn Stars fame recommended this place, and he was right! Everything here was amazing, and we loved the tapas approach. My wife enjoyed her favorite-ever steak, the petite filet mignon, and I enjoyed a wonderful Firefly burger. Everything was full of flavor, from the diablo ketchup all the way to the bread pudding for dessert. This is a very upscale-feeling place where you can be comfortable dressing casual, too. Magnifique!

I love Firefly! I've been here a few times and I always make sure to eat here anytime I visit Vegas! This place never disappoints! The food is always on point and the atmosphere is phenomenal! Tapas are one of my favorites and they are very well done here. Lots of different options to chose from ranging from veggies to chicken or steak to seafood and just about everything in between! The red sangria is DELICIOUS AND REFRESHING! Can't wait to go back!

My wife and had dinner rather late around 10pm and it was maybe 50 % occupied. We ordered the combo paella first because it takes about 40 to 50 minutes. We had the patatas brava and wasn't to impressed by it the potatoes were not crispy my daughter had this in Barcelona and it was not up to par and we also had the huevos estrellados which is similar to the braves but with a fried egg and chorizo.  I was waiting for the server to mention that I had  2 potato dishes but he said nothing and it was a little better but I have to say that both potato dishes seemed like they sat around for awhile. Someplace place use the 2 fry method to crisp them up but it seems like over fried once trying crisp them but it was not.

Then we had octopus(pulpo Saadi)was really good and tender.  Next came the warm Spinach salad and it's just okay.    The ipaella finally showed up and it was okay but not prepared properly it had no socarrat at the bottom of the pan which I was looking for; the flavor was rather muted.

We had dessert the cherry bread pudding and flan.   The bread could have more edge it lacked any cherry flavor but the flan was one the best I had in flavor and texture not heavy or aerated it was perfect.

We picked Firefly for our 11/12 wedding reception, as this was frequently one of our favorite places in Vegas for dinner, and they had a nice banquet room, big enough for our party (45 people). I communicated primarily with Regina to set everything up. I'm a project manager, so I tend to over communicate, and communicate frequently, and expect the same in return. Sometimes I would have to follow-up for a response, which made me hesitant at times, but on the day of the event, it was clear that everyone (including all of the vendors) had communicated just fine, and Regina had everything set up perfectly. Our other vendors included a DJ, Elvis w/ Showgirls, & a Desert Bar. We had a bar set up in the back for our guests, and we thought they did a great job separating the rooms for cocktail hour, dinner, and dancing. The best part, Firefly's food! It did not fail. I was nervous that if we had a lot of food, it would come out cold, and slow. I was wrong. It came out hot, and quick. The only complaint from my guests were that they wish they knew what was coming out- as they ate a lot in the beginning, but didn't realize how many courses there were. My Grandmother wasn't a fan of the food (very different for her!), but they were so nice to make her some ribs with no sauce, and she was happy. All in all, we were very happy with our event at Firefly, and I was glad I didn't need to worry about a thing! Thank you!!

Great Spanish tapas for a birthday family lunch. All ages OK in the restaurant. We had a party of 7 and were quickly seated about 1PM. Jesus was our server and was very attentive throughout the meal. The warm bread served with the honey butter is always a nice way to start the meal, of course we had another hot batch mid way ;-)

We started out with waters and a pitcher of sparkling sangria. Very good and dangerous as you can barely taste any alcohol 5/5. We began with some stuffed dates which are... amaze balls 5/5! We also had a couple orders of the Firefly fries 3/5 and a tomato basil soup 2/5. 

Since we arrived early in the day they had breakfast tapas available so we tried the Huevos Rancheros 4/5 and the brunch potato bravas 4/5. Camarones Al Ajillo were very good 5/5. We also ordered some of my favorites: Scallop Escargots 4/5, Tierra Mar Skewers 4/5, Albondigas 5/5 and another 2 orders of stuffed dates. To try something new we ordered the Petite Filet 4/5, Pulpo Asado 4/5 and fried calamari 4/5.

Overall a good lunch and everyone enjoyed the variety. For dessert they brought out a flan and sang Happy Birthday. The rest of us tried the Banana Beignet 4/5 and the trio of Gelato 4/5.

Thank you Firefly for making this a memorable birthday lunch! Will be back for Happy Hour as this is one of our faves!

We were a party of six and we sat in a booth in the back which was perfect so we could talk.All of our dishes we delicious.My favorite was the tuna stuffed pepper and the shrimp tempura. I WANTED TO go back for Sunday brunch! It's a bit loud for a large party, but,I will definitely make it a go to place on future visits.

Another good meal but we were lucky enough to eat there at Happy Hour. Eight tapas and two drinks for $44 was a bargain. And we enjoyed most of our eight dishes.  Favorite is the bacon covered date with some sauce and cheese.  Service was excellent, everyone was nice and the place is classier than most.

Good stuff! Delicious tapas at this place, with great atmosphere, convenient off-the-strip location, etc. This place should definitely be on your list if you're heading to Vegas. The short ribs, Mac and cheese, and empanadas were all great.
Amazing!  Came here 3 years ago.  New look.  New vibe.  Food was exceptional!  Price was spot on.  Are new favorite tapas spot.

Fire fly was on FIRE tonight! I always love the atmosphere especially on the weekdays around dinner time it's not as busy and you can request a booth for just two! The sangrias are amazing and the red one is my favorite. The ceviche tastes so authentic to me it's so limey and good! I also got the lentils with veggies which are delicious as well and the tomato basil soup is great so is the baked cod but they put too much fried onion on top next time I'll say light on it or non at all. The customer service is great he kept making sure we are good!! I highly recommend this place! I heard they have great brunch I need to try it sometime!

Visited this place without a reservation, upon arrival the wait was estimated 1 hour for table for two. It was a Saturday and prime time for dinner. We got lucky and found a spot at the bar. Our server was super cute, and sweet. The pitcher of sangria is huge, wasn't able to finish it, which is not a complaint by any means lol. Tuna tartar is fucking amazing, great quality. Ham & Cheese Croquetas were crispy on outside and super cheesy and delicious. Calamari was cooked to perfection. The Tierra y Mar skewers:shrimp, steak, sausage was filing and great flavor. Apple and manchego salad was refreshing, but not my favorite. We ordered the stuffed dates to finish, so damn rich in flavor and delicious. Service was quick sitting at the bar. My only complaint is their restroom situation, it's located through the kitchen and it was super confusing I just decided to hold it. Would dine here again, so much more to sample.

Amazing describes my dinner with my husband. We pretty much had little to no wait time and are at the bar. The bartender was super nice. Good was affordable, fast, and filling. The octopus was to die for and the passion fruit cheesecake is a great way to finish the meal. I am dreaming about it as I wrote now.

I was excited to come here after reading all of the reviews. I was in town on vacation, and many friends had recommended this place. 

Thankfully, I made a reservation. There was a huge line when we arrived. I liked the feel of the restuarant, but wasn't blown away by the food. Maybe it's because I live in NYC and we have some amazing tapas places (Boqueria), but I wasn't so impressed. The sliders were delicious, but the paella left something to be desired. It was dry and not very flavorful. 

I wouldn't come back to the restaurant when I am on vacation, but if I was a local, I could see myself coming back for drinks. Seems like a great place for a date.

Let me start by saying Pepe, my waiter is the best waiter I've ever had in my life. No kidding. This place was already a favorite of my mine just because of the food but the service was amazing tonight.  Pepe kept my glass full, ensured there were no food allergies, really just went the extra mile. Hands down great service. He said he inly serves on Friday nights. .. not sure why though because he's great at what he does. I'll def be requesting his section going forward. 

Food is delicious. Worth the wait every time to enjoy this great food. Red sangria is my favorite, order by the pitcher, it's a better deal and ur going to want a few glasses! 

Thank you Firefly for great service with Pepe and delicious food!

The food was great. We had the tomato-basil soup, Grilled Veggies, Firefly fries, and warm spinach salad. The house Sangria was awesome as well.

It was a nice sunny day and they have a nice patio!

Service - meh. The waiter brought in 2 wrong dishes even though we asked questions about those dishes before ordering. By the time the food arrived, we had already waited more than 30 minutes.

I guess the worst part of the experience was that I was charged double the actual amount that I signed for. I called to correct this, and they were very nice, friendly and apologetic but its more than a month later and I still don't have a refund. My advice would be to check your bill twice and make sure you keep a copy in case you need to dispute it later.

This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. The menu has a wide variety and since the portions are small, you can try so many different things. The octopus, grilled shrimp, petite fillet were among my favorites. Great ambiance!
amazing food. bacon wrapped dates. filet mignon perfect. diablo shrimp and sangria all amazing! great food great drinks amazing service!!!!

Where am I?? Barcelona! Amazing tapas and delightful sangria. Loved the padron peppers, shrimp ceviche, eggplant cannelloni, camerone al ajillo and empanadas.  New favorite Vegas dining location! Great service and upbeat atmosphere.
The food is amazing! Best tapa definitely the camerones de la diabla (name may not be correct)! The service is awesome. Great experience overall!
Ordered an UberEats delivery from here and every single thing I got was amazing

I honestly come to Vegas all the time and had no clue this place existed. I am so happy my friend took me here. The server(Mario) was very accommodating to the allergies in our group and super nice. The tapas are so delicious. My fav was the Mac n cheese and the firefly french fries. Basically anything with cheese was super sexy. Def coming back.

I should've done this sooner, but we celebrated my best friends birthday on March 31st and Fireflys did a wonderful job at accommodating our entire party. Our server was Ivan and he was just awesome! The manager on duty was awesome as well although I can't remember his name. Fireflys is one of my favorite places to grab a bite to eat and have some drinks. Their food is amazing and my favorite drink is the sparkling Sangria which is amazing as well.
Firefly is my go-to restaurant in LV. I'm never disappointed. The staff is great and there's nothing I've ordered that I wouldn't order again. Yummmmm!

Awesome service and atmosphere. The menu is deep and diverse with something for everyone's taste buds. 

Took a group of six for lunch today. Everything was amazing. I especially liked the beef skewers, the and the artichoke hearts. We sampled 7 dishes and ordered a total of 10, since we doubled up on the skewers, the artichoke, and croquettes (so amazingly good!)

The sangria was also great. Overall I would highly recommend it
I love this place! We come eat here every time we are in Las Vegas. Delicious, flavorful tapas & sangria!
Came here with a friend.  Great place to share several items.  Everything we had was great.   The sangria is delicious as well.  The portions are large for small plates.

Thanks to Alejandro Garcia and the chef our trip to Firefly was enjoyable and delicious! We ordered the escargot, the huevos estradelldos, the skirt steak, calamari, empanadas, petite filet, tuna tartar finishing up with the flan and tres leches. Everything was perfect and we can't wait to come back!
Amazing food and experience. Make sure to order the ahi tuna tartare and baked goat cheese. Our server Eder was AWESOME!!

We ordered so many things I can't even remember! I do however remember the LAMB! Melt in your mouth and full of amazing flavor! The mac n cheese was delicious! And please order the pitcher of sparkling sangria!!!! It is the BEST I've ever had!!! How will my life go on without that, I have no idea! 
A MUST!!!

We came Friday night around 6:30, and there was no wait. How lucky are we!! We sat down and Alejandro took our orders. He was friendly, courteous, and helpful. We ordered the seafood paella, lamb chops, bacon wrapped dates, and the shrimp cervici. The dates were a bit too sweet for my liking. The lamb chops though tasted perfecto!!! Yummm.... The paella was cooked great but a huge portion and it came after the tapas with good timing. 

All in all its a great place to be and the service was excellent thank you !!

Ceviche of shrimp was my favorite tapa here. From there on we paired the Firefly fries, Firefly fish sticks, and Serrano ham sliders together for a full meal. The ham sliders were actually more like hamburgers but were the better off the three. Four dishes and we were stuffed. Felt a little expensive but they are tapas so we knew what we were getting ahead of time.

Came here as a farewell Sunday brunch to reflect on all the poor decisions we made over the weekend in Vegas. And it was also my mom's birthday.

I live in LA, where "tapas" are like $20 each and you get a serving that looks like a Costco sample. I was hesitant about coming here but I wanted to try and be a good son for once so we tried it out. 

The menu is HUGE. Lots of options that made the decision difficult so we just said funk it and ordered a bunch of stuff. Avocado toast, chilequiles, steak and mushroom skewers, calamari, a couple other things I can't remember, and the chicken mushroom paella. The paella was decent, nothing groundbreaking, but all the tapas were DELICIOUS. And affordably priced for the generous portions. I was surprised. We didn't really need to eat the paella by the time it came out but we're American so obviously we didn't just stop eating when we were full. Come on.

Service was kind of bad, but the waiter made up for it by offering a complimentary espresso and a flan for my mother. I didn't eat any, but my mom said the flan was amazing. Now she's inspired and sending me pics of her in the kitchen at home working on her own flan recipe. Thanks Firefly...you inspired a new chef.

If you're looking for tapas in Vegas, this is the place to go! My friends and I came here for dinner one night and ordered the Mixed Paella and 4 tapas to share. We also ordered a pitcher of Sangria. The Sangria was light and sweet. The Paella takes about 40 minutes to prepare so make sure you order that with your waiter as soon as you sit down! 

They bring out a nice garlic herb bread with sweet almond butter while you are waiting for your food. my party ordered the ceviche, tuna tartare with taro chips, bacon-wrapped stuffed dates, and pulpo asado (grilled octopus). All of the tapas were delicious and left us craving for more but we knew not to order any more while we waited on our paella. The paella came out and it was huge! I do not understand how a paella serves 2-4 people. I cannot imagine 2 people sharing a whole paella. The paella was good with a nice assortment of seafood and meats. However, it was a little disappointing that the paella didn't have any soccarat at all. I understand that it was probably because they were in a rush to serve us since we were sitting there with no food after we finished our tapas. However, I would have rather waited for the paella to finish cooking fully. 

Overall, good food, good service and nice atmosphere/decor! I would definitely just stick with the tapas next time though. 

P.S. it is a little pricey but it's Vegas, right?

This is very mediocre "spanish" cuisine.  The Serrnao ham had the descriptor "Iberico" next to it but it tasted like it came straight out of a package from Giant or Safeway.  It was hidden on the plate by thick blocks of cheese (again tasted like it came straight out of a grocery package).  The grilled octopus was overpowered by both in taste and presentation by the sauce.  The saving grace was the paella which was passable but unfortunately, it was overcooked.  On a side note, how do you call yourself a Spanish restaurant when you serve butter with your bread?

This restaurant is delicious and is very cost effective (especially for Las Vegas standards). I actually came here by myself while attending a conference and liked it so much that when my boyfriend joined me for the weekend we went back here. The Chicken Tinga Empanada is amazing, should be your first choice tapa! The patatas bravas are classic. Got a strawberry mojito too, which I would also recommend. Ambiance and service are good too...aka you should definitely go here for dinner.

This was one of the first restaurants in Vegas we went to and we were not disappointed.  Very clean, great food and service.  Very busy, but we were able to get right in.  We made an evening out of the many different dishes and we enjoyed them all.  The plates are actually bigger than you would expect and we probably ordered more food than we actually needed... But, it was so good and different!  Highly recommend and the prices were fair.  My fiancee' loved their Mojito's!

Even on a Monday this place is great for after work drinks or dates or just come with friends the vibe very hip they have a bar in the middle and an outside patio area .the dress is dressy casual in case the ladies were wondering ..the servers are great very attentive and friendly and the food is perfect small bites of a variety !!!!

After 30 minutes waiting we decided to take one of the bar tables and keep ourselves busy until the 45 mins to 1 hr waiting was over and we could get a table. We were 4 bar tall tables with 2 chairs each. 2 of us took the chairs and 2 were standing. Before we could order drinks someone came and told us we can't take that table without ordering and it's not our turn yet! There were 3 other empty small bar tables! For a Monday night we decided it was not worth the wait in a place where we couldn't even get a drink when waiting and left.
I really enjoyed Firefly. I went for dinner with a co worker and we really enjoyed our meals and the atmosphere.  we got several small plates and all of them were good.

This place a amazing. We ate outside and it was so nice and open. Service was good our waiter was friendly and attentive. The tapas plates were of average size. The bacon wrapped dates were so good so flavorful I would just come back for that dish!  The muscles in a curry sauce as ok could have more flavor to it. Got to have the red sangria we had two pitchers so good!

Located just South of the Strip, Firefly on Paradise has become an essential stop that brightens the already ecstatic Vegas experience usually felt by yours truly.

This place oozes Vegas in all senses. From the dim lights above, to the bright lights around the bar and along the walkways, the banter, laughter, cheers, showoffs, care-nots, great service and what matters the most, GREAT food.  

The wait was (and usually is) relatively long as we entered the packed house. It was just my sister and I.. that being the case, we noticed a couple available stools bar-top and nabbed them on the (fire)fly. It's not necessarily the case in ALL restaurants with a bar, but I noticed that because there's more action here, you'll probably get an attentive bartender, prompt service and  a quicker food turn around time. 

Spanish tapas / small plate style.. Ladies and gentlemen, this means you'll be eating more than one dish tonight!  

First dish that was placed before us was the chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms.. though quite small in size, they definitely pack a punch when it comes to flavor.. probably because of the chorizo.

Second, Serrano Sliders.. mini burgers with Serrano ham, bleu cheese & crispy onions, cooked Medium rare; Not sure why we ordered mini-burgers.. they played the 'void' filler until our next dish arrived. I enjoyed the bleu cheese, but asked for medium rare and they came back to us a little too well done.. dry & crunchy. They happily replaced them and got us a new order within minutes. Very nice service.

Third, Steamed Mussles.. steamed in white wine with an heirloom tomato, garlic, herb butter with parmesan crustini. I'm not even a fan of the things, but the Mussels were the best tasting seafood item that I've had in a quick minute. It's really the sauce that made it.. the best way I can describe it would be the equivalent to a creamy Alfredo, minus the pasta. It masked that 'fresh out of the water' taste, which I don't mind.

And Fourth, the item that stole my heart.. the baby back ribs covered with an out of this world BBQ mango sauce. Fall off the bone tenderness covered with a sweet finger lickin' sauce that'll have your tongue and lips slurpin' and smackin' through every bite. I'd get a full rack of these alone. Straight up, yo. 

Our bartender was on point; we were continuously checked on, had our waters refilled, if my beer was low another was offered (this is how you keep me here) and aside from the slider mishap.. everything here was tasty and the atmosphere sparked the perfect start for our night. We'll be back to explore the rest of that menu!

Thank you yelpers.... I was in the area and was looking for a good meal.  Yelpers directed me here and it was OUTSTANDING!!!  Service was great and the food was the bomb.  Waitress recommended most of our dishes and she knew her stuff.  Highly recommended.

My friend Karen recommended this place, it was fantastic!  We ordered the manchego mac-n-cheese, patatas braves, vegetarian empanada, and the stuffed red bell pepper.  At first, I thought having one empanada wasn't enough, but with the other dishes combined, it turned out I couldn't eat another bite!  We also ordered a pitcher of their delicious red sangria.

What I also liked about this place was there were a lot of vegetarian options, which I usually don't see at a tapas place.

We also ordered the spicy chickpeas, but it never came out.  I'm glad it didn't because, like I said, I was full.  I would love to come back here and try more of their dishes.

Good was good, service left a lot to be desired. We waited 30 minutes between plates. I ordered a medium petite filet and it was cooked to death and flavorless. The patatas bravas, smoked salmon, tuna tartar and camarones diablas were all delicious! The sangria was heavenly

I go to Firefly every time I come to Las Vegas, which is a couple times a year. Service this last time was adequate, in the past has always been fun and flirty with an attractive and attentive wait staff. The place is always noisy, so don't expect an intimate conversation!

So many great bites to choose from, some of my favorite are the Ahi Tuna Skewer, Steak & Mushroom Skewer, Baked Goat Cheese, Camarones ala Diabla, and Camarones Al Ajillo. The Stuffed Dates are usually my top pick, but they skimped on the goat cheese and the dates where tiny and dry this time. While the Flourless Chocolate Cake with raspberries was tasty, it was not moist. 

I'll definitely will be back again soon, just hope they tweak the shortcomings I noticed this last time.

Long overdue review. Came here in Feb during our trip to Vegas. This was the one restaurant that I was dying to try in Vegas. So I made the BF drive here straight from the airport, even before we checked into our hotel.  

Firefly sits in an unassuming location off the strip. I didn't expect it to be so big inside, but I guess everything is bigger in Vegas (or is that Texas?). Anyway, came during late lunchtime on a weekday, so the place was pretty empty. The menu looked so good that I wanted to order one of everything, but the BF convinced me to start with just five dishes first, probably a more sensible approach. 

Here are the dishes we tried:
Stuff Dates - my favorite dish! To be fair, I rarely met a stuffed date dish that I didn't like. The combination of the soft sweet dates, crunchy salty bacon and the stinky Gorgonzola cheese is just heavenly. 

Lamb Chops - oh how I love my lamb chops. I always try order it when I see it on the menu, even though most of my friends can't stand the taste of lamb (whatever, more for me). The chops here were seasoned well and perfectly cooked. The accompanied lentils and vegetables made me feel healthy, despite the fact that I just inhaled two lamb chops. 

Stuffed Peppers - not a dish that I would normally order, but I am so glad I listened to our waiter and got it here. The peppers had just a hint of spiciness and provided a perfect balance to the creamed cheese. I still think about this dish today... 

Shrimp in Sweet & Spicy Sauce - shrimps were well cooked, I didn't really taste the spicy note in the sauce, but it was a good sauce nevertheless 

Tuna Tartare - the most average dish among the ones we tried. I didn't think the tuna was very flavorful, although the taro chips were good. 

Trio of Gelato and Chocolate Tres Leches Cake - oh that cake, it was what dreams were made of, so fluffy, so moist and so chocolaty. I would marry it if I could. Or at least date it for as long as I can without the BF getting jealous. It was sooo perfect. The gelato were good too, but, they were like the jealous bridesmaids next to the cake. 

The service was a little weird, our waiter was extremely attentive in the beginning with recommendations and water refills. All five of our dishes came out in extremely quick successions, I understand the place was pretty quiet, but they could've slowed down and allowed us to savor the food instead of rushing us. Our small table was covered in plates in the span of 10 minutes. Also, our waiter disappeared once we've put the dessert and coffee order in.  I had to track down another waiter to finally get my coffee. Moreover the coffee came in a comically small cup, it was more like an espresso cup. I would normally take off a star for the weird service, but the food was soooo good that I am will to overlook it. 

Overall, I highly recommend the place, wish they would open an outpost in NYC!!

Small tapas plates style restaurant. Food and service are both good. Would come back again. Not far off the strip and worth it. Got tired I eating on the strip with overpriced and low quality this took care of that. With a try.

Amazing food.. And when I say amazing.... I mean absolutely amazing! The service... Well that is just icing on the cake. Every time I come, we are treated with the most amazing service I have ever experienced. Every server is on top of their game as well as super personable, attentive and friendly. Today we had Samantha and like usual, we were not disappointed! She took care of us with a friendly smile and quick efficient service. We are always bringing our friends here, introducing the "amazingness" that  IS Firefly.

First time a couple years ago and everything was really good.

When I came back in July 2017, everything was subpar.

Best dish we had was:
chorizo clams
tuna tartare

would not order again:
stuffed dates (bacon charred, not very appetizing)
tierra y mar skewers (good but not memorable)
camarones a la diabla (they said the sauce was great...but it was not)
chocolate cherry bread pudding

Probably the best food i've had in Vegas in years. Not blazingly authentic in the dishes, but the spirit is good. We were lucky to get sucked in on a dinner with the sales guy and some customers, so a lot higher budget than normal. Still exceptional. Good service, great food.

This was a wonderful Tapas restaurant not far from the strip.  The food was fantastic and the service was great as well.  The stuffed dates were to die for!  The sliders were probably our least favorite of everything we ordered (and we ordered a lot :) ).  Can't wait to go back on our next trip!

Delicious off strip meal. Mrs and I have now been a couple times and enjoyed it. It's easy to get caught up in ordering too much but just go for it. The food and drinks are amazing. Highly recommend the mojitos by the pitcher, and if you can get there for happy hour they are only $18.

Amazing service and delicious food!!! I am a local and I enjoy coming to this place every time because every time servers like Oscar make my time there super special by recommending new things to try (like the tres leches cake...yummy!)  Sangria is a MUST with your tapas which always hit the spot and are not too heavy because the portions are just perfect.  

If you're a tourist and are looking for the perfect spot to have drinks while having a good ambience, definitely go here.  Love dining on the outdoor patio filled with charming lights and Spanish music. On Friday nights they even have Latin dancing!
Good menu, decent prices, service can get a bit bogged down during peak hours. Well worth a visit, just aim for an off hours visit if you can.

My wife remember coming here a while back and so she said we had to go.  Happy she made me because this place is great!  Definite bang for your buck. We ordered the paella and almost killed it lol, definitely serves 4!

We also got some other tapas that were very good.  For dessert I got the chocolate tres leches cake. Yummy!!

This review is long overdue!  My boyfriend and I visited Las Vegas for the first time last Valentine's day.  We stayed on the strip for all of our dining and entertainment.  On our last day, we were getting ready to drive home and had to go to the outskirts to fill up on gas, when we passed by this restaurant!  We were both hungry and saw that it offered small plates, tapas, which was just our style so we decided to go for it!  I can't remember what we ate, but it was SO yummy!!!  I am so happy that we happened upon this cute little place, and the next time we're in Vegas we're definitely going back!!

Unprofessional stuff. For example: we order sparkling water it came later than food cause they forgot, than they brought bottle with only one glass. Food was ok, but we ordered skewer medium well, it came bloody. Very loud inviroment. The wine glass was sticky on the outside. I don't  know, just whole dinner experience was ruined.

Went for lunch, service was great, & food was so yummy! Had stuffed dates,  Apple salad, calamari, & scallops for tapas, & shared a mixed paella. Already too full, but the desserts were calling to us, so we had the tres leche cake & bread pudding...oh boy! So delicious! The service was very good & pleasant. Not crowded at lunch, but I imagine it's probably not the case in the evening. Such a nice change from the casino scene.  Go try!!

I love this place!
Lets start with the bread with that amazing butter that I just can't have enough of.
Then I ordered the 
stuffed dates: I could eat 100 of those.
Camarones a la diabla, that sauce goes good with anything I used the sauce to dip my fries.
Stuffed peppers: ok..
Sliders: soooo good!!
Croquetas: like
And for dessert a tres leches cake, I know traditional tres leches cake and I've never seen a chocolate tres leches but it was good.
Definitely coming back.

Came here while my brother and I were at a business conference. We heard so many great things about it and had to check it out. When you sit down they give you some garlic bread with an amazing butter spread. The butter tasted like some herb/chipotle/garlic butter. We ordered ribs which melted off the bone. Even when we tried grabbing the bone the meat was falling off. It was one of our favorite dishes. We also had chicken skewers that were just okay. They were a little chewy and the sauce could of been better. For the most part service was great and the food was good! I will for sure be back the next time I am in Vegas!

Great location off the strip. Easy to find, plenty of parking. We went for an early dinner on a Monday night and sat out on the patio. Attentive service and fantastic food. We had the shrimp ceviche, croquettes, baked goat cheese and petite filet. Generous portions and this was more than enough food for the 2 of us.

Back again to treat my daughter and daughter-in-law for mother's day. Our reservation for 3 plus an infant was 545 on Saturday night. Although not a place you would normally take a baby, the girls just moved to Vegas and a sitter was not an option. They kindly accommodated us in a corner booth with plenty of room for the baby. (She slept most of the time and then smiled at & watched the staff bustling around). On top of the dishes from my first visit, we added the mushroom  tart, tuna tartare, lemon & berry tarts, stuffed dates. Again, it was all delicious. I tried the blood orange mojito which was so good I had a second. 

This place is a gem. There isn't another restaurant I've been to twice in 6 months, and I'd go back here today. If Vegas locals aren't eating here, they're missing out!

Love coming here for a tasty bite that doesn't break the bank like most restaurants on the strip. Be prepared for a hefty selection of tapas options. 

I really like the apple and manchego salad - a nice combination of tart/sweet and salty.

Mac n cheese is a tasty choice as well. Of course, you have to get the bacon wrapped dates. Just don't freak out when you find a hard thing in the middle - it's just a crunchy almond. 

Fries were meh when I went - they weren't freshly fried. 

The best thing about this place is it's open until 1am for those late weekday parties.

Great tapas! The bacon wrapped dates everyone talks about is a MUST! Sounds strange but we ordered a second order after the first was devoured so fast. Everything was exceptional except for the paellas. At roughly $25 a pop we thought it'd be delicious. It was too saucy which made the rich soggy. The seafood paellas mussels and fish were both way over cooked and the chicken and mushroom one was not spectacular. 

Service was great. Go with and group.

We were visiting Las Vegas with family and friends to celebrate my wife's birthday last weekend...about 16-18 of us...and was recommended to Firefly by local friends who live in Vegas. The staff really took care of us, the service was excellent, the food was really good,decent portions for tapas style and reasonably priced. Our wait staff even came out with a birthday dessert for my wife and her cousin who was also celebrating her birthday. Would definitely recommend Firefly to anyone who wants to have some good food, a casual restaurant with nice ambiance and an overall good time. Thanks for helping to make my wife's birthday memorable.

We have eaten there a number of times in the past but will never return. Dishes were dirty and a few of the food items were cold including shrimp tempura which I have never had cold. We told the waiter but all he said was ( oh, it's cold ). Never offered to make good on cold items. They also are expensive for the product you and then charge 20 % gratuity for four adults and two children. We will never go back. I can see why the health Dept closed them

One of the best tapas places I've been too and I've eaten tapas in Spain. (Humble brag)

Make sure you make reservations because people started piling in on a Friday night when we went at 6:30. 

Feel free to take a taxi here, there's a greeter/valet team outside who'll help you get one back to your hotel.


The service here is quick and the menu is huge.  
Not only was everything fatty and buttery and delicious but the portions are huge!!!! 

Great value and perfect spot to sit in the patio with girlfriends

Firefly is the place to go if you're craving delicious small plates and alcohol. The interior is decorated with dark red walls and paintings.

They have a wide variety of items you can choose from, and basic items with a twist. They also serve paella that is made to order, so you have to give them 40 minutes to prepare. 

They start you off with some garlic bread and their house butter. It was sweet, and balanced very well with the savory flavors.

We ordered the firefly fish sticks, and I was pleased with the crispness of the Japanese bread crumbs. The spicy tartar sauce wasn't spicy at all, but it had a slight kick to it. 

The vegetable empanada was delicious. The breading had a wonderful texture; soft, buttery and flakey. 

We also ordered ribs, that were doused in their mango barbecue sauce. The meat just fell off the bone. It was so soft and tender! The mango chunks and the sweetness of the sauce created a beautiful symphony of flavors!

Finally, we finished the meal off with a pan of chicken and mushroom paella. It was filled with flavors, that just made you want to eat more! By this point of the meal, I was already full, but I just couldn't stop eating.

To top it all off, we then ordered a chocolate tres leches, which was also very delicious. Super soft and moist! Tastes even better with the chocolate bits drizzled around the plate!

I had an amazing experience here at firefly. Definitely would like to come back to try their other tapas options. One of those places where you don't regret spending a bit more for some small plates!

Firefly is awesome! The varied selection of tapas is top-notch, as is the flavor of the many tapas my party and I tried. We ordered about half of the tapas on the menu and we found them all delicious. The sparkling sangria is delicious as well..strong yet fruit at the same time. The butter that accompanies the complimentary bread is, in all honesty, finger-lickin' good and I wish I had the recipe! Oh, and the desserts are just to die for! We ordered the dessert platter which included the caramel flan, chocolate tres leches cake, lemon-berry tarts, and passion fruit cheesecake. To say that these deserts were exquisite would be an understatement! 

The service was great as well, zero complaints there! The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is that the atmosphere was not what one would think one when thinking of a Spanish tapas restaurant. We expected it to be more lively and vivacious but it was more quite and mellow than we had hoped. Still, I highly recommend Firefly!

When friends visit from out of town and we are looking to bring them off the strip for something a little different we often find ourselves headed to Firefly. There is something here for people of nearly all tastes and as others have mentioned all of the Paella variations are excellent. The tapas are small and relatively inexpensive allowing even a smaller group to sample an impressive variety of dishes. Definitely worth a try.

We had read that this place was vegan friendly so when our friends suggested we meet there for dinner, we made reservations. So glad we did. They were very busy. No parking available in the back, had to valet which was free. My husband and I like to order different plates and then share them, so the small plates here just fit us perfectly. We had bacon wrapped dates, clams and chorizo, lamb chops, grilled octopus, and mango BBQ ribs. My vegan son had the lentils and veggies and the tomato bread. Everything was hot, tasty, and served just at the right time. The staff was busy but very friendly and provided good service. Dessert was Nutella and banana for hubby and coconut sorbet for our son. The place is very very loud   but it was packed with big parties celebrating birthdays so understandable. The food and service are both high quality. We will go back to this one.
Great restaurant for tapas. Went here for a birthday party and service was impeccable. Will certainly return!

i have mixed feelings about spanish tapas places in general but i did have a really enjoyable meal here. my friend and i each had a sangria, red and white, and both were really good, not too sweet, and shared the following:

tuna tartare, roasted eggplant, spicy beef salad, grilled octopus, lamb chops, and empanadas. everything was really good but a lot of them were on the salty side. my favorites were the octopus, which was super super tender, and the tartare, which is almost always my favorite anywhere it's good. this one could have used more avocado, but that's just a personal preference.

one complaint i have about the place that's not really a complaint is that the portion size is huge - the biggest i've ever seen with tapas. it just made me sad because we had to order everything to try it, but couldn't finish everything. as with any tapas, a bigger group is better. regardless i would have liked to see smaller portions at slightly lower prices, though the prices are still really reasonable.

the service was good and the place was just a normal seeming restaurant atmosphere wise. this is only the second tapas place i had tried in vegas and the other was the fancy one in the aria on the strip. this is way better!

We had a table for 20 on Friday night - it was a pre-party for our wedding the following day. Daniel was our server, and he was AMAZING! We ordered pitcher after pitcher of sangria and mojito (so yummy!). He was on top of everything the whole time. The seafood paella was the highlight for me - but the table was full of tapas and everyone raved about their food. It was my first time at Firefly. I will be back every time I am in town now. Fabulous evening all around.

Love this place 

There sangria is to die for  you can't go there and not have sangria it's the best. The infused shots they have are yummy! 

I always get the ceviche and there mac and cheese both are super delicious! Everything there is good don't think I've had anything bad!
One of our Las Vegas favorites, celebrating our anniversary~dessert on the house.  Thanks to our awesome waiter Nahum

I am going to be thinking about the meal we had here for awhile and crying because there is not one near my house. Flavors were amazing. We ordered about 12 dishes and all were so good. Food came out fast and staff was great. 

SO FREAKING GOOD!!!

GREAT SERVICE! GREAT FOOD! The manager Eduardo went above and beyond out of his way to make sure we had a memorable dining experience. He felt a little bad bc there was confusion when we got sat and it took a little bit too long for our server to get to us. Thank you Eduardo for everything I have a new found love for this place.

This place is always impressing me. I went and they were doing an art sale. our servers were so attentive it was fabulous. the food exceptional as always. the chorizo stuffed clams were to die for. of course we ended with the chocolate tres leches . thanks for a great date night.

I dare you to name something that IS NOT good here!!!
Ok, maybe the paella isn't in par with Miami, but still darned good!!

I have been to numerous restaurants in Las Vegas, but Firefly is my favorite. It is off the strip, but very close, so well worth the trip.

First, you should order the sangria. Delicious! The menu is primarily made up of small plates, or tapas. There is a large variety of selections, from salads, to chicken and steak, to seafood. Most are prices from $6 to 11 each. We have been there numerous times, so we've had many of their offerings, which are consistently excellent.

In our most recent trip, we were served by Alejandro and his assistant, Roberto. Both were personable and attentive. They made great recommendations, which helped us, even though we have been several times before.

We started with the plate of serrano ham and manchego cheese. Served with bread and sun dried tomatoes, it was a great start.

We followed this up with the pardon peppers and pork empanadas. Both were great. The pork empanadas were cooked perfectly and tasted terrific.

We followed these with an order of the Tierra y Mar skewers (skewers of shrimp, beef and chorizo) and another order or sangria! When we asked Roberto about his favorite dish, he suggested an order of the camarones a la diabla, so we ordered that, too. Both dishes were outstanding!

Without saying much, the second pitcher of sangria was better than the first.

All in all, another outstanding experience at Firefly. If you go to Las Vegas, this off the strip gem is not to be missed!

This was good, not over the top amazing tho. The good stuff was great but other things were good (borderline ok). Nothing was bad but service was friendly but sometimes hard to find. They seem to rely heavy on spice too. I will go here again for sure, great break from the strip stuff.

Wow, just super good. I got the Diablo shrimp, potatoes (papatas), mixed salad with dried cherries and mandarin oranges. One point! Service is really great as well, constant water refills and great guidance through the menu.

First time here. Was hungry as hell and didn't know what to order. But our server Rojelio made AWESOME suggestions. We left it up to him to bring out what we had. He had a great helper Jazzey who made sure our plates were taken once done. Waters were refilled really quickly. This is what we had...
Mango ribs... tender. Sauce was over powering
Bacon wrapped dates...delish 
Tuna tartar... my favorite
Ceviche... good amount of lemon and came with these hand fried tortillas
Mac and cheese... ehhhh
Marinara sauce and a glop of cheese in the middle. BOMB with the bread
Surf and turf skewers. Tender. Was excellent combo with the steak shrimp and sausage.
Filet mignon on a bed of spinach and fried onions soooooooo tender
We had a few more thing but we were starving from being out on the strip. Overall. This would defiantly be a place to visit again. 6 people. $150. A crap load of dishes. Awesome service. Quickly served. Food was prompt and hot. Thank you for a great meal. Sorry no pics... like I said. We were starving:)

A hidden gem in Vegas!  The service is impeccable and the portions are right on for tapas.  The tuna tartare is a favorite of mine.  The sangria is a definite hit.  You see it on almost every table.  I highly recommend Firefly* on your next trip.

Great food!  Bacon wrapped Dates live up to their reviews as well as manchego Mac and cheese. Awesome!  We also had the Diablo shrimp, mushrooms and steak. They were also very good. The server was perfect as well. Kind, helpful, but not overbearing.

Tapa style but MEGA portions. Left very full and satisfied but some of the food was just MEH. Ordered smoked salmon bagels, manchego mac n cheese, spicy beef salad, stuffed dates, firefly fries, mushroom tart, tierra y mar skewers, shrimp tempura, chicago beef bocadillos, and lamb chops. Salmon bagels, fries, and stuffed dates were really good. The rest was overcooked or bland but at least we were full...

I wanted so badly to like this restaurant. It's one of those places I've been hearing about for years, but never actually got around to visiting. My boyfriend owed me dinner, so I asked him to take me here last night. Not one of the tapas I had wowed me. For the price, the portions are exceptionally small. Three mini stuffed peppers for $9. A single cup of soup for $7. We left with a bill of over $80 (two drinks included), and I was still hungry. I would have ordered another tapa to fill me up, except nothing I had thus far was all that good, so I didn't want to waste even more money on substandard food. Most of the food we had was too salty, aside from one tapa that didn't have much flavor or seasoning at all. 

At least the staff was friendly.

It's happy hour from 3-6 Monday thru Friday. Pitcher of watermelon mojitos for the low low. Today's line up mac and cheese always solid. Tierra Mar skewers slamming. Steak and mushrooms skewers save the sauce to dip the bread in. Almond butter nuff said. Bacon wrapped dates. Berry tarts for desert. Forgot the mango ribs they were thick and proper.

Came here for my bachelorette party and just had to return with my fiancé...I mean husband. Lol. We just got married last night and over 24 hours later we finally come out of our hotel to have a romantic newlywed dinner.

We were in Las Vegas for a week. And our first day we ordered Uber food in this place and it was absolutely delicious. So two days later we had to come back, but we wanted to eat in the restaurant. We had an amazing time. The food was delicious, service was amazing. So I can say that from 6 days that we were in Las Vegas we came 4 times for dinner. That means a lot.
3rd visit and still amazing!  Ordered almost the entire menu and loves everything.  Lamb meatballs and stuffed dates are off the charts.

Tasty food and very good service! The food  portions are small and expensive. Love the waiters. They're very attentive. I love when they give you a pot of fresh coffee!  The lamb chops and the dates wrapped in bacon are the best! Great last before heading back to SD!

The best food I he'd 
Wow 
Customer service it's amazing
The stuff they're so nice
the Hottmosphir so good 
And the design something else
I love it love it love it

i like this new location a lot, it's more local to the strip, spacious, and trendy/intimate than the Westside location that they moved from. they have an outside patio seating area, or you can sit at the huge bar in the middle, or at one of the half-moon booths or tables.

there's a strongly Spanish and seductive vibe which i'm definitely diggin' - the intimate lighting, red tones, spanish dancers and bullfighter paintings adorning the walls, the uniquely patterned wallpaper, i love it all. 

definitely a place you want to bring someone special or a Ladyfriend you're trying to impress. good times will be had over their tapas, calamari, sliders, octopus (my favorite), bacon-wrapped dates, etc. the cocktails are on point as well.

-salud!

So good!  So many choices!  The wait staff was friendly & efficient.   The kitchen was so prompt getting tapas to our table!  We were with 2 friends and tried 8 or 9 different dishes - and enjoyed them all.  Also had wonderful mojitos that they prepare by the pitcher full !

I've been here several times before, and the food is superb. However today, we were told it would be a 30 minute wait for inside or we could sit outside immediately. We opted for an outside table and after 15 minutes had not been offered water or anything to drink. The waiter came out several times to check on other tables and even after we ask someone to send a waiter to us, and he checked on the other tables again and left. We walked out.
Where else can you get stuffed dates? The menu is eclectic and promises to surprise the adventurous with a drink menu to match. Amazing romantic ambiance but it's loud. Would definitely come back!

Oh my GOD the dates!!! OH MY GOD THE DATES!!! If you see your mama slap her! OH MY GOD THE DATES!!!! The stuffed bacon wrapped dates are that good!!!! We came across the place by accident on our trip to Vegas. We were driving by & notice this place. We decided to Yelp to view reviews based on the reviews we decided to give s try. Best decision ever! Our server Gabriel was excellent. He recommended the strawberry mojito a definite must!  Service was superb! If you're in Vegas you must stop in.

Oh, FireFly. How i love thee, let me count the ways! 
Every time I decide to try a new restaurant in town, I almost immediately regret not going to my faithful FireFly. 

I've been a regular for about a year now, and I'm never disappointed. I love the tapas style. Tapas meaning small plate, If you didn't already know that. It's great to share a few plates with a friend or scarf a few down all to yourself. 

I'm a vegetarian but I have no problem with options here! 
Some of my favorite plates include;
-Apple and manchego salad- scrumptious and light 
-Artichoke toasts- a delicious little snack 
-Veggie Empanada- Pretty filling 
-Warm spinach salad- healthy and yummy 
And of course the Manchego Mac and Cheese if you can afford the calories!  

Not to mention the pistachio gelato! To freakin die for. 

As for drinks, the sangria's, both red and white are delicious. 
My personal faves are "The new girl" a red vodka drink infused with a hint of jalapeño! Yum! 
And the "cherry mule" a Moscow mule with cherry flavored  grey goose! 

Ok, but MOST IMPORTANTLY.... The servers and bartenders. 
Athena, Omar and Eduardo are so sweet and they always take such good care of me! 
I love it when I walk in and they greet me like a friend, and then ask, "your usual?" Maybe it's because I come here too often, or maybe it's because they're great at serving their loyal customers! 
Either way, I'll keep coming back!

Fantastic place for tapas. I love almost every dish they serve. Their bacon wrapped dates are a must try as well as their samosas. The ambiance is really nice too with plenty of heat if you sit outside at night.

Excellent Tapas, service was awesome and the atmosphere was great.  We had only eight of the many available Tapas and everyone of them were flavorful and cooked perfectly.  

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who enjoys great Tapas and at a very affordable price.  We'll be back!

This place is the bomb.   This is the best food to money ratio in Vegas.  I can't recommend it more highly.   In a town with high end food for expense accounts and high rollers this is the real deal for real people.  Excellently prepared food, a great staff,  flipping off the chain flavors!   I'd stay an extra day to eat here again!   Damn!    Get the Bacon Wrapped Dates!

Been here several times and never had a bad meal. Friendly, quick service. Great atmosphere. Decent prices. I love Firefly.

Update:

I've been here many times now. Everyone I take here loves it. Every meal I get is great. The only issue is that it is PACKED on a Friday night. It's awesome.
I love Tapas. Many gluten free options, and a fantastic wine list! They even had The Prisoner by the bottle. Nice restaurant with an outdoor covered patio too.
Always an excellent evening as anticipated.  I took friends here that came in town.  They wanted a different type of dining experience.   They too became instant fans.

Totally stumbled upon this place by accident...And what a fortunate accident it was. The watermelon mojito was refreshing as it was delicious. I was torn on what to order but our server helped with narrowing down the decisions. Pear &-best salad, chorizo plate, and the mushroom pastry were more than enough to satisfy. 

The location is close enough to the strip to make it an easy enough venture but far enough away from all the noise and hustle n bustle. Loved the outside patio seating that provided plenty of shade and cooling fans with mist. 

I definitely need to come back again...with more friends and a bigger appetite. The dessert menu is calling my name!!

Good for a tasty bite or a quick dinner date before dancing or a show.  The choices are nominal and they do seem to try to make everything up scale at an affordable price.  There have been a tish or two about the service and food safety standards at the previous location.  This is a much nicer roomier spot.  Honestly I haven't had any issues with the food ever.  I like it as a less formal dining option, decent food.  Service at this location is much better than the westside location.  Probably why that location is closing..  Sangria or flavored Mojito in a carafe pitcher is the way to go.  

I recommend: 

firefly fries
duck roll 
petite filet 
stuffed dates
tuna tartare
tierra y mar
camarones al ajillo
lamb chops
scallops "escargot"

Not too fancy, not shabby at all.

This was my first time back to Firefly since they moved down the street. I have to say I love the change! The restaurant is bigger, more open and it looked like they had separate dining rooms for larger parties.
It was super unfortunate what happened a few years ago with the food poisoning but don't let that change your mind about dining here. The food is still amazing but their prices did go up a few dollars per item.
This trendy restaurant has always been my favorite Spanish tapas go-to. The flavors never disappoint! I love their tuna tartare and artichoke toasts but tonight I tried some new dishes. The smoked salmon bagels and scallops were a great pick! Larger than expected and a flavor explosion in my mouth!
The only reason I can't give 5* is because the service is still amiss. Our server was friendly but he did forget to put in half my order. When the food runners dropped off food, they literally drop it and run away, instead of taking pride in the dish and announcing what it is. Our drinks were also always empty. I would understand if it was a Friday night with a 45 minute wait, but we came in on a Monday night around 9pm.  I watched bussers look at our empty glasses as they walked by, and servers huddled in groups on the floor.

Went here on a trip to Vegas and man was the food good! I love Tapas but usually always see a $100 bill each whenever I go. Not here!

All the tapas are $4.50-$8 each and the drinks were reasonable too. The result - 6 items and drinks for under $50 for the two of us!

We had:
Chicken Empanadas - my favorite dish, flakey and full of flavor; a lot lighter than a typical empanada. Excellent.

Tuna Tartar - not the best tuna I have eaten but for $8 it was decent for the price

Bacon wrapped almond fig - okay no the official name but you will see the one I am talking about it. If you like bacon order it. The perfect blend of salty and sweet. Has a bit of blue cheese and a balsamic type sauce. Very good.

Apple and Manchu Salad - really awesome. a light and yummy summer salad. I love the fresh green apple cut julian with the almost-blue-cheese. 

Garlic bread with almond butter - the free dish was probably the most unique. I need to know where they got the almond butter from because it was like nothing I have ever tasted. It was galic meets peanut butter, but not. It looked and spread like butter but tasted creamer. So good.

Dessert - Gelato Trio - 3 excellent flavors: chocolate, vanilla and my favorite the pistachio.

Sangria it was the sparkling white one aged for 3 days; very good for a hot summer day

No this wasn't the quality of San Fran tapas but it gets 4 stars for being cheaper than eating at the Olive Garden and excellent food. I will be back on my next trip to Vegas.
Enjoyed this place - awesome food, friendly, courteous servers and prompt service..... this place is highly recommended! Would definitely come back when I'm in LV.

I had a great experience here. I came here around 1230 on a Saturday, and it was not busy at all. My waitress, Irina, was superb. She was very friendly and attentive so excellent service there. We had about seven different tapas, including the chocolate/cherry bread pudding (delicious), bacon dates, mushroom pastry, ceviche, beef salad, and sangria (red and sparkling). I've had better tapas before, but overall tasty dishes and great service.

Primera vez en este restaurante!!!! Excelente servicio, atención inmediata no tuvimos que esperar, la paella deliciosa, diferente variedad de escoger!!!! El sabor riquísimo,  definitivamente recomendado, precios accesibles¡!!

I had the pleasure of swinging by Firefly for an early lunch yesterday. Based on the building and parking lot (which is private), they must get incredibly busy later in the day, but at 11:30, I was the 2nd table seated. 

I was seated right away and everyone was friendly. The service was great throughout. The waiter immediately brought bread and butter. The butter was honey and some type of pepper. I don't do bread, but it looked amazing and the sweet/spicy butter was great. 

The waiter recommended 2 items and they were exactly what I had my eye on! So I got the stuffed dates and Tierra y mar from the Hot Tapas menu. Both were awesome. The dates were almonds, dates and then bacon-wrapped and had a red wine reduction and blue cheese on top. The Tierra y Mar was grilled chorizo, shrimp and steak skewers with salsa. Delicious! I will definitely go back.

I came here for a nice, fresh, cold brew and some tapas and sat at the bar. The ambiance I thought was nice. But I must say, at least compared to Minneapolis and Seattle, the tapas served here are rather mediocre. Beer selection was poor. The tap wasn't working we were told. I guess Vegas is not considered the beer capital of US and for Vegas, maybe this place is considered better than average. Probably not coming back. The nice girl who worked at the bar was nice and friendly though.

The tapas are delicious. We had a mishmash of sorts, the bacon-wrapped dates, the chorizo/chicken mushrooms, the tinga empanada, the mac and cheese. Everything was delicious!!!! Can't decide which is my favorite, but everything was great! The drinks were good, too!

Firefly was awesome all the food we ordered was delicious. Each dish served had its own authentic taste, every bite was superb and for the price it was off the charts. Wish we had one of these in Hawaii, I'm glad it was the last meal I had in Las Vegas
Always outstanding. They can get busy at times, but worth it. Grab some Sangria and relax.

First timer! Great place to get some drinks and some appetizers. The food is very tasty. Friday nights and Saturday nights are very busy and it's hard to find parking but other than that the place is very upbeat and is great for a night out with some friends

The Burrell's love Firefly. We love the bacon wrapped figs and the Paella. We used to come when they were in the old building but they are still great, if not better in the new building. Can't wait to come back!

I heard bad things about this place, but don't listen!!! It's was amazing, went with friends and we each ordered something different. Best thing was the artichoke toast. Loved it!!! The sangria was also incredible. It had apples which are my favorite! Defiantly gonna come back.
Hands down my FAVORITE restaurant in Vegas.  Love everything about this place - the ambiance, the food, the service - all great.  Give it a try next time you are in Vegas!  You will love it too!
one of the best bargains in vegas. great food. great service. we were seated close the door which may have been the reason it was quite hot. other than that it was perfect.

Best damn Tapas in USA and bar none best servers, service and Atmosphere for Lunch or Dinner. Great for Couples, Families, Friends and Business trip.  Have never had a bad dish and reasonably priced so you can order 6-10 items!! The best!!
Amazing food. Everything was absolutely delicious! And better yet we were able to share and try everything! Would recommend this place highly

Ok.... So I have told about this place time and time and time again


Finally went and was. It disappointed 

The bacon wrapped dates...are a must order fir anyone.... Ohh man I want to go back after writing this..


Also the shrimp Diabla the sauce amazing..

Sangria amazing red that is 

Service was great..


Will follow up with more details

My wife and I absolutely love Tapas- so when we got to Vegas this was an absolute must and they definitely didn't disappoint. We started with a pitcher of Sangria that we were able to both get 3 cups out of- so that's a super win. As for the menu, it ranges from Cold, Hot, Seafood, and Meat Tapas so we were in Heaven.  

We started with Some Shrimp ceviche that was incredible. Next we tried the Stuffed peppers that were solid. Being that we look Chicago style Italian beef sandwich with had to try their version in the tapas form and boy are we glad we did. It was three mini-mini size hoagie Italian beef that were delicious. We also tried the stuffed mushroom and the empanadas that were good. 

All and All we had a blast here and definitely would come back. All the food and drinks came at reasonable price so don't be alarmed.

Favorite restaurant in all of Vegas. We've made trips to Vegas planned around eating here. The service is always great. The sangria is amazing! Happy hour prices can't be best. The best tapas are the bacon wrapped dates and the croquetas. Their chocolate tres leches is delicious! Definitely venture off the strip to go here!
Sangria and lamb chops at 1:00 a.m. in the morning, baby.

Great place! Food is spectacular. Favorite tapas dish is the bacon-wrapped stuffed dates; just amazing! Everything we had was really fantastic.

- Bacon-wrapped Stuffed Dates
- Tomato Bread
- Baked Goat Cheese
- Chicken Skewers
- Albondigas

So good!

Ive been here more times then I can count for business dinners.  Always consistent and always amazing meals.  Tapas give you so many choices and bites for dinner.  We ordered wine this time ...  2nd bottle recommended by staff was better than the one I picked.
A MUST for me every time I'm in town! Absolutely LOVE this place. Always a pleasure coming here, from environment to servers everyone if so nice and fast!

Came here with my friend who is a local in Vegas. This place seems to have a few delicious choices on the menu. Bacon wrapped dates, escargot, mac n cheese and much more.  They offer a great variety of tapas and drinks. Good place to meet up or hang out with friends.

Server was excellent. Busser or server assistant was terrible. My cousin came to visit from Peru. I wanted her to try one of my favorite restaurants. I asked the busser to take a photo of us (closest person at the time) and he was the rudest!! He seriously gridded his teeth and took the phone from me with out saying a word. He acted as though I slapped him in the face.. Last time I checked you're in the service industry, to SERVE! Like I said my food was great, server was great but the bussing staff is terrible. He just made us feel uncomfortable the entire time. Took every single thing off our table with out smiling or making himself friendly by any means...

Ate at this new location once before I moved, but I used to frequent the spot that closed due to problems and have been to the Sahara location, this one is better. Firefly is awesome for drinks w/ friends, a date, or whatever. This place does tapas right. Many interesting choices and great cocktails. 

There's quite a lot to choose from, so you'll probably be back again. My favorites are the coconut mussels, fish sticks, and tuna stuffed peppers. There are many other notable items, including hot/cold options featuring shrimp, beef, chicken, fish, etc. Their drinks are the best I've had. I'm a beer girl, so when I order sangria or a pomegranate mojito, you know something is up. 

Prices are reasonable. I love the ambiance and the service is always good here. It's better here than at Sahara, for some reason, so come here if you have the option.

Horrible food and service....Lisa was our waitress, 1st we ordered a bottled she brought us regular, we had to wait...which is ok accidents happen, I ordered a hot tea,  they brought an assortment, the person I was with ordered tea also, Lisa dropped off an empty cup and didn't bother bringing the assortment to them until we asked, filet mignon skewer was tough, overcooked...we didn't hardly eat it, we got chicken fried bread , forgot what it's called very tough and old, fish cod was tough we didn't eat that at all, manager took it off, just terrible all around...

The tapas were very tasty and they have a bunch of choices for people with allergies.  The paella wasn't spectacular but the tapas made up for it.  My only complaint was that it was very loud which made it difficult to have a conversation.
Just love this restaurant...great staff, great food and they serve Stella Artois.

CUSTOMER SERVICE: was average. Nothing special. Host was not inviting. Services hardly came to our table.
FOOD: Its more of an appetizer and drinking place. Has a couple of entrees but I dont really recommend it. But if you are hungry there is that option. There small plates/appetizers are very good. Alot of them have alot of flavor. 
DRINKS: AMAZING! I would definitely say this is a drinking place. Sangria amazing. Mojito amazing!

Food was just okay, service was lacking (only saw our server 3 times), we ordered hot appetizers and most came out cold or luke warm at best, the sangria was very lacking and had maybe a tablespoon of fruits to compliment the drink, and finally the mixed paella the dish that can make or break whether a true Spanish restaurant is good and it came out burnt and the flavor was lacking all the foods flavor in fact was just okay, we walked away disappointed.

This tapas bar and restaurant off the Strip, is definitely a hidden Vegas gem. My friends and I came into Vegas on Friday, and decided to check this place out. Prices are fantastic and range from an average of $5 to $10 per tapa dish. I ordered the bacon-wrapped dates stuffed with almonds. Bacon-wrapped dates are one of my favorite tapas, so the almond was definitely a different texture than what I was used to, but still tasty. In addition, I got the veggie empanadas, which were quite savory. I was saddened that there were only two of those on the plate. My table ordered a pitcher of sangria for $28, which was a steal. Firefly* also has some affordable desserts, and so I shared the chocolate tres leches cake with a friend, and was more than happy with its taste and texture--not too sweet, and not too runny.

I am not sure about other nights, but definitely on Fridays, it can be quite loud with the live band, so be prepared to use your outdoor voice inside. The band, Space to Pace, played light salsa music. After seeing one of the waiters dance with a hostess, I really wish I knew how to salsa dance (note to self: take some salsa lessons). I love Latin music, especially the classics like, Oye Como Va and Guantanamera, which they both played, and so it was a treat to be there that night to listen and clap along with the band, as well as enjoy tasty, inexpensive food with great company. This will definitely be a go-to spot every time I go to Vegas.

Our business group found Firefly a couple years ago at the old location up the block on Paradise and fell in love with it for entertaining customers. The food and service were outstanding, and the Tapas theme great for having a fun business meal. The place was noisy, but you could still hear each other. However this trip to Firefly we found the restaurant had moved to a new and larger location just about a block up the road, however the building has low ceilings and terrible acoustics, making the once passable noise level for business unacceptable. Also, the tables are really small, so once you seat six or more people, and they start bringing Tapas, there is simply ZERO room to put the food! Unfortunately we will now sadly not return for business meals, but will always go for the Bacon-wrapped Dates!
Great food. Mac and cheese and bacon dates unreal.. Great wine. Sat at the bar, nice setup..

It's been awhile but the food quality remains awesome!! A lot of tapas to choose and we ordered 5 and they were all delicious & flavorful. Red wine Sangria a must try!!! Finished up with the chocolate tres leche. I couldn't give 5 stars because the service was not great. Our server, Ivan came to our table...no greetings, no introduction, no smile. Basically asked us "Anything to drink?". Took our order, delivered the food and didn't come back to ask how's the food, need anything...we had to flag him down to order more tapas. It was disappointing and it was not busy at 9:30 pm. Nevertheless, we will return because the food is just too good

What an experience! 

First off, we decided to go on Valentine's Day, after we eloped, so this would be our special wedding dinner....having never been....I solely booked a reservation based on yelp reviews.
The restaurant is beautiful! Black velvet wall paper, red velvet booths, perfect dinner lighting.  Even the staff's uniform is great! Everyone was so professional,  kind and attentive. The perfect spot for a special event! The beautiful manager offered us a complimentary glass of champagne and checked in on us a couple times, she was so nice! We decided to purchase the photos from the young lady taking shots of guests. She did an amazing job!

We got blood orange mojito and sparkling sangria. Both drinks were big, mixed exactly right and it was happy hour! Bonus!!!!

 Our server suggested a tapa item from each section, we decided to get 2 of her 4 suggestions. We also got the special of the night YES! They were so good. Here's what we decided on:
Boquerones, anchovies on toast w/roasted red pepper, vinegar, fresh avocado and greens. Delicious! Everything blended quite well... the acid from the vinegar was a perfect touch.

Bacon wrapped dates.  W/smoked almond and bleu cheese. I could eat a platter of these!! They were addicting! A MUST try

Eggplant cannenoli with goat cheese. Tender, thin sliced eggplant, creamy filling, light tomato sauce. Excellent

 Grilled Octopus with roasted potato and diced pepper relish . I Love this dish. I don't remember the title of it, but it was cooked perfectly. I usually get octopus or squid and this dish was one of my all time favorites. Acidic, sweet, and a textural delight.

Heart of palm "crab cake" a vegan choice...very very VERY good. Over baby greens topped w an aoili, these cakes were prepared perfectly, lightly panseared, perfectly moist and very fresh.

Special was...Red Snapper and grilled shrimp over grilled asparagus w pomegranate sauce.
Again, another fantastic dish. It was cooked perfectly, especially the seafood. So tasty!
