We got the dessert platter, had a couple bites and took it togo since we were full. Every item was fresh. Chocolate tres leche was our favorite as well as passionate fruit cheesecake.

I Would absolutely recommend Firefly and we may go again before we leave Las Vegas, as there were many more things to try.

I'm writing this from the bar at Firefly as I enjoy a glass of pinot grigio,  Serrano ham and manchego cheese and the bacon wrapped dates. It's 1:30 pm and it's pretty quiet in here. Let me preface my comments by saying that I have lived in Spain and frequented many tapas bars there and in southern California, where I live. The prices are very reasonable. Comparable dishes at other places would cost the same or more in California. The portion of Serrano ham is very generous and delicious. I got my food quickly. Both items are beautifully presented and tasty. I will definitely come back. They have ample parking that's free. They have an extensive wine selection.

I really like this place and have been dozens of times. Happy hour is good but limited, wish they would add more items or switch them occasionally. 

I love the 
Apple and cheese salad
Ribs
Chicken skewer 
And many other things. All small plates (tapas) so ideal to get 2-3 things and maybe share few things. 

Don't get the fries, they're SO bad! How can you make world class tapas but serve terrible French fries is just silly to me. I guarantee almost 50% of the fries get thrown in the garbage, the owner should be ashamed they haven't been removed or fixed. 

Great service almost all of the time, rarely been unhappy with they. I have brought groups of 10+ without reservation a few times and got seated and served reasonably quick. 

I'll be back for sure.

We went with a group of four and it was worth the short trip over! We split a few Tapas and then shared the Mixed Paella. The price was incredible, especially considering we were only a 10 minute walk away from the strip. $100, including tip, for 4 people, including drinks! Doesn't get any better than that. We have already suggested it to others and we will be back next time we are in the desert!
Worth going out of the way for!  Food is excellent and comes out very fast.  Try the flavored mojitos.  You won't b disappointed.

My girls and I, after a long night of work,love to hit up Firefly! Such a good happy hour! The red sangria is my favorite, we always get a pitcher! (Okay maybe two) At night we don't want something too heavy so we love the tapas idea! MY Faves are the bacon wrapped dates, stuffed mushrooms, STUFFED PEPPERS, and the manchengo Mac and cheese is a guilty pleasure! The ambience in here is great, I feel like someone is about to bust into the room and start dancing salsa! The waiter that serves us I'm so mad I forgot his name but you can't miss him he looks like a Telenovela superstar! Just yum! (Wait the food, the food is yum) Overall love it here!

This place is beyond jaw dropping because of it's amazing food.
Every time I come to Vegas this is a place which is a must!

A friend of mine that used to live in Vegas highly recommended this place to us and boy did it not disappoint!! We ordered a pitcher of Sangria and it was absolutely amazing. Then we followed that up with two plates per person and split them all. We could have easily tuned that down a bit but all the food was super delicious!!
Amazing tapas with a great late night happy hour. A little bit away from the strip but nice environment to get away from the tourists.

I'm so upset with myself that I haven't reviewed this earlier when all the food I had was still fresh in my mind. What I do remember is that the prefixed menu of about six course I believe was only about $80.. And on top of that the plates are unlimited! Say what??! I know, I still am trying to fully grasp that idea myself. For prefixed menu this is an amazing deal, let alone for unlimited plates. Also unlimited sangria/drinks included! I don't remember if it's just sangria/mojitos, or if other cocktails are included. I'm pretty sure they were. 

The food was pretty good as well. I remember the scallops being delicious. We had sliders included and I only ate half of mine because I don't really like sliders and it tasted like a normal slider you would get at a TGIF. Mussels and the spicy beef salad were very good, I definitely recommend those. We only used the unlimited plate option for a couple items split between 11 girls and by the time our last two plates came we were so full. We ended up wasting a lot of food because we couldn't take leftovers with us as we were having a night out and didn't have time to go back to our hotel. 

I definitely recommend this place for group outings.

I went here with a friend. We were a little apprehensive at first in light of the recent history.  Their menu is quite amazing.  We ordered a lot of small dishes including Serrano Ham and Manchego Cheese, Padron Peppers and Firefly fish sticks and several additional dishes.  We were both impressed and satisfied with our meal.  We are both looking forward to our return.

One of my boyfriend's favorite restaurants when he visits Vegas so we decided to leave our group and have a romantic dinner for two.  When we arrived it was pretty full already and I would recommend making a reservation if you have a larger party for sure on the weekends.  This is a small plates/tapas syle restaurant.  We were able to sit at a high top in the bat, which was perfecr for the two of us.  We ordered a few smalle plates and only the chicago style bocadillo beef dip sandwich really wowed us.  We ended up sending the grilled octopus back as it was very chewy.  We did order a pitcher of their famous sangria but it took forever for it to be made and we were right next to the bar.  I think it was an off night bc our server was definitely new and it was so loud we had to repeat ourselves several times to ensure she heard us correctly.

Amazing food! Enough for easily three people to share! We stopped here on a whim and were blown away by atmosphere and food. The portions are tasty and filling. We tried four small plates and the main entree of rice, chicken , mushrooms, veggies. That plate took forty minutes to make but the others started coming out quick and hot. We were starting to get full when the main dish came out! Great place I will be back!

I used to love Firefly, but unfortunately it is nothing like what it used to be.   The big disappointment over the years has been the change of the atmosphere.

The first Firefly we went to many years back was in downtown Vegas.  Although the seating was nothing special, the great view of the old casinos and the light show made for a very cool atmosphere.

The second Firefly we went to was at their PREVIOUS/smaller Paradise location.   That one had some cool seating with couches and what not, giving that a very cool atmosphere as well.

Suffice to say that when we were seated at their CURRENT Paradise location, it was a bit of a letdown.   The atmosphere is completely missing in this larger location of theirs on Paradise.   They tried to give it some atmosphere with the candles and red hue, but the space is just too big and open for sit down tables for that to work well.   

The red pitchers of Sangria are still delicious and well worth the $28.     

The tapas don't seem to stand out to me as they used to; they were all good, but nothing really stuck out as being delicious.

The old Fireflys used to be something we would visit every time we would go to Vegas.   With this latest experience, things have changed.

The menu is expansive and delicious! Lotsa choice and everything I have tasted was spectacular-- wine is very fair priced and the servers are quite knowledgable when it comes to wines!  In definitely going to return here!

Definitely a tummy pleaser ! Firefly has yet to disappoint me on my birthdays or even just group gatherings with friends. Besides the delicious tapas, the ambience is set to perfection . It reminds you being at a family get together plus the music on Latin nights makes you want to dance the entire time .

I've been there only once, and that was as part of a group luncheon.

But, the food was terrific and the service was even better.

There was a total of six folks in our little group, and everything was so perfect, I picked up the check for everyone.

Few places make THAT kind of favorable impression on me.

There are certain things you have to do when you go to Vegas.. Drink, party, gamble and eat at firefly. We come all the way from Australia and everytime we get here we make sure to book in a time to enjoy a decent meal with a nice range of tapas and a decent drinks list to go with it. On the busy nights I'd definitely recommend booking but allow a few hours to relax and enjoy here!
I always get the prawn dish something a la diabla, bacon wrapped dates, french fries, anchovies and avo toast, Apple mânchego salad. It's just always so good

I haven't been to such a nice restaurant . The food is quick to get to yourtable and the waiters are active, quick to clear the table, the bread and butter keeps coming. Me and my fiancee will continue to show up here . It wasn't to full but the overall service was great. The bar seems like a cool way to head if you like that type of thing. Will return soon

My first time eating at this restaurant and it was a good experience. If you are planning in going on a friday evening and you don't want to wait for a table for a long time make a reservation. The food was good. The tapas that I recommend are: the chorizo clams, stuffed dates wraped in bacon, baby back ribs, and lamb chops. The pitcher of red sangria was refreshing and very good. My son is Vegan and he had the tomato bread and the veggies and lentils. The coconut sorbet ice cream they had that day was out of this world. I also recommend the banana sandwich with nutela for dessert. I did not like the scalops escargot, pulpo asado, and the ceviche of shrimp. The service was very good and efficient. As soon as you are done with your tapas the servers clear the plates off the table. Selfparking is behind the building and it was full on that friday night so I had to use valet which is awesome that is free of charge. So I gave the valet $5 in and $5 out. I will go back again for sure and if I have guest visiting I would definitely bring them to this restaurant.

I've been coming here for a very long time & I could actually say it's okay for the price you are paying, but then again they specialize in tapas. The reason I gave them 3 stars was because they have an amazing red sangria and that I cannot deny. Service is always good, but just be prepare to wait for a table for a very long time on some occasions.

Whenever I'm in Vegas I always try to make time to come to Firefly.  This newer location is great with lots of seating and dark, nice decor.  Great Spanish tapas at reasonable prices, right off the strip.  A few of my favorites are the stuffed dates (2 orders please), patatas bravas, empanadas, ham and cheese croquetas.  Sangria is a must!  Early and late HH has some nice selection tapas for less and of course great deals on the sangria.  Come early or late, or you'll probably be waiting for a long time.  Always a fun time at Firefly!

As a first time trier at a Spanish Tapas Restaurant, I thought this restaurant was better than I thought! The portions were reasonable, but a bit pricey to me. However, the quality of the food was good! I wasn't much of a fan of the mac and cheese we ordered, but the bacon wrapped dates were so good and I don't usually like dates!

If you order the paella, it takes 40 min, but if you order a bunch of tapas, it won't seem long because the tapas come quick and in the meantime while you eat them, your paella will be ready!

As for service, they really do a good job filling your glass of water and taking away your plates!
Great tapas good mix of locals and tourist always busy I would recommend the sangria or diablo shrimp

Truth be told, I was disappointed in Firefly on Paradise.  The place is always packed, and the smells from the outstanding were amazing, but the eating experienced left a lot to be desired.  I had a hard time even getting a table - tried a couple of days - and then I was seated but only outside in a corner.  Waiting times for service were longish, and then a couple of dishes I was served were obviously made ahead of time and heated at the last minute, and the inside of the food was still cold.  The dishes were modern yuppy fusion and not traditional.  All in all, there is a lot of flash and not a lot of substance.  I will not be coming back.

Do not waste your time or money in this place.  The worst service i have experienced in as long as i can remember.

I must adjust my review. While the service i received was well below expectations,   That was possibly the individual.

The food i received was very good and certainly deserves 4 Stars.

I feel certain,  they will correct this oversite.

I ordered 4 different tapas plates and they all were delicious. Scallops were well cooked and all the sauces were good. Artichoke bread was really a nice surprise, well seasoned and topped with basil which just complements the dish well. Only thing was that's the food came out slightly delayed, too far from one dish to another but granted, it was very busy night. I will be coming back!!
Great sangria (the red one especially), delicious paella (though it takes a while to be cooked), and unforgettable tapas...

Sexy modern Spanish tapas restaurant not far off the strip. Great place to slow down and enjoy the company of a group of friends or that one special friend. Wide variety of tasty tapas. You won't find chicken fingers or nachos on the menu, so if you don't know tapas look it up. The empanadas are excellent. Friendly attentive servers.
I found this to be an OK venue. It's off the strip, and has parking. Also, it's convenient for getting to Thomas & Mack before or after an event there.

The food is just amazing. We had a party of 20 and the accommodated us last minute. Let me tell you about Ivan our waiter. Such great service and he handled our entire table so fast. We told him our limo was coming in a hour and a half and he responded. Food 5 star. Service 5 star. Drinks 5 star. I'm coming back!

I ate here last week when I was leaving vegas and it was the best decision I made that week for food. Everything there is super reasonably priced and delicious.

We had the Mac and cheese which was amazing. The filet mignon was delicious too. The ceviche was to die for. The cheese plate was so so. We had chicken skewers which were pretty good. We also had the mango ribs which only half of us like but I really enjoyed them. The scallops were sooooo good. 

I recommend anyone with a big appetite to go share a meal there and try a bunch of stuff.

This is not a place meant to have only one thing.

I thought this place was great! The restaurant is huge, the lights are dim, and it's super lively (I liked it, but my friends complained that it was too loud). People were dressed anywhere from jeans to cocktail dresses. My group was impressed with the food. Mine was really good, but I'm going 4 stars because I felt like my shrimp (ceviche) and octopus were slightly overcooked. Not the best I've ever had, but it was good. The tapas selection was insane, huge variety and super reasonably priced especially considering how large the plates were.

I love tapas in general for variety, but i felt like out of everything we ordered (grilled octopus, tuna tar tar, cod, skewers, crab cakes) it all tasted like the same sauce of some sort so it got boring fast. The drinks were good though! :)

Coming off a bad dinner at Wicked Spoon buffet at Cosmo the night before, Firefly made us wonder why anyone goes to the buffets on the Strip. Parking was free and plentiful behind the restaurant, although rush hour traffic made it a bit difficult to get to. We timed our visit to take advantage of the Happy Hour specials and had the inside dining area to ourselves at 5pm on a Wednesday.
 
We started with a beer and a sparkling sangria ($5) which was both strong and sweet! We got several of the $4 tapas specials to sample and share including the wonderful French Fries and some rather standard little Meatballs. The "must try" Stuffed Dates were delicious and I am craving that sweet-salty flavor combo now as I type. The blue cheese really makes the dish. The Apple Manchego Salad was light and flavorful and went so well with the other heavier plates.

We saved room for dessert as the Chocolate Tres Leches ($7) stood out to me and the Chocolate Bread Pudding ($7) caught my husband's eye. Both were delicious and he finished the bread pudding, but the Tres Leches cake was definitely meant for a crowd! Mmm, all of that for only $40 plus tax and tip!

Firefly is an awesome restaurant. The tapas are incredible. The petite filet was awesome as well as the stuffed peppers, the steak salad, the ham & cheese croquettes, the green bean summer salad and the Nutella dessert!!!! The service was incredible. It is a bit loud inside but for a place that has such good food, it's expected. Two thumbs up
Incredible, I annihilated the Chicago Beef Bocadillos and finished off with some coffee and the Gelato Trio. Service was quick and clean. Atmosphere is a definite two thumbs up as well.

Went to a friend's birthday gathering at Firefly's new location on Paradise. Disappointed. Best example was the potatoes brava. They were slimy with a spicy but otherwise flavorless sauce and globs of what seemed like mayo from a jar. A feint shadow of the fabulous potatoes brava at Julian Serrano, which have a gourmet tomato-based sauce and light creamy aioli.

The service was also frustrating. We were in a booth with about eight people. The curtains blocked people on the ends of the table from sight, which meant waiters never bothered to ask us if we wanted anything else. We had to get up from the table and seek out the waiter several times.

This is huge place and in terms of quality this is like the chain restaurant of tapas places. For a little bit more Julian Serrano, in Aria, is orders of magnitude better.

This place was great especially if you want something off the strip but still tasty. I recommend ordering the paella before everything else so that it comes out as you finish with your tapas. The paella was the best that I have had stateside and for $26 we got a steal with the seafood paella. Incredibly cooked and seasoned.

The tuna tartar was amazing, incredibly fresh and if it was just me I would have ordered 2 and would be done with my meal. The scallop escargo, which is basically scallops cooked in the escargo style of heavy butter and garlic was also well done buy I wish the scallops were better.

The music was also great but could be turned up a bit to help drone out the other conversations and because it by itself is very nice. 

The best part is that this place isn't too far from the strip, like one mile off las vegas blvd. So it wasn't crowded but still tasted good. We were full but we weren't vegas buffet style full/dying so we could still go get drinks and gamble without the food coma feeling.

We will be back soon.
So good!!  You have to try the bacon rapped dates. They don't sound like they would be tasty but it's my fav dish there.
A lot of choices. Decent food. The stand out dish was def the bacon wrapped dates. Good spot if you want something off the strip.

I must admit that I was a bit weary to dine here given that they were shut down in the past due to severe food poisoning, but a really good friend wanted to eat here and since it was her celebration and ultimately her decision, I went along with it. Another friend, who was also part of the group that ate with me, came here on her birthday and had nothing but great things to say about this location and she didn't get sick from it then. 

The parking was a bit confusing. Up front they have a valet area and in the back of the restaurant is self park. When entering the lot, there was no indication that the back parking lot is self park. Here is where I got confused--normally the parking in the front is reserved for self park and valet is sectioned off somewhere in the back. So I thought that the back parking was reserved for valet. I decided to valet my car since I couldn't figure out parking and it was just easier for me to drop my car off. When the valet parked my car in front of the restaurant, I thought that was interesting that I valeted my car to have it within walking distance. 

We had reservations already made so we didn't wait at all for our table. Right from the start, our server came by and asked us if we wanted anything to drink and since we were still waiting on one more, we just asked for water for the meantime. We also placed an order of paella since that takes awhile to cook and we thought it wise to get it started. Other dishes ordered were the shrimp ceviche and calamari. We also ordered a pitcher of sangria for the table. 

Reasons for the 3 stars:
-parking could be better indicated for first time guests
-the paella said it could serve 2-4 people. This could be true if more tapas are ordered along with it, but we ordered it as if it was the main dish. When I imagine paella, I think of a big serving of it!
-the shrimp in the ceviche were whole. I'm used to ceviche being cut up in smaller pieces and I've had better ceviche at taquerias
-it wasn't as busy as it could be, but we still had to wait around and ask for our check several minutes after they cleared our table

I would come here again to try other stuff on the menu. Maybe next time with better knowledge of the place I'll have a different experience. For my first time there I would say that it was ok, but it wasn't spectacular.

Great for Tapas and large groups, or any groups for that matter. You can sit at the bar or make reservation for a table (this place is packed!) and try different food options from the menu, most of them are around $5 and very good!. Loved the bacon wrapped dates and mushrooms and the eggplant, heck loved them all! It's a little off the strip so if this is your first trip to Vegas you won't make it here, but if you want to try something else and have some good food and good time absolutely bookmark this one!

Firefly was fine, but not at all amazing (contrary to its amazingly high yelp rating of 4.5 at the time we came). The sangria was excellent, and my wife got the steak and mushroom skewers and liked them a lot. But everything else we got was ehhhh
Can't say enough about this place. Amazing food. Great experience. Affordable prices. Excellent drinks..

Probably should be 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't allow 1/2 star.

Should be three $$$ instead of $$ since by the time you order enough tapas to be satisfying, you've probably shelled out $30-$35/person.

Interesting dishes. The almond honey butter was amazing. Tiny portion size for the price - one could easily eat 4 $10 tapas and still be not full. $6-12 for 4-6 morsels of food - the scallop escargot ($11) didn't even come with 6 smallish scallops but 3 smallish scallops cut in halves. The mixed seafood paella ($26) has lots of chicken (every other bite) and maybe two clams and two small mussels and lots of rice and little other discernible ingredients.

Loud and lively attractive scene. Not a place for quiet conversations.

Probably worth trying once but for us experience was somewhat underwhelming primarily due to the the stingy portion size. You can tell the tapas were light on costly ingredients which took away from the dining experience.

HOW RUDEEEE!!!

Came here w/ a couple of friends when they finished work & it was late happy hour. We decided to sit at the bar since that's where it seems like it was POPPIN... we sat at the edge near the well wear we could see all the drinks being made...

The 2 stars is for the food ALWAYS being AWSOME at any Firefly location but honestly your palate gets affected when other things affect your mood such as service.

We were greeted promptly ... we ordered some cocktails & one of the guys ordered a bulleit rye on rocks while my man ordered it w/water. They brought both w/ water. Mind that both our boys are bartenders & love their bourbon & know the flavors. BUT we saw the bartender pour just Bulleit Bourbon & not Bulleit rye... also because the bottle was still sitting on the display. The fact is he had the odosity to come & say we ordered wrong & even though it was our fault he would make a new one. We said forget it...it's fine. The boys decided they wanted one more... & again we were watching as the drink was being made.. he poured the regular Bulleit AGAIN!! Brought it over & said it was rye... UGH! ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?!? 

APPLE & MACHENGO SALAD $3.50 - absolutely refreshing with thin julienne slices of green apple & some cheese w/toasted almonds & lightly dressed.

STUFFED DATES $3.50 - bacon wrapped w/ toasted almond to give a crunch... sprinkled w/ Bleu cheese crumbles & drizzled w/ red wine reduction. A MUST dish whenever you go into firefly!!

FIREFLY FRIES $4 - large bowl of fries thin & crispy w/ seasoning.

Sadly DEFINATELY will not be back to this location...

Our last meal in Sin City, and worth the build up, especially after a week consisting mostly of pampering and partying. 

Much needed when your friends need some space from the blinding lights of the strip. This spot was recommended by some local friends, and we're glad that they have prime taste. Super hip, and not as gimmicky as most tapas places can be these days.

Vegas fall weather is the best weather. so try and grab a table outside. A little vino won't hurt either, it's more Spanish that way.
Excellent food excellent service excellent atmosphere! I'm super picky and I am super happy with this dining experience!

Always my go to for special occasions or big groups . Love this place ! The strawberry Mojito is soooo good and the firefly fries and comarones a la diabla ( shrimp diablo) are a must ! The place is cute and the service is good.

Good tapas place off the strip. It's a really short taxi ride/drive from the Wynn end of the strip so don't be afraid to deviate from the main strip. They offer free valet here too so it's convenient if you have a car. 
We went with a fairly large party of 9 and our waiter advised us to just order a few tapas at a time in rounds. They come out fairly fast so you don't have to be afraid of waiting that long. For the most part, he was correct, except our party was pretty hungry and scarfed up every plate almost immediately after they came to the table.... so if your friends are a pack of ravenous dogs like mine, you can order more at a time. 

We ordered:
Mixed Paella (one order is good for about 4-6 people)- nomskies. Legit Spanish cuisine. 
Ahi tartare + avocado- standard dish you can't really go wrong with 
Bacon wrapped stuffed dates- I don't normally care for dates but this was like CRACK. So good. Nice balance of salty and sweet. It's really small though, like 5 dates on a plate and one date per person is not enough  
Fries- good but also forgettable 
Lamb shank? Thigh? I forget which part but it was good. 2 pieces only. 
Mac and cheese- nomskies in all it's creamy goodness 
Stuffed mushrooms- nomskies,  I'd get it again 
Some kind of stewed veggies + egg- meh I'd pass on that one 

I can't remember what else because it just kept getting passed around the table rather quickly. 
My other advice to you would be GET THE RED WINE SANGRIA. It's a little on the sweeter side but I think everyone can appreciate it, even those who don't care for sweeter tasting wine. 

"Take this all of you and drink it. This is the cup of my blood which will be given onto you and to all so that your sins may be forgiven."

If Jesus was talking about the Firefly red wine sangria then I'd be downing that all day and all night... like a mofkn sangria vampire or something. 

Okay that's my advice, you heard it, enjoy your time in Vegas!!! :)

I've been here a few times in there new location and old. The atmosphere is always busy and loud but makes a good environment for fun with friends or even a first date. The central location is great for pre dinner drinks or food before you go out on the strip. The bacon wrapped dates are a must try! I'm also a big fan of Serrano sliders with crispy onions and bleu cheese. Yum! Order firefly fries on the side and you are in food flavor heaven.if you're a seafood fan I recommend the chorizo clams. I've tried most of the menu and everything is very good. Service is always good.

The original had a bit more character, it was aged and awesome. Locals knew this whole in the wall that was sooo cool and hip. The new place is new, bigger and the food is just as good and on this Tuesday evening it was packed. Yeah for Firefly. I hope they can add more locations again in the future.

Huge fan of the regular tapas and desserts. Tried the brunch today and was so disappointed. Patatas had no flavor, eggs Benedict was dry, mimosa over priced, the home made strawberry jam wasn't just impressive. Will stick to the regular menu.

Any time I go to Vegas, I eat at a Firefly location. I am a sucker for tapas and they do a great job at it. The wait staff really made us feel at home and was very patient with a few members of our party being late. The food is amazing, the drinks well stocked and the atmosphere is sheer fun. 
Looking forward until the next time.

Always a fav or mine when I am in town. Great food and atmosphere. This time tried the steak and mushroom skewers..OMG soooo yummy!!! Always love the bacon dates and tuna tare tare. Summer salad was light and refreshing.

Very good but not the best tapas I've ever had.  Actually had good service for a group of 9 and the restaurant was also pretty busy.  Though all the plates we ordered were good nothing stood out to me as fantastic.  The drinks however were fantastic and those were the most memorable of the night.  Especially the espresso martini which was mind blowing.  Location is a little off the strip but not more than a 5 min Uber ride away.  Nice to get away from the Vegas prices but this place is not cheap by any means just more of a bargain than anything on the strip. Would return!

We decided to go here with our party of 9 people for dinner on a Saturday night and I am so glad we did!!!! We arrived and had about a 30-minute wait which was fine as we just had cocktails at the bar. I tried the infused vodka on the rocks and it was fantastic!!!! When we were seated we ordered a bunch of small plates. We had the following plates:

Apple & Manchego Salad - Great mixture of crunch and flavor
Baked Goat Cheese - AWESOME and so mild in flavor
Ceviche of Shrimp - So flavorful
Veggies and Lentils  - for lentils that lack flavor this dish was packed with flavor

And then we all kind of ordered more for ourselves to share with our dates and I tasted/ordered the following

Tuna Tartare - So fresh and delicious
Manchego Mac 'N' Cheese - WONDERFUL
Petite Filet - one of the best filet's I've had!!! Cooked perfectly!
Chicken Skewers - Flavored so well!

I have to say everyone in our group/party loved every plate of food! Service was also great. One thing I did like is dishes came out randomly which worked out perfect!

I cannot wait to go back the next time we are in Vegas!!!!
I love tapas foods and drink in here. Also the price not expensive and about the portion is ok. We're been here last night for 2 ppl and we're order 5 menu that enough. And foods come fast too.

All five of our senses are triggered.  Starts with the hearing, sight, and touch; continues with smell and taste.  Having an eye for art, interior design, and food presentation will be a bit of indulging.  With a strong preference for noise to drown out a hectic week, the task can be satisfied within the walls of Firefly.  All of the other senses will just follow.  Allow it... by starting with a Ginger Smash, Island Mojito, or a Pear Ginger Martini at the bar.

For the remaining flavor senses, manipulate them with a cool selection of tapas.  My faves are as listed:

Mushroom Tart - comfy smells appetizing
Seared Tuna - wonderful highly recommended
Calamari - pretty good nice with the sauce
Grilled Octopus - soft good flavor, missing sticky rice hahaaa (no picture included)
Bacon Wrapped Dates - stuffed with an almond WOWtastic!
Baked Cod - good flavor but DRY (get it right next time)
Beet Salad - salty... why?!!! (otherwise healthy)

There were more tapas ordered by others in our group of 11 people.  They had a good flow going with servers delivering them to our table.  Best to make reservations way ahead.  Even with a reservation it took almost 40 minutes to be seated after our reservation time at 8pm.  This restaurant rocks!  Friday night Salsa dancing happens in the side room past the bar.  Didn't try it; just letting people know in case they didn't yet.  Cuz no - not everybody knows everything.  4**** stars even if it was a little chaotic.

This was my first time at the new location and it was great! We went for a family get-together and although the table was very small for 4 people, we made it work. I always get a pitcher of sangria to share with the table and it's always amazing, definitely recommend the red wine sangria! All of the tapas are amazing, I can't get enough. To top it off, the atmosphere and staff are so accommodating, helpful and very knowledgeable. My husband has a gluten allergy and they were nice enough to spend time explaining ingredients so he was sure not to have an allergic reaction. We are often limited because of his allergy, however he was still able to enjoy several tapas and even dessert. Great new spot, much bigger and so pretty inside!

What a turn around they've made. Everything was really good, service was meh but I was concentrating more on the pitchers of sangria haha 
Bacon wrapped dates are a must!
Ahi Tuna Skewers were the perfect little bite, there was pineapple in between each piece of tuna. Great idea! Love some grilled pineapple.
Chorizo stuffed mushrooms weren't my favorite. They tasted like the mushrooms were pre stuffed and frozen. 
Lemon tarts were cute, I just wish it was bigger. Not enough of the tart alittle too much crust.
Flourless cake looked good, my girlfriend said it was delicious !

All in all, everything was great :) but I'll be back for that red sangria !

I really love firefly!! I've already written a review but I feel the need to write another! 

I went in the other night and received a free pitcher of sangria, complements of the owner for my loyalty! 

The food here is always top notch and I must repeat: the Sangria is so delicious- easily the best Sangria in Vegas, and it's definitely in the top 3 best sangrias I have ever had (and I've had A LOT of Sangria!)

If you're looking for a fun restaurant, with great food, excellent drinks and good service, go to Firefly. It's one of my favorite places in Vegas

I have been a fan of Firefly restaurants for several years now but had never been to the original location on Paradise.  Finally made it (apparently it is now the ONLY location) and I was not disappointed.  The ambience is sexy, the drinks are tasty and potent and this is THE original place for tapas!  

Many other restaurants began offering tapas menus following the late 00's economy crash, but nobody does it as well as Firefly!  They offer something for everyone, whether you're a vegetarian or a carnivore, and the food presentation is interesting and unique.  

Basically, tapas style is like ordering appetizers.  But these aren't anything close to your traditional "loaded potato skins and chicken fingers" appetizers!  While Firefly does serve more traditional entrees as well, the tapas is where it's at for the ability to sample multiple items.  I can't think of a more fun destination for a night out with a group of friends.  The mojitos and sangria are delicious, as is the food.  And if you are splitting the bill, you can really get a lot of bang for your buck here!

We came in without a reservation and got a nice table on the patio immediately. To start we got the firefly fries.The Aioli that's served with them is delicous and a must try! We also tried the Tierra y mar, baked tetilla, Manchego mac n cheese, stuffed dates, artichoke toast, Camarones a la diabla, and the big bowl salad with grilled chicken. Everything was amazing and was served pretty quickly even though it seems a little busier tonight. The waiter suggested the dates which we loved and can whe why they're one of the more popular dishes. I can't wait to come back this summer and enjoy dinner on the patio again. As a side note, Jonathan, the manager, truly took my dinner to another level. His level of service and care for our experiemcewas on another level. He was attentive, caring, professional, and personable and I can't wait to go back; solely because of him.

I love this place! I've been to this place many times but their service is consistent as well as their food.  
Great food and great service!  
I had tuna tartare, shrimp ceviche and spicy beef salad.  Their dessert was great too.

Delicious sangrias, and a very creative tapas menu, everyone we told about Firefly said it was their favorite place! From the The cab attendant at the hotel, to the cabbie, everyone raved about it, this is definitely a much loved which even the locals enjoy. It's a nice looking restaurant, not over the top like most other places in Vegas, service was friendly and the food was excellent.

We tried:
- Artichoke toasts
- Stuffed Dates
- Roasted Veggies
- Patapas Bravas
- Empanadas
- Steak & Mushroom Skewers
- Ham & Cheese Croquetes

Everything was delicious, the only one we didn't care for was the Baked Tetilla (Chorizo & cheese fondue) but everything else was excellent. I would love to go back next time I'm in town.

Not bad but bring your appetite. Reservation via OpenTable is recommended but do go back to the lady seating ppl when your reservation time is due because it gets busy and she might forget.  Paella was big and really good.  All the recommendations on Yelp were good as promised, including grilled octopus.  Full bar so order your heart out but be prepared to expect no conversation- the place is loud and at dinner time there are lots of people.  Still worth it - dinner for with Mixed Paella $76 (3 tapas, dessert, 2 coffees and a drink).
Paella was over seasoned. Staff was so rude staring with the hostess and the waitress. Price was good. But I won't come back.

Please bring Firefly to Atlanta! The tapas here were the best I've had. EVERY SINGLE  item that we tried was a perfect 10!  The mushroom tart was my favorite, it was to-die-for! The petit filet was the second runner up. The tapas are a pretty nice size, my husband and I ordered a total of 4 and we were completely stuffed by the time the last plate came out. Our server was s bit forgetful, but really and upbeat. Overall, this slot was the highlight of my trip. The next time I'm in Vegas I'll plan on eating here daily.

Firefly is one of our favorites! It never disappoints. We went the other night with a big group for a special celebration. 
The service was spectacular and the food is super consistent and delicious! Our server was great and even comped us a bottle of champagne. If you are looking for a fun atmosphere, great food and delicious drinks firefly is the place!

From the atmosphere to the food, I LOVE this place. This is like one of those secret off the strip places that you treasure. We brought a big group in during the Furniture Market. Our table wasn't ready so they let us hang in the bar. We had a blast! The SANGRIA here is amazing!!!!!! We then were seated and ordered TONS of plates -they were ALL delish! It is loud and a little crazy in here but I can't wait to bring other people here! 

Well done!

Everything on the menu sounds delicious so it was so hard to chose , started of with camarones a la Diabla , they were not spicy at all mostly sweet but still tasty , followed with scallop escargots , so good but so hot! I burn my tough because I didn't wait . For main corse I had the lamb chops and my husband had the petite filet mignon and we finished off with the chocolate tress leeches cake . Everything's was great but I do have to say that the menu was overwhelming with so many options . The good thing is I can keep going and try something new every time.

We went for a bachelorette party and ordered 6 tapas and ipaella, flan. The best was apple and manchego salad and is a must try cold tapas. Rest all the other tapas which we ordered were really good. Would like to visit again for apple and manchego salad

I cannot say enough about how great Firefly was. The menu was extensive, prices were great, and serving sizes were much bigger than I'm used to at tapas restaurants. What really made this worth five stars, however, was the excellent, excellent service. I went with two friends, one who has an extreme shellfish allergy. We called ahead of time, just to make sure it wouldn't be an issue (she knows not to order shellfish, of course, but kitchen cross-contamination can be deadly). We were told they could accommodate this food allergy, just to let our server know when we got there. Apparently, unbeknownst to us, they also flagged the reservation. So immediately after we were seated, Carlos, a manager, came to our table, acknowledged the allergy, and let us know we would be taken care of. The cleared out one fryer to only fry non-shellfish items for the evening, offered the best suggestions, and even put up with the additional issue that I'm a vegetarian. (Note: they have a separate vegetarian menu with only non-meat choices!) The sangria and mojitos were flowing, the food was great, and my friend was able to enjoy the meal without worry. Fantastic all the way around. This was, by far, our best food experience in Vegas, and we tried the gamut during our four days there!

You will not find better food in Las Vegas!

The ambiance is wonderful. Staff is friendly. 

The shrimp ceviche is a MUST! And the banana nutella is a great way to end your meal. I've yet to have a bad thing on the menu. This is a wonderful restaurant with loyal customers. We have been going to all of their locations for years and will continue to do so.

I have been to the old location on Paradise a few times in the past. I thought over time it became overrated. When they moved to a larger place I thought maybe the food would have improved. Not really. I still think its overrated and the tapas are slightly above average.  I am sure I will be back a few times because my friends LOVE Firefly. The next time I eat here I will most likely get an entree instead of tapas. 

PROS: Tres Leches chocolate cake
             Chorizo and clams
             Great place for a group to try many different dishes. 
             Ribeye Steak and truffle fries (entree)

CONS: Spicy Beef salad - the salsa verde didn't mix with the other ingredients
             Pulpo Asado - the octopus was good but the tomato, paprika lemon vinaigrette  didn't mix. 
             Lemon Berry Tarts - the berries were good but the tart cups taste like they came out of a  box.

Really underwhelmed.  Everything tasted like it had been soaked in a salt bath.  Even the warmed spinach salad!  Mac and cheese was completely bland and not worth it.  The octopus and chorizo was okay, although if the spinach salad was salty you know this was to the nth degree.  Overall I was very disappointed with the menu choices.  Won't likely waste my time or money here again.

The entire experience was fantastic. Love the atmosphere and the food was all delicious. Really enjoyed the vegetable empanadas. The goat cheese, the lamb the shrimp tempura and the bacon wrapped date. Oh and desserts! Loved the cherry chocolate bread pudding and the dessert plate with the tarts!! Yummy! I can't wait to come back and try some more things. One if the most yummy meals I've had in a while.

Maybe they should change the name to phoenix cause this place is reborn.

Its nice to see spot like Firefly bounce back from the whole Salmonella disaster last year. Yes people got sick from the food here, will it happen again? Nope. In fact they have a food safety consultant and its probably the safest place in town to eat.

I've been slacking on checking out the new location but I finally got to stop by a few days ago. The new location is a building over from their original spot but is probably three times the size. Its a large stand alone building with a big patio, massive bar, and plenty of space for diners and large parties. The new spot captures the look and feel of the original Firefly while expanding a little and establishing itself as its own restaurant. Across from the bar is an open kitchen viewing area/bar which should ease some concerns about food handling and safety.

During our visit the service was spot-on. Our server and bussers were on top of refills and had some great recommendations. Keep in mind that the tapas come out in waves not all at once. The food thankfully (unless you had the limited edition Salmonella flavors) is the same. During this last trip we had the mac n cheese, chorizo and chicken stuffed mushrooms, bacon wrapped dates, and chicken skewers. We also had the chicken and mushroom pallela, kind of like a gumbo without the shrimp, this thing can easily feed 3 to 4 people. All of the dishes were as delicious as before and I recommend checking out all of them. I think their raised their prices on the pitchers of mojitos but its still worth it especially if you are stopping by during happy hour.

Its great to see people give Firefly a second chance, and I commend the restaurant on making some substantive changes.

First off, this place is not on the strip. We went here for a reception after a wedding. We were placed in the back reception room where there were some high tables, a couple low tables and a few chairs. We had 40 people. 
They set up a bar in the room and because the wedding party did not opt to have an open bar we had to pay. $10+ per drink... During happy hour!!! Weak ass drinks to boot. 
The food was good but tiny. I mean really freakin small... Like one bite type of stuff. It was good but for what the bride and groom were charged, total rip off. I recommend finding something else for tapas. Unless you want to go broke. Kinda gross dirty building too.

I just want to say I have such an excellent experience for my Husband 40's Birthday Celebration.
Manuel really take care of everything we need and accommodate all the needs perfectly.
Is a great place to run a private events in their privates rooms.
The food was fenomenal and service excellent from the Managers to servers and bartenders.
Nothing to worry about our guest were so happy as I'm. My husband have a great surprise party.
I won't hesitate to make any celebration at Firefly and also we really enjoy the restaurant we usually have tapas there and we love it!!
Great place!!!!
Thank you so much!!!
Sabrina

Even though firefly used to be a traditional local spot,,,it has become I've of the most talked about tapas restaurant in vegas. I have gone there so much i don't even need a menu and now.. Either do u! 

Bacon wrapped dates 
Mac n cheese
Beat salad
Mushroom tart
Stuffed peppers 
Steak and mushroom skewers 
Duck spring rolls 

My favorite... The sangria! Your welcome and enjoy!!! Xo

Arrived for early dinner with a party of 6. Luckily we got there at 5pm and Happy Hour goes on till 6pm!! We ordered 4 Sangria pitchers and wow where they amazing!!! We also ordered the stuffed dates 10/10, chicken skewers 8/10, Fires were a 100/10 !!  
 Service was amazing! Waiters picked everything up right away  so don't leave anything unattended lol
Will make it a point to come have some sangria and a few appetizers here more often, the vibe here is great, the decor is amazing and just a really great spot to meet with friends!
Best Vegas Spanish tapas I've found. I went at night and it happened to be happy hour so a lot of tapas and drinks were half of. Would highly recommend and can't wait to go again.

I came here for a birthday dinner this past week. We ordered a bunch of tapas for sharing. My favorites were the mushroom tart, tuna tartare, and the croquetas! The sauce from the mushroom tart was so delicious, it can be used as dipping sauce for the complimentary bread.

We went here with a large group. Even though the restaurant was very busy we were seated within 20 minutes, no reservation. We were not in a hurry, but were very happy with their ability to accommodate us quickly. 

The atmosphere is swanky and fun. The staff nice and very knowledgable. It was our first time trying a tapas restaurant, the menu is quite extensive giving us many choices. 

We tried the sangria, was excellent. The white was a little too sweet to drink a lot of, but was very good. Most in our party preferred the red. 

We ordered to share as a group, so we made a rule that if someone before you ordered an entree you could not order the same thing. Doing it that way allowed us to try many different things. Fun! 

When the food came we passed it around the table family style. They filled our extensive order accurately and with a great flow, well timed so we were not overwhelmed or ever waiting. 

The prices are affordable, the food is flavorful and varied (everyone can find something that fits their taste), the drinks are yummy and the ambiance is unique and perfect for a group looking to celebrate or an intimate date. 

Don't leave without trying the filet mignon or bacon wrapped dates, they are fantastic.

Amazing!

Wonderful food, great portions, and spot on waiter. I regret not getting our waiter's name, because he was truly a great guy and made us feel really comfortable and taken care of, without being overbearing or pushy.

We ordered: stuffed dates, ham and cheese croquettes, tuna tartare, firefly fish sticks, boquerones, and baked goat cheese. Fish sticks were okay but not too special; everything else I would definitely order again.

This is a PHENOMENAL place to hang out for brunch and some sangria or a light dinner before a party or for a bigger dinner, just a great place. The food is phenomenal, the service is amazing and after having a dispute with a credit card (that turned out not to be a dispute but a mistake on my part) the management was phenomenal with trying to work with me to solve the non-existent problem.

I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Headed this way after  a late of bowling.  Happy hour  11pm to close -1pm m- th. Able to taste a few things that i would not normally order at full price. Apples manchego- pleasantly freshing apple salad with cheese crumbles  tossed in a vinegrette. Steak and mushrooms  on a stick was amazing.. moist with a drizzle of a flavorful  beef and red wine sauce.  Ceviche was right on point with avocado and home made chips .

Excellent service matched with delicious food means a place I would frequent if only I lived in Vegas!  The apple salad with manchego cheese, so crispy, creamy and refreshing!  Eggplant goat cheese cannelloni again with the creamy goodness. Bacon wrapped dates, why mess with a classic, these were our favorite dish! Chicken tinga empanadas, chocolate cherry bread pudding, delish.

Delicious! Tons of options, for vegetarian and meat eaters alike. 

I went there on my first adult trip to vegas, 2 others had already been there and strongly suggested we go, and all 6 of us LOVED it.

This review is for 3.5 stars. 

I came to Firefly after work on a Friday to hit up the end of Happy Hour and try some tapas I've heard so many great things about.  The Happy Hour menu only includes drinks, but included beer, wine, and Sangria, most for $5 or less.  The bar area wasn't too crowded for the time and day of the week and had a very low-light, intimate, Spanish-type of setting.  It was a great environment and had a very post-work feeling to the crowd.  This makes sense as the restaurant is ideally located right next to the Corporate sector of Las Vegas.

I began with the Sangria, and it was very good and highly recommended.  I also had a chorizo plate which was quite good but not as authentic as I was expecting.  I saw a bunch of orders around me and they all looked great.

I will be back to come for an actual meal in the very near future.  Most of the food sits at around $7-13 for tapas so it is highly affordable and worth a go if in the area or even for an after work stop.

The paella had little flavor and tasted salty. The manchego mac and cheese was good but could of used more browning on the top and a hint of spice to cut the cheese. The tuna skewers were overcooked. Not sure how they have received 4.5 Stars this restaurant does not have the flavors to warrant 4.5 Stars.

Very nice Spanish restaurant. Beautiful decor. Great service, waiter even ask you about if you have any allergies. Never ever j remember that somebody ask me about allergies in restaurant. Everything we ordered was delicious. Stuffed dates with unusual kick of bacon, nuts, cheese and reduced red wine but absolute delicious, must try. We also had spicy beef salad, ceviche of shrimp, baked tetilla ( melted tetilla cheese with sun dried tomatoes and chorizo), and mixed paella . Everything was delicious with enough spices. I hate over salted or over spiced food. They had just right. We were told it will take about 40 min to prepare paella so we ordered it first with drinks. Plates with tapas were brought at perfect intervals, as soon as we finished one, next was coming. I would recommend to visit this place off the strip about 2.4 miles from Caesar casino.

I usually really like Firefly because the food comes out really quickly which I love, and it was delicious.  The issue came when we tried to ask for our check.  Our waitress seemed to have one whole side of the restaurant plus tables outside.  We had to ask for our check twice.  Then waited for awhile before she would come back to get the check.  In the meantime one of the people I was dining with had to leave.  10 minutes later came to get my cash payment and then 20 minutes later I was till waiting for my $87 of change.  The other three people I was dining with had to leave so I was now sitting alone and the waitress still did not come to bring my change.  I finally flagged a manager down and asked if I could please get my change because I had been waiting 20 minutes.  No apology, just said the waitress was having issue with another table.  Brought my change back in two minutes again saying the waitress was having issues with another table , I said I understood she was busy as it looked like she was waiting on half the restaurant.  She just looked at me like I had two heads. Brought down the mood from what had been a fun dinner.

Overall a very good experience here at Firefly. Traveling solo (no co-pilot!), so grabbed a seat at the large bar. The tapas menu is expansive, with many cold, veggie, and hot options. Very solid drink options and I chose wisely with the red sangria--not too sweet w/excess sugar and fruit--it was a perfect mix, just right. 

My tapas selections were spot on:  Pulpo asado (octo, potato,tomato, paprika-lemon Vinaigrette), the Chicken Tinga Empanada (fried and good), and the Mushroom Tart puff pastry (served warm--herbed cream cheese) in "gravy". The pulpo plate had a lovely coordinated flavor and the mush tart was a light, creamy journey to loveliness. 
The tapas and sangria were vehicles to the holy-land:  the Chocolate Tres Leches Cake. Do yourself a solid and share this with a pal or two--they will love you for it   I had the honor of devouring this symphony of flavor all on my own. 

Service was attentive at the bar--friendly and no nonsense. Grab some friends, some drinks, and have fun at Firefly.
This was our first time here. Food and service amazing. Stuffed peppers and fried calamari were our favorite. Mussels and ribs also delicious. We will be back next time we are in Vegas.

Will keep this short and sweet. Great place to get either small plates or even an entree. Wanted to try to Paella but ordered so many of the small plates didn;t have room. I was with friends and we all ordered and shared stuff. We loved everything we ordered. Some small plates are priced ok and others a little high. I like this location over the old one. Much bigger, more room, nice bar. Will be a regular here.
Wow!!!! Just wow!!!! We got 5 things but 2 were by far the best. The Ceviche of shrimp and steak and mushroom skewers are amazing!!!!! For sure get them or at least one.

Now that it has moved, I must write a new review. I just love this place! I am sad that I have moved so it is out of my way so I can't make my weekly happy hour trips, but I have been able to visit a few times and I have had great experiences. The food and drinks were just as good as the old location as was the service. I love that the new location is much bigger and more modern, although I do miss the dark romantic ambiance the old location had, but the bigger the restaurant is that means the less of a wait so I'm happy about that! Also, valet is a HUGE plus as the last location's parking situation was horrible. Some of my favorites I order every time I have been here and never disappoint are the stuffed peppers, pulpo asado and camarones al ajillo (garlic shrimp, I may have totally spelled that wrong but at least I tried LOL). Definitely recommend this place to everyone!

Called to pick up the seafood paella an hour before going to pick it up. It still wasn't ready when I went to pick it up. Had to wait another 20 minutes until it was done.

Apart from the waiting, the paella was delicious and enough for two people. Firefly did not skimp on the seafood and their tomato sauce is delicious.

The bread was delicious and fresh. The sauce to go with it is buttery and fantastic.

I would highly recommend trying their food. It did not disappoint.

Overall it's still firefly even with the scare that happened. I came here the other night and ordered a few dishes , it's still really good just like it's always been there was a few minor changes to each dish. The server was the only downfall to my experience here. Overall still taste and has the vibe of firefly.

This tapas restaurant has amazing food. Value is great, the choice of tapas is fantastic and all the ones we tried from gaspachos, bacon covered dates, apple mangego salad, firefly fries, ablondigas were unbelievable. We also had brunch tapas and came back twice! Best food in a long time, not to miss. Will try next their other Mexican restaurant! Congrats to Chef Villanueva and his team! Great service as well. A big thanks!
Everything was off to a good start with the food until the mussels and clams. Then the service went south. Hmmmmm, if it wasn't for the tuna tar tar I wouldn't have been happy.
The food here is great we order so many things every time we come here and are always more than satisfied! Oscar and Carlos are great servers, funny and easy going!
Prices are a little steep for tapas, but then again portions are pretty decent. The drinks are strong and good. I had the muscles and the portion was huge! Also delicious.

I died and went to tapas heaven!!!  OMG the pork empanadas gave me a foodgasm. You must get the stuffed dates.  Think candied bacon with a sweet creamy filling. Paired with a yummy sangria this. Place will be visited twice while I'm here on vacation.

Id give a 1 star if the food wasnt so delicious here. thats why im giving two. 
The service was horrible. came here for a going away party last week and we were sat in the middle of the room at a long table. My boyfriend and I were a little late so we asked the hostess if she sat any big parties, who ever she was texting on her phone was obviously waaay more important then we were so we found our party ourselves. once at the table it took us 15 minutes to be able to order drinks. I ordered my usual scotch and soda, never being asked what scotch i wanted, but i assumed they would just give me their well scotch. was i wrong about that... but we will go over that once i tell you about our bill.

our drinks finally arrive about 10 minutes later, i ordered water as well so i reminded the server when he dropped off our drinks. Our water never came, even after reminding him a 3rd time.

The food was amazing, as usual. We had the heirloom salad, padron peppers, artichoke toasts, ceviche, ahi poke, and we split the spicy shrimp. (i obviously took a break from veganism for a night) The heirloom salad is freaking amazing, ive never had such a great salad. 

Once getting our bill, we noticed i was charged for Macallan 12. For all my scotch drinkers that are reading this, it is a crime to mix Macallan 12 with soda.. If you cant just drink it straight, just admit to yourself that you are by no means a scotch enthusiast.  And with a price of $14 (i think?) a drink, we werent too thrilled. On top of everything the tip was already included, and we werent told this. So for horrible service we ended up tipping double. 

On our way out the same hostess was still on her phone texting away. If we didnt live in Veer Towers and were so close to this location we would never return. You would figure with all the bad press this restaurant has endured they would step up their customer service.

Hands down.......Best Tapas Ever.
Took a chance on this place based on the reviews. Gambled and won big!!!!
Had pork empanadas, Tierra del Mar skewers and a nice rib eye steak. 
Staff was attentive and friendly. 
Ambience was cool. I will be back for sure.
I definitely  recommend  this tapas bar!!

First time here and I was impressed. Off the strip it is a favorite of the locals and its tapas style dining is a great opportunity for a group to try several of their tasty offerings. Everything we ordered, and it was a large selection, was nicely prepared with this restaurant's own signature highlighted by subtle variations. For a Tuesday night it was unbelievably busy and that is a testament to its ability to tickle the palate.

This is always my go to place in Vegas.  Not on Strip, great food, and close enough for Uber.  They moved into a much larger place from the start so you can get in pretty quickly with a party but always make reservation if you have a large party.  The 1st favorite is bacon wrapped dates, just try it and you will be hooked. Plates are small so sharing is recommended.  The meats are awesome, albondigas(sp).  Etc.  I love almost all fish dishes, try to get the ceviche with fish or shrimp.  You should try the sangria's and order pitcher's, you'll want more after one.  All the food is solid, some of them unique taste.  Go here if you want to eat well, and start with what I said up here.
We went late, sat at the bar. Our bartender was nice and helpful with our questions. Sliders and chicken tinga empanada were highlights. Would definitely go back.

Went here for happy hour for my husbands birthday.  We sat outside on the patio.  It was a beautiful day.   We got monitors and sangria to drink. Yummy!!!   To eat got a bunch of tapas. The stuffed pepper bacon wrapped dates and steak were amazing. The other ones certainly weren't bad at all. We cannot wait to go back n

We had our wedding reception in one of their private rooms for 35 guests.  We chose the Tapas banquet  ( stuffed dates are DELISH) and the premium bar. We had the room for three hours.  Everyone and everything was beyond compare.  The food kept coming  the wait staff was unobtrusive.  Bar was great.  I cannot say enough about how great Fernanda was to work with.  I'm sure I made her crazy.  All of our requests were met.  All in all a great experience.  Our guests are all saying it was THE BEST EVER!  Thank you FIREFLY.

In the land of buffets and assortment of restaurants this is truly a hidden gem. there is only one word I need to use to describe this place - yum!!!! It is a little bit off the strip but definitely worth a try. Everything I tasted was delicious and mouthwatering. Also the service was pretty good and I would definitely recommend.
We hosted a dinner during my sister's bachelorette weekend and it was amazing!! Everyone was so helpful and the food was amazing!! The stuffed dates and sangria were my favorites! Thank you!!

Bring Firefly to NYC! ... Or maybe don't. I like having secrets gems out of state. Their happy hour is TOP NOTCH. It's off the strip but so what? So much variety and it's all half off! Lowkey spot, cool ambience, AWESOME DRINK/TAPAS MENU! Def make this a stop for happy hour!
Must try Lamb chops, warm spinach salad, shrimp, & veggie empanada.   GREAT atmosphere.   Light & refreshing

"my endless love!"

I visit Vegas almost as often as I change my undergarments.... seriously! We have been there twice this month and visit Firefly each and every time!!

I am vegetarian, pushing vegan and there are TONS of yummy creative options for me! With a few modifications, there are even MORE options! My boyfriend is a full-fledged carnivore and this is a place that suits us both. 

His favorite: the Rib Eye. My favorites: The empenadas, the artichoke toasts (with or without the aioli!), the green apple salad and the lentils (though they do need a little salsa/sauce). 

We always sit at the bar. 
Service is not the friendliest in the land or the most attentive but it is definitely not bad. Actually, in about the 2 years we have been going there it has improved. But there is still the occasional empty bar and we have to flag down the bartender even though there is no one else around. 

I encourage you... please do NOT go here. It will be too packed and I will be super sad if we cannot find a seat! This is my place, MINE I tell you!

This place was really amazing.  They have a huge variety of tapas and all selections we sampled were very unique and tasted excellent.  The bar is cool and I strongly recommend the sangria as it is the best I have ever had.  My favorite tapas was the bacon wrapped dates.  The location is just off the strip and it is easy to get to.  Service was fantastic and prices were reasonable for an upscale restaurant with a great atmosphere.

Dinner just took way too long. The food was good but it was not as great as it used to be. Things were either way too salty or not flavorful enough. The white sangria was way too sweet but the strawberry mojito was delicious.   I used to love the papitas bravas now I would have to say my favorite is the manchego mac and cheese. The service was sooooo slow.

Here is the deal folks : come here for tapas only!  I mean, that's it! Not paella, not for the hostess service, not for trying to get most of your tapas together.   Fill up on tapas. And the sangria will not disappoint. 

Five stars tapas are as follows: stuffed dates (ON POINT - I mean seriously on POINT! ), merguez (couldn't ask for better lamb sausage - savory with right amount of spice), empanada (NOT the the chicken tinga), chicken and chorizo stuffed mushroom,  juevos estrellados (it has really good spice but only order to get full...carbs will help fill you up)  

They have outdoor misters if you want to be outdoors. Noise level is fine. Not too rowdy at all but I went on a sunday evening around 8 pm so you be the judge.   Plenty of parking but can easily get here by taxi from the strip for under ten bucks (like 8 bucks) - note that we came from Wynn. 

One of the better tapas places I've been to. Really really good food. :)

Went to firefly with homies for a bday dinner. Have to say the customer service was on point with them constantly checking up on us. The food was priced well and came out fast. Definitely had some favorites but I feel like if you know what to order this place is bomb. Way better than overpaying at the strip. Would be back for sure.
My favorite place to dance in Las Vegas! I've been coming here for years and it never fails to be a good time, especially if you love salsa.

The food and service is amazing! 
Great ambiance too. 
I highly recommend this place!

My wife loves this place. We used to go here a lot. Actually we used to go here everytime we go to las vegas. We would also recommend this place to everyone.

Its a tapas place (small plates) which is good so you get to taste a lot of different dishes.

Me and my wife felt that this place deteriorated over time.
Excellent service from Neo! Food is flavorful , ambiance pretty chill. Sangria delish . Mushroom tart a must try ! Paella tDF

Excellent tapas dishes; we had 5 different plates that were all equally delicious. They have a honey & almond butter with their bread that is unbelievable. Atmosphere was really nice too - noisy but you can still have conversations. The service was awesome with the dishes coming out one after another, giving us time to enjoy each one. Would highly recommend.

My review would have been a 5 star rating, but their night time salsa dancers pissed me off & ruined my good time.

First, let me say that the red sangria is the best I've ever had!!  Truly amazing!  Our party of 3 finished two pitchers (it would have been more had we not been "forced" out).

It was SO noisy inside with little acoustic material to absorb sound so we asked to sit on the patio. It was a beautiful fall night!

We had the dates, shrimp ceviche, tuna tartare, baby back ribs, skewered meats, and caramel flan.  All the food had a rich flavor, and everything tasted very fresh. The sauce on the ribs was sweet yet savory.

Everything was perfect until the salsa band showed up. Girl #1 started moving tables to make room for dancing by dragging the metal tables across the floor. It was so loud & the pitch was so high that it hurt my ears....like nails on a chalkboard!  Seriously?!?!  There were still 3 tables enjoying their meal!!  Then girl #2 approached each table & basically told us to leave because they were going to play music & dance. WTF?!?!  After telling the server that I was upset, we paid our check.  When we arose from the table, these people had all their band stuff around our table & we couldn't even exit the area!!  SO RUDE!!!!

Had the manager approached us earlier to let us know what was going on, we would have taken our group inside to drink more sangria. But instead the server kept apologizing.  So we just left. 

If I do return to this restaurant, it will be for the food & I will NOT get in the way of the rude conceited self-absorbed salsa people. Just plain ridiculous.
Bartender is friendly and makes great drinks. Also recommends what to get since it's my first time.

This place is amazing! The waiter we had was so attentive and even moved our menus to the side for us to have extra space on the table. The pitcher of red wine sangria was delicious and just two tapas were enough to fill me up. I had the apple machengo which was a green apple type salad which was delicious, and the ahi tuna skewers which I highly recommend. The atmosphere is calm yet infused with red everywhere and the music is just the right volume for having conversation without yelling
The food was amazing and delicious. Service was exceptional as well as the drinks. Mojitos were stout!

With 985 reviews under my belt, my friends handed me the task of picking a place to eat on a Friday night.  "Keep it cheap, but not too cheap". "Classy but not stuffy".  "I want MEAT".  "Something off the strip".  "$20 entrees, plus drinks."  "Dude, we trust you".  Ok, I got this.

The reviews were, in the words of Vin Scully, "remarkable".  Two $$. Good looking pictures (food porn).  Easy to make reservations for a party of eight.  My wife and I were the first to arrive and we had the choice of inside or outside.  The bar area is gorgeous, the inside had cool music and a classy vibe but the patio was perfect for us.  We are a loud group so we wanted to feel more comfortable.  Red and white lights above us on the canvas patio cover.  Very simple, kind of cool.

Service was prompt and efficient.  The tapas were amazing.  Top picks were the hot cheese dishes with chorizo, bacon wrapped dates and tuna tartare.  The highlight was the paella.  We had one with seafood and another with chicken and mushroom.  Killer dishes.  3 pitchers of different sangria so made us all fuzzy and happy.

The desserts were plentiful and the banana Nutella dish was a standout dish.  In truth, I was pretty buzzed to remember too much but all of my friends had a great time.  About $40 per head including booze, tax and tip.  Winner winner tasty dinner.

After FireFly had their little health code shut down i thought I'd never be back, but they turned it around and have the best Sangria and awesome tapas for cheap which make for a great meal. The stuffed dates and chorizo stuffed mushrooms were most memorable dishes of the 10 or so we tried. Every dish was quickly served and  flavored to perfection. if you've never been its amazing and for return visitors the newly remodeled Firefly makes for an impressive venue for a date or just a casual hangout with good friends. awesome job!

We arrived a little before the late happy hour time, but since we asked information about it the waiter was so nice to give us the HH menu and wait until the clock struck the hour to take our orders!

The ambience/atmosphere is pretty cool, I liked it. It is a perfect place for a couple or for a small group of good friends. The service was good, fast and not too oppressive. The only negative note to it is that at the end of the meal the waiter took my husband's glass away before he had actually finished his beer!

Anyway, I'm giving 5 starts also because of the food: it was really tasty, fresh and well prepared and presented. We tried a few tapas - some of them in HH too, GREAT deal! - and the empanadas were probably the best, so give them a try. I enjoyed my red sangria as well.

The place is a drive away from Las Vegas' center, and that means it isn't crowded. Thumbs up!

As soon as knew I was going to Vegas I bookmarked this place.  
I read the reviews, saw the pictures, and knew I had to try it.

I did not have a lot of time in Vegas, just going for a trade show, during the week, and only time off for dinner.
First night I attempted to go, place was booked for a private event and wait time was over an hour.  I didn't give up, next day, I went a little earlier and was able to find a spot at the bar.

I was greeted immediately, and given both the happy hour menu and food menu.
I love Tapas style restaurants, gives you an opportunity to try many different things, especially if sharing.  
Since I was traveling solo, I didn't get to order many things but what I did, I absolutely loved.

I started with one of their specialty sangrias, the sparkling one.  Very well balance between the wine and peach flavor, plus all the fruit.  It's a little too sweet for me but very refreshing and I would order it again.  

While enjoying my Sangria, I looked over the food menu and decided on the Mushroom and Steak kabobs, and the Manchego Mac N Cheese.  
They didn't take too long to come out, and they served them almost at the same time so I was able to have them as a meal.  Protein and it's side dish.
The steak, I ordered medium-well, was soft, juicy and very flavorful.  The mushrooms were decent size, and so delicious with the steak.
The Mac N Cheese was crunchy on top, perfect amount of cheese...  maybe if I would have stopped eating this I would have been able to try something else but I just couldn't.  

Before I was able to finish my meal, the sangria was done.  Instead of ordering another one, I saw their other specialty are mojitos...  and, they have a passion fruit one.  I just HAD to order it, and absolutely LOVED it!  The passion fruit flavor (my favorite fruit) really comes through, and it's not drowned in sugar/ simple syrup (like many places do).  I like it's natural tartness, and love when people don't mess with it.  Extra points for that!

The food was amazing, service was friendly & quick, and on top of that, I got to talk with some fun people sitting at the bar near me.  
So glad I went again that night and got to enjoy this place.  Definitely a must and permanently on my list of restaurants to visit in Vegas.
Great tapas! The atmosphere was up scale causal. It is just off the strip so it was easy to get to and had a bit more relaxed atmosphere. Favorite dishes were the scallops escargot and rib eye.

Used to come here all the time but waited after all those people got sick. The new place is better and bigger visual wise. The firefly fries and stuffed dates were on point! The sangria is the same and I had two glasses. My sliders had chewy meat so I gave up on those and my boyfriend didn't like his chicken empanadas. He got ahi tuna and he ate the whole thing and like it! We got the peppers and they were delicious! We got the dessert platter but next time I'll just get tres leches. Coming back again .

I never actually went there. I called because Yelp showed it was very busy. I asked if they had a waiting list I could put my name on or reservations. She said you have to check in there. I explained I had a disability and cannot stand. I asked if there was seating for people waiting. She said yes but they would not make sure I was able to sit. I again explained that I wanted to come but that I cannot wait. She suggested I go elsewhere then. Her tone was very rude. She certainly has no empathy for people with disabilities. It is a very poor reflection of the establishment. I do not plan to go there now.

I'm not saying this is a good thing, but Firefly is the first place I've ever gotten drunk!! The food was incredible here. We ordered several tapas and a pitcher of raspberry mojitos. I would love to tell you all the dishes we tried, but I don't think I can remember them all. I know we had a vegetable empanada, an apple salad, mini steak sandwiches, baked goat cheese and diablo shrimp. Each dish was wonderful. We will definitely return when we head back to Vegas.
Nice place, great vibe, loud , and the food well the 4 stars are for the food, it is tasty but the meals are  small.

The smoked salmon bagels and ceviche of shrimp were both a hit with my friend and I. The bar serves drinks with style and a little something extra each time. It's definitely a cute place to bring someone out for a fun little date night.

I didn't hear about this place's "storied" history until I had already been here and decided I loved it (for more info, read the 1 star reviews or google it). Lucky me - I may not have ever come otherwise. This review is only for my experiences, which have been top notch. 

That being said - this is now just about my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Very reasonable prices, a great selection (i haven't had anything on the menu that i didn't like - and Ive had a lot), and fantastic service. 

Highlights:

-Tortilla espanola
-Shrimp ceviche
-Tierra y mar skewers

Come here with a group that's hopefully not too picky, and try as much on the menu as you can until you can't eat anymore. The waiters are very happy to help you through this process and make suggestions for you too. 

Cool atmosphere and an extensive beer and wine selection on top of all that. Tapas + Rioja + sobremesas = happy Kurt G. 

Also - the bathroom smells like Sweetarts. Not sure how i feel about that yet, but thought it deserved mentioning.

Tried this place out for a vendor lunch while attending a local event at the convention center. Was hesitant as all we had heard was about the sick outbreak some time ago, but was willing to give it a try.
