We were seated on the patio and the environment is great, but the food was not. We had 10 people in our party and no one was super excited about their lunch choices. 

With all the amazing food places to choose from in Vegas, would not recommend or return to Fire Fly. Quality of food is not worth the price tag.

This is a great Tapas bar!  They have a nice wine selection and many different tapas to choose  from.  The server was very helpful, but when I asked him what was good, well he seemed top like everything on the menu.  I can see why, because everything we ordered was very good.  I guess our favorite was the apple manchego salad, but I think you can't go wrong.  Great service, nice atmosphere, we will definitely return.

Food is good, but service is kinda a joke. I feel very disappointed for coming back to this place. We sat down for a while before our server approached us and we barely see that person through out rest of the dinner time. We had to ask someone to refill out water and that person never returned back to our table.  One server stood close to us once a while to watch a game that was playing on the tv which located right above my friends head.  Asked for the bill and took forever to get it. I feel like we spent most of our time just waiting around for someone to serve us. We did not enjoy our time at all. I'm very surprised to see this kind of service here. I will not recommend it to my friends and family.  There are many places in Vegas that provides great food with great service. I would not come back to this place again.

Hubby and I met up with some friends for a birthday dinner here. We had a reservation, but still had to wait for our table in the bar area which is pretty common on a Friday or Saturday night. The bar is big, busy and can get crowded. They have several options when it comes to hot and cold plates to share. We tried and shared several dishes from the menu and most everything was well liked. 

Garlic Bread with Sweet Almond Butter - This was brought at the beginning of the meal and it's oh so addicting! Very very good. 

Ham and Cheese Croquetas ($6) - Serrano ham and manchego cheese. These were tasty! Comes with 3 croquetas. Why oh why couldn't you put 4 on the plate to even things out? Lol. They are a decent size and best eaten right away while hot. 

Roasted Beets and Persimmon Salad ($9) - Star anise, mixed greens, pecan crusted goat cheese, beets, persimmon and balsamic-pear vinaigrette. The greens were a tad too salty on this dish, but everything else was very good. 

Mushroom Tart ($10) - This was a well liked dish at our table and now we know to order more of it next time! It came with 4 puff pastries covered in a delicious mushroom sauce and it also had some cream cheese. Everything melded well together and I wanted to lick the plate. 

Stuffed Dates ($6.50) - You get 5 bacon-wrapped dates each stuffed with a smoked almond in a red wide reduction and sprinkled with blue cheese. This is one of the most popular items on the menu and with good reason. The stuffed dates here are some of the best that I have had and even when I see Firefly at Bite of LV or some other event around town I have to stop by and grab some of their stuffed dates. These tasty gems shouldn't be overlooked when ordering from the menu. 

Baked Goat Cheese ($8) - Goat and garlic cream cheese in a boat of tomato sauce that's drizzled with pesto and served with toast. My hubby really liked this dish while I didn't like it much at all. I personally didn't taste any garlic it was just plain cream cheese. I did enjoy the bread that came with it. 

Stuffed Peppers ($8.50) - 3 good sized Spanish piquillo peppers stuffed with fresh mozzarella and garlic cream cheese on a bed of tomato sauce and topped with green onions and crispy onions. This was a very good dish and well liked by others in our group. 

Serrano Sliders ($9) - 2 mini burgers with serrano ham, cabrales bleu cheese and a side of crispy onions. These sliders tasted great, but where was the ham? I'm not sure if the ham is mixed with the burger and then cooked or if it's supposed to be slices on the slider, but there was no visible ham or none that could be tasted in the mini patty itself. Still tasty regardless however with serrano  in the name I would expect more of a piggy flavor. 

Someone in our group brought a birthday cake from a local bakery and the restaurant had no problem slicing it up and serving it to us on their dishes after our meal. Service was good and the menu is priced fairly. Definitely a great place for large groups.

Love this place, my favorite dishes: 
Papas bravas, croquetas.
Friaday night: Salsa music do you can dance all night.
The only thing: they no bring the food to the terrace on Friday night, you have to purchase at the bar, and it could be inconvenient. 
Service is good

My husband found this place on the whim while we were in Vegas. We took our friends there and had the most amazing meal! All the dishes were bursting with flavor, freshness, and heat! This place isn't on the strip so parking was a breeze. Will be back the next time I'm in town. The wait staff was attentive and friendly. The reception could use some work but I'm judging this place on the food so I would override that mishap. Don't forget to order the paella in advance 'cuz it takes ~40 mins to make. You won't be disappointed.

Nothing says "I love you" like great tapas and sangria. Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates stuffed with almonds in a red wine reduction? They were a damned fine start. 

Who'd a thunk Mac n cheese at a Mexican themed joint would be good, well it was. Correction it was great (especially after a wee pinch o salt).

Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates?

And our starter was the manchego and apple salad. I wanted a big bowl of it. It was lightly dressed with chopped, toasted nuts atop. I am going to make that at home - twice.

Did I mention the bacon wrapped dates? Maybe?

Go. Have fun & eat like a local in Vegas. Bring some friends and sit in the gangster alcove in the back.
I love this place! Every time I come here I am never disappointed! Thank you for your great food and service Fire Fly!

Ordered 8 dishes. Steak was over cooked then what i asked for. I am a chef myself so my critism is slightly high, but the food was ok. The shish kabob was fantastic, but as for the rest, not worth going back a second time.

I've been to Firefly before, at their smaller location a few years back. We were in town for the weekend for Mr Olympia and to celebrate our post-wedding bachelor/bachelorette so i wanted to come back and try their new larger location.

i made a reservation for Saturday at 8PM and we drove up right at that time. They had our table all ready and set up with no wait time at all. The restaurant is definitely much bigger and nicer than their previous spot. 

I absolutely love sangria so naturally, the beau and I ordered a glass each of the red sangria ($7 each). Some of the others in our party ordered the mojitos which I tried as well.  Both drinks were delicious and refreshing!

For food, he and i had the chicago beef bocadillos, chorizo plate and huevos estrellados. i'm a meat eater, give me lots of protein...and all the dishes we had was perfect! i also had a little taste of the dishes my friends ordered which included stuffed dates, chicken skewers, steak & mushroom skewers and baby back ribs. OMG, i was seriously in tapas heaven! the portions are much bigger than what you'd expect too so be prepared to share!

we really wanted to order the paella but knowing it would take a long time to prepare and we had to places to go, we decided not to order it this time.

the service was good, the food delicious, the drinks strong and made to perfection. it was absolutely one of the best dining experiences, especially with good company! Seriously, this is the one of the best places to eat off the strip!

I've come here twice and would recommend Firefly to others! It's about an 8 minute uber from the strip but worth making the trek to visit. The house made sangria is a must try! This is a tapas (small / sharing plates) style restaurant, which is great for any type of occasion. Tons of vegetarian options, but plenty of options for the meat eaters alike.

PRICEY. 

I came her because ever since I was in college everyone raved about how good this place was. It's been 8 years since and I have to say the price definitely outweighs the flavor here. It's tapas style where everything is a appetizer and you order a bunch to share. We order about 7 dishes and really only enjoyed 2:

Mushroom Tart
Lemon Butter Cod 

The rest just wasn't worth the $8 price point. For example, the chorizo mushroom cap was literally 4 small BUTTON mushrooms. 

Extra star because service was good.

My favorite tapas restaurant! I always have to go here when I am in Vegas. Food is amazing! Here are my favorites in order:
- Stuffed Dates
- Manchego Mac & Cheese
- Tierra y Mar skewers
- Scallops Escargot
- Stuffed Peppers
- Pork Empanada
- Mixed Paella (although this is a hit or miss because sometimes it is too salty.. ask for lemons)
- Baked Goat Cheese

Sangria are better than the Mojitos here. Get a pitcher!

I made reservations for 6 for birthday party at 6.30pm (Friday). We got seated today in a cute private booth. 

I love their ambiance, trendy, and dim with lots of Spanish arts on the wall. Outside seatings looked very beautiful.

The waiter suggested their winter Sangria that has pumpkin and cinnamon. It was tasty. I ordered Chorizo clams - the clams were very fresh.

Camarones Al La Diabla - the lemon garlic sauce was flavorful and the shrimp was plump.

The place is great for big groups. It was very loud and packed with big parties celebrating birthdays. Not a place for quiet conversations.

My friends enjoyed their food. If you let them know it's your birthday, they give you a complimentary flan.

The service was top notch. We sat there talking for a while and they didn't rush us.

Our expectations were high after reading the reviews but our expectations were exceeded. Our experience was fantastic from drink to food to service by Alejandro. 
We had 2 martinis that were GREAT. The Scallop Escargot was amazing. We shared 6 different Tapas and every one was so flavorful. 
You will not be disappointed here and the patio is lovely.

I have had tapas in a lot of cities and this place did not disappoint! The menu was huge and the food was amazing. We had the garden variety salad, pork empanada, and salmon bagels. OH and a pitcher of sangria!! They also give free bread with a garlic butter. SO DIVINE! 

Having dinner at Firefly was a great way to spend our first night in Vegas. I would have to say out of all the places we ate in Vegas, it was the best. We will definitely be back next trip!!

This is the first Mexican Tapas restaurant that I have been to in Las Vegas. I I did not know what to expect. When we watching all of the hostesses and waitresses were extremely friendly. The menu was relatively cheap and had a variety of things that I had never seen before, such as bell pepper tomato soup. We were able to order a wide variety of things and nothing had let me down. The best items on the menu that we had ordered that I would probably have been the bacon wrapped dates or the paella for $26. I would most definitely come here again if I had the opportunity.

Really enjoyed the tapas! Plus it has a really fun atmosphere. 

The stuffed dates were amazing! So was the tuna tartare. 

Was a bit disappointed with the chicken stuffed mushrooms. But other than that dish everything was really yummy!!

Would definitely come back!

Food was excellent. First time coming to restaurant like this. I was unfamiliar with the food selections. Wait staff was helpful I recommending a couple of plates I would like. Next time I will try the paella.

My family and I ate dinner at this "off strip" restaurant on a Saturday night.  The food was really good, and we had a lot of fun trying new things.  Our bill for two adults and one child was only $50, and that included one beer and a dessert.  We would definitely go here again the next time we are in Las Vegas!

I wanted to give this place a better rating.The Fried Calamari was great and loved the fact they have tenticles and okay saice. The Churizo Clams we're probably the best thing we had, really awesome flavor. Wish there were more clams. The ribs weren't as good as I thought, very tender but I felt they tried to mask a lot of taste with all the topping. The Rib bones broke off while I was eating and the meat was burnt. Waiter wasn't really on it, but the inside of the restaurant was very well setup. Wish I had something better to say...
The food is absolutely amazing!!!! Whoever thought one would get full off appetizers! I highly recommend this place.

The waiter was very rude. I knew our party was rather large, but were all very easy and polite. I specifically specified chicken and he brought me pork and tried to deny it. Thankfully he brought out another. The food was very good, but I was not happy at all with my experience here.
This place is always fun. The sangria is great and the food is different than most other restaurants. It's one of my go to stops when Im in Vegas.

We went to Firefly on a Friday night with a group of 6. We ordered about 10 dishes, and everything was delicious, particularly the Korean short ribs, the clams & chorizo, and the baked goat cheese. Even the complimentary bread and almond honey butter was incredible. There wasn't a single dish or drink we didn't love, and the service was fantastic. The atmosphere was great, too... we sat outside and had a great time.

My group had lunch here while at a conference.  The only reason this isn't 5 star is because the food came out in no logical order.  Some of our party were done eating before others got food.  Two people ordered the same thing that came out at different times.  Really not a big deal to me, but 5 star takes perfection.  Wait staff was polite and accommodating.  The food was really, really good.

Like most people I was a little nervous to consume food here again but I also think once an establishment has been caught doing the unsanitary things that they are guilty of that that they are now on their best behavior.  Firefly's new space is larger often making it look like it doesn't ever get crowded.  I also appreciate the fact that unlike the old location you can actually have conversations here without yelling or feeling like you are sitting on top of each other.  I have now been here for a private function in a back room, sat at the bar for apps and drinks and most recently for a birthday celebration.  

I've never had a problem with service.  The dates used to be my favorite but this last visit they just seemed watered down and I don't think I will order them again.  The mango ribs, however, are a must order.
delicious tapas!! the food was amazing and so was the ambiance of this restaurant. Great for date night, so intimate and some-what dark inside. Great place for dinner and drinks OFF the strip

Had family in town and was looking for somewhere that would really hit the spot for everyone. I  am so glad to have found another location for this restaurant as the location nearer my house was closed. Firefly has always lived up to my expectations at their now closed Summerlin location, I was extremely pleased to see it carried on in their Paradise location. :) The service is attentive without being overbearing, the food delicious! We left full and happy! Please open in Summerlin again soon.
My favorite place off the strip. I had the red sangria, bacon wrapped dates, mac n cheese, lamp chops, and empanadas. ALL were very good.

I haven't been here since they moved and I always enjoyed Firefly. A 30 min wait on a Friday was not bad and we were taken to a table within this time frame. We sat and it took  a bit for a server to come over so we made some food decisions before ordering a drink. Finally ordering a mojito it was brought back to the table with the worst sour taste to it. A new one was made with no issues and it was a little better.
 -The food itself was up and down. The fries are always good and the Serrano ham and cheese plate was excellent. The clams with chorizo were bad, the clams weren't cleaned and there was grit in the dish along with broken pieces of shell. The Tierra y mare skewers which are my favorite were so salty I wiped them off with a napkin! just a nightmare.
- service may be the worst. Waiting on drinks and trying to reorder food is like waiting in line at the DMV but with alcohol. Most of the staff was busy talking to a friend who sat at a big booth and sipped water for an hour while other parties waited to be seated. It was nice to see someone was being waited on.
:D :D :D 1) the Tres Leches cake 2) and infused vodka - enough said!

Great place for Spanish tapas. Everything was very flavorful. I ordered apple manchego salad, chorizo clams, lamb chops, dates - all excellent

Great choice for a light meal of small plates. I would have loved to order dessert but was too full. Topped all off with a glass of dry CAVA

The new place is great! Don't know how, but it was even better than the 1st time we went, we tried a lot of tapas, and all were AMAZING! Stuffed dates, patatas bravas. stuffed mushrooms, meatballs, chicken skewers, fries, sardine/anchovie avacado bread, all were so delish! Sangria was out of this world! Banana nutella sandwiches and chocolate tres leches were good, not the best part of the meal, nothing to complain about, but not out of this world.  Our waiter was great also.

I did most of the happy hour menu there with my mom, I think happy hour is from 3 to 6 Mon-Thursday. Everything was $4 to $5 on happy hour menu. The shredded apple salad was delish! Veggie Empanadas were crispy and yummy. The complimentary bread looked amazing, but I am watching my carb intake. The sauces were were flavorful. Overall I would recommend this place!
I was not impressed this visit. Had the paella with the red sauce. It Was over cooked. Rice was mushy and the seafood was very chewy.
Loved the food! Delicious!! The ambiance was fabulous!! So glad we heard about this place... We Loved it! Everything was top notch! Will be back again!

Amazing food & service! If you're looking for a good time and incredible food, this is definitely a place to try. Our group couldn't get over how delicious each plate tasted! My favorite? Definitely the mac & cheese and the chicken empanadas. Absolutely one of the best tapas meals I've had.
Their Happy hour is absolutely amazing. Their mojitos and Sangria are off the charts! 10/10 would go again

What can say about this place except I LOVE FIREFLY AND THEIR FOOD! I originally had eaten, a while back, at their location they used to have off of Fremont in Downtown Vegas. I fell in love the first moment I had their food. It's hard to find any Spanish restaurant that actually has TRUE Tapas. This place has the best Tapas outside of Spain. The flavor of the food is absolutely mouthwatering and delicious. I have never been disappointed. I don't live in Vegas but when I visit, I have to eat here each time. It's a must!!! If you are vegetarian like me, they have a special menu for you. I wish they had more location but I am grateful for even having this one. The Sangria is also a must. And if you are a fan of Nutella, you have to try their banana Nutella sandwiches! Yummy!!!!!

I love love LOVE Firefly!!! The food is absolutely delicious, the drinks impeccably refreshing, and the service is speedy. I have never tried a dish that I didn't like, but my favorites and first to recommend would be the Stuffed Dates, Ahi Tuna Skewers, Steak and Mushroom Skewers, Petite Filet Mignon, Stuffed Peppers, and Chocolate Tres Leches Cake. Try it and love it too!
Food was perfect! Bar staff was super nice! Will come back next time I'm in town. Good place for locals.

I was seeking a unique eating experience off the Strip but special for a day trip to Vegas. My Special Lady Friend hadn't ever had Tapas and Yelp was recommending Firefly so I thought we'd hit it. 

I'd been to a couple of Tapas places but looking on the app I've never seen such an extensive menu with so many types of Tapas to choose from such as Chilled, Seafood, and Meat and Poultry. 

The space is pretty amazing with the romantic atmosphere and these awesome images of Flamenco dancers and Spanish art all over the walls. Great for something romantic or friendly or just stooping in for lunch on a day trip to Vegas. I'd love to come check it out on their Latin Night. The bar is a very stylish installation that should be a wonder when the lights are low. 

Have individual captions on the Tapas that we ate. Our favorites were definitely the Bacon wrapped dates that had a nice, rich sauce to go with it, the Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms, and the Serrano Ham and Machengo Cheese. Each portion is sizeable and great for two people. The Ahi skewer was actually pretty meaty and nicely packed with fruit and a great garnish that completed the dish. I would have loved to try more of what they had on the menu. 

My one complaint might be that during lunch rush our waitress disappeared for a bit but the bus boys and her fellow waiters made sure to help us out as best they could. 

I'd totally recommend this place and would happily visit again for lunch. Many more Tapas to try.

Tried this on a whim. It was wonderful. We ordered several items and split them. Everything was great with an exception of the fries which were just good. We look forward to going back and exploring even more of the large menu they offer.

The food was great and was really surprised how flavorful and fresh all the food was.Im a picky guy and was quite hesitant to try this place out.When we arrive our car was parked quickly by valet and we were seated promptly.My girlfriend and I enjoyed everything about the mean except out waiter was training a new guy and never really came around,however we were fortunate enough to get a great busser who picked up all of the servers slack while he was flirting with his coworkers. We'll go back for sure and I look forward to trying more from their menu.I do recommend this place most certainly and had it not been for the waiter making his shift his personal social hour this would be a 5 star review.

Terrible!
They sold the restaurant as a Spanish tapas place but is toooo far away from the original Spanish food, the only thing they keep in the dishes is the name. 

Something funny, they bring the same horrible bread over and over, at the beginning with butter and with every dish.

They add butter to every single thing. The next morning, I woke up with a strange taste in my throat.

A place to avoid in Vegas.

Love tapas. Love Firefly. Sad the other locations are closed. Will always and forever adore their bread and butter. Red sparkling sangria was my new venture this visit, and I really liked it. I always get the bacon wrapped dates... and then will indulge in a second order. I am a fan of their spicy shrimp tapa... can't remember the name of it but it's  sinfully good. Great place for casual business dinners, or girls night out. The border of swanky and casual- and I have found Tapas to be one of the best ways to have a social dinner. Can't wait for my next visit!

The menu is HUGGGEEE for tapas. Surprisingly 4 dishes was way more than enough for my friend and I. We came on a Thursday night and it was really busy as there were only two servers in the entire restaurant. As busy as it was, our server rang in our food rather quickly because our dishes came out right away!

We shared: 
- Warm Spinach Salad - Pretty tasty dish! But we could've done without as we enjoyed the other dishes way more!
- Ceviche - So fresh! Be sure to ask for extra chips, it's not enough!
- Mac and Cheese - Pretty tasty but also pretty standard compared to most other restaurants. 
- Babyback Ribs - The meat fell right off the bones and was so tasty with their mango bbq sauce.

I'd love to come back the next time I'm out in Vegas!

2nd time at Firefly... 2nd time amazed!  I laid off the happy hour sangria this time though... so I can actually remember something about the food to write a review.

Everything here is fantastic... for those not familiar with Tapas (such as my parents)... just think of it as a Spanish version of Dim Sum. 

Ordered the usual:

Stuffed Dates - bacon wrapped... yum!  Some might find the flavor unusual however... each serving comes with 5

Roasted Beet Salad - have had better elsewhere... you can skip this and try something else

BBQ Mango Ribs - my favorite dish... very tangy yet has that mango sweetness... meat falls off the bone... dish comes with 4 good sized ribs

Firefly Fries - truffle fries = king of all fries.  comes with a nice dipping sauce as well

Stuffed Mushrooms - stuffed with some sort of chorizo... fantastic. 4 pieces per order

Seafood Paella - order this right when you sit down because it takes a while to cook... probably could feed 4-6 people... it's great!  It's quite on the peppery/spiced side (not spicy but you can taste a lot of different spices added).  Unfortunately it came last and we were quite full already and couldn't enjoy it.

Even the bread appetizer is delicious... comes with what I think was a jalapeno butter and olives.

I stayed away from it this time... but the Sangria is fantastic.  Especially if you get it during happy hour.... quite the bang for the buck... careful though... that sh*t creeps up on you!

Only reason this doesn't get 5 stars in my book is the music is way too loud and the service is a bit slow.

I'm so happy that Firefly moved and didn't close. I have loved visiting this place as long as I've been coming to Vegas (long time). Their Padron peppers are my favorite menu item and they did not disappoint today! A full plate of peppers flash fried with lemon and sea salt was $5.50 - a really unbeatable price compared to anywhere else. We also had fries with Parmesan seasoning and that's the only plate that at all disappointed me. The serving was very large but the fries were soft and not crispy, even though they were skinny and browned. Lots of yummy shaved cheese though!

Husband enjoys the ham and cheese croquetas ($5) and had a soda also (coke $2.50). I tried a new plate this time and went with the chili, lime garbanzo beans (in the shell!) ($4.50) I didn't even know they came in a shell (but it makes sense) so I asked the server what they're like. He compared them to edamame but these little pods were much more difficult to work the beans out of. I liked them a lot but they were a lot of work for too little reward. 

The new restaurant is wonderful. Much bigger and still a great location. There is parking in the back, but if you miss the driveway on the way in, be sure to not park in the subsequent parking lot, as we were told they are happy to tow you.

$25.41 for amazing tapas for two

The food was delicious. I had crab cakes, steak and mushrooms skewers, filet mignon, and mac and cheese Tapas. If I had to change anything it would be to bring out the food all together and keep homeless people out. We were followed out to the parking lot and hit up for money by a homeless man we just saw grabbing candy inside.

Stuffed Bacon Wrapped Dates - 'nuff said!

Even of all the nice, fancy restaurants Las Vegas has to offer this one is always at the top of my list and mostly always on my mind when I dream about yummy dishes!
I really love the paella and sangría, the place it's a little bit noisy but good... and decoration it's

We came here for a very early dinner before we hit up the Strip and it was a great idea because not only was the food amazing, but it was also happy hour. I had a Cherry Moscow Mule and it was nice spin on the drink. It was definitely on the sweeter side which was enjoyable.

If you're looking a pre-party meal, I would suggest this place. I was not full in anyway after the meal, but I knew if I was going to have 21+ later that night, I would still have enough food in my stomach to keep me functional. However, if you're looking to chow down, I wouldn't recommend this place because the portions are fairly small and for three girls, we pretty much cleaned up every plate. For that reason, I would put this place at more of a 3.5.
Great place that is local. Found a long hair, manager addressed as well as server. Scallops were over cooked. Other than that good food good price.

This is the best kept secret in Vegas. Great food and amazing service in the BEST of atmospheres. Do not miss this gem while in the Sin City!  Ask for Haley or Athena for the time of your life!!! Craft beer I haven't had the pleasure of trying yet, paired with the finest tapas! Amazing taste and affordable pricing! Great company with knowledgable bartenders! Every flavor mojito you can imagine made to order! Very well known by locals for their Sangria!!! We love Firefly, come see for yourself!!!

I lived for another day...so their previous demerits should not merit on this review. I like their new location and the new feel. It's very dark, romantic (if you want it to be), and hip. They are filled with nicely designed booths for more privacy, and they have a private room which you can reserve for a big party.

I headed to the bar and of course you have to order one of their signature mojitos or sangria (by the glass or pitcher...if i were you I'd order a pitcher) as I wait for the rest of my party. Even if I was already late I was still early than the rest of my group. Anyway, I ordered a glass of the BLOOD ORANGE MOJITO. Then, as our party slowly but surely showed up, we ordered rounds of pitchered mojitos. This included the watermelon and cucumber mojito. 

Here are my mojito highlights:
Glass: $7.50 Pitcher: $30.00

BLOOD ORANGE: Lovely! It has that nice tart taste from the blood orange, and can barely taste the alcoholic kick. So if you want something with a strong cocktaily flavor with less of an alcoholic taste I would recommend.

CUCUMBER: This is pretty good too. Here, you taste more of the alcoholic flavor. It is a lighter mojito flavor wise. So if you're looking for something fun in flavor...probably steer away from here.

WATERMELON: While a pitcher or two of these bad boys may lead you to your own rendition to DRUNK IN LOVE (you can't help it since Queen B does say watermelon), this has a really light refreshing taste with a good mixture of that alcoholic POW. Definitely, one of my faves. In which we did drink the most of. 

Food wise, we ordered a bunch of random plates in which a party of 7 shared. 4 pitchers and a handful of tapas plates later, our tab reached a good $300. So expect to pay a good $60 to $80 PER PERSON especially if it's at a dinner party. 

Other favorite foods I like ordering here:

DATES
CHORIZO SKEWERS
SCALLOP ESCARGOT
STEAK AND MUSHROOM SKEWERS
SHRIMP CEVICHE
MUSHROOM/CHEESE TART (this is really filling with a strong cream taste...which is usually a hit or miss with people so be careful)

Just name drop these choices and you'll sound like a regular here. Other than that, read everyone else's review on the plates.

I was fortunate enough to dine here during CES last week. Holeeee moleee it was good. We bought pitchers of the Sangria which was suitable for 3-4 people. Then we started off with the bacon wrapped dates because BACON. My colleague was very eager to try something with Manchengo cheese so we ordered the Manchego Mac & Cheese which was good but I'd pass next time around(not a manchego cheese fan). The pork empanadas were good as well but I'd definitely recommend the steak and mushroom. Nom nom noms.

Price was reasonable so if you get a chance dine here!

I love fire fly, if it was a little cheaper would get 5 stars, took the girlfriend on a date here and we were both very happy with the service and food. The bacon wrapped dates Mmm so tasty. If locals get discounts I would be returning quite often .

Came here on a Saturday night, It was quite busy. Three girls/hostess were at the host desk, they were not welcoming, no smile , no greeting, just a "how many?" We said "3" and the girl didn't look at the books or anything, and was like "30 minutes." There was no one else waiting. We knew someone that worked there so we called him and boom got seated right away. From this point on, everything was great! Our server was very attentive and always checking on our table. When our food came out, it was phenomenal. I got the steak and mushroom skewers, and my two friends got the filet minon, and the lamb, we like meat! Lol all three was soooooo good! We also ordered a pitcher of Passion Fruit Mojito, and it was very good and refreshing!!!! 

All in all, great food, great servers, great ambiance BUT HORRIBLE HOSTESSES. I think hostesses are a big part of a restaurant operation, they are the first impression of the restaurant, and with those girls there that night, Oh NO, seemed like they were just there chit chatting and checking out guys, not doing their job. Should have been 5 stars, but garbage hostesses made 1 star go to garbage.
Love, love, love the sangria & the tapas!  Very nice bar where you can dine solo. Stuffed dates are a favorite! Red sangria much better than white!

We had been thinking of trying out this place for quite a while and we finally went. I could have lived without eating here it was just okay. The food was fine just nothing spectacular, the service was fine as well just nothing impressive overall. It was super loud so it was difficult to converse with our friends. I do recommend trying to bacon wrapped dates if you come here, though. Those were really good but you only get a bite since this place is tapas style. Nothing bad to say about Firefly but just nothing impressive about it. They do have a bar that we did not try anything from so perhaps they have some awesome drinks to make up for the place.

My whole body awoke to taste the bacon wrapped dates. The fantastic flavor of the sauce enlivened my spirit and encouraged an illuminating conversation between myself and my date. Pun not intended. 
With each bite of the petite filet mignon revealing more and more power of a red wine sauce, so too did each sip of the perfectly crafted mojito reveal more and more the depths in relationship that are discoverable through a layered and reasonably priced meal. 
If you want your taste buds to envelop your body like goose bumps on a cold naked night, then eat at the Fly... and soar into one of God's kitchens.

Wow, what a fun restaurant!  Being from out of town, I was told by many people to take a little adventure off of the strip and go try it out.  What a great decision.

The menu is tapas style, which is basically my favorite thing in the entire world.  I mean, you can get so many different flavors and varieties (each at around $6 or something) all while appreciating the ambiance and fun atmosphere!

Our table ordered the big bowl salad to start, followed by the stuffed dates (AMAZING! GET THESE!!!), spicy beef salad, manchego mac 'n' cheese, ahi tuna skewer, camarones a la diabla, sliders, chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms, merguez, firefly fries, and we all shared the seafood paella.  Everything....EVERYTHING....was wonderful! 

This sounds like a lot of food, but keep in mind that it is tapas style.. Between 7 girls, it came out to be like 2-4 bites per dish!  They were perfect for sharing!  Also, our server was spectacular and everything was served relatively quickly, given the restaurant was packed!

Oh, try their blackberry and raspberry infused vodka and/or a pitcher of the blood orange mojitos.  Trust me, you will love.

This will be one of the first stops when I go back to Vegas!!
Kinda slow service but really good food. Tons of options and very reasonable. Great menu and close to the Strip. Way better than overpriced strip places to eat.

This restaurant came highly recommended by a friend. She is beyond a fan. This restaurant participated on the Epicurean Affair we came to all the way from Florida to attend. 
 She came with us on this visit and ordered some of her favorites for all to share. I had tried what they offered at the Food and Wine affair and I looked forward to try more selections. Everything was great. I especially loved some skewers I had and the sangria!  I wasn't too crazy about the bacon wrapped dates, which seem to be their specialty. 

Service was phenomenal, and the restaurant is a mixture of funky and eclectic. Lots of colorful artwork. Lots of mirrors. It is a great place.
We didn't get entrees, just tapas. I would definitely be back.

My second time here. I was in charge of setting up a dinner for my Bffs Bachelorette for 6 girls! They all loved the food! Best part was Gerry the bus boy! Awesome and funny! The manager Eduardo was accommodating, funny, and made sure we were taken care of! Great food and atmosphere!

firefly once again satisfies our ever whim. Nahum served my girlfriend and me with candor and professionalism, and of course the food and red sangria were all amazing. flavors,  textures,  ambiance... fantastic! 

it was only in the 90s yesterday and cloudy,  and sitting outside with the misters was all very pleasant. 

do see if there is a Groupon... ours was totally a steal. and let your server know if you've been a loyal customer! they very much appreciate years of love,  and happy reviews. 

and did I mention the sangria was on point?
Tasty and relatively inexpensive tapas with a bit of a locals vibe yet close enough to the strip a tourist like me could make it there. Certainly worth trying out if you want some tapas.
Firefly is one of my favorite off-strip places to have a great variety of food and excellent drinks. Pepe, Vanessa and Alejandra really know how to take care of you and make you feel like a rockstar!

My boyfriend and I come here religiously. The food is so good and it so fun to order a ton of food because it's all small sized and easy to share. The servers are always on point and the hostesses are awesome. This place is incredible and you're not limited to ordering one entree because it's all tapas. 100% love this place and hope they branch out and open up more locations! Anyone who judges this place for things in the past is truly mistaken and missing out on amazing quality food.

Did not disappoint!  We kept passing Firefly and being intrigued.  Their Sangria is flavorful and devine.  We ordered a wide selection and loved all.  Not a traditional paella with saffron, but rich and delicious anyway.  The butter for the bread is incredible too.

Smack dab beside our humble hotel, Marriott version, the Firefly was a taste and cultural treat. Our drinks, house Shandy and a Cherry Mule, delicious different and just right after long flight. Small plates includes spicey steak salad which was a palate explosion and chorizo stuffed mushrooms.  Tres leches were a wonderful ending.  Best way to finish was watching some salsa dancers on the front patio. So cool!

DEEELISHH!

My co-worker highly recommended this place and no way did it disappoint!

We had lots of food - too many dishes to remember, but I remember the stand out of the night was the seafood paella.

To be honest, I think it was better than most of the paella i had in Spain last year.  It was full of seafood, and the rice was cooked perfectly al dente.  It was perfectly seasoned and the portion was HUGE.  We were all happy campers.

It's just a close cab ride from the strip.  It's moderately priced and there's something for everyone.  It's my new LV place to go for some good food!

Can I just say this is my absolute favorite place! I recommend it to anyone and everyone! The red sangria is life along with their happy hour! From 11pm-2am Monday- Thursday and Fridays they have Latin night!! Definitely recommend!

I really look forward to eating here whenever I'm in Vegas.  The flavors all complement each other so well in everything I've tried! The servings are definitely small but it won't break the bank to get a few options and enjoy what they do best... The food! Do yourself a favor a skip the buffet and give this place a try!

We have been coming here for 12 years and have seen them through good and bad times. We have always had outstanding service, tasty drinks, and delicious tapas. 

We always order multiple orders of their dates which are stuffed with an almond, covered with bacon and finished with crumbled bleu cheese in a tasty sauce. 

They also have delicious paella, stuffed red peppers, eggplant cannelloni and of course sangria. 

Everything is to di

Was taken here for dinner, and it was pretty good. The food was great, the staff was nice, but a little slow on service. They had salsa music playing inside, but we were outside eating and talking. This place is a bit out of the way from the strip, so you may or may not make your way over here. However, if you are willing to take the ride over, or are in the area, I highly recommend you go! Great tapas, great serving sizes and a great atmosphere. Would visit again.

Came her for my cousins 21st bday, it was so amazing! The food was so good, we ordered so many different things, and there wasn't anything I tried that I didn't like. The highlights for we were the filet and the chicken empanadas. The red sangria was also very delicious. Our server, Eder,  took amazing care of us! It's for sure a must go for dinner!

I really hope this place doesn't shut down.. its my go to spot for good food and great sangria.  Never been disappointed eating here, everything I've tried is amazing.  I am really sad the Henderson location closed, please open another one! New paradise location is really loud, makes it really hard to hold a convo.

Delicious!! Went with a group of friends and ordered maybe like 8-10 dishes? They are all small tapa dishes and they were great!! The only thing is if you order the paella it takes like 20 mins to cook, which they inform you. Since we were in a time crunch, we didn't order that. All the tapas were great, but the best ones were the skewers-- I think we order 2 different ones and both were so good! The empanadas were also really yummy. Service was attentive and atmosphere was relaxing.

Came to Firefly for our last meal in Vegas before returning home to NYC.  On a Sunday night there was a wait which speaks highly of such a restaurant.  

Atmosphere: Typical tapas place.  Not a complaint at all, but don't expect anything above and beyond in terms of atmosphere.  It looked like a nice date spot. In fact we sat next to a couple on a birthday date and honestly it looked perfect. They even had a private photographer who came around and took photos.

Food: I feel like we ordered a ton of stuff, ironically my favorite dishes were the roasted vegetables and the grilled peppers (not sure what they are actually called). I've been back for over a week and I'm still thinking about those peppers, they were the perfect blend of sweet (not spicy peppers) and salty.

My other favorite dish was the scallop "escargots".  I must admit, they did a fantastic job with this dish.  The presentation and flavor was spot on.  Firefly escalated a scallop dish in an inventive way that I have never seen before, and I always appreciate that.

We didn't drink or have dessert so I can't speak on either of those topics. I would definitely come here again.

Finally made it to the new location, still the same menu with a great selection but the quality of the dishes has really gone downhill. 

First off, happy hour only has drinks discounts, food items are always regular price. We came in for dinner, and ordered several things. The signature bacon wrapped dates, unfortunately had a cold center and was not baked throughly, which is an indication that the kitchen was rushing and not paying attention. The other thing I did not like was the serrano ham sliders. The filet mignon patty was definitely not filet mignon, I can taste the difference, also there were pieces of bones AND chewy tendons in the patty that I had to spit out. Yuck! Also, I was informed by our waiter that the serrano ham was grounded into the patty, which I couldn't taste at all, probably due to the tiny amount of ham that was put in. 

Service was very nice,  but I'm really disappointed with the food.

Oh, Firefly...I wanted to give you five stars, I REALLY did. After reading amazing reviews, I attempted to make a reservation though Open Table. The time provided was a little later than I wanted so I called the restaurant directly. The hostess hung up on me the first call. She flat out told me the second call that they weren't accepting any more reservations for the evening. I wish I'd gotten your name, love, because your hosting/customer service skills are lacking.

Er, okay. I logged back into Open Table and booked a table for 2 at 9pm no problem. Kind of made me wonder if they try to lighten up the later reservations so the host staff can get cut? Anyway, we arrived at nine on the dot. And we sat. For fifteen minutes. Staring at an empty two top. Which we were eventually seated at.

We had a server...who took our order and who we pretty much never saw again until we got the check. Odd, There was an "assistant server"...some young girl who seemed annoyed to be there. No smile, no initiative to refill my boyfriend's Sprite. 

The food! The food! Good, great, awesome! (5/5)

The service (crying emoji face) Stop the madness. If management doesn't oversee this closely, they will crash and burn. Good food only carries you so far. Especially in a town with endless options.

I was there for an event which had a buffet. I really liked almost everything about this place. The patio is huge and was perfect for our large group. The food was very good, especially considering that it was a buffet. The drinks were good, but a little overpriced. There are cheaper places to drink in Vegas! I would try their happy hour if I went back. (3-6pm)

Very good flavor in all the food we ordered. The music is very loud in the restaurant, the restaurant itself is quite loud, but the impeccable service and food made up for it. 

The restaurant is about a ten minute walk from the strip which made it easy to get to. We ordered several small plates which included the Mac and cheese (AMAZING!), the chicken skewers, beef and mushroom skewers and the ahi tuna skewers ( AMAZING!). Every single dish we got was very very good. Complex flavors, not something you normally find at a place with good reviews, strangely. 

We got the dessert platter which featured 4 different desserts including the caramel flan (AMAZINGGGGGG!)

If you live in Vegas or passing by, you need to come here. No questions asked!

Wasn't expecting to find such a great tapas bar in Vegas. It's off the strip, but well worth going a little out of the way. We loved everything we tried. The chicken skewers with veggies, scallops served escargot style, and bacon wrapped dates were all full of flavor. They serve bread with some kind of butter, almond butter if I remember correctly. It was different - my husband wasn't crazy about it, but I enjoyed it trying something new. 

Even though we were satisfied from the three small plates, we ordered the dessert platter. It's a good value for the money if you like sweets. I wouldn't say any specific dessert blew me away, but I am glad we got to try several different things. 

Our bill was less than $50 (before tip) for three small plates, two sodas, and the dessert - for Vegas stands that is a cheap meal, but nothing about it tasted cheap!

A few friends had recommended Firefly to me so thought I'd give it a shot. Soooo glad I did! The service was amazing... Joaquin was our bartender and server. He was so knowledge and provided us great service and great drinks! The food was very good as well. We had a few appetizers and the paella.. Everything was on point! I would definitely come back!

Very cute place with great tapas.  I would definitely recommend it as an option for something off the strip, and the prices are good too.  The only reason I give four stars is because the food does not all come out at the same time....so some people have to wait longer than others and not everybody eats at the same time.

I had to host a happy hour for 70 people. Got referred to Fire Fly by the hotel I was staying at.  Best referral!  The management at Fire Fly was on point!  Regina and Eduardo were extremely accommodating.  Athena and Omar, the bartenders made sure cold drinks were in everyone's hands at all times.  The food was tasty as well. Defiantly a fun time had by all!

I came here with friends for restaurant week. I liked the busy, dark atmosphere, the food was good, and my friends seemed to enjoy the drinks. 

I enjoyed the mixed paella, though I wish the seafood portion was a bit bigger as compared to the rice. The tapas I tried, albodigas, shrimp diablo, dates stuffed with almonds wrapped in bacon (so good), and shrimp ceviche, were all good but nothing was so outstanding that I would make a return trip. 

I'm glad to have tried to the place at least once. The other members of my party seemed to be having a good time, and so did everyone else in the restaurant.

I came here with my boyfriend on valentines day, It was pretty busy so good thing he made a reservation. 
I had never been to a tapas restaurant before but it was pretty cool. the restaurant inside is very nice and cute, service was great, and food was also very good. We ordered the chicken and mushroom paella to share, and then a handful of small tapas plates.
The paella was delicious, it did not look like traditional spanish paella, but it was very good! The tapas plates we ordered were also good, the do seem a bit pricey for such cute tiny plate though. 
The only thing i didn't like was our table, it was the half booth on one side and then a chair on the other side, which is fine, but the table (that was for 2 people) was so big i felt like the people next to me could hear our whole conversation because my boyfriend was so far away.

Overall firefly was a great restaurant and i would recommend it. Im sure we will go back.

This place was so fun!! We hit it up for a Sunday brunch based off of Yelp reviews and honestly, it was one of our best meals in Vegas. We sat outside where a guy was playing the bongos to a DJ. Different, but cool. 

Our server was great as was everyone else who was helping. 

The food was incredible. We wanted so many things and couldn't decide, so we ended up getting way too much! Next time, I would order one thing at a time so I don't get as full. However, the online menu said that brunch came with two sides and the menu contradicted that, so I assumed the portions were small. Regardless, we loved everything we ordered!!
One of my favorite spots in Vegas to go eat, drink, take a date. Great food great staff

A pleasure as always! We've been back every year with CES and love this place.  Amazing stuffed dates and patatas Bravas and tuna tartare.  Good sangria too!  Really very good! Friendly service, reasonable prices. Will return again next year!

Had a great event at the Firefly last week and it was AWESOME . First the place looked great they set us up on the patio. 

The staff was more than attentive, (Thanks Carlos and crew) glasses were never empty. The plates never were not full. We finished one thing and the next came. Special requests didn't slow them down. The paella and shrimp were so so yummy. 
Please if you are in Vegas try the Firefly

Loving this tapas restaurant on a lazy Sunday afternoon in April - sat on the patio and took my time enjoying a book, beer, and several tapas. The beet and roasted pear salad was perfect for a very warm day. Vegas is so crazy on the Strip, this location on Paradise Road is a welcome respite. The Tiera y Mar tapas was excellent - shrimp, filet mignon, chorizo with a salsa verde - great flavor and fun to eat, although it would be nice to offer to take them off the skewer to avoid a meat projectile. Complimentary side of toasted garlic baguette with almond butter was a great filler between course. Server Mario and staff were very friendly and efficient.  I'm guessing this place is quite busy and hectic at night, but daytime is the best choice.  Great outdoor patio for al fresco dining. I'd return on my next Vegas trip for sure.

Overall good experience. Restaurant was a little noisy for our group but the service and food were pretty good. The ceviche, steak and mushroom kebabs, roasted mushrooms on toast, and some form of avocado toast were all very good. The tartar and meatballs weren't bad, but I would pass on the potatoes bravas and shaved beef sandwiches. The food came out pretty fast and service was quick except when it came time for the check (it was very busy though)

Our Saturday night dinner reservations fell through and instead of battling the lines and wait on a weekend night on the strip we went here. There was no wait for two at 8pm. Friendly service. Nicely priced and well made tapas. We ordered the sangria and 3 tapas: bacon wrapped almond/dates with a red wine reduction and blu cheese-which was flavorful savory and sweet, Shrimp Diablo which was good too-it ha: the same wine reduction base as the date tapas but with added sweet spicy chili, and we had the chorizo, shrimp and beef skewers with a tomato/chimichurri sauce that was also delicious. If you like flavorful and thick saucy dishes to dip your bread into this is the place. It was crowded (lots of large group celebrations), lively and loud and we had a wonderful time! We left full and happy!

This place is amazing!! This is a staple when we come in to town for a Vegas vacation!! I know there was some drama with a health issue. However, I am a huge germ freak and the new location is great and the staff is wonderful!! I love this place! I wish we had one in Minnesota!!!

After a long day of working in LV, my husband and I wanted a quick, delicious meal. Firefly happened to be right down the street. We were greatly surprised with the yumminess that was had. Bacon wrapped dates, artichoke toast, salads, chorizo-chicken skewer and can you say "Sangria"!!! I tried all three varieties..... Like candy! We will definitely be back on our next business trip!

I chose this place for dinner for a bachelorette party, so 8 of us all dolled up came stomping in and had a nice big table. Service was friendly, but not that attentive. We often had to ask for water refills and our server disappeared many times throughout the meal. Needless to say, we all enjoyed ourselves. Food was delicious, and we ordered a ton of different dishes so we could try them all. I do have to say though that about half of our party had stomach issues a few hours later, which I'm chocking up to just eating too many different things. The food was pretty rich too.

Bacon-wrapped stuffed dates: i hate dates, but these were SUPER tasty. Only got about 5 of them per order though

Scallops: I'm also usually not a fan of scallops, but these were cooked perfectly and the polenta underneath complemented the seafood well.

Mussels: Tasty! Good. Not delicious, but not bad.

Chopped chicken salad: Tasty! Good. Not delicious, but not bad :D

Baked tetilla: basically cheese fondue. I looove me some cheese and some fondue, but the cheese had a weird rubbery consistency after a bit

Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms: LOVE! So good. Mmmm

Petite filet: It was kinda rubbery meat. The steak was a disappointment

Meatballs: These were pretty good, I'd order them again

Paella: A couple of the girls in our party had been to Spain before, and they said the paella here was better. Delish!!

For all the food we ordered (we ordered multiples of the above dishes + a few I forgot to mention), dinner only came out to about $30/girl. Awesome!!

They're off the strip so you avoid the wait, the long lines, and the overpriced food. But they're also really easy to find.

We're just passing through Vegas and picked this one because a pro TV foodie mentioned it. Punchline: We just ate the best meal  in ages. Very deep menu of hots, colds, meats, seafood (about 15 of each). The preparation was waaaay up there: fresh, spot-on seasoning, great accompaniaments. Nice sized portion. And value-priced. The service staff (especially Nahum) was helpful, enthusiastic and made sure our order was promptly served. We ordered 5 dishes and a glass of wine at a laughable price. This gem is not far off The Strip and worth a detour. .
Went here with my girlfriends!! So yummy! My favorite is the scallops!! Yummy . We are definitely coming back here!

Usually when I make a trip out to Vegas, I am much too intoxicated to eat anything at a sit-down restaurant but it was my friend's birthday and his gf suggested this place and I'm glad we went! The menu is tapas style with various small plates to share family style. They also have entrees if you're the kind of person who just doesn't like to share :)

The paella takes about 40 minutes to prepare so you should order that right when you sit down as you look over the rest of the menu. We opted for the mixed paella for the table. Everyone ordered various things and honestly, EVERYTHING was delicious. I have no complaints. I had the petite filet as my main entree and it was DELICIOUS, only $15! 

From what I remember from tasting everyone's tapas, the shrimp, stuffed mushrooms, ahi tuna, chicken and rib eye entrees were ALL great! I hope I can come back soon. The menu is so extensive, there's prob around 50 tapas to try!

This was a totally unexpected surprise I happen to use Yelp and read the reviews and I am happy to say that all the reviews made this Experience worthwhile... not only is the food awesome and the menu pretty diverse but the staff is phenomenal I wish I could remember everyone's name.. so I gave it five stars for the food and for the service

As a previous reviewer wrote  "Stuffed Bacon Wrapped Dates - 'nuff said!"  

The food is great 
The prices are right 
The service is great

We had about 8 different dishes from the dates, chicken skewers, stuffed mushrooms, filet, empanadas and a couple others for $65.00 + tip.  

Everything tasted and great and everything was little different with a unique taste.  Well, worth the $14 cab ride. 

We will definitely return when in the neighborhood.

I was excited to try Firefly because of my love for tapas. Overall, everything was decent but not good. I think because I've tried some great tapas places in both SF and Portland. Firefly did not come close. The flavors were bold as tapas should be but it did not feel authentic. Something missed the marks. However, it is a great place to come with a big group and only a few minutes drive from the Strip.

The Food made me sick. Tapas plates were too greasy and were not prepared well. The fries was The only thing I liked. 
They post food pictures in their bathroom. I don't think that's appropriate when you see food advertising in the bathroom stall behind the door.

Great Food, Great Service and Great Ambiance. We were in town for a conference and went to Firefly with two couples and was very impressed with the service and the quality of the food. Definitely a great place to go out to eat that was not expensive. Definitely a place we recommend.

Firefly is a vibrant little tapas restaurant that's great for large groups. We were treated to some nice, cool fall weather on the outdoor patio. The menu has a huge selection of tapas, broken down by hot, chilled, meat & poultry, and seafood. Their eclectic food choices are matched by their drinks menu with numerous types of cocktails, beers, wines, and sangria. 

With a large group, we were able to try a bunch of their most popular tapas. My favorites included the ahi tuna skewer with mustard-ginger glaze, the ham and cheese croquetas, and the manchego mac 'n cheese. The firefly fish sticks were a bit over-fried. For dessert, we tasted the banana-nutella sandwiches and the trio of gelatos. Nothing special that couldn't be store-bought and made at home. 

All in all, Firefly is a nice place to grab a drink and some food after work, but I imagine the value to be better during happy hour 3-6 PM or reverse happy hour 11-1 AM.
The tapas were surprisingly good, and they are open late.   If you're staying close by (as I was), it's worth checking out.

My husband and I came here on a recent vacation to Las Vegas. We have never been to a restaurant like this before but it was a fun experience overall. The atmosphere was rather loud for us and the tables are so big that we could barely hear each other. The food was delicious and we got to try a lot of different types of things. It was a really nice place but we would not go back.

Fireflys knocks it out of the park for sure.  Their staff are their key to success.  Their staff where friendly, energetic, and took care of our party very well.  We had my mothers 60th birthday party (8 people in party) , and it was beyond memorable.  Food was amazing and the drinks where tasty.  I had the seafood paella which was perfectly cooked and I finished it all (serves 2-4).  
Loved it and everytime I go to Vegas I will have good times and great food at FIREFLYS.  Thank you.

The food was amazing! We ordered nine different tapas and shared them all between three people- that along with a pitcher of sangria- it was plenty!!

Favorites:
Steak skewers, petit filet plate ($13!!!)
both cooked to a perfect Medium rare 
The Apple salad was perfect - and plentiful!
The shrimp cheviche  was the best I've ever had!!

Also yummy:
Baked goat cheese
Chicken salad
Artichokes toast

It was very busy, my critique would be that I called to make reservations the day before, a left a message and they never called me back. I made reservations through open table and ta-da! Rsvp's for a party of 3 at 7:30 was confirmed.

This is a *must* try place when visiting Vegas!
Excellent food, friendly staff, fast service, what more could you ask for? I think they've really stepped up their game since they had issues and moved locations.

We found this restaurant on Yelp. It looked like it would be reasonably priced and had four star review.  We were not disappointed in fact we give it five stars! The service was so friendly and attentive. They were very busy but you need to expect to sit and relax at a place like this and enjoy the ambience and the social time...  The small plate of food items were fabulous. Their bacon wrapped dates were very good.
I think our waiter's name was Roger. He was a sweetheart. The manager came over and he was very charming as well. Thank you firefly for a great evening!!!!

Did not disappoint! Wide variety of tapas, and you can't beat the white sangria. My favorite has to be the bacon wrapped dates. Delicious! Plus we hit it at happy hour, so they were only $4. Actually the happy hour menu is perfect, so arrive before 6 to take advantage. Our favorite waiter, Alejandro, came by to greet us--nice touch! Although our waiter (Naum) really hustled to keep us happy. Prices are very reasonable unless you eat as many portions as we did!

Full flavor tapas off the Strip so it's about 50% less cost than a casino restaurant. Service has always been attentive and prompt. Really enjoy this gem. Portions are very fulfilling and artistic. Highly recommend.

Firefly is my go-to Happy Hour during the week. After 11pm Monday-Thursday, the fun begins. A glass of sangria for $5, and they have a small menu of tapas for $4 or $5. Always go with the Firefly fries, stuffed dates, and the chicken skewers. They have the best stuffed dates I've ever had, and the chicken skewers always have different seasonal veggies every time I go. Last time I went they had brussel sprouts. Firefly also has some of the best bread! It's a sliced garlic bread with AMAZING almond and chipotle butter I think. 

This is a great place for a late night dinner with friends, my friends are always reluctant to go but by the end of our meal they rave! They have a fun photo booth too so you can commemorate your awesome dinner.

Amazing food. Great service. Bacon wrapped dates, lamb chops, garbanzo beans, mushroom shrimp steak skewers were all awesome! The food came out insanely quick as well. Wish there was a location in Houston!
Unimpressed by everything.  The Sangria was good,  not great and all of the food was super heavy.  I would not go back.

Seriously, I love this place every chance I get to go.  The Red Sangria is excellent, if you want to drink alcohol and enjoy the taste too.  I love the bacon dates, firefly fries, albondigas, and Tierra y Mar.  The food was quick, drinks were 5 stars, and the general manager Carlos was nice enough to allow us to use both of our groupons.  Service was excellent and the food came out fast.  Will be returning hopefully some time soon!!!
The atmosphere was so fun and the staff were really funny and did a great job. The food was delicious!! So happy that we chose to go here!

Loved it!  We were a party of 4 (business co workers).  

Seated quickly and attentive service

Food was very good.  Believe there were 12 different dishes between the 4 of us and all were good

Definitely recommend the dates and tuna

I came to Firefly for my 21st birthday, and it was one of the best meals I've had! (I could be biased since it was a pretty important milestone though.) Firefly also had great value, especially considering we were too full from Hash House to try a buffet. Tapas are the way to go!

Standouts include:
Gazpacho
Stuffed mushrooms
Tilapia
Skewers -both steak and chicken

Ironically, the raspberry mojito was my least favorite part. So much for my 21st, right? At least they gave us a small dessert on the house.

I absolutely love coming here. I've been several times while I was visiting Vegas. The service is amazing but the food is even better. The stuffed peppers were my favorite thing I got the last time I was in. Not to mention the sangria. I recommend people to go every time someone tells me they are visiting Vegas.

BEST. FOOD. in VEGAS. 

I recommend to everyone I know who travels here. 

beautiful motif, great atmosphere. Food delectable. My favorite was the chorizo clams. I could have eaten those all day.

I have nothing positive to say about my experience at Firefly on Paradise.  The service was the most awful thing ever.  I was in management for a Forbes rated the hotel for a long time, and I would be seriously embarrassed if my team ever acted like this team.

We were sat at a table outside, and then we were left for 20 minutes before anyone checked in on us. During this time, all the tables around us were being serviced. I watched the waiter check in with several tables. 25 minutes into this experience the busser brought waters, and the waiter came over. He didn't say Hello, he said what do you want to drink. I was expecting some type of reason why he was ignorning us. The paito wasn't that full.  He took the order and left.  During this time the manager was walking around the patio area.

I also watched the manager of Firefly mingle with what appeared to his friends and several other tables except ours. During this time, the manager made eye contact with me four times (I was giving the look of hey how's it going can you please assist me), but he failed to do anything.  He started to walk our direction, and I was about to speak up to him, but he turned his focus to a table full of young women. The service should be the focus, I can understand if you are speaking with your guests, but this was not the case.  He continued to check in on what appeared to be his friends and tables full of young women. Each time he did this he was chatting it up for several minutes.

We were still waiting for our drinks at this point about 35 minutes into our experience. At this point, we had to walk up to the bar to get our drinks because no one returned with them.  The manager also was at the bar during this interaction and failed to say anything. We mentioned our experience to the bartender and the manager could have said something, but he didn't. 

Overall, the waiter seemed mad he had to work, and the only person who was doing anything positive was the busser.  We asked our busser at one point to get send over the waiter so we could order another round.  The busser walked over to the waiter, and the waiter disappeared for several minutes before coming to our table. 

During this time, the waiter made eye contact with our table, and then walked away. I tried to give him the benefit of the doubt, but I then watched him walk inside and stand by a curtain. He wasn't doing anything for a good five minutes, and then he finally came back out, went to another table and walked away.  I had to wave him over, which I hate doing, because it is rude, however, there was no other way to get his attention.  

Eventually, our food came out, and the waiter continued to be short with us.  The food was good, but the service at this place was awful. I think the thing that rubbed me the worst about this place was that the manager failed to step in and show any interest in our situation. He seemed consumed with talking to women rather than doing his job.  This was my perception last night.

I hope everyone else doesn't experience this while you are at this establishment. Maybe it was an off night, either way, the service was horrible.  The only reason we didn't leave was because our friend loves Firefly and it was her birthday.  

I also witnessed several staff members on their phones, I can't believe this place...get your standards in with the rest of this city!

I have been to firefly a few times already. Last night we arrived at about 915pm were seated in less than 5 minutes inside. The pitcher of sparkling sangria was a hit and if you drink enough you get a nice buzz. The lamb chop was cooked perfectly and melted in my mouth. The civiche de camarones is seasoned to the absolute t. Just the right amount of acid. Definitely recommend this restaurant. You can dress up or dress down either way you fit in. My date enjoyed every dish we selected which made for a nice date. Look forward to returning for another pitcher

BACON WRAPPED DATES!!! that is what you must have! the food here is delicious and the service is great. i love the atmosphere and my favorite drink is the sparking sangria. i can go here and stay for hours to talk and relax. i highly recommend firefly. 
must haves again the bacon wrapped dates, the chicken salad, the sparking sangria, and the paella..enjoy!

i'm a big fan of firefly I love the food, the cocktails, and the atmosphere. The food here is tapas style so small plates. The prices per plate run from $5 to about $10 dollars each with a few larger priced entrees such as the paella. Their also known for their sangria and I personally recommend the sparkling sangria over the other two. 

The atmosphere here would be considered trendy and tends to be on the loud side but as long as you know that going in its no problem. If you go on a friday or saturday night expect service to be a little bit less than stellar because of the sheer number of people in the joint.  Some of their stand out dishes would be the bacon wrapped dates, the ham and cheese croquetas and the manchego mac & cheese.

A cozy establishment with a great assortment for myself, the vegetarian, and my meat-eater boyfriend. Between us we ordered, the roasted beets and persimmon salad, Firefly fries, albongigas and Chicago beef bocadillos and either of us had a complaint and enjoyed every bite. We are moving to Vegas and this is the first comeback spot we have found. Cheers!
The new Firefly on Paradise is beautiful! Upscale and trendy! Lots of delicious and fresh vegetarian options!!! And the best sparkling white sangria! Check it out!!!

For 2 of us, we ordered
Empanada (7.50), Machego mac and cheese, Steak, shrimp skewers, bacon wrapped dates, stuffed mushroom chicken. 

Meat skewers: cooked very well and had a lot of flavors

Bacon wrapped dates: crispy and declisiuos 

Empanada: It was really good but hard to justify paying 7.50 for one empanada. 

Machego mac and cheese: nothing special, tastes like mac and cheese to me 

Stuffed mushroom chicken: yummy and juicy. 

We also got a Flan dessert with a crispy waffle like roll for our anniversary and it was yummy.  


The complimentary bread looked really good from the looks of it but it tasted stale. 

Make sure you make rsvp.  I saw a bunch of people waiting when we left (around 7:30pm Saturday).  

I would come back to try their ham sliders, and paella.
Great food, my wife and I love the Paella, get it! It is worth the wait and best in LV, so delicious and amazing portions could easily feed 3 to 4 people.

This is seriously an amazing Tapas restaurant and the ambiance is just perfect for a date or a group outting. 

We ordered the civiche, dates, melt in your mouth baby back ribs and for dessert we had flan and the nutela banana sandwich bites. 

The service was speedy, efficient and simply perfect.  We had a main server and a runner whom both provided us their names and recommended dishes based on what we said we liked.

My friend actually asked for an iphone 4 chsrger and the waitress was kind enough to let us use her charger & she even watched it for us while it charged.  

This is a great place to go before heading out to the clubds or bars. You can enjoy small dishes and get a littls buzz going before paying $20 for a drink in a popular club.

Great food and I love all the options. Not too crowded on the weekends but I would still recommend a reservation. We didn't try a paella but we shared plenty of tapas and that Pan con tomate being the tastiest! 
I do however miss their old quaint location.

Delish menu and good service.
Trying to stay away from bread, but Firefly has the most delicious sauces you have to eat a bunch a bread to dip and soak up the sauce- so if you're on a diet- stay away from here!! Too much temptation.

I drank the red sangria- it's sweet and goes down very quickly, but not the best I've ever had... 

Food is scrumptious.

My friend and I went to Fireflys for a cocktail or two (wink wink) and food. First of all, out server Andrea was AMAZING!!! She had great suggestions on her faves and we ordered them!!! The Mac N Cheese was cheesy and full of flavor. And you could never go wrong the Stuffed Dates. 
We will definitely be coming back...thanks Andrea for the great service!!!
Nice restaurant with good food. I love the grilled oysters and the garden-variety salad. Next time I'll use a Groupon.

Great vairiety of food

This is a great off strip place to head to with a bunch of people

Nice selextion of drinks.  

Cold beer, icy glasses

I especially liked the borqueraderos, or something like that.  White anchovies
Always a favorite place to eat when I'm in Vegas awesome delicious food and great atmosphere definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegas ....

Just ehhhhh. Every time I am here I want everything to be just has great as the Sangria and I am always disappointed. The only thing I really love is the parm fries, but on occasion they are way to salty and stale. But I love the atmosphere, by atmosphere I mean the Latin concepts and hustle and bustle of the staff. it needs to be bigger with a better floor design. It feels musty and dirty most of the time.  I want to love this place but I just can't.
Awesome food, drinks ands atmosphere !!! Always a good time when my friends and I go here

Very nice Tapas place! We (5 of us) were there for happy hour and got a pitcher of Sangria an a bunch of the happy hour tapas. The pitcher only cost $18 and there was enough for all 5 plus refills for two people. I would highly recommend the stuffed dates, very amazing.

Always a delightful dining experience! Tasty food fantastic service. Our server was so on point he had the good decency to ask each of us if we had any food allergies before taking our orders which is very rare but welcome! Food was prompt but the fries were quite soggy (only negative) still a favorite.

I always take my friends and family to FIREFLY. When I lived in Vegas, it was a great date night place and I am missing it now!!! 

The sparkling sangria is perfect. I love sangria and this one is sweet and bubbly, great on hot Vegas days! Get a pitcher and enjoy your surroundings, plus it will get you feelin' good as your delicious tapas come out. 

The must-haves:

Bacon Wrapped Dates-everyone likes these. EVERYONE. I don't like bleu cheese and the little pieces in this make the dish stand out! GET THEM. 

Anchovy toast things-Boquerones? I probably just butchered that. Anyways. THIS IS MY FAV!! I know I know, anchovy whaaaaat!!!? But for real get it. White anchovy on toast points with avocado, roasted red peppers and a lemony sauce....it is SO GOOD. I didn't want it, my date insisted, and it's now my favorite dish. A balance of seafood saltiness and creamy avocado...omg yum. 

Manchego Mac N Cheese- I'm a lover of all things cheese and this is great, baked on top which just enhances the texture. 

Stuffed Peppers- cheesy, creamy, and fried onions for crunch. Love this. 


Nutella Banana Sandwich Dessert. Explained itself. 

 
The ambiance is fantastic, the drinks are strong and delicious, and the pricing is great (especially for Vegas), and service has always been very helpful and friendly!
Checked this place out it ,was close to the hotel ,nice atmosphere , OK service  , food was good, but limited choices for picky kids. Would recommend if you want to try something different

Was in town in Vegas for a short get away trip with my girlfriends and wanted to go back to Firefly since we remember the food was awesome from the previous visit before the restaurant moved to a bigger and nicer place (few doors down), but this time it was a disappointment. Sorry Firefly.. Your service was good since it was a late lunch, and it wasn't crowded, but your food has changed and not how we remembered it. We each ordered 2 dishes (total 12) plus a paella. Every thing was mediocre except for the scallop with butter and garlic sauce, the mussels, and the salads.. But other dishes either were too sweet (the ribs, shrimps, octopus), and the paella was not even close to be ok. It wasn't your thing. It has too much tomato sauce which causes the dish too wet, and the mussels, clams, shrimp were too dried. Hmm.. Not sure if we would come back here again for the good old time.. You had it going, but not sure what went wrong?? Did you change the chef or just simply because of the expansion that made it go out of hand? Hope you could pull it together so i could recommend others when they're in town because the new place looks awesome with good decor and vibe.

Awesome!! Tried many dishes and all were yummy!! Highly recommend tuna tartar!!!! Stuffed peppers definitely need to order!!! Highly highly recommended! Very nice atmosphere and reasonably priced! The hostess actually walks around looking for you after your table is ready! Pomegranate monitor delicious!!

Great place for any occasion. Very friendly staff that is always willing to make suggestions. Can't pick a wrong dish! Everything is ridiculously GOOD!! Even if it sounds like something u won't like try it. I was shocked when I tried the date  . And they have great happy hr deals and reverse happy hour.

As Owl City famously once said: "Try the Sangria, it's delicious." With the drinks sorted out, you have a multitude of tapas options... and I haven't met a menu item I didn't like. The apple salad or tempura shrimp are always good picks. Great place to bring the posse.
