I found out about this place through Groupon & it was really good!
The location could be better (It's in a slightly ghetto area).
But once you're inside, it's great.
I love the ambience/decor (Red lamps & damask wallpaper are nice).
Feels like a trendy lounge atmosphere.
Food is delicious!
Service was fast, friendly, & attentive.

(3.5 stars)

Firefly serves the purpose if you're looking for an alternative away from the strip and want a casual bite to eat. There are PLENTY of options on the menu to keep everyone happy!  

On our plate - 
* Veggie Empanada - crisp, flaky and flavorful.
* Warm Spinach Salad - with artichoke, red pepper, pine nuts, feta and a dash of lemon. The slightly warmed up spinach gave the salad a nice body and the addition of pine nuts added a great crunch. 
* Baked Goat Cheese - can't really go wrong with baked cheese! Ever. This was creamy and melt-in-the-mouth delicious.
* Shrimp in lemon garlic butter sauce - the sauce was good, but the shrimp did not absorb any of it and seemed to be tossed in it a few minutes right before serving.
* Grilled octopus - very disappointing, the octopus was chewy and didn't taste fresh at all...the sauce lacked seasoning as well. 

Service was friendly and efficient.

Everything we had was amazing. The table ooh'd and aww'd with every bite. The bread and spread alone are wicked good. I can just eat that alone and be happy. Seriously.
Any way, what did we order?

1. 2 pitchers of Sangria (one white, one red) Both tasted good! Comes with infused apple pieces. 
2. Bacon wrapped dates. These are off the charts! Crispy and extreme flavor!
3. Manchego Macaroni and Cheese; the best cheese to use in this dish - so decadent!
4. Tuna Tartare  with Taro Chips; this is really good and refreshing. Tasty!
5. Steak and Mushroom skewers. I wish I knew what kind of sauce they use for this cause it's fabulous! 
6. Ham and Cheese Croquetas - manchego cheese again! Yum! Some thought it was a bit salty; but I love salt! LOL.
7. Baked Cheese; whoa! Didn't think I'd like it, but I loved it!
8. Firefly fries; great combo with the Sangria; carbo load while drinking! Plus their fried to perfection and has a great seasoning!
9. Paella! Whoa! We got the seafood one and it was a great ending to the rest of our tapas! It was able to give a sampling to 7 people and everyone loved it!

You can't go wrong with anything you order here. Everything tastes so good. I have brought friends and family alike here, and it is ALWAYS a winner and becomes a favorite to all! Go now!

Firefly was an amazing experience

Pros:
1. All of the food tasted amazing and came out in a timely fashion

2. Our server Elena and Jazzy was attentive and efficient

3. There were no tables inside, but the outdoor sitting area had fire pillars to keep you warm (see picture)

4. The bathrooms were clean and had around 5 stalls so there was no line for women (always a plus)

Cons:
1. Our entree came out before a lot of our tapas which was weird for me

2. The blue cheese on top of the steak was a bit much so if you don't love blue cheese ask for it on the side


What we ordered:
1. Scallops Escargots (hot tapas)
2. Lamb chops (hot tapas)
3. Roasted Eggplant Cannelloni (hot tapas)
4. Stuffed dates (hot tapas)
5. Chicken and Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms (hot tapas)
6. Blue Cheese Ribeye
7. Flan (not a huge fan)
8. Chocolate and cherry bread pudding (delish)

Finally ate at this new location, twice in one week.  

Happy hour:
Monday-Thurs 3PM-6PM, Fri 3PM-5PM.

The night I came here with a party of about 25 people it was a disaster.  Food was great but service was horrible.  When I say service, I mean only the waiter.  Drinks took forever to come out, refills bahh, food plates remained on table as more food was being served, and we never got bread.  Can't split checks, come on upgrade your system.  - 2 stars.

Came again for happy hour with just one other and the food still tasted great.  Bacon wrapped dates still delicious, mango ribs still killed it, firefly fries, sangria, everything was just as good but with better service.  - 4 stars.

If I ever come back, it'll probably be for happy hour.  And I would definitely recommend Firefly's for one of Vegas' best happy hour option.
Very special place ....the food is amazing...great for catching up with friends ...atmosphere is great ...beautiful design...and great service.

After looking at their menu online, my boyfriend decided to eat dinner here for our monthly date. We didn't have a reservation, but the hostess seated us fairly quickly considering the fact that it was busy. The menu was organized and really easy to read so that helped me to order what I wanted to eat. We ordered Apple and Manchego Salad, Stuffed dates, Scallop Escargots, Camarones a la Diabla, and the Seafood Paella. The food was delicious! I do wish that the Camarones a la Diabla had a little more shrimp because there was only 4 pieces, and the Paella wasn't so salty, but asides that everything else came out wonderful!

I had found this place via Yelp, and meanwhile a friend sent along a list of "10 best Vegas restaurants", and they were on it! I definitely agree they should be! This was really good. We ordered 4 tapas plates for 3 people, and each of them was memorably good. Generous portions for tapas, delicious. Ample parking. Attentive service. There was road construction in the general vicinity, but that amounted to a minor annoyance (especially since I wasn't the driver).
Used to love this place so much but the quality seems to have changed quiet a bit and they got rid of some of the best dishes and don't have many vegan options.

I don't know what to add that hasn't already been said. Great food, very attentive service, and plenty of tapa options (some authentic, some more of a latin fusion, but all delicious). We didn't have a plate we didn't enjoy, and lets not disregard how reasonably priced everything was! 

Recommendations: Chorizo clams, tierra y mar skewers, & stuffed dates.

I have had this place bookmarked for I don't even know how long but I have been low key scared to check it out because of the Salmonella out break a few years back. Finally I found a friend who wanted to go and check it out! 

We went on a Wednesday during happy hour (3PM-6PM) and it was pretty much empty. I have a weakness for Mojitos and they have like 9 different flavors. I asked our waitress what she would recommend and she had me try the Paradise Mojito and it tasted like a tropical getaway. With hints of pineapple and coconut this was truly refreshing, And during happy hour they were only $5.00 or a whole pitcher for $18.00!

We got quite a few tapas to share and everything we got I would definitely recommend/get again:

Artichoke Hearts 5/5

Firefly Fries (Happy Hour) 5/5

Calamari 5/5

Filet Skewers 4/5

Stuffed Dates (Happy Hour) 4/5

Shrimp Ceviche 4/5

Warm Spinach Salad 4/5

We ended the day with a beautiful Flan dessert!

I cannot wait to come back and try even more of their expansive menu!
Love, love, love this place! Never had a bad meal or service here and much more reasonably priced than all other tapas in Vegas. A must try!
Once again awesome tapas and sangria!  All for the same price as three margaritas at the Jose Cuervo  airport bar.  I love the new location!  I hope the kitchen issues are behind you firefly!
So much delicious items in the menu, try different of them and share with those in your family or group. I highly recommend this restaurant. :)

Firefly, I really do love you. They have some great tapas, if you're in town, you need to stop in. The stuffed dates are so good. I highly recommend the red sangria, it's really good. My favorite item to get is the steak and mushroom skewers, they're cooked in a red wine reduction; and it's amazing. 

The only reason I couldn't give 5 stars is because of the service. The service is pretty terrible at best. Everyone looks annoyed to be there, and the servers tend to disappear after you order only to be briefly replaced by what they call, an assistant server. They look even more annoyed that the regular servers. 

Firefly, please hire some better servers. The service needs to be comparable to the food!
Fantastic food, great staff.   We go there once a year when we visit Las Vegas. The Tapas are fantastic, just order tapas with Sangria and your evening will be perfect.  You need to try this place !

Cancelled flight took me to the Fairfield Inn. The front desk clerk recommended this place that is next door. Fantastic service and the happy hour menu is one of the best! I had the chicken skewers char grilled with fingerling potatoes asparagus and a garlic cream sauce and a cucumber martini with Bombay Sapphire gin for 11 dollars! Stayed at Caesars Palace the night before and spent that on a cup of coffee.
Everything we ordered was absolutely fabulous. Food was served very quickly, excellent service. Loved the atmosphere!

I was disappointed by this restaurant -- it did not live up to the reviews.  It is true that this is an affordable tapas restaurant, but the food was just ok.  It wasn't horrible.  But nothing was really a wow.

Food

Pulpo Asado 

Nose of skillet potato with a hint of sea brininess and tomato. Octopus had grilled nose, very gently salty and spicy palate with soft consistency with only a hint of chewiness. Potato was skillet with skin. Smokey nose, a bit of saltiness with skin crunchiness. Some sautéed small-diced pepper, tomato, and green onion added accent. I think potato was unnecessary. 4.25/5. 4.5/5 without potato.

Merguez

Nose of feta cheese and tomato-pepper confit. Gamy lamb nose on the sausage, followed by medium saltiness and high black-pepperiness. Feta gave accent and tomato-pepper confit gave sourness fresh counterbalance. Eat them together. 4.5/5.




Service

Half bar half trendy bistro. Bar open seating. Food delivery is as authentic Spanish as the tapasAlcohol service. 4/5.


Ambience

A trendy bistro for a nice getaway. 4/5.


Overall

A delicious food at a crowded trendy place. 4.5/5.

The food was delicious! From the egg plant to the scallop escargot and beat salad. We loved everything. The steak & shrimp skewers made the meal. Nahum our server was a highlight of the evening.  Go here ... you will be glad you did!

First timer here. Walking in and getting seated was nice and easy. Luckily we had no wait. We ordered the Tierra y Mar skewers which had chorizo, shrimp, and steak. Definitely recommend it . Our second mini dish was the empanadas. We were a little disappointed with it. It's only one small empanada cut in half. The meat was okay in flavor just wish it contained more than just meat. For drinks we ordered sangria and a raspberry mojito. Over all food was a 4 out of 5. Reason I'm giving only two stars is because the service was not what it should have been. We had to keep waving down our server and our plates were never picked up until about 15 minutes once we waved down one of the hostess. 
Also hostess did not seem happy to stop and see what we needed. After wards the person that came to help us and bring us the check was very rude and just dropped the bill off with out saying a word or looking at us. Really wish we could have been treated better . ALSO I mentioned it was my wife's birthday and not once did they even say happy birthday. 
REMEMBER customer service makes a huge difference in a persons visit to your business.
Great value for the price. Many options to choose from. Service was excellent. Kept the tables clear of dirty plates and always there when you needed them. Flan was amazing too.
Best Tapas in town! Every time I come to Vegas I have to stop and enjoy the food! Best lamb chops ever!! Stuffed peppers to die!! Just everything is delish!! Come you won't regret it!

WOW! How did I not know about this place any sooner?!

We came here for dinner on Saturday night and our server Carlos was just downright AWESOME. He was attentive, courteous, and offered excellent meal recommendations! I love that we didn't feel like we were rushed given how long the wait was and how crowded the place was. We got to enjoy our meal - people watch a bit and take in all the flavors of the amazing food. 

Food - bring a huge appetite because this place will rock your taste buds. My favorite staple of the night was the Apple Manchego salad - order it!! It was crunchy and salty and every bit amazing. I almost wanted to order another plate to go as a late night snack post drinking. We also ordered the veggie empanadas, the petite filet, the firefly french fires and for dessert - the trio of gelato. If you aren't drooling yet - you should really re-read what I just ordered. The food came out as each plate was ready and it was nice and hot. I did think we could have lived without the fries. It didn't have much of a wow factor compared to the other dishes we ordered. The food tasted great and it probably now my go to place for every vegas trip going forward. 

Amazing food - awesome service and no fancy price tag. Gotta love that! Be sure to make reservation. There are always large groups here so to avoid the wait, plan ahead. Also perfect place for group dinners!

Went here for a friend's birthday. Haven't been since they closed down the original one across the parking lot.

One thing that struck me is how big Firefly is. It's a huge establishment which is nice. I feel the new location is much bigger than the old place. This is a definite plus.

Drinks. I did not order a fruity drink (like sangria or mojito) but I saw people order them. The mojitos are drowning in mint. Barely any drink in there. That was a downside. The beers on tap though are actually pretty good. You would think they would only specialize in mixed drinks, but they had some nice Belgian Tripels on tap that really packed a punch.

Food. The bacon wrapped stuffed dates are what you get. Get a couple of orders. Quite possibly the best item on the menu. Fried Calamari was okay, they give you a bunch. Bit chewier than I wanted it but it was still good. Empanadas were okay, nothing special. Tierra y mar skewers were very delicious. This is the one with filet mignon on a skewer along with some other tasty morsels. For dessert, the flan was fantastic. 

Service. Just like many other restaurants, there seems to be a communication issue with servers. You'll have a server take your order (dates), then they'll disappear. Another server will come and take someone else's order. That person's order will come out before yours. You'll see another server, ask about your order as another server is walking aimlessly around asking every table if they ordered dates. This just happens so often with every order. Luckily, all my food arrived without much trouble but I can only imagine that other people's meals aren't so lucky. The positive is that every server was very nice and was trying very hard. 

Overall, I like the new location better. It's bigger, better atmosphere and the food didn't make me sick.
Modern Spanish tapas.  Big classy place.  The recommended mac & cheese and empanadas were great.  Warm spinach salad was good.  Mojitos were quite decent.  Prices were fair for LV.

Larger location with a much larger patio. Service is much more personal and more attentive. The food is much better quality with bigger portions and the alcohol is flowing a lot better. It's obvious Firefly is trying to gain there customer base back. I will continue to be loyal to this amazing restaurant.

Always have and always will come to this place. 

Went to the old and still with the new. Tapas all around with yummy sangria. Doesn't take look to be seated but I do highly recommend reservations because it can get busy and expect to wait. If you didn't make reservations, don't worry, there is a bar where you can sit and enjoy a glass or two of beverages. 

My hubby and I love coming here. This is our must go to every time, so highly recommend it.

I will be coming here in the next few months so I will try to take some photos before we devour it.

Easy lyft ride from our hotel to the restaurant.  They wouldn't take reservations  on same day (knock a half star for that), but we took a chance, just showed up at around 7:00 and were seated right away.  Surprisingly, there were many seats available for a Sat. Night.  We ordered 6 dishes and I specifically had a discussion with our waiter to bring a couple of dishes out, wait till we were almost done and then bring the rest.  So what happens?  They brought all dishes out at once!! For that poor service, I knock a half star.  Food was good.  Not amazing, but good except for a couple dishes.  Highlights we're the bacon wrapped dates, firefly sticks and ahi Tatar.  We weren't crazy about the stuffed peppers (cheese was just too heavy, thick and flavorless).  Also disappointing was the Tres Leches desert.  Too dense compared to others we've had in the past. The restaurant is nice, clean has a good vibe and we will probably go back with a larger crowd so we can try more items.

First off, parking was a nightmare. I would avoid this place Friday to Sunday for dinner. Yes, there's free valet but they park your car like they're playing tetris. 

Next, the food. The food presentation is great as is the ambiance, but most of what we got was jusy OK. Based on the price point and parking experience I probably would not be back. Yardbird was better. 

*BACON WRAPPED DATES: sweet and savory bites of heaven. A MUST TRY. 

*STUFFED PEPPERS: good flavor just a bit much on the cream cheese. 

*FIREFLY FRIES: you can get these fries at McDonald's and sprinkle Parmesan on it. The Parmesan melted together and was difficult to distribute for taste. 

*FIREFLY BURGER : we asked for medium, but it was pretty much med rare. Nothing special just your average burger. 

 *PAELLA, as others have mentioned - order first as it takes like 30 to 40 min. It was good, but unfortunately we were pretty much full when it arrived at our table.

I just had to try this place out when I was in ATL for the weekend and I'm glad I did! The service was awesome and the food was amazing. I had the mango ribs and they were delicious!! They fell off the bone with each bite. I also had a steak dish but I can't remember exactly what it was to be honest but it also delicious. It was a big crowd on the couch area but I sat at the tables by the bar. I dont know if you have to make reservations to sit on the other side but it seemed like it. Everything came out quick. Now I will say that the drinks weren't memorable. 


The bathroom was clean and everyone seemed to be friendly. I will be back !

Only been here a few times but every time I've been in, I was never disappointed! This past time, however, every dish we had was amazing!

We started off with the apple manchego salad. AMAZING. Who would've thought sliced apples and manchego cheese together would make such an appetizing dish?! This is a must order for me every time I'm here. Definitely shareable too!

We sat at the bar, to which our bartender was very knowledgeable on the menu and suggested many items to fit our taste buds/diet. 
We then ordered their shrimp ceviche, tuna tartare, and scallops "escargot" from his many, delicious sounding, suggestions. 

Their shrimp ceviche makes my mouth water just thinking about it. SO FLAVORFUL! Its a little on the citrusy side, but I loved it that way. They came with crackers so balance out the lemon. *droool*

The tuna tartare came with taro chips, which by the way, are my faavorite, so it instantly got a lot of lovinnnn from me. But the tuna tartare alone was delicious. It's basically ahi tuna and avocado, and their seasonings, sprinkled with love. 

And lastly, the scallops escargot was very delightful! Herby, buttery, breaded goodness with a nice lilll scallop in the middle. 


Those four were about 50 dollars, give or take. I absolutely love tapas for the fact being you can try many different options on the menu without breaking the bank. And with that, I absolutely love this place! The portion sizes, yeah they're still small plated, but I feel like they still give you a good amount! We're small girls tho, so that was enough to fill us up without feeling too full

Also, side note, on another occasion, I had their stuffed dates and those are just as bomb as everything else :) try everything! Or atleast what I've mentioned.

Pros:
Food is pretty good
Large selection
Lots of vegetarian and vegan items
Moderate pricing

Cons:
Loud, definitely have to increase your voice level to talk to the person across the table from you
Some dishes could be executed better 

I came here with my friend on a Thursday night and we were seated within five minutes though the place is filled and booming. One of the most immediate things we noticed was the volume of the setting. We chose four tapas plates, albondigas, empanadas, scallops escargot, and heart of palm "crab cakes." 

The albondigas which are a type of meatball in a tomato sauce with cheese were delicious and warm. 

The empanadas, which was really just one cut in half was good, but maybe a little heavy. I understand that it is an empanada, but I've had empanadas that are lighter and airier. The pulled pork with the cream cheese and the aioli on top was a little much. 

The scallops "escargots" were good, they came in a pesto like sauce with a lemon to squeeze over. They were good, the flavor was spot on but... I wish they were seared more for a crisp outside, they didn't have much of a crust at all, so I was slightly disappointed. 

The palm of hearts crab cakes was vegan, really just a mix of vegetables seasoned with old bay and served with a mustard aioli which was quite citrusy. These were good, but not necessarily crabby except for the old bay and the shape of them. However, they were still tasty. 

Overall, I'd return, but I'd likely try some of their other dishes, which isn't a problem because they have a huge variety. Our bill was $36 for four plates.

Thank you fellow Yelpers! I was able to find this great place through you. Went here for a late night dinner and it was so damn good. There were 4 us. We started off with ordering a pitcher of red sangria which gave us about two glasses each. Each of us picked 2 plates to being with. I can't honestly say I remember all of the plates since we were randomly picking off the menu. I can say though, as each one came, they got better and better. We were all pretty fully satisfied, but did end up ordering 2 more plates because we really wanted to try them out. We had steak, chorizo, shrimp and mango skewer, Ceviche, ahi skewer, stuffed peppers, Diablo shrimp, chicken skewers, goat cheese dip, petite filet, and mussels. They were all great dishes. We had absolutely so complaints. Service was great, staff were friendly and helpful. Place was nice and clean with attractive decor. Bomb!

Super tasty Spanish restaurant.  Ordered 4 or 5 tapas to eat while we waited on the made to order paella.  Everything tasted so good.  Inside seating is quiet and dark, and outside is lively and fun.  Best part is they are open late.  My friends and I went around 1am after doing some late night Fremont street exploring.  Highly recommend!

Great food love the sangria! Happy hour before 6pm is always great since the majority of tapas that I order is on the happy hour menu plus the sangria. I love the Tuna tar tar, sliders comes with shelters and blue cheese if you don't like that then let your server know and also read INGREDIENTS it's very annoying to hear people around us that they didn't like a certain thing. Service was a bit slow could use some work on faster paced but our server was very attentive when he did arrive.

Wow! So just a few things before I get to the food-

1) The customer service was great! I made reservations for 13 about a week in advance since my company had a conference out here in LV; and they were able to accommodate it easily. With a large group, and a loud/happy group of people, all our servers were FAST, answered all our questions, and made sure we were well taken-cared of (probably b/c they knew they'd get a great tip). Food came out super-quick and their water / beverage replenishment was on point!

- We were also celebrating one of our co-worker's bdays and they were able to keep the cake in the back and bring it out to surprise her after dinner!

2) The Food: again, WOW. I haven't been to a spanish tapas restaurant in awhile, and this made me just want to go everyday! The food was fantastic. With such a large group, we were able to order a good variety from the menu, and honestly, everything was great!

- Just to name a few favorites: Tuna tartare, ceviche, bacon wrapped dates
- We also had the seafood paella which was very delicious BUT there were parts of it that was way too fishy - which made me worry & wonder if they washed the seafood since I haven't tasted anything so...."seafoody" (& I'm not even that picky and eat lots of seafood). BUT again, since the service and EVERYTHING else was so great, I couldn't knock off a point for this but thought it was still important to mention.

3) The Sangria: Saving the best for last - oh. my. SO GREAT. The end.

Overall, awesome experience. Thanks to the employees that waited on us! They were so fast and ensured our drinks/water was always replenished! I will be taking my fiance here when we return to Vegas next month!

I fell in love with this place...  When driving up, it looked empty and there was only one car in the parking lot.  Then we realized the parking was behind the building...  We walked around still wondering if there were people inside or if we'd be the only ones there for dinner????

We walked in and I'm so happy we did, it was packed.  The vibe was great, the decorations was great, the music was great!

Now let's get to the food.  It is tapas, so it made it great for sharing.  The food was absolutely delish and I will definitely come back again to try more dishes.  If we're weren't so stuffed I could be just kept ordering.  The need empanada and salad we're so, so good.  The ribs just fell off the bone.  The croquettes we're, ok I'm going old school, the bomb dot com!!!  Hahaha. The fries were the beginning of our meal, and my daughter would not let them take the ate until she had the very last fry, so in saying that...  They were pretty darn good!

Off the strip, well actually, right behind the strip, so prices are decent. The reviews are pretty on point.  Give this place a try when you're in Vegas.  You won't regret it!

This is one of our new favorite restaurants. We went for lunch time and the service was great. I've been dreaming about the food ever since. I'm a vegetarian so my husband and i ordered, the avocado "toast", the tomato soup, and the firefly fries. They were all delicious: we also had the chocolate tres leaves which I have to admit wasn't very tasty. We can't wait to come back!

I love this Firefly! I always get the Firefly Fries, which are delicious. Tonight I got those, with the Petit Filet and it was boooomb.com! And my dinner partner got the Mushroom Tarte, which he really enjoyed and the sliders which he thoroughly enjoyed. They did much better than usual with their customer service; our drinks were constantly refilled, even after we paid. Very professional. Although, the hostess was a little rushed, and no one was waiting and she didn't hold the door open for us and left us both with one menu. It was about $20 each for us and we got 4 tapas with two drink.
Ps. Their butter on their bread is AWESOME & their butter on their steak...
Super good Tapas! I love the rack of lamb, wings, cheese plate just to name a few. Quick friendly service with incredible ambiance. Updated lighting and hoppin bar area!
Amazing. The 10$ Filet is Huge! Drinks are great Just a little pricey.

Finally got to try this place out and it was SOO GOOOOOOD. I forgot my server's name but he was very helpful. The service was great as well. 

Breakdown of what we ordered:

- Bacon Wrapped Dates: Yes, listen to what everyone is saying and GET IT!! 

- Petite Filet: the meat was so tender

- Tierra y Mar: it was good, the salsa verde was amazinnggggg

- Apple Machengo: so refreshing & the cheese was so good 

- Shrimp Ceviche: AMAZING

I definitely recommend coming here. It's inexpensive. I def want to come here again the next time I visit. I want to try the paella! The table next to us got that & it looked amazing.

I've eaten at many fancy places on the strip, but we decided to try a new place based on reviews. This restaurant is very unassuming upon entering; did we make a mistake? The food was AMAZING, the service was great, and the prices were even better. If you are looking for atmosphere, this probably isn't the place for you....but if you are looking for amazing food.....you NEED to try this place.
Average food, portions were large for tapas. The service was okay, but all the servers were pretty cold and unfriendly. I wouldn't come back here.

I've always loved this place because I love sharing and talking about food. Tops: red Santeria: light fruity, yet strong... order a pitcher, you'll need it! Pork empanadas... amazing and tender! My favorite go to is the toasted goat cheese dip and bacon wrapped dates! Savory and rich! Outdoor patio is great and breezy!
OMG! Everything was sooooo good.  I highly recommend the baked cod  and steamed mussels.

Love, love, love this restaurant. Had one of my bachelorette party dinners here a few weeksn ago and I couldn't have been happier. The food, drinks and service were all really amazing!!! Thank you for everything!

I have been, and taken numerous groups of family/friends, to Firefly at least a dozen times throughout my life. Most recently, however, was the crown jewel: my brother, his best friend, his bf's wife, and I, truly enjoying ourselves. Yes I have had better sangria, but FF's version is delicious, refreshing, and compliments the food well nonetheless. I cannot live without their mussels with chorizo, bacon wrapped dates, and camarones a la diabla. Our service has always been outstanding -- a couple of visits were a tiny bit more frustrating than others because we had to flag down servers, but those incidents were few and far between -- and we always leave feeling really satisfied as far as value is concerned.

So what prompted me to write this? Man, haters gonna hate. I suppose that's the beauty of Yelp, and America in general I guess. But seriously? I find it highly ironic that there is a petition circulating to shut down all Firefly branches. ABSURDITY. I'm no math teacher or anything*, but Firefly's aggregate rating goes into the 4 star range, which for hundreds of reviews is pretty impressive. I've delved deeper into this situation and found that many have claimed that Firefly's owners refuse to adhere to any standards of cleanliness or sanitation, and Firefly's owners responded by hiring a consultant specializing in health safety. I don't know who to believe -- the strange minority stepping in because they know so damned much, or the overwhelming majority of people who are pleased with Firefly and believe it to be a true Vegas gem.

I adore you, Firefly, and so does EVERY person I send over. Don't ever go away!

* Note: I actually am a math teacher

I don't write many reviews; reserving my opinion for only the best or worst experiences. Firefly ranks among the best. Highly recommended, and if you don't try the bacon-wrapped dates then either you're a fool or you hate bacon which is essentially the same thing. The flavor explosion is life altering. Pair the pulpo asado with a Rogue hazelnut brown; it's a surprisingly exceptional flavor combination. Cheers!

We were kinda skeptical about going to this place so soon after the Salmonella scare but we figured we would try it out and give it a go!  MAN were we on the MONEY!!

Fantastic spot to check out hipsters, have a few shots, and a few more tapas, savory and sweet alike, as well as enjoy the beautiful decor and friendly staff.

Started off with Patron shots, then a pitcher of Sangria which was very refreshing then we moved on to tilapia sauteed in butter and wine, dates stuffed with goat cheese and wrapped in bacon, shrimp cocktail, Spanish albondigas, Angus sliders, ohh and so many other delicacies that I want to remember but it's been a month since I was there and my memory is a bit shot from the Patron but I promise, everything was excellent.

This is definitely a MUST GO TO when in Vegas!!!

Tapas Style restaurant, killer mojitos, good music and a kick-ass happy hour. When my wife and I go to Las Vegas this place is one of our stops. Do yourself a favor and give it a try. Specially during happy hour

The fid was good.  We had the Albondigas meatballs, baked goat cheese, petite filet, ham and cheese croquetas, chicken skewers, and the chocolate tres Leche cake.  All were pretty good, the skewers were dry and the petite filet was pretty so-so,but everything else was great.  I highly recommend the baked goat cheese.  Service was slow, and my waiter spoke brown English.  The dished were staggered but still really slow and I never got my second drink.

I came here for a Bachelorette party that was party of a VIP package - so we got treated to all you can eat and drink... I have to think the alcohol is definitely factoring in to what a great experience I had, but honestly the food was great and our servers (we had two) were AMAZING!! I would go back just for the service alone as they were attentive and went above and beyond to keep our party of 9 happy.  

Food - like I said it was all you could eat tapas and desserts for us, and a table of 9 girls, yep we pretty much had it all.... and managed to hand the plates around as if they were big enough to be family style.   I loved the bacon wrapped dates, the octopus, the apple salad, the tuna tartare, the empanadas, and the dessert platter.
You can probably skip the mussels, the chick peas in shells (these were actually good, but not worth the mess or effort to eat), the shrimp diabla, and the steak skewers....  trust me we ate many more than this, but these stick out as the best and the worst.

Drinks - the mojitos were ok, not as flavorful as I would have liked, but it was all you could drink and really I wasn't complaining. The sangria was strong, maybe too strong, and then others in our group ordered wine and beer.  

Service - again, sooooo good!! Our waitress took the time to get the bachelorette a candle and sing a made up bachelorette song to her as though it was her birthday... she didn't think the bachelorette looked happy enough so she kept going above and beyond with little details to make our night that much better.  

Atmosphere - loud, like really loud, and I'm sure our table wasn't helping... definitely not a romantic tapas spot I'd want to go to with the bf, but perfect for our kind of evening.

They have a very extensive tapas menu and the service was great. Omg surprisingly their red sangria was delicious especially on a hot day. If you want the paella , order it early. We had the seafood and it was good, lots of seafood. The dates bacon wrap was a tad bit salty. The potatoes with chorizo was super salty, you truly need a bowl of rice to scarf that down. The shrimp glazed with sweet and sour sauce was typical , nothing interesting. Felt like I can buy a sweet and sour sauce bottle at the Asian store and just stir fry it with the shrimp. 

I truly enjoyed the scallop escargot , pesto and bitter were so yummy!!! Must order !! I also enjoyed the apple salad with manchego cheese and smokes almond, very light and refreshing!

I haven't been to this restaurant in years so this time I went to a wedding reception. The new building is nice as well. The reception was set up outside on the patio area and was well decorated. The staff were nice and even though I'm not big on tapas food it was served as different samples and some things were very tasty. I was pleasantly surprised this time around. 

The one thing that stood out is the parking is in the back of the building and there are signs to lock your cars and hide belongings. Maybe there have been car break ins??? Not sure but it was a concern for me.

Could be a 3.5, but I'll get to that in a bit.

Firefly is a nice place off the strip with a nice menu. We've done Jaleo in our hometown (it's a go to) so we venture away from the Vegas locations to try Firefly. The white sangria stood out as the best thing we ordered. With four of us we order 10 plates and they were all good - nothing to really complain about - but nothing that stood out. Nice staff. The mark down is for the roaming photographer who's running some sort of "you're on the rollercoaster at DisneyWorld and want to buy pictures." She took a few and then came back to pass along a 'free' photo and offerings to sell. I don't need someone selling me photos at dinner - it's cheap and...cheap. And, vaguely unprofessional for a restaurant. If the manager reads this, knock it off. It's awful. Ran about $125 for ten plates, a pitcher of sangria, and two coffees.

Never disappoints!!! This place never seizes to amaze me! The food, the service and not to mention the staff!
I've taken numerous groups and friends to this location and it's always such a treat to see how much everyone enjoys it. I've never had a dish I wasn't impressed with. Thank you Firefly for making it so easy for me to share this little gem.

I wish I could give this 6 stars. Everything was incredible. The complimentary bread and butter was enough to swoon over. Then my waiter alejando  was so attentive and made sure my mojí tos never ran out. Mac and cheese was great, veggie empanada was better, skewers were delicious. Watermelon is better than mango. Amazing dinner!

Finally a place I can order several plates and not be judged..... 

I like tapas restaurants because you get a little bit of everything and you don't need to order five huge meals to get it. The idea of tapas is to get people at your table to share so you get to experience several dishes and that's exactly what we did.

They started us off with their sweet almond butter and bread. This was complimentary and the only problem was I couldn't stop eating it. The sweet almond butter was addicting! I think I filled up on bread. 

We also ordered off the tapas menus:

-The Apple and Manchego salad: Green apple, Manchego cheese, smoked almonds, and light dressing. The salad was light and refreshing if you want a healthier choice. It was good but nothing memorable.

-Veggie Empanadas: Spinach, mushroom, artichoke, herbed cream cheese in a pastry with red pepper aioli. They were served hot and crispy. 

-Firefly Fries: Parmesan, herbs, and aioli.  I'm not a fry person but I do prefer thin fries when I eat them. These actually were my least favorite. 

-Baked goat cheese: Goat and garlic cream cheese, tomato sauce, pesto, and toast. This was the groups favorite dish. I thought it was great for cheese lovers! So cheesy and delicious! 

-Mushroom Tart: puffed pastry, herbed cream cheese and mushroom sauce. This was my favorite. It was rich but also had enough carbs to make me happy! 

I also tried The New Girl drink which was house infused Vodka, cranberry, hint of Jalapeño and mint. Delicious! I loved it! 

All these tapas dishes were pretty big. They probably run on the bigger side of most tapa plates.

My friends ordered two main dishes:

 -Firefly burger with truffle fries 
 -Clams 

Neither of these interested me but everyone seemed to love their food, they all were very happy. It was very busy on this Friday night so it's probably a good idea to make reservations. We came in with no reservation and waited about 30 minutes.

This place was very busy and the atmosphere was fun. There were lots of people at the bar, loud music, and I even saw people dancing. No frowning allowed in here!
One of my favorite restaurants here in Vegas!! I always bring my guests here for their sangria and yummy tapas.
This place is clearly one of the best places I have been. ITs god very unusual combinations of food and excellent staff

Another Vegas favorite! Service, food, drinks, atmosphere, all fantastic! They gave a huge variety of tapas, pick a bunch and share! Also if you use the Open Table app, reservations are worth 100 points!   The champagne sangria is delicious!  Get a pitcher!
I love firefly. Everything is so tasty. I love the dark and red ambiance. It's such a great date night spot. Or group dinner with friends. Late night happy hour. It never disappoints.
Best tapas in Las Vegas. Too bad they dont have this restaurant in OC! Scallop escargot, tuna tartare and bacon wrap dates are my fav.  The New Girl drink was sooooo good and refreshing!

Perhaps i ordered poorly... or perhaps I wasn't drinking while eating. Probably the latter... yep definitely the latter.

Best thing I had was the bacon wrapped dates. Also it was enjoyable watching the two couples at the table in front of going to the bathroom every ten seconds... ya know... for stuff.

The rest of the food here was adequate and not worth the price. And as many reviews say... it is extremely loud! Once again due to all the alcohol consumption. It is also very dark... great place to take an ugly date.

The service is great, and I don't really know what else to say about it. Great ambiance minus all the noise. Our reservation was for ten but they let us in at 930 because there was no one in line. A lot of people have said to get a reservation which I suggest... BUT if you want to go earlier you might be able to sneak in... to the bathroom and do blow.

THE VERDICT: Go?! I can only suggest this place who have money to burn. Which i do i burn 1 dollar bills for heat. There is such a VAST variety in vegas (how bout that alliteration?) that if you are there for a weekend you should definitely go to other places, because there are a lot of delish places. oh and to the prostitutes at the table in front of us... make the powder breaks a little less noticeable.

This place is excellent! Quite a mini hidden gem for me. Is off the strip on Paradise Blvd, but only a few minutes drive from the strip. Firefly is known for their tapas and their sangria is DELICIOUS! 

I ordered the "Ahi Tuna Skewer"- The seared Ahi Tuna was cooked perfectly, and the presentation was nice. There's two skewers and there's pineapple bits in-between every ahi tuna cube. The pineapple and tuna goes pretty well together.

The sangria was AMAZING! I had two glass. So good. It was not too strong yet not too light. However, my girlfriend got tipsy drinking it. Funny. It's really good though. Definitely recommend others to get it.

The ambiance was nice. Dimmed lights inside. Service was great.

I love going here with my friends, and my sister. Cannot wait to bring my boyfriend on our next date. This place offers the best happy hour deals for the best mojitos and sangrias in the world. They are strong enough and delicious at the same time. The service could be a hit or miss sometimes, but mostly good. They refill your drinks before you need them and have really good foods as well. I personally love their bread and almond butter. Their bacon wrapped dates are a bit sweet but definitely a must try on the menu. Although the paellas take awhile, they are definitely worth every minute of wait as well. I wish they opened another location near my house so I could go more often!!

I've been here twice now & loved it both times! The sangrias (both red & white) are smooth and delicious. Just get the pitcher. I've only had the tapas, but they're fantastic. Some favorites: the patatas bravas, the apple & manchego salad, the macaroni & cheese, the petite filet, the spicy beef salad, and the empanadas. Service can be a little slow depending on the waiter & the crowd, but the food is worth it. An easy uber drive and especially great for mid-large size groups.
I love this place.   The ambiance is great.  The Apple and Manchego salad is my favorite.  They have delicious Mojitos and Sangria and tons of other cocktails.

Service 1/2 a star+ food 5 stars= 3 stars

The reason I even gave this 3 stars was for the incredible amazing food. 
The service was horrible.
 I understand its Vegas and when servers are charging gratuity for big parties at some point they dont care because they probably won't see us again. Its sad but true. I will recommend this place to friends when they want amazing food but will always warn about the service.

Salsa, Merengue, cumbia, Bachata dance floor outside.
Wow!  How have I not heard of this place before.  I the bacon wrapped dates, among other things.  It was amazing.  The staff is really friendly and attentive too.  I'll be back!

Yes, you are reading this rating right 4STARS for Firefly.  At the end of this review I will explain why I did not rate 5STARS

With all the negative publicity that this restaurant has received it's time to put them back in the good light.  

I was recently here for a team meeting, and I have to say that I was very impressed. This new location is AWESOME, valet parking in the front and ample parking in the back.  Hostess booth as you walk-in just like the old location but the update in the new location is now there is a WAITING AREA.  Helloooooooo, no longer do I have to wait outside, in addition to the waiting area the new bar area is big enough to sit and have a drink and not be elbowed by other patrons.  

RESTROOMS - clean, clean, clean! and more than 2 stalls (sorry just keeping it REAL)

DINING ROOM - OMG, amazing you can actually walk through the restaurant w/o saying the following: 
- "oh, I'm sorry"

- "excuse me, can you scoot your chair in please"

- "it's hot in here, is the AC on" , etc

Big parties can be seated and accommodated comfortable.  Firefly now has a extra room for private parties, that sits off tot he side of the dining area.

BAR - The bar is SUPER, more than 5ppl can sit at the bar now.  If you and friends want to chill at the bar and sit together, you can.  Open bar area, it sits kind of in the middle of the restaurant.

PATIO - couches outside, more of a lounge area now.



FOOD - 

- STUFFED DATES: yummy! yes indeed, dates stuffed w/ blue cheese wrapped in crispy bacon. (I don't even liked blue cheese, but i KILLED those stuffed dates)

- MANCHEGO MAC&CHEESE: when you can see the grease of the cheese along the rim of the dish, know that you're in for a culinary delight.  bubbly cheesy goodness, mac&cheese comes out w/ that crunchy cheese top. you know how you throw food in the oven set on broiler to make it extra crunchy...YEP, and that's what come to you table. mmm, mmm, good

- ALBONDIGAS: juicy moist meatballs w/ melted parmesan cheese sitting in a bath of tasty tomato sauce.  NO really, the sauce is on point, I wanted to take the bowl and slurp but I didn't want to look like a fat a$$.

- VEGGIE EMPANADAS: crispy flaky dough, you hear that slight CRUNCH when you bite into the empanada.  the veggies are not all mushy or hard for that fact.  its a nice balance, it comes drizzled with some kind of sauce that matched very well

- STEAK&MUSHROOMS SKEWERS: um YEA! medium rare, i don't what type of steak but it was tasty.  it reminded me of filet mignon, it was so tender, when I pinched the steak to pull of the skewer it just slide right off.  If you are a mushroom person, then this dish will make you very happy.  They do not skimp of size or flavor

- BEEF SLIDERS: DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! no extras needed, don't ask for for any ranch, no ketchup, no mustard, no NOTHING. EAT AS IS, beef is seasoned perfectly, cooked medium rare, you take a bite and your teeth just sink into the beef.  OH MY GOSH, i'm getting hot over here..oh i forgot I'm still writing a review

GO TO FIREFLY'S you will not get SICK, I PROMISE.  They have cleaned house in there, I did not see any of the OLD employees there.  I was a regular at the old paradise location, I was familiar w/ all the workers at the old location.  The NEW paradise location is NEW all the way around.  The food is still GREAT 

NOW, the reason why I did rate 5STARS is because of this one problem:
With a new spacious restaurant and bigger restrooms there is still NO TOILET PAPER in the bathroom.  If you're a girl, go to the bathroom with a friend just in case you walk into the stall and it is out of paper.  "hey girl, can you hand me some rough ass paper towels please"  I'm just saying.....

Check out the NEW FIREFLYS on Paradise, it's good.  A good place for anything

Been here multiple times, and everytime the service is great, the food is fantastic and the sangria is light, not too sweet, thirst quenching and will get you buzzed. Never. Fails.
I've tried multiple items with everything always being so tasty, however I do remember last year when I came I tried the veggie paella and it was not delicious. But again, paella is supposed to have seafood and meat, so that was a lack of judgment on my vegetarian friend who ordered it. So I forgive Firefly for that one and blame my friend. Ok back to last week. I ordered the clams, and it was so tasty my mouth is watering just thinking of it. Steamed to perfection and soaked in a broth with chorizo. Simply amazing. Roasted veggies were also amazing, as well as the pasta bowls. Our table ordered 3 of them and everyone who tasted it was in awe. However, it's alot of pasta; I don't think we even finished 1/2 of each one of the orders. All in all, you can't order wrong here ( Unless you get the veggie paella) and the sangria is one of the best I've ever tasted. This place is always on top of my list to visit when in Las Vegas!

Meh. Not memorable or remarkable. Missed its mark on the service. I felt that our server didn't even want to wait on us. All of our food we ordered came out at the exact same time except for one hot dish. Will not be coming back or recommending anyone to go here. Save your money and go elsewhere. Very cold welcoming and basically set the tone for the entire evening where I just wanted to pack my mediocre tapas and just leave even though I wasn't full or satisfied.
Took my grandma here for her birthday the food was so good and the service was great doesn't take long for entrees to come out and big enough to share thank you for the awesome time

If you are looking for great food, drinks and music, this place is it ! 
The service is exceptional and the food even better.
Gabriel is the best., attentive and friendly.

we come frequently to this place, excellent food, environment and the service/atention of Irina is the best. She always is ready for help us and give us an excellent service

Irina you are vey kind and sweet.. mulumesc!

304. I rarely go off the strip for food, but my friend raved about this place so we met up here. This was his first stop after driving directly from California. #Commitment.

All of the tapas that we got were tasty, but the real highlight was the stuffed dates. I don't like dates, but they were decorated with so many other things that it didn't even matter anymore. The dates were wrapped with bacon and topped with blue cheese with a sprinkling of some red wine and smoked almond somewhere in there. It was an explosion with every bite.

We also ordered a pitcher of sangria because it's a tapas bar, who doesn't? I didn't take it too well though. Ended up with a bad headache. It was probably too sugary for my brain.

Sounds like this place can get packed on the weekend, but we went during off-peak hours and it was pretty empty. Parking wasn't an issue either with plenty of space behind the restaurant. Definitely would come back for the tapas, but I'd probably go elsewhere for drinks.

This place has a serious obsession with mint. 

I came here with a large group to celebrate a friend's birthday. Many people in the group ordered mojitos. I was not on that list but just from observation,  I was blown away at the amount of mint that was in these drinks. From what I understand, all you need is a little bit of mint to be muddled to release the mint flavor. My dining companions could not even finish their drinks at times because there was so much mint gumming up their straws. It was practically coming up the sides of the glass and people were pulling out leaves and putting it on their plates. So please, Firefly, pull back the heavy hand for mint in your mojitos. 

Here are some of the dishes I tried and my thoughts:

Bacon wrapped dates-Were really good but super rich. 
Empanada-Meh. Nothing that impressive about it. I can see why they drizzled it with a ton of aioli--they were trying to give it some extra flavor. I believe that a condiment should be served on the side and compliment a dish, rather than make it the only way it has any dimension. I say this because I scraped the aioli off and it was just bland and then soggy in the parts were the aioli sat on the crispy empanada shell. 
Tierra y mar skewers-grilled shrimp is the first thing on the description and there were only 2 shrimps to be found on the entire thing). The filet mignon chunks were quite heavenly. 
Caramel flan-a standard flan that was served with an almond "cookie" which looked like a cannoli shell. When I scooped up the fruit compote garnish with the cookie and ate it with the flan...I enjoyed that combo together. And of course there were a few mint leaves as a garnish!

I was a tad bummed because although they have Delirium Tremens beer on the menu, it was not on tap when I got there. The waitress did express some concern that it was on the online menu (which is were I had seen it). BUt I was still happy with the beers I ordered in its place. I don't care that they are known for Sangria. I had Sangria the day before at a baby shower. I was over having just some fruity wine. So beer was poison of choice that night. 

Service from our main waitress was really good. She was very fast and informative and kept all of the separate checks straight and there was not a large group gratuity charge! 

The other servers really missed the mark with getting waters refilled or handing out food. When  some plates came out, they would go to the edge of our table and say "tomato soup? who ordered the tomato soup?" and this happened every single time. This became grating  because they said it barely above a whisper and they just stood there repeating it until someone realized it. The table was so large that it was very easy for someone that was deep in a conversation several feet away to miss the call for their food. I don't know if there is a way to improve upon that strategy. 

Overall, I had a fun time with the people that were there and I enjoy the tapas style of eating. But, the dishes did not really impress me enough to give this place a 4 or 5 star review.

This was a great stop to get away from the hustle and bustle of the strip.  Great atmosphere and patio was adorable.  There was a great variety of things to choose from. super for sharing and trying new things. The servers and staff were very attentive without being pushy. A great find!
BEST FOOD IN LAS VEGAS?!?! Every plate was full of rich flavors. Made you want to order more and more!

Great experience, excellent happy hour. My family of 6 ordered everything on the happy hour menu and we were extremely satisfied with all the tapas. The Fly Mule was a little too melon-y for our taste. The mojito was also good. Definitely worth $5.

If I need to take one star out is Due to the fact the Dish is h u g e and you cannot enjoy the incredible taste the chef offers. I tried almost 15 different place each one of them was delicious . The top dish for me was the Tuna tartar. But really it's worth the price. They Have Parking as well. For free. That's a rare thing in Vegas. 

Enjoy.

Great spot for locals AND tourists! I've been to the one in Summerland and since it closed down was worried the food wouldn't be as yummy.... I was wrong! Tasted great as always! The tapas are def the way to go!! I also order the chicken paella, takes 40 mins but enough to share and it tastes amazing!! Patio has a nice ambiance and it's a great spot to have some sangria and hang out with friends. 4 star due to the slow service. Half the time you can't find the server!!
When in Vegas, Firefly is a must especially for happy hour! Lamb sausage, pork empanada, albondigas, Apple salad....oooooohhhh....I wish they had a Firefly back home with the same prices!
Seriously good. The way to eat. Try a few small plates and all will be good. Bacon wrapped dates, Tuna tartare were awesome, one more, what shall it be?  The Sangria is the bomb.
This is one of the best places I've been to in Vegas! The menu, the food and service are excellent! Can't say enough good !!

Our favorite spot in Vegas. Went there for my B-day dinner . we were 18 ppl.  Great food, great sangria, great atmosphere but most of all the waiter Mario,  Very efficient, he kept our table clean and our gasses full. 
I strongly recommend this place !!

Love this place. This has been the go to place when no one knows what we want to eat and just want something consistently good. We have been coming here for years (the original location and this place combined) my favorites are the ceviche, stuffed dates, the all the skewers, and Padron peppers. Honestly tho anything you order from here will be good, not once have I been disappointed. The best of all is the red sangria. It is a must try. The service is always consistent, and very friendly people.

I've tried this place a few times for the happy hour, then dinner with a group.  I cringe when someone suggests it.  
why: 1) service was consistently crap (full house, but not crowded).  2) food was overpriced. 3) they will push alcohol, no matter if you or someone in your party has had too much.  
Want a DUI? go there.

After hearing about Firefly on Paradise for years, I was happy with my first visit and can't wait to return. As the other reviews have stated, this is an excellent spot for group outings as well as intimate dates. While my wife and I enjoyed our meal, I'd suggest going with a group so everybody has a chance to try a wide variety of tapas.

My wife and I decided on an early dinner on a Sunday night and booked our reservation through Open Table on Yelp, which was easy and convenient. We arrived and were seated immediately. It was still early for Vegas, so the restaurant was not fully buzzing yet. 

Our server Nahum greeted us and he was terrific throughout the dinner, as were the additional servers who promptly removed empty plates and refilled our drinks. Nahum explained some of Firefly's dishes and offered a few recommendations. We went with a few of the more popular items and since we'd had our share of meat during lunch that day, we went with dishes that were not meat-centric.

The tapas we tried:

The stuffed dates were outstanding and lived up to the hype. I was a bit weary at first, thinking that the bacon wrapping would overwhelm the date, but it was used more for its smoky qualities and the almond center was a nice way tie in all of the flavors. Highly recommended.

The fresh garbanzos were a nice snack seasoned with lime, chili, and sea salt. It was the first time I'd had them served in their shell; it was similar to munching on edamame, but with more flavor. 

The Firefly Fries were shoestring potatoes topped with parmesan and herbs and served with aioli. I didn't think they were anything extraordinary, but my wife really enjoyed the comfort food quality they brought to our meal. 

We both enjoyed the manchego mac and cheese, which was made with baby shell pasta instead of elbow macaroni and topped with a tomato-pepper relish. It was rich, creamy, and mellow.

The camarones a la diabla were more sweet than spicy, with the shrimp cooked perfectly and served in the sauce along with small pieces of grilled bread.

Surprisingly, the tapas filled us up more than we thought they would, so we intend to return to sample the other dishes as well as their popular sangria. We did, however, leave room for dessert and devoured the chocolate tres leches cake. It was a perfect ending to our dinner.

Note: it's unfortunate there's no sort of dress code at Firefly. It's a nice restaurant, but when diners show up looking like they just returned from their hotel's swimming pool, it ruins the atmosphere. I'm reserving my fifth star for a future visit.

Food was great, drinks were great.  Too bad they don't understand how to run a business.  I purchased this Groupon for use on a Friday night while visiting Las Vegas.  I called first, because I read the restriction about only being able to use from 5:00 - 6:30 for dinner, and reservations being required.  The person I spoke with was really short with me, didn't really understand my question about "having a groupon and needing a reservation during that window, etc.".  She told me to just come right over, because they weren't busy and there was no wait.  When we got there, approximately an hour later, it was 6:15.  I know this, because we had told friends we would meet them there at 6:00 and I was upset with my husband because we were 15 mins late.  By the time we got sat and had ordered our drinks, it was probably 6:30.  We had a party of 8, and spent almost $300 and 1.5 hours there.  When I presented the Groupon, the waiter told me it was only valid from 5:00 to 6:30.  I explained that I had read the fine print, had called for a reservation, was told it was unnecessary, and was still seated by 6:30, regardless.  He persisted in saying that he understood, but still couldn't honor it, but i was welcomed to use it on a different night.  When I explained that we were in from out of town and had purchased it specifically to use that evening and asked him if he could let me talk with a manager, he said he would certainly check with the manager and explain my dilemma.  He came back a couple minutes later and told me that "the manager was sorry, but they couldn't accept it, and since I was from out of town, I was welcomed to call Groupon and request a refund".  Really?  I'm not a cheap skate.  In fact, I'm the opposite.  The measly Groupon amounted to a $17 discount on a $240 check, upon which I left a $50 tip.  I really don't care about the $17 but I do feel a little scammed for being lured into their business, bringing 7 other people with me (2 of which live in Las Vegas) only to be treated like dirt.  Worse than that, I hate that the employees at Firefly, clearly don't understand that the value in advertising is in bringing new customers into your business and keeping them coming back, not to bait and switch them, thus ensuring they will never visit again.  And, sadly, had the manager come over and spoken to me, I could have shared this feedback with him, rather than airing my grudge on Yelp.  Fail, Firefly.  Fail.

I came here for a late dinner on a Thursday night and was seated right away.

The restaurant has indoor, outdoor, and bar seating.

To start I had a cucumber martini made with Bombay Sapphire which was delicious.

For my meal I had the bacon wrapped dates after seeing so many positive reviews on Yelp. They lived up to the hype. I also had the pork empanadas. Yum!

Fun atmosphere, great food, and good service.

Writing this review while still in Firefly. Yes, the tapas ARE that good! It is only matched by the impeccable service we got from Pepe and crew. Great food, good fiun, overall awesome experience! Nuff said...

Would have put a 1 star, but the food and atmosphere are excellent. Absolutely terrible service followed by a forced 20% gratuity! Wtf! Our server Pepe' came to our table only to take our order, deliver food, and handle the check. I ordered food 5 minutes after my friends, and it took over 30 minutes to bring out my food after reminding several other servers and table cleaners. Almost laughable service. Leaving hungry and upset.
AMAZING, blown away, just amazing. I live in New York and I dream of the apple and manchengo salad! I cannot wait for my next visit to firefly and I am so excited!

If you're looking for something off the strip that's got great food and you're short on time and can't dish out $50 for a fancy buffet, then Firefly on Paradise is where you and your friends are going for dinner before the club.

HERE'S A TIP: If your wait is long to get seated, go to the bar, order a pitcher of Sangria and put in your order for a paella because that will take 40 minutes to cook and by the time you get seated you can have the paella delivered to your table. By the way, the Sangria will change your life. 

       Let's start with the house bread which is garlic and the butter that accompanies it is this sweet, herby mix with I don't know what, but it tasted AMAZING! The staff saw that our group enjoyed this and brought extra bread out without us having to ask. We ordered the mac and cheese which was delicious and used the pasta shells instead of the elbow macaroni. Definitely home made and not out of a box, creamy and delicious.The goat cheese dish was good and had a sort of marinara base. I'm not a huge fan of goat cheese but it went well with the base. The mixed paella was out of this world! I need more paella in my life after eating the mixed paella which consisted of pieces of chicken, shrimp and clams and just a great flavorful bed of rice.  I'm still heart broken that we didn't take the leftover mixed paella (there was at least a cup of paella left) to go because my friend said she didn't want her car to smell (we were headed to XS at Encore after dinner and it would've sat in the car for like 3 hours).
It was my friend's birthday, and they brought us flan for her at no additonal charge and put a candle in it. Luckily she hates flan so I got to eat most of it and yeah, I'd lie and say it's my birthday anytime I visit here to get free flan.
 
          Everyone from the hostess at the front to the bartender and wait staff outside were courteous, beautiful and attentive. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'm definitely eating here and trying even more tapas and taking the leftover paella to-go and eating it on the way home.

We were soon hungry and found this place that serves paella and tapa style food!! Service was quick and had a bunch of food that we took back and ate at our hotel! The paella was massive! Saved it for later and it was still delicious! Come during happy hour! Great selection of drinks (try the mango mojito) and tapas are all very organized so you can decide very easily.
The star in LAS VEGAS. There is great service, wonderful food, super friendly staff, and a warm, welcoming environment. Try the pitcher of red sangria.

BOMB!!! Since their reopen I have to say even better than before. Their new facility is HUMONGOUS!! 10x the size of their old spot. The layout and design of the restaurant is very chic. Their full bar is a great place to entertain drinks!

As for the Tapas! Well........ 
They are simply delicious. I love it all. The mini filet is excellent. The potatoes that came with it are great too. 
Can't go wrong with the shrimp either. The sauce is succulent. 

But the real kicker here is the Mac and cheese! Nothing like anything I've had except maybe the Mac and cheese at BarBistro by Chef Beni Velasquez. These two Mac and cheeses are the best in the city. 

Overall a nice dinner date venue.

Great food and even better service ! Patrick at the bar gave us awesome recommendations and kept us entertained - wish we would have gone earlier in our trip because we would have gone back to try more tapas!

So many options, but there was only so much room in my stomach to try them all. Had the tuna tartare, stuffed dates, steamed mussels, & the lam chops aka $40. Not too shabby on the pricing. 

Before I get into the "imo" of the food, I have to recommend the sangria ($13/pitcher). Probably the best sangria I've had so far. Sangrias tend to either have too much alcohol or just be too fruity, & I don't know how they make it here, but man oh man the balance was just perfecto. 

Okay, back to the food. The tuna tartare was okay. My favorite about this plate was the taro chips. Those are some tasty chips. But, I have had better tuna tartare. I am not a dates fan. And although this taste wasn't particularly for me, everyone who enjoys dates in my group loved them. But if you don't like the texture of dates--yeaaaah, don't try this one. The lam chops were okay in my opinion. I've had better lam chops as well. Not sure if it was the texture, the taste, or just both but the sautéed lentils & julienne vegetables were just not doing it for me. The star of all these plates were the mussels. Be warned, this is not a tapas plate. They are very generous in portions with their mussels, but it is nothing to complain about. The sauce just had my taste buds exploding with flavor. This is a must-have for mussel lovers. 

I would compare Firefly to Cheesecake Factory, but a more elevated version. I would've been happy with just the mussels & the sangria all night long. For a group of 17, I did expect a bit of better service, but I guess we can't have it all now can we? 

Eat on.

This is the best tapas restaurant that I've ever visited. Every dish is perfect. Standouts include the mac 'n' cheese, the empanada, the stuffed dates, and the stuffed mushrooms. They also serve a killer red sangria.

The prices are a steal, ranging from $6 to $13 per dish; the entrees cost more but are still very reasonable. While the restaurant is located off the strip, it's just a short taxi ride away. And the restaurant itself is roomy with a charming ambiance. My husband and I make an effort to visit every time we go to Vegas.

I came here for dinner on a date. I have to say, Firefly have crazy good food, excellent service, awesome alcoholic beverage. One of the best in Vegas, and we've eaten at what were claimed to be the best.

Their signature dates dish is genuinely one of the best things I've ever had the pleasure to taste. The artichoke hearts on toast was amazing too. The dishes are small, so you'll be ordering multiple items to be satisfied, and it's definitely worth it to leave satisfied. We did try the shrimp ceviche and weren't great fans. It would probably be better to shoot for something else. Our server, Carlos, was excellent. We'll most certainly be dreaming about those dates until we're able to make it back
We came on a Friday night. It was a Latin night. We both ordered the spicy beef salad. The beef was seasoned well and the dressing was amazing! I couldn't enough!

I've wanted to come here for awhile, but for some reason it took me three years to make it in. It won't be another three years before I return. The food and service were great when I dined here for lunch last week.

There wasn't a wait for a table when we arrived for lunch on a weekday. I'm sure evenings and weekends are a different story. The ambiance of the restaurant is cozy and I could see this being a great spot for a date night. Our waiter was great about refilling drinks, checking in frequently, and getting food to us as soon as it was ready. There weren't any delays in getting additional orders placed. 

I really enjoyed every item that we ordered. The menu offered a nice variety of dishes so everyone will find something they are sure to enjoy. All of the plates had a lot of flavor and I was impressed with everything I ate.

Roasted Beet & Persimmon Salad- the largest serving of the items we ordered, several really great flavors that came together well, loved the pecan crusted goat cheese and beets
Stuffed Dates- my favorite tapas I tried, bursting with flavor and the texture was perfect
Padron Peppers- one of my favorite pepper dishes I've tried, salty in a good way
Empanada- serving includes two empanadas, the outer pastry was delicious and the sauce on top was great too
Chicken & Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms- simple, but delicious
Manchego Mac-N-Cheese- addicting, this was really yummy and was tastier with each bite, one of the heartier tapas options
Warm Persimmon Cake- yummy, a moist bread pudding with delicious raisin gelato on top, a delicious dessert for sure

I'll definitely return and bring my husband for a nice date night!
One of the most reasonably priced restaurants you will find anywhere near the strip. Great variety and great service!
Firefly is an absolute must if you like tapas. Perfect setting for groups, dates, or just flying solo and the food/drinks are out of this world. You can't go wrong here so make sure to check it out!
Excellent place to have some delicious tapas!  I love coming here with a few friends and ordering a bunch of items to share.  Order a pitcher of their yummy mojitos to drink with your food.
I've had the tuna tar tar, ribeye steak, chicken skewers, steak skewers, ribs, must have mac n cheese, dates, meatballs, and a few others. All were fantastic! Everyone loves their food.
Went with family and ordered a variety of tapas. You can't go wrong with any of the tapas. This place is amazeballs. Chicken tinga empanada for the win.

I have been coming to firefly since the old location down the street. I have not been back to the new location in a few years but it didn't disappoint. Everything was good and quality was also good. The paella is amazing and worth the wait since it is made to order. Prices have stayed the same over the years but noticed that sangria pitches got smaller and more expensive. Best to come during happy hour for 1/2 prices.

The happy hour is fantastic! The mojitos were "Bomb- tasting". If you have 3 or more people - buy a pitcher!!! The dates, Chicken skewer and pork empanadas were so tasty. The parking lot had a security guard so I felt my car was safe. The staff were friendly and the restrooms were clean! I am definitely coming back!!!

I'm from out of town and I went to Firefly on behalf of a friend. Let me say, hands down, one of the best spots in Las Vegas. The service was impeccable, the food was beyond words and the sangria... Wow. Not only was the atmosphere amazing along with its food and drinks but it's priced at a perfect amount. Such a special place off the Strip. Carlos, the owner came to our table, introduced himself and even sent us an exquisite dessert platter. I was in Heaven. Thank you Carlos and to your whole team at Firefly. I will be coming back and bringing more guests!!!

Amazing experience.  I have to go to vegas every year for a work conference, and Firefly will definitely be on the list of must-visit restaurants, for me, right there next to Nobu in terms of awesomeness.

We tried about 15 dishes, the sangria, and cocktails.  All were quite amazing, especially the food.

From the ahi tuna skewers, to the manchego mac and cheese, to the petit filet, lamb chops, and much much more, it was all rememberable and amazing.

The most enjoyable  dishes for me were tuna tartare, the manchego mac and cheese, ahi tuna skewers, and the flan :)

Lastly, value wise, it is extremely affordable.  We went with 5 people and were shocked when the bill came because we thought we would have done much more damage.

Can't wait to go back.

This is a great restaurant to dine or hang out when in Vegas. 

The menu offers a variety of more of the American-Spanish fusion tapas rather than traditional Spanish tapas.

We ordered:
5/5 - Camarones a la diabla (shrimp with firely sweet and spicy sauce)  $10
5/5 - Grilled Scallops $12
4.5/5 - Steamed mussels $9.50
3/5 - Seafood paella $20 45 min. wait so order in advance
5/5 - Large Salad $12

The shrimp and scallops were absolutely flavorful and cooked to perfection.  Even the salad with sun dried tomatoes and roasted peppers was absolutely delicious! 

Since this is a Spanish tapas restaurant, we decided to try their seafood paella. The paella takes 45 minutes to prepare and for most people, that's not a long wait since the times goes by fairly quickly when people are talking and sampling tapas. Nevertheless, it wasn't very authentic so will skip that next time around.

Great service and lively atmosphere. Will definitely return!

Firefly never fails! I've been coming here for years and it is consistent. Service is always good and fast even on busy nights. They have a nice wine list but if you're looking for something on the sweeter side, their pitchers of red and white sangria are infamous. Some of my favorite food items are the apple/Manchengo salad, boquerones, stuffed dates, and chicken skewers. I love that firefly is tapas style because you can try a little bit of everything.
Best Tapas restaurant! Tuna Tartare is my favorite!

Perhaps I just did not order the right thing.   Or maybe because I was not drinking pitchers of sangria like others at my table that I was able to taste what their food really taste like.

SO not impressed... the empanadas taste like the Goya frozen ones that you get from the spanish supermarket.  The fries ehh okay.

Although the location is bigger now it is still to loud for a decent conversation... and again the food was just okay.

So if you want okay food and alcohol go here.  Otherwise there are plenty of delicious places to go in Vegas.

One of our favorite restaurants. We left in 2008 and came back to more Firefly locations. We tried one of the new locations and hated it. We tried it again thinking it was a fluke and it was still terrible. Then the food poisoning happened. and while I would not wish that on any business, it has forced them to close the other locations and focus again on their main one. 

This has allowed them to go back to doing what they did so well before. Although I wish they would bring out the bread, olives and honey almond butter like they used to. Now you have to ask for it. They have some new things on the menu now too like the Chicago beef sandwiches. Their flavors on that one are spot on. (I'm from Chicago, I can say that). The dates are to die for and 

The things have have changed for the not so good are the mushroom tarts, filet sliders (now it's much cheaper meat) and ham and cheese croquets. Those are so bad that the inside is ground down to the consistency of baby food. 

So it's all about knowing what to order.

We needed a late night place to eat dinner after we saw Blue Man Group, and this place fit the bill, as they were open until 1am on a Sunday night. Fresh made tapas, and we ordered enough for the whole table of four. Our server was kind and attentive and plates were cleared quickly. The food was delicious, and we tried a large variety of dishes. Each dish was large enough for everyone at our table of four to get a portion. It makes me want to return for paella. The Red sangria was also delicious. Of note were the empanadas, Albondigas and shrimp diablo(?). Disappointing goat cheese dish. Lots of manchego (sheep cheese) dishes, including their take on a mac and cheese. If you like tapas, and even if you've never tried it, this is a good one to seek out.

Small plates. Yes. Large taste also yes. 

I got the gazpacho. Cold tomato soup. Very different very tasty. 

I got the stuffed peppers. A little spicy but great taste. Fried onion rings on top with cream cheese in the middle. Good combination. 

Congenial atmosphere. Attentive wait staff but not over bearing. 

Recommended.
Oooooooh my god! The food is soooooo good! Atmosphere is great, service is great, food is great what more can you ask for. This spot is a absolute must if your in town.

There is a reason firefly has almost a near perfect rating with over 1k reviews... it is awesome!

Tapas restaurant with a full bar; I can't recommend this place enough for groups. We have been there a couple times before and last night's stellar experience was on par with our other visits.
