Go with a group and order a paella or two (recommend the mixed paella with all the seafood, chicken and chorizo in it for $30ish it is a great deal because it can serve up to 4 people) to start to share as a table (they take 40ish minutes to make, so order it first thing) and then have everyone pick out a plate or two to start with and enjoy! The sangria is pretty good, not the best, but an awesome value at $33/pitcher. Another favorite appetizer of mine is the petite filet, they cook the steak perfectly and the accompaniments and sauce is tasty!

Give firefly a try for your next get together or celebration.

This was my first time at Firefly while visiting Las Vegas and I will definitely be back. The highlight was the Mixed Paella which had seafood l, chorizo sausage and chicken and it was very flavorful and filling. It was enough for our party of four to share. Keep in mind that everything is served tapa style. We also ordered the Red Sangria which was delicious! We got a pitcher of the Sangria at happy hour which ends at 6pm. Some of the other tapas we had were the Scallops Escargot Style, Bacon Wrapped Dates, Calamari and Empanadas with Pork. I can't complain about anything we ordered. Service was excellent and we even got a free photo post card given to us!

We arrived around opening time and made a reservation for an empty restaurant haha.  The server was super nice and answered all our questions.  We still must have ordered wrong or ordered why too much food because half way through the meal I felt super gross and greasy.  Most everything was good but super rich.  We could have gone with less dishes recommended by the server.

I tried Firefly for the first time 6 years ago, and since then, I have always made it a point to visit every time that I am in Vegas because it is my favorite tapas restaurant, better than any others that I have visited (mostly in SoCal), and possibly my favorite restaurant in Vegas thus far (though I have recently found a couple of solid contenders). Anyway, the tapas, the drinks, and the dessert are all fabulous. You really cannot go wrong with whatever you pick, particularly because you can do family style and if a dish is not your favorite, someone else is bound to enjoy it. My favorite items are the stuffed peppers, the patatas bravas, the bacon wrapped dates, and the chocolate tres leches cake. Aside from the food, the ambiance is great, with a bit of a classy romantic flair, the service is good, and the valet parking is free.

Have you ever been hungry after work and gone to a local restaurant you have previously had a great experience with looking to pickup your day, only to be disappointed?

I've been here several times, with pretty good experiences, however this time I ordered take out, and was severely disappointed. To start the food was not ready 20 minutes later when I went to pick it up, the teenaged receptionist seemed out of touch and ambivalent about my order, another inquiry 10 minutes later, and I get "it will be up soon, just waiting for the steak". Another 5 minutes and I ask for the manager seeing it's now been over 35 minutes, and they could have started cooking the food when I arrived and it should be ready by now. Another 10 minutes no manager, but the food comes out and seems to be hot. Get home, food is not to order, despite all the time wasted.

While this used to be a go to place, it seems understaffed, management does not care (half full restaurant btw), and service level sucks (did not even order the paella, which takes 30 minutes). I'm done with this place and would not recommend it (despite previous reviews).

Please see my review record to confirm I'm usually a pretty positive person.

Love the food here . We have been planning to come here for so long and we finally got to try it . All the food and drink selections are amazing ! 
Service was great and we would come back again !

Just come for the vodka infused shots. So good. I can't believe I haven't gone here before.  The food is amazing. You can't go wrong with bacon dates. The beet salad was scrumptious. I love that its off the strip a bit, so it's not too crazy. The garlic butter for the bread is amazing. 
A great date place or after work place to try and share small plates. 

They do like putting blue cheese on everything. Again just come for the vodka infused shots. :)

love everything about this place EXCEPT the music and crowd can be quite loud at times. tapas and sangria's always amount to a great night. love love love that the month of July is half off sangria's.
OMG. This place is rad. Get a little bit of everything--I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu. Good drinks, too!
My friend David obrought me here this place it was amazing irina was our server and the food was so tasty

Must must must stop when you are in Vegas!! I could eat there every night for 2 weeks and never eat the same thing that's how good this menu is. Have been there several times and continue to go back. Friendly staff good service. Don't miss this place!!!!!!!!

OMG ... everything about this place was on point!!

I had bookmarked this for my trip to the Sin City and looking forward to it, so I was concerned that my expectations would be so high that I might be let down.  Um, negative.  We took a cab over to Paradise and have found our new favorite restaurant in Vegas!

From the ambiance, dark and trendy, to the food, rich and delicious, this place did not miss a beat.  The mac n' cheese is a must if you love mac!  And the stuffed dates ... om nom nom.  

We didn't have any issues catching a cab back either, as the hostess station was accommodating with this, too. We will definitely be back!

My boyfriend and I were looking for something a little cheaper than all the fancy and expensive options in the Strip. A friend referred us to this place and I'm glad she did! We came for dinner and luckily had reservations, the place was PACKED. We ordered 4-5 tapas to split. Each was served one at a time and came right on time. Service was exceptional. Only complaint is that it was very loud inside, sort of dark, and the tables are very close together. would definitely recommend to a friend.
The ham and cheese croquetas are delicious!! We go often. Good food and reasonable prices. Their mixed paella is a must try.

Went to Firefly yesterday to celebrate.

The food were delicious but the service was not great. The lady that served us brought us the wrong order, twice. When we told her we didn't order the first one, she gave us an attitude and insisted that we did order it. We originally ordered stuffed mushrooms but changed our order to mushroom tart when she told us that the dish I wanted on the picture was actually the mushroom tart- not the stuffed mushrooms. We ended up with two mushroom dishes. The stuffed mushroom was mediocre but the mushroom tart was superb! I didn't want to make a big deal out of it (although my boyfriend was a little frustrated.) 

Later on, she gave us the wrong order... again. We ordered baked tetilla and got something completely different (I don't remember the name). We couldn't  eat because it was too spicy and frankly, it didn't taste good. My boyfriend was very upset. We ended up paying for food we didn't want and can't even eat because our waitress was not paying attention. She should start writing down the orders and repeating them back to customers to avoid messing up orders in the future. She caused us money that we did not want to spend. 

The garlic bread was chewy, but everything else was great! The baked scallops were delicious. The petite filet was juicy and cooked perfectly (medium rare.) The red sangria and the pina colada were both awsome!

If it wasn't for the messed up orders, I would give this place 5 stars.

Wow! What a fantastic dining experience. We went here for the first time last weekend with my brother and sister-in-law and learned first-hand exactly why it is one of their favorite place to dine in Las Vegas. The food was stellar and the service prompt and friendly. This was my first tapas experience and I fear it may have spoiled me for anywhere else. 

Since there were five of us and we all shared our selections with the rest of the group, I got to taste a wide variety of their menu offerings. It is hard to pick a favorite because everything was delicious, but I think I'd have to go with the stuffed dates if pressed to only pick one. I only had the white sangria but it was so superb I can't imagine the other sangria offerings would not be as well-crafted and delicious as the white.

My wedding party ate here after the wedding and this place knocked it out of the park!  The tapa's plates were nothing short of incredible.  Having 12 different people order different plates made it a smorgasbord of incredible diverse tasting foods.  The tuna tartar with sesame was to die for, smoked salmon on tiny bagels was divine.  I don't think a single plate was over $10.  Service was nothing short of exceptional and very patient with our guests that needed help with the tapas philosophy.  Eat here when in Vegas!!!

I made a last minute decision to come here for dinner before going to see Vegas! The Show everything was really good! I started with the shrimp cieviche followed by the summer vegetables & stuffed mushrooms. I really liked the ambiance too very inviting & seems nice for a date just hanging with friends.

My favorite meal yet in vegas:) I could have thrown a dart blindfolded at the menu and fully trusted that I would receive an interesting and delicious culinary success. 

The meal is well paced and the servers are efficient (you get what you pay for). Only drawback? I was there on a Thursday and it was PACKED and very loud. 

Also, free valet;)

The value for the price we paid was great.  The food is good, maybe slightly above average.  

We ordered calamari, eggplant roll ups, mac and cheese, scallops, ham croquetas, salad.  

The calamari was good, not greasy, rings and tentacles..sauce was served.  The salad was good, but as I write this, I can't remember what was in it so it was not memorable.  But I do remember that I loved the salad dressing (vinaigrette of some sort).  My husband liked the croquetas, but croquetas are not my favorite thing, I'm not fond of the gooey center.  

The scallops had some sort of burnt taste to them.  Kind of reminded me of burnt garlic.  They were cooked well, but ruined by that burnt garlic taste.  Maybe something stuck to the grill and then stuck to the scallops.  I find that inexcusable.  

Eggplant roll ups were quite tasty, I wish the portion was larger, or we ordered another plate.  Eggplant with goat cheese, and very little tomato sauce.  Over all good.

The mac and cheese was made with manchego cheese.  I think manchego is best eaten on its own, or with fruit.  I didn't like the mac and cheese, but I think that's my personal taste and not the dish served here.  I like mac and cheese more traditional and creamy.  Again, just an opinion, not a knock against the restaurant.  

I'd go back to try other dishes, but I think I'm spoiled with previous experiences at other, authentic Spanish Tapas Restaurants.  For example, Emilio's in Hillside, IL.

Firefly is my absolute favorite tapas restaurant in town.  Took my family here while they were in town and they loved they experience just as much as I always do.  We all have our favorite dishes but some of our faves were the ham croquettas, baked Brie, stuffed dates and Serrano sliders.  The sparkling sangria is also fabulous.  Great social restaurant to enjoy small bites with friends, family or a date!
Absolutely amazing food and staff. Been here twice now and will come back every visit to Vegas.

We came here full of expectation, but the whole experience was a disappointment. We were seated at a side table. The place is loud even it wasn't full. The tables are close to each other.
We had a hard time picking and the waiter didn't know what to recommend, felt like he was randomly saying dishes.
We picked a few and they were all pretty tasteless and small portions. None stood out and we were disappointed with the food. 
We had the eggplant with goat cheese, escargot like dish (please stick to escargots, this made no sense), tuna with chips and another I don't even remember. The stars are for the tuna as that was really good but nothing that blew me away.
Won't be back.

So much fun! This was my first time here, and I'm glad my friend made a reservation because this place was packed! I enjoyed the white sangria more than the red, but both were good. I'm told the champagne sangria is great and I will probably get it next time. I came here with my husband and 5 friends, this place is great for a group, because you can try many of there tapas this way. The bacon wrapped dates were my husband's favorite, and the group as a whole. I really loved the apple manchego salad, it was surprising how much I enjoyed it. It was so fresh, crisp, and nutty. I will definitely get it next time. The filet was delicious, I thought the Mac n cheese was just ok. The mushroom pastries were lightly crispy, but the saucy mushrooms on top we're just ok. Calamari good, stuffed peppers yummy. Padron peppers that were flash fried were a table favorite, I thought they were good but I might have enjoyed them more with more lemon. Was impressed with the stuffed mushrooms which was disappointing. The heirloom tomato salad wasn't very good. The butter lettuce, vinagrette, and tomatoes were yummy, but the creamy cheese they slathered on top was just too much. It overwhelmed the dish and ruined it for me. All in all I'm extremely excited to go back. I will definitely be getting Sangria (get the pitcher), filet, apple salad, dates, and stuffed red peppers again. Hopefully I'll leave some room to try some new things and dessert! 
I took away a star because our waitress was kind of snobby, and seemed to be in a "wish I was anywhere but here" kind of mood. I'm assuming because we were in a group, they automatically added gratuity, and I don't think she was very deserving of it. Having been a waitress, I completely understand adding gratuity to parties (I wish they did that when I worked at Applebee's'), but I feel that some waiters take advantage of that and slack on service. I will return though!

This is our go to spot for lunch on this side of town. Love the Apple Manchego Salad! My absolute favorite! Flavors of sour apple and rich cheese blend magnificently, and sliced ever so perfectly. This is a must, EVERY TIME!!!!!!
Some other favorites are the meatballs, the firefly fries, firefly fish sticks, and the lamb chops.
I actually have never had a tapas plate that was bad here. This is great for almost any occasion and any taste bud. Love Firefly!!!!

This was a great choice to dine. The food is great and the staff is attentive and very pleasant. They have really good selections on the menu I don't get back home in Memphis.   The atmosphere and music really enjoyable. I would give it 5 except for noise from patrons; some at the bar are extremely loud and practically screaming. Otherwise, I love this place.

We had a large party that was split into multiple tables. Took a real long time for orders to be taken. Plates were delivered haphazardly. When everyone had been served, I asked where my tapas were?  Turned out they'd been delivered to our other table quite some time prior.  Staff wasn't organized, very loud environment. Food when delivered was good. Pricing good.

Food was amazing and very reasonable. Happy hour from 3-6pm then 11pm-? You can get a pitcher of mojitos for $18... prob 6 drinks worth. Bacon wrapped dates are to die for $4. Tuna tartare was incredible. We came to the restaurant 3 times during our 4 day trip, it was that good. 
The only thing I ordered that didn't blow my mind was the beef salad. It was good, just not on the same level as everything else we ate.  Servers are very attentive and super friendly.

My first impression of he restaurant was the service wasn't to friendly and couldn't  accommodate my request because I'm a vegetarian and I wanted them to hold meat from the dish but he repeatedly told me that it's not good with out meat and I insisted I wanted it made without meat. He finally go if you want it you have it but he's going to be nasty. The garlic shrimp and spicy potatoes and shrimp ceviche were the best thing on the menu. The clams hold the meat were also good. He recommended the mussels with curry sauce so we tried it and sent it back it so gross. It was a Mexican restaurant but the flavor of the food was Asian and Italian ( Diablo shrimp dish ). I probably wouldn't come back here again.

I came here for work, lucky I didn't pay. The food was ok I guess, but it all adds up quickly. It's as its described, tapas, or small plates. Best suited for quick work luncheons,  meetings, or just some side snacks to accompany drinks.

As part of a Bachelorette party package (where the limo takes us to a restaurant and then to a nightclub), we went to Firefly last year in May.  We had 14 girls in our group.  We all ordered different items and we all shared different dishes with one another... the food and service was amazing.  I want to say that nearly every dish out of the 5 that I tried was very good!
One year later, I was craving Firefly again because I had such fond memories of how delicious the food was.  
Once again, I wasn't disappointed.  The food was as good as I remember, the service was great and I believe you get a good deal for your money.

I highly recommend this place.  It's slightly off the Vegas strip, but worth the trip!

Visited while in town for business based on a colleagues recommendation. I'm generally not a fan of Spanish tapas, but was very pleased. Everyone enjoyed and there is certainly something for everyone. Great for a group

** meh**


The good :
- Tapas mean a huge menu with several affordable tasty options
- plenty of bar seating 
- great happy hour menu with affordable options including some of their most popular meals 
- tasty sangria 

The blah:
- wasn't impressed with the bread and almond / mango butter too many flavors on the butter ' the bread was cold and the butter was like marble. Didn't care for this 
- apple salad was the only edible thing but BEWARE a lot of their meals have almonds in it . So like clearly
If you have a nut allergy this isn't for you
- didn't care for the flavor of the dogs wrapped in bacon
- meatballs were forgettable

Even in a place with so many great restaurants, this is a gem. Amazing food. Good service. Bit noisy, but with conversation, no doubt about the food.

Tried:
Albondigas (meatballs): 7/10
Padron peppers: 8/10
Ribs: 9/10
Merguez: 8/10
Chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms
Chicago beef bocadillos

Yes.  This place restored my excitement for Vegas.  I don't gamble.  I don't care for strippers.  I don't care to drink free booze until I black out and wake up with a face tattoo in Thailand.  I just enjoy good food and people.  Wanted to stay off the strip to avoid all the meaninglessness so walked to this tapas place near my hotel. Bellied up to the bar... group to my right were bartenders and waitresses from the strip on their day off, laughing out loud and having a great time .  Guy at my left was a chef grabbing some food before heading to work.  Bam.  You know you got a solid place.  Everything I had was amazing (Stuffed dates, pork empanada, eggplant cannelloni, petite filet).  Bartenders on their game and very attentive.  Just a great place, bottom line.  My new favorite place in Vegas.

Love the ambiance of this place. They always have ample seating throughout the restaurant, bar and patio area. 

Drinks: I would highly recommend there strawberry and watermelon mojitos. May just be some of the best mojitos I've had in a while. I'd skip on the passion fruit option. No Bueno. 

Bacon wrapped Dates are still my favorite plate to get here. It's really a great place with good tasting portions. 

Try the Camarones al Diabla and Ajillo. Can't forget those.

Food good, service good, outside parking lot especially in front, SEVERE safety hazard.

Dark curd, nothing to show a curb there, poor lighting, an overall reflection of a management/owner not really caring about the safety of its customers, a common thread for these owners.

Explains why they have had issues and have had to close a few establishments.  My mother law tripped over the curb and fell, the valet guy could have cared less.  Didn't say anything, didn't offer any help, management has no idea, a total lack of caring otherwise there would be plenty of lighting and a well marked curb just like the north side of the building, well lit with a bright yellow curb.

Like I said the service was good, the food came out fast and all tasted good, just disappointed about the outside and the lack of care for customer safety & if someone does have an issue, oh well not their problem attitude.
Great place, cool vibe delicious food! I will definitely try this place again. Service was great also!

This is my favorite go-to spot in town, whether your starving or just want food to pick at while catching up.. this is where you wanna be! The flavor here is on point  their drinks are so bomb! My favorite is the passion fruit mojito and their red sangria! I always order the petite filet because all the flavors in one dish is to die for! Their firefly fries are one of my favorite, always yummy to have on the table to everyone to pick at.

This place is amazing, small plates of great food to share. A really fun atmosphere and great food. The staff is incredible, the food comes to the table as it is ready, they do a great job of keeping everything straight. They keep the table clear of empty plate and make sure your drinks are always full. All of this at a very reasonable price!! For dessert the chocolate tres leches cake was fantastic.

My 300th review and a local Las Vegas favorite! I have to say I've only ever been to this location and not any of the others in the past, but I've never had any type of problems. This most recent time I came with my boyfriend and parents for an early Father's Day celebration. The location parking kinda sucks which is my only reason for a 4 star rather than 5 since it's so hard to find a spot when it's busy.

This time we ordered quite a few different things. My favorites were the steak and mushroom skewers, stuffed peppers and stuffed mushrooms. Their bacon wrapped dates are also very good. Don't let the word tapas fool you as some of these plates are pretty large portions.

I also have to recommend the red sangria, so good! They don't skimp on the liquor either.

Okay so it wad hard enough going into this place the first time after all the trouble the company had had with the health department , but hey, i try to keep an open mind so we went for it. 

Honestly (surprisingly enough) the food was hands down the saving grace of this place. The stuffed dates were insanely good and everything from fries to steaks was well cooked, expertly seasoned and of decent portion size. 

However, and i wish i knew his name (a big muscular guy, maybe late 20s), the bartender was so incredibly rude--and openly so!-- that instead of moving on to entrees like we wanted to, we cashed out and left. 

I wont go into the drawn out details of it all, but trust me when i say i was shocked how clear he made it to us that our business was neither wanted nor appreciated. Its not like the bar or well was even busy. If it was negligence due to that, i could have understood...

Well, we liked the food so much though that we decided to give it a second chance a couple weeks later. But, when we walked in and saw the same bartender with his signature eye roll and snarky comment as our only greeting, we quickly regretted it and left. 

So then, it really is a shame, because the food is killer. If you decide to go, i recommend getting a table and bypassing the bar. We wont be back though.

Firefly is a great off the strip tapas spot. 

Huge restaurant and very lively. Crowded on a Friday night.

Service was friendly.

Artichoke Toast - $7 - Artichoke was tender and seasoned well. 

Stuffed Dates - $6.50 - Salty bacon and sweet date. Reduction makes it really sweet.

Pulpo Asado - $10 - Octopus was grilled perfectly and really tender. Too much potato mixed in, made it hard to find the octopus. 

Camarones Al Ajillo - $11 - Shrimp were plump and tasty. The lemon garlic sauce resembled something you would find in an asian restaurant. 

Steak and Mushroom Skewers - $11 - The filet was so tender and flavorful. Mushrooms were placed evenly with the steak so each bite was perfect. The garlic butter and parmesan enhanced the steak but did not overpower it. My favorite dish we tried. 

Babyback Ribs - $12 - Ribs were fall off the bone. The mango sauce was good but there was to much and made the ribs so saucy and sweet and hid the pork flavor. 

Chocolate Tres Leches Cake - $7 - Chocolatey and moist cake.

Red Sangria - $8
Blueberry Mojito - $8
The signature drinks they have here. Good but to sweet for me.
I love tapas so I can try everything. This place has fun, noisy atmosphere, good sangria and very good food. Best for a small group
Being a big eater, I thought a tapas restaurant would not be for me.  This worked got me I was way stuffed.
Firefly never disappoints, obsessed with the firefly fries and their chicken salad is one of the best. Nahum was our server he was very kind and attentive.

Firefly has amazing food and great service. Carlos knows exactly what's going on and I recommend you request him as your server if you want to have a great experience. Our favorites were the Firefly fries, tuna tartar, lemon garlic shrimp, and lamb chops. Carlos knew how to provide excellent wine service and never left our glasses empty. The establishment was constantly busy which attests to the quality of service they provide.
the food is so so to bad meat taste so hard and not much foods there no any kind seafoods or wat dislike come here
First time eating here for drinks and dinner. I ordered the seafood paella and it was amazing! Great service and all food was great!

Vacationing in Las Vegas was wonderful especially because we found this great Tapas restaurant. We were a table of 4 and got a seat right away since we got there at 6:30pm on a Saturday. Expect a wait if you go after 6:30pm, but it's worth the wait to get a drink and relax while you wait. We started with a pitcher of Red Sangria, which was able to serve each of us a glass and a half (we ordered a pitcher of White Sangria after that was gone). I'm not sure which I liked better. Both were delicious and the red was a little dryer which was nice since we had it with dinner and it complimented the food nicely. 

We had a friend with us that is allergic to shellfish and made sure we told our server before hand that way the server can tell him if he ordered anything for himself that had shellfish in it and he wasn't aware. 

The dates wrapped in bacon were one of my favorites as well as the tuna tar tar. Yummy! The flavors were like fireworks on my palate exploding with flavor and making me want more. The dishes came out quickly and even after ordering so much our final bill was not as high as we all thought it would be. 4 people ordering dishes like crazy with 2 pitchers of margarita's around $200. 

In my opinion the food was better than our favorite Tapas restaurant in Boston, MA and the prices were a lot better as well. Service was great and ambiance was perfect. With it being so big I thought it would get loud, but you don't notice it when you have good food, pitchers of sangria and wonderful company. Yum!

I ate here twice while visiting Las Vegas, NV. I love the prices. The quality of the food is quite good.  I enjoyed the flamenco paintings on the wall and the atmosphere afforded by pleasant waiters reminding me of southern Spain.  The tapas make me happy. The only thing I would add is some more architecture...as it is, the place is a bit too much of a strip mall in a desert city in the U.S.A..  It needs a bit more stone work, a tighter decor that makes you feel like you are in a tiny alley in a historic town in Andalucia.  Oh well, it's Las Vegas.  Go for the prices and you won't be disappointed by the food.  

I guess the "firefly" lived up to it's name: the place needs to add some fly catchers on the front patio.

Another recommendation to improve this place would be a better beer list.  More microbrews from the United States would be a good addition to the Spanish wine drinks.

Most of the dishes were fine. Not sure why all the 4-5 star reviews. The best thing was probably the stuffed dates. The kitchen forgot our order and we didn't get our food until 40 mins later. That sucked.
Delicious food, good prices, super friendly wait staff and manager. Although, it did take a while to get a bill. Granted we were a large party- but asked to have our checks split before ordering.

I was a little reluctant to try because of the food poisoning fiasco they had at the previous location but have to say was very pleasant. The tapas were very tasty and although I'm a vodka guy the sangria they are famous for was very good. Good job turning things around Firefly!

What makes us go to Firefly in the first place is their spectacular sangria but what keeps us going back are all those bomb tapas. Food & beverage there is on point. Staff could be better at being more available for the tables but hey it was a busy Saturday night so completely understandable as well. Love the ambiance!

Overall food was great! So much different types of food and well we were brought  here by my friend because he LOVES the sangria...and boy he was right!!! I usually get headaches when I drink sangria, but for some reason I didnt get one when I drank it.  My friend also mentioned that their servings were a bit bigger than what it was before thus the priced increased by an average of $1. 

Tried the chicken and mushroom paella, ahi tuna skewer, steak and mushroom skewer, manchego mac n' cheese,  spare ribs,  baked scallops, shrimp tempura, and escargot.  All BOMB.

The service was good... but there were lull times of waiter for the come  but when he did come, he was nothing but polite.
Loved the place. Service was wonderful. Told my son about the place and he was very pleased with the food and service. A little loud for my liking
Muy buena atención y la comida espectacular, el ambiente de poca luz pero muy acogedor
Food was good. We were with a group so it was great to try many types of dishes. The mohitos in a pitcher were terrible. We just sent two pitchers back.

We had a tough day so we treated ourselves to dinner at Firefly and were not disappointed. Our service was impeccable and the food was great. I highly recommend the ribs. They were my favorite. By the time we finished our pitcher of sangria we felt much better.

Firefly is such a cute spot. Very quaint and relaxing. Came around 4PM on a Sunday and got seated very quickly. They give you a choice of sitting at the bar, outside, or inside. 

We chose  to sit outside since it was pretty nice outside considering Vegas never has nice weather lol ((I hate the weather here.)) Outside seating area has fans and light bulbs hanging from the ceiling. 

They start off with bread and almond butter. My expectations were high since all the reviews raved about it, but the bread was pretty hard and didn't taste fresh and the almond butter was a bit too sweet.
 
We ordered firefly fries, calamari, mac n cheese, and the ribs.

When they brought the fries out, my eyes lit up and I swear my pupils turned into hearts. The portions are so big and they put the perfect amount of Parmesan cheese (some places are so stingy with that lol), luvvvvvv fries!!!!!!!!!! You can never have too much fries. If you think otherwise, we can't be friends. Ever.

The mac n cheese was really good at first, very unique flavor. The tomatoes on top make it even more flavorful. However, halfway through I had to stop eating it because it was way too cheesy. It's either that or I was a little tipsy off my red sangria (which is yummy, btw!) 

Calamari, yum! So crispy and well portioned out.

The ribs....... R.I.P to those. They were devoured in about 5 minutes. 

Service: Quick and attentive. 

All in all, would definitely recommend!

Went there with my fiancé, and we both loved it. We probably like the stuffed dates best. Also had the mushroom tartlet, stuffed peppers, and ahi tuna skewers. All were great. They also didn't skimp on the alcohol in the cocktails. We'll be back, as there are a lot of other things we would love to try.

I always order the ceviche whenever I come here, deff my favorite! My fiancé is obsessed with the bread they bring to the table while you wait for your food & I second that! Another item  I would say to not hesitate to order is the white sparkling sangria. Every time I bring friends with me to eat here, we always leave happy with the service :) just a quick tip if you order the ceviche, always ask for extra chips!

Every time I'm in town, I make this a must eat or die place.  I can forgo all the places Hawaii doesn't have to make time for to eat here.  And it's because I'm so in love with this place!  It's perfect for groups or dates because tapas are the best thing ever!  I have tried a lot of things on their menu, but not everything.  I hope to try everything, but there are so many choices!  And of course you have to get your favorites, too.

My go to favorites are the empanadas, baked goat cheese, chorizo clams, to name a few.  I'd probably list all the stuff I've tried, if I could.  But yes, I still have to try all.  Go with a few friends and have each person pick a couple so you can taste a variety.  I mean, hopefully, everyone would pick different items!  And the best thing to drink is the sangria.  Tapas and sangria are so awesome together.  The sangria tastes great and isn't watered down or bitter.  Trust me on this even if you don't care for wine, get the sangria!

Normally it's just a couple of us, so we've never had to wait for a table.  I know if you have a large group, you should make reservations.  There is ample parking and the service is awesome.  Kind of random though, when a person just drops food and takes off.  They normally tell you what it is.  But with me, I normally forget what I've ordered and I'll sit there wondering, did I get this?  But usually it is something I've ordered.  Rarely do I get someone else's order.  Service is always quick and friendly, I just love it!

I can't wait to return to Las Vegas to come back!  I need to try more items!  With Sangria!! Yay!!

Out of every place we've eaten at on our 2 day stay, this has been my favorite. We ordered:
-Ceviche of shrimp
- Stuffed dates
-Tierra y Mar Skewers
- Calamari 
-Scallops escargots 
- chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms 
- Seafood paella 

Everything was delicious. Not a single plate disappointed.

Slightly disappointed because all the publicity took away some of the intimate aspects of the "old" Firefly. Parking was horrid (you can't tell if one side is one-way or not) and the wait was long at the new location when we finally found it! Given that, I still think that this is the best tapas restaurant that I've ever been to. My friends and I have been a regular before it was "popular" and hyped up, and we've always loved the menu items, all the way down to asking for extra bread and that yummy butter! 

Our regular orders would usually consist of the chicken salad (TO DIE FORRRR!!), petit filet, firefly fries, empanadas and the kabobs among other things. I am absolutely in love with the chicken salad and I wish I could make it at home, but ehh. Price is okay, but I wouldn't go regularly--only on special occasions or when the gang gets together for a dinner date. Their dessert items are also very good.  I have never, ever been disappointed by their food! Also, the white sangria is yummy but I gotta say that their pitcher of Strawberry mojito beats the sangria hands down. 

I wish they had a Firefly here where I lived now, that's how awesome this place is (minus the long wait). Last visited August 2013.

If you want the best Bloody Mary's you have ever had in your life, go see Daniel Chino (the Russian) at Firefly. Please don't wear him out though, because he is my favorite Bloody Mary Maker!! Omar is also fantastic...pretty much every bartender here is on point. Become a regular and they will absolutely take care of you. No matter what other Firefly establishments may have done, this place is by far on point. I love their Happy Hour, I love their appetizers, I love it all. Come here over and over and over!

I've heard about firefly & its previous demerits with the health district which is why I was reluctant to go at first...but I'm so glad I changed my mind! Coming in at around 10pm, our small party didn't end till around 1am. This is definitely the place to not only eat, but get a good conversation in. 

TAPAS are amazing. Our group ordered several small plates to try it all out! Our dishes included machego Mac n cheese, stuffed peppers, Apple & machego salad, firefly fries, camarones a la Diabla, etc. 

I don't eat bacon, but many others have loved the bacon wrapped dates (I wanna say it's called chorizo or something). 

It was all so good my mouth continues to water. The apple and machego salad was different; definitely worth trying! The camarones a la Diabla were fancy, loved the sauce/dressing. I could go on and on about the stuffed peppers and the garlic cream cheese that was stuffed inside...but even then no justice would be served. 

For dessert, us 4 girls ordered the dessert platter and that was more than enough to try their best sweet items. Flan was definitely the best! 

Bottom Line: TRY what you can. It's delicious. It can get ridiculously busy, but they are open late.

Nice place for Tapas!!  Easy & convenient to make reservations online.
Lots of parking behind the restaurant!
Great place to get-together with friends...

Fantastic tapas, great service, delicious drinks and a cool atmosphere. I am definitely coming back here. I would recommend the blueberry as well as the original mojitos. As I said, all the tapas were delicious but the Tierra y mar skewers take the cake. These were my favorite! The salsa verde ties the flavors of the filet, shrimp and chorizo together. I could simply go there and just order these and the mojitos and be a happy camper.

Arrived when they were opening.  Odd, funky smell from old mop water thankfully dissipated before food arrived.  

Bartender spent too much time talking with her boyfriend, so drinks took Way Too Long to be delivered, and we were sitting next to the bar.  

Waiter and back waiter were friendly and attentive. Small plates were hit and miss, but I would give it another try.

Great find off the Strip! Came here with a group of 9 to celebrate my friend's birthday. The tapas style worked perfectly for our large party, and we all got to sample a variety of dishes: ceviche, tuna tartare, patatas bravas, pork empanada, chicken empanada, fish sticks, fried calamari, pulpo asado (octopus), steamed mussels, scallop "escargots", steak and mushroom skewers, lamb chops, and seafood paella. We also ordered pitchers of both red and white sangria. Everything was delicious and there wasn't anything I didn't like! Some plates do only come with a few pieces, so we did order doubles. 

The service was attentive the whole night, with our waiter checking up on us regularly and our waters refilled. We brought a cake in, and they helped us cut and serve it for dessert. Price was extremely reasonable, unlike some other restaurants in Vegas. In terms of atmosphere, there was some dim mood lighting, Spanish decor and art, and the space is pretty big. We got seated in a sort of private booth which was kinda cool. Will definitely come back the next time I'm in town!

I had the bacon wrapped dates, scallops escargot, steak skewer, and manchego Mac n cheese. It was all good, but nothing made me overly excited. I would love to come back again with my husband or friends because the atmosphere is nice and we could all share.

This location is working hard for your business! The servings are generous for tapas! The mojitos and sangria are excellent!
I highly recommend all of their dishes as I've tried almost all of them!

Don't forget to use your bread to soak up the tasty sauces from the plates!

Nahum in an awesome server! Thank you!

love love love coming here!! firefly is always a favorite when I come down by the strip. the tapas are a great price and SO yummy. my favorites are the apple manchego salad and the stuffed dates. their mojitos are bomb too. Daniel was my bartender today and he was awesome! He even invited us back for their Sunday brunch :)
Service on slow side on busy Friday night, but food was fantastic! Everything I tried was very, very good!

Came here for my bachelorette dinner and had a fantastic experience. Our server Mario was very attentive and helpful with the menu. The manager came over at one point to ensure we were enjoying ourselves and had a round of drinks sent over to us. The food and sangria was also excellent, I highly enjoyed the bacon wrapped dates. Thank you Firefly for a memorable dinner
I come here often when in Vegas. The food is great service is fast and though I have not had the drinks here they look delicious and I will definitely try next time.

Food was delicious, as always but the service was NOT good. Our waitress was named Rachael I think? Something like that, idk. Took 10 minutes to even come to the table. My boyfriend and I side tipped the busser. He did all the work. If I didn't LOVE Firefly, you can bet I'd never go there again.

When the most recent health inspection debacle revealed the same offenses (food handling, contamination, hand washing) as inspections in the past, it sent a message. It was a blatant disregard for the public's health and safety. It stung more because I was very adamant about forgiveness and continued to patronize their restaurants after the salmonella incident. I've never had a food poisoning issue, but now it felt like a gamble to dine with them. I've made a choice to not support a business that has repeated offenses of this nature (regardless of what they claim is not their fault) based on principle.

My recent visit was prompted by the celebration of a good friend's graduation. We joined her and her family on their vacation to Las Vegas (I had forewarned them about the events). In any case, our dining experience was mostly pleasant and I was admitedly excited to eat some of my favorite dishes again. 

The hostess was kind enough to accomodate our large group in one of their semi-private dining booths/tables with drapes (although these proved difficult for the servers and bussers since they had to constantly move them to reach the table). Everyone was really friendly, but service was just okay. Several times we were searching for our server or anyone to come to our aid or just replenish water.

The food was still as delicious as I remember. My favorites being the Stuffed Dates, Firefly Fries, Paella (mixed), and Pork Empanada. The only disappointment was the Tuna Tartare, which was also an old favorite. But overall, I enjoyed my meal. Also, I really liked the Chocolate Tres Leches Cake.

So, the food is still good and service is okay. Doesn't change how I feel about the business and their owners. Dine at your own risk.

SO in love with Firefly! 

I know this place catches a lot of crap for it's mistakes in the past BUT Firefly is actually one of the better restaurants in Las Vegas these days (in my book). 

I love the atmosphere and energy at Firefly; the service is always great and the food comes out quick. I take newbies to Firefly all the time and it really is because the food is so creative, flavorful, and impressive. 
I have a ton of favs at Firefly that I typically order but am never disappointed when trying something new (lots of options on the menu). 

*Things to note
-Infused potato vodka with lychees and berries..YUM. 
-Pitchers of Sangria are perfect for a group. 
-Manchango & apple salad- looks plain but full of flavor. 
-Any of the empanadas are delightful. 
-Salmon bagels are excellent 
-All the skewers are tasty, especially the shrimp and ahi. 
-Tomato basil soup with the little sandwich is great comfort food
-BACON WRAPPED DATES are a must-do. 
-Flour-less chocolate cake 
 And I have yet to try stuff off the brunch menu but will sooner than later (especially the lemon blueberry pancakes).  
-Unlimited mimosas and bloody's on Sunday for $20

Great food, friendly staff, they know the menu well, all of the drinks and food they suggested was awesome. Great for a group of people willing to share. New place to visit every time I come to Vegas.
Good food. Good atmosphere. Good service. The tapas are the best. I would go back and eat here every night if I could...

It seems to be that everywhere you go, tapas is the hot new topic. Small plates are awesome. You can have as many plates as you want, and variety makes us all happy. You don't have to order 1 dish and be stuck with it. If you order one wrong dish, you at least have 3 other ones that are good. Tapas is shareable, and at one sitting, you can easily have tried 10 different dishes. For those saving money or not too hungry, its a good way to save money and just get snacking items. It doesn't seem like tapas is going away anytime soon. Firefly in Las Vegas, not too far from the strip. They have some of the best tapas in Vegas, and the atmosphere is very relaxing. Stumbling upon this spot, I could only wishttp://www.dinedelish.com/wp-admin/edit.phph it were on the strip, inside the comforts of a resort.

Their stuffed dates were on point. Wrapped in bacon, the salty and the sweet was working perfectly together. Also stuffed with smoked almonds, it gave it a nice nutty flavor as well as a good crunch. A sprinkle of blue cheese made everything round out nicely. When you are talking about tapas, stuffed dates is automatically in the conversation. The ones at Firefly were nothing short or spectacular. The red wine reduction was a nice touch to the stuffed dates. This is a must order when you are at Firefly.

The filet minon sliders were surprisingly tasty. Topped with blue cheese and fried onion straws, the sliders were rich. The fried onions gave it a good crunch, and the cheese is what gave it a nice flavor. If the cheese didn't do it in the flavor department, their south western style sauce topped it all off. With filet minon being the patty, you know it was going to be soft and juicy. The patty had a nice crust on the outside, and the inside was juicy and not dry at all. This was a perfect little slider combination.

My favorite was the tierra y mar skewers. Skewers with grilled shrimp, filet minon, and chorizo sausage was a perfect trifecta of flavors and textures. Drizzled with a nice salsa verde on top, each bite was perfectly different on its own. The filet minon was uber tender and though it didn't have a lot of fat, it contained so much flavor. The shrimp was grilled to a nice crisp and was a match made in heaven when eaten with the chorizo. Everything seemed to work together in this -- as if the shrimp had the beef's back, and the chorizo had the shrimp's back. Obviously, pork chorizo sausage can hold its own. This is a must order. Maybe a double up would help so that you can have your own plate.

Firefly was awesome. Despite not being on the strip, it isn't that bad. Basically a block behind the strip, it isn't too far off. The food is done right and the tapas allowed me to snack on the cheap. Yes. All that was a snack, not lunch. All kidding aside, Firefly is the place to be if you want small plates. I went during the day so it was quite mellow. I'm sure it gets somewhat rowdy at night as it turns into a lounge after hours. Either way, you will get your tapas the most delicious way possible.

Bacon wrapped dates - were just ok I've had better and the peanut inside threw me for a loop thought I was chewing on a bone 

Mussels- were very good! Tangy and perfectly sauced 

Tierra y mar skewers - amazing steak cooked to perfection flavors meld together with the green salsa 

Grilled scallops - not too great had a very fishy taste to them which seeped into the potatoes when your food all taste the same as the main part of the meal it's no bueno.

Only came here for desserts, which was pretty good but the service was awful. Two servers went to the table next to us and asked if this was their order, they said no and we said we think it's ours over and over again. The servers immediately got confused and nervous. Finally, he put in on our table and I think he thumbed one of our desserts.

On the tab:
Banana-nutella Sandwiches
Dessert Platter

Yum to both. Enough said

this is my go to spot... I used to go to the Sahara location every week until they shut down... Now my only option is the Paradise location... Luckily I work at the Howard Hughes Center across the street. I'm not being paid attention to by the waitress at the bar... I asked for a menu so clearly that means I want to order food, but she has yet asked to take my order, and she's standing right in front of me!!! I'm a bit disappointed. It's now been 30mins...It's happy hour but she isn't busy... How do I know this? Because Im sitting at the bar and she's standing right in front of me looking cute and doing nothing. I'm going to pay for my one drink (even tho I want several more as well as food) and I'm going to leave to go somewhere else. Very sad. Smh
Great for a large party. Good food, loved the dates, sangria, everything we had was really good!  Days later our group still talked about our experience there!

We came here almost every night during our stay in Vegas and the food was absolutely amazing every time. There wasn't any dish that we did not like (and we tried a lot of them). The staff is very friendly and attentive and even on the most busiest nights dining here we seemed to have gotten all our food VERY fast! They waste absolutely no time when it comes to customer service. Well done!

Sangria, Sangria!

Along with many of the other places, Firefly is bomb.com!  Definitely a place you can come with a party...to party.  With awesome food, service and ambiance, a good time is to be had!

No matter how many people you come with, you can expect them to enjoy their experience.  Don't worry about ordering, everyone can order something different and pass the plates around.  A favorite of mine is patatas bravas, veggie empanada, firefly fries, and mac n cheese.  That mac n cheese I won't share.  Get your own, you won't regret it. Along with the food, the drinks are tasty too.  Can't go wrong with sangria.  Red sangria is really good.  If you plan to have more than 1 drink, order a pitcher.

Service here, I hate to say, could be better.  My friends and I were seated right away, but service after that was slowww. And we were sitting at the bar, where someone is always there.  We ordered through someone other than our waiter, because he was a lil too busy.  But other than that, I enjoyed myself.

Fridays at 10:30pm is Latin night.  Salsa! So much fun.  I love watching the really experienced dancers.  The fluidity of their movements is amazing.  Some of them incorporating flips and special turns in their routines.  And they all switch partners.  Don't be surprised if someone come to you while your dancing.

I use to frequent the old location on Paradise quite a bit but had not been to the new location yet...I like it much better.  The space is bigger and every area feels much more open.  I didn't have any food at this last visit but we did have a couple of pitchers or Sparkling Sangria, still my favorite.  The ambience is great, love the music they play and will go back soon to have some bacon wrapped dates which are exquisite from what I remember.

I haven't given five stars to any restaurant. Ever. This place is fantastic! Especially for the price.

I sat at the bar and my waiter was so attentive, friendly, helpful, and knew the menu well. I went solely off his recommendations. When he found out it was my first time there, he was very welcoming and enthusiastic.

I had the stuffed dates...amazing. It's a small plate, but I guarantee you won't want to share! I also had the petit fillet, which melted in my mouth. I was bummed that I didn't have more people with me so that we could try more food....but those two small plates filled me up!

I will DEFINITELY be back! 

PS If you have more than one in your party, best to make a reservation...it was packed!

Gross... I saw my server outside smoking and walked straight back into the kitchen... I 
Watched him take plates to be served out to the main room without washing... Good food is one thing, bad cleanliness is another.
Beyond excellent!  Everything was delicious and eye candy as well.   Lamb chops were remarkable as was the Pulpo. I can't wait to go again!

Firefly man I love this place. Food orgy time yet again.  I discovered it via a friends recommendation last time I was in vegas and now it is an essential part to any great vegas vacation. First time to the new location which is a stones throw from the old location. I like the larger size but miss some of the character of the old building. 

They have a great mojito and a even better happy hour M-F 3-6. Unfortunately the happy hour is only for drinks. I also enjoyed one of my favorite craft beers rouge hazelnut its only 3$ during happy hour.

We brought a few friends along and stayed for several drinks and hours. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip. The standouts wrrr the majitos we had both a pitcher and a few extra glasses. It is a little better in a glass the flavors are better proportioned. The sliders and dates were my two favorite dishes. I really enjoyed the shrimp, empanadas, stuffed mushrooms and firefly fishsticks. The only dish I would pass on was the scallop as they were rather fishy. 

I feel the best way to experience firefly is with good service,  friends, drinks and great food.

This place is awesome. We had reservations for a Monday night and were promptly seated and asked what we wanted to drink. I had an amazing ginger pear martini that was out or this world, and my date had a mojito that was also impressive. I was disappointed that they ran out of pear purée for a second ginger pear martini, but ended up having a mojito myself.

The food here is some of my favorite in Vegas. Favorites included the plate of Serano ham and Manchego cheese, steak and mushroom skewers, and lamb chops. Also good was the veggie empanadas, grilled scallops, and the chorizo plate. 

The atmosphere is good, always have pretty decent customer service, and the plates are priced well considering the quality. You will need a few plates per person so it can add up, but you definitely get what you pay for. Most people I know really like this place. I did come here in summer 2013 and it definitely improved from the first visit. I would come back again no doubt.

I absolutely love this place! We celebrated my birthday here a couple nights ago and everything was so delicious! Some of my favorites are: manchego salad, bacon wrapped dates, camarones a la diabla and you have to have the tres leches for dessert!
Amazing food!!! Came here on a Monday night date night and couldn't be more happier that we chose this place! The ambience is great and the food is delicious! Yum yum!

I loved the food! Portions are bigger then what you expect from tapas and the flavor was truly Southern Spanish. They are open late, until 2am with excellent happy hour prices for a few good tapas 11pm to close. An awesome place to recover after the strip ;)

Firefly has a lot of potential, but is short on the customer service. I made a reservation for 7:00pm and received a phone call that if I was not in the restaurant by 7:02, my reservation would be given away. Well, good thing I like to be on time. In fact, my husband and I were at the restaurant by 6:45pm. We were then told that we had to wait until closer to 7 to be seated. Understandable. Until I noticed about two to three parties without reservations being seated before us. What's the point of making a reservation??? At 7:02, when we were walked to our table, we passed about 10 empty ones...um, ok. The three stars is for the food. It's good. Service, not so much.

Awesome food and better service! Just happened to stop by because it was close to our hotel and so glad we did! My wife and I both had the petite filet and it was better than some of the five star places we went. The scallops were also awesome! Very cool atmosphere it is a little loud though. We didn't mind, just wanted to mention that it isn't the best place for a quiet date. You can find people dressed up for a bachelor/bachelorette party or just in jeans. Cool place with great food and service!

Two stars for service. 

Food: Fried calamari - too salty; Eggplant cannelloni - too bland filled with coagulated, low quality goat cheese; Seafood paella - more like rubber disguised as seafood - was overcooked beyond belief; Chocolate tres leches - cake on top of melted ice cream it seemed

Atmosphere: not a great date place unless you want to exercise your vocal chords via yelling at your date. Excellent bar atmosphere, chill and great customer service. Overall appearance of the restaurant is great.

Best thing they can do for this place, re-train their cooks or fire the ones they have. They need new cooks. 

Overall, take your money elsewhere, this is VEGAS. You will find better.
Food was delicious and they had a lot of vegetarian options as well. Very quick and friendly service! A very good experience overall

Amazing service. Great food, get the stuffed dates it is divine. I had my food in less then 20 minutes. Food came out perfect as ordered. Server was polite and had my drink put within 2 minuted. Would come back again any day!!! Love it here great atmosphere!!

Everything here is great. I had a fillet of beef dish (small plate) it was perfect. The red sangria was amazing. The bacon wrapped dates were great. The French fries and the apple and manchego salad, and the ribs... better than most places that claim to specialize in ribs. Fall off the bone in a mango BBQ sauce that was not too sweet, just right

Finish with the desert platter... 

It's great, one of my new favorite spots

The first time I visited Firefly was in 2013 for a wedding reception and I had the best time munching on the bacon wrapped dates and downing mojitos.  So when I was planning my high school's 20th reunion, I immediately thought of Firefly, a hip, super fun place to have a great dinner and hang out with friends.

From the initial email I sent Regina with Banquets to payment at the event, the whole deal went without a glitch.  Communication with Regina was a breeze and she answered all of my emails quickly.  Our group was small (under 50) and from out of town so naturally many of them were skeptical with the salmonella incidence and health inspection violations and closures at their other locations.  But I kept close communication with Regina and paid attention to the REPUTABLE recent reviews of Firefly on Yelp.  

The affordable all you can eat banquet menu included their starter, a choice of 6 tapas, and "chocolate" tres leches cake for only $30 per person.  Out of their extensive selection, I chose the most popular based on yelp reviews:  artichoke toasts, stuffed dates, baby back ribs, patatas bravas, steak skewers, and camarones a la diable.  We decided on a cash bar that they set up in our private room and we added on unlimited soft drinks for $2.50 per person.  The room charge was $200 with a minimum $1000 food and beverage.  

Our room was set up with one row of tables which initially seemed a little crowded, but turned out fine.  Our crowd mingled for about 20 minutes before I asked when the food would be served and they told me as soon as we were seated.  We sat down and like magic, the food was ushered in by the trays.  As expected the dates were a favorite, but people seemed to love the artichoke toasts, ribs and shrimp as well.  

They are located minutes from the strip and parking in their lot was plentiful.  Our group had a great time and having it at Firefly was awesome.  Highly recommend Firefly for your banquet.  Excellent service from start to finish.

I had an amazing time here! Came with friends before I left on a trip and their happy hour is the best time for an afternoon pick me up. I had a server by the name of Carlos who couldn't not have been more amazing! Got an amazing goupon deal so it worked out well with their happy hour and food. Would come back here again! Especially for the mojitos! Yum!
shared a few small plates, the food was great, the white sangria amazing, the date was aweful. lol Thank God the restaurant was fantastic

Great spot! Portions are larger than your average tapas that's for sure. I was starving and got full 3 tapas. The Ahi Tuna, Shrimp Diablo, and Grilled Octopus were delicious! I had about 6 cocktails and they were all amazing! 

The food comes out super fast! We got our dishes delivered no longer than ten minutes after we ordered and it was made freshly. 

Good for dates, group dinners, and parties/celebrations.
Amazing bacon wrapped dates... And finished with chocolate and curry bread pudding. Great service, very friendly and attentive.

I'd always been a fan of this place.  We didn't get food poisoning. =D  I love the new location, bigger, cleaner, and nicer!  I'm so happy they opened a new restaurant and closed the other one.  Must try their sangria if you haven't yet.  Everything they serve is so tasty.
The ambience was good but really noisy. The food was definitely tasty but the quantity was not at all sufficient for a meal. We had to order atleast 2 plates per person. I liked their berries drink

I work in fine dining and am a self-proclaimed foody, so I'm not ignorant when it comes to judging food. Everything was delicious, the sauces that complimented every dish were excellent, and flavors were layered expertly. 
The stuffed dates (wrapped in bacon) were exceptional. 

Service was professional and attentive. Atmosphere was both casual and classy. A very nice experience.
A must on every Vegas trip. We ordered the shrimp, bacon dates, beef salad, escargot & more shrimp & sangrias. Dinner w/ drinks around $70 not bad for the taste and selection.
Awesome girls night out or celebratory dinner spot! Food was AMAZING. Very small tapas portions.. I could've eaten 5 by myself easily lol. I'll definitely be back!

Read great reviews about this place but wasn't so impressed. This could be because it was not very crowded night given the off season. Tapas were good. If you're thinking of ordering entrees, the her roasted chicken is really good and flavorful (decent quantity too).

I had higher expectations of this place and was a little disappointed with the dishes we ordered.  The Garbanzo Beans with spices and the shells still on them confused me, I wasn't sure how to eat this....chew and spit out the shell?  We did order a spicy shrimp dish that was the most simple of all the dishes and yet the best it had nice flavor combinations.  The Red Bell pepper dish that was stuffed with Manchego cheese was tasty but I think just going the chille Relleno route would have made this dish better it was too tart with the bell pepper.  Than there was the Clams in a tasty broth with chunks of sausage in it, that was really good just a tab bit too much sausage flavor as it took away from the clams having any flavor at all.   We also ordered a Safron type of rice that was wayyyyyy to overpowering that flavor was stuck in my mouth all night.  I'm thinking we ordered wrong and there was possibly way better dishes on the menu than what we choose.   I would give this place a 2nd chance but probably at a different location.

This restaurant is awesome! Great place to eat and have drinks. They have a beautiful bar with a vast array of liquor to suit any taste and seats plenty! The substance of the food menu is filled with flavor and caters to a wide range of vivid tastes, and the price is excellent for such high quality food! Totally recommend for anyone looking for a great meal and cool atmosphere,  perfect for friends, family or dates!

Probably my favorite place in Vegas! I love their mojitos and sangria! I must order one of these drinks whenever I visit or else it isn't really a complete firefly visit. 

I have tried most of their small plates but I think my favorite would have to be the dates! They taste almost like candy! They are a must try when you visit!

I also really like the eggplant with goat cheese. I mean, who doesn't like goat cheese?! It tastes like heaven.

The fries are always a good option especially with a larger party. 

The escargot scallops are also divine. It's not actually escargot just cooked in an escargot tray. It's made with lemon butter and garlic sauce. Need I say anything more?

The dessert platter is also a must try. So many desserts on one tray-trust me you'll love it! The dolce de leche cake is out of this world!

Another great experience at fireflies. Pepe and Vanessa were on point with service, and the food was amazing. One of the best spots to eat in Vegas, hands down. I recommend the pitcher of sangria and anything else on the menu.

Just a short walk from the strip and so worth it!! Tapas were amazing as was the sangria. The best thing on the menu though was the bacon wrapped dates in red wine reduction sauce. I discovered this place on one of Rachael Rays episodes!!!!
Oh dear! The Gazpacho! The Mac & Cheese! The Flan! The Passion - Fruit Cheesecake! Yum! But really the Stuffed Peppers are to melt for. Whoa! Oh, and the Sangria...... delicious.

Always a great experience coming here. Food and service is excellent. I don't think I've ever ordered anything that I wasn't pleased with. That being said, I have a particular fondness to the tuna tartare, tuna skewers, tres leches cake, and especially the chocolate cherry bread pudding (warm with a generous serving of ice cream on the top). 

The ambiance is really lovely as well. You wouldn't be out of place dressed up or down (as with most LV places). Prices are very reasonable. I think each individual plate is good for two people to share and feel satisfied with the amount tasted. If you have three or more, you might want to order doubles of some plates to make sure everyone gets a decent amount. The two of us order four to five plates, plus one dessert (and you get some delicious free bread), and leave feeling well-satisfied.

Firefly is a more than competent tapas place with a lot going for it.  The decor is comfortable but perhaps a bit dark - nothing special.  And the service is friendly and very prompt, maybe even too prompt; if you want your dinner paced, you will have to do it yourself (see hint below).

But in every other respect, Firefly excels.

Every item on the menu that we tried was very good to excellent.  No misses at all, and some were really outstanding, most notably the baked goat cheese and (believe it or not) the Chicago beef bocadillos.  The San Gria was above average too.

The menu is large and has a wide variety of selections.  You will want to order 20 or so, but two per person is enough for an average appetite.

The prices are quite reasonable, with a typical plate being well under $10.

Go hungry.  

HINTS:
1.  Reservations are really necessary.
2.  From the time you order to the time you get your food will vary from a few minutes to about ten.  Each plate will be brought separately, so you really need to share.  
3.  To pace your meal, order one or two dishes, sit around eating and talking, and when you are ready, order a couple more.  They are fine with you doing this.
Great food. Loved the atmosphere. THE SERVICE was fantastic. Highly recommend. The shrip with diablo sauce was amazing. The mussle sauces was good. The clams were very good.
Great off strip tapas restaurant. Solid food, great service and a good location. Great spot for lunch.

Great sangria and great happy hour! We came here with a large group of friends and were accommodated quickly. We were over 15 and I was surprised with the quality of service we received. We did not wait a lot for our food or  drinks. Everyone on the table each ordered different things and the food came promptly. 

I ordered the empanadas (delicious), fries (big basket!), Mac and cheese, croquetas and chocolate tres leches cake. All the food that we ordered was great. The only one I did not love was the Mac and cheese. It tasted fine but not something I would order again. My personal favorite was the empanadas. The dessert was also very tasty and could be shared with 2 people. 

Like I mentioned, the sangria here is really good. We ordered pitchers for the table. They have 3 options but I only tried the red sangria. This is a place I would definitely come back to especially during happy hour.

We never miss a chance to have dinner.  This trip we took granddaughters age 9 and 14 and they loved it too.  The menu has the best Tapas selections we have experienced.  Great Mojitos.  The staff members are friendly and knowledgable.  The manager Carlos makes the whole experience a must stop in Vegas and everyone we've sent from Arizona considers it a must stop for Vegas visits.
Food is awesome...and the Sangria is the best I've had in a long time. This is a total hidden gem being a couple of blocks off the strip. Payless, get better food and drinks!

I cannot believe that I have not left a review for Firefly yet! I have been coming to Firefly for over 6 years now and always have a great experience. The food, the ambiance, and the service are consistently excellent! This is the restaurant I always recommend for people new to Vegas, and so far everyone has thanked me for this recommendation. 
As for what to order...I always get a pitcher of red sangria, to share of course. They start you off with complimentary bread and sweet almond butter, which surpasses any other buttery spread I've had. Most of the menu is tapas style which makes the meal even more enjoyable because it is possible to have a little taste of everything if you want. My absolute favorite dishes are the artichoke toasts and the vegan "crab cakes." YES, they are VEGAN FRIENDLY here! Lately, I've been getting their veggie paella. It's delicious, huge, and contains the most perfectly cooked artichokes within it. Back when I did eat meat, their stuffed dates, sliders, and fish sticks were my top picks. For dessert, you can't go wrong with the Nutella sandwiches or chocolate cherry bread pudding. 
Do yourself a favor, and give Firefly a try if you haven't yet. You can thank me later!

Sat At the bar and Omg the stuffed dates were the most amazing thing I have tasted in a while!  Service was great and the cucumber Mojito was so refreshing :).  Definitely coming back on my next trip.  Plus it was easy parking and not to far off the strip.

Went for a late b day  dinner. Being my first tapas spot it was amazing. The stuffed dates are to die for, l could eat a whole table full. It Has a great scenery and awesome vibe. Service was AMAZING. Had our food in a matter of minutes. And they brought me a b day desert that was really a great added touch. The white sangria was spot on as well

Firefly moved to a new location but everything I said in my previous review http://www.yelp.com/biz/firefly-las-vegas-3 still applies. They're still located on Paradise but they have moved to a bigger and better spot.  This place has a bigger outdoor patio and is large enough inside for big groups.

While they have moved on to bigger and better digs, this didn't change their attention to detail when it comes to food or service. My only problem was that I came alone and since it is a tapas place I wasn't able to sample as many items as I wish I could.

Firefly is bigger and better than ever and definite worth a visit if you're in Vegas, it's a little off the strip but well worth it.

Not bad for a tapas place I guess. We got a seafood paella, stuffed peppers, potatas bravas, empanadas, and stuffed eggplant to share. The paella was quite delicious; good flavor and a lot of food. The tapas were just okay, nothing to rave about. Prices were fair (paella was $26 for 2-4 people, which isn't bad at all), though tapas were on the pricier side. I would give this place 3.5 stars for the food, will bump up for good service.

So good! Went there because it was within walking distance of my hotel. Ordered way too much food, the sizes were very generous. Had a pitcher of very delicious sangria. Service was stellar & I would come back again.

Best restaurant in Vegas! Our service was spectacular and so generous! Went for my sister's birthday and they gave her a free drink. She couldn't have been happier!! The food was absolutely delectable. Every single item on the menu that we ordered (we ordered a lot) was better than the last! Thanks Firefly for making my sister's 21st her best birthday to date!

Overrated.  Went here for dinner on 10/30/13.

I had a few things, including the mushroom tart - tart was cold, but mushrooms were warm.  When food is not served at the right temperature, then I'm over it.

The garlic cream cheese stuffed peppers sounded better on paper than they did on the plate.  The cream cheese completely separates from the pepper when you cut into it.  No bueno!

The best part of my meal is the garlic bread and sweet butter.  That was good!

Restaurant is dark and very large.  Self-parking in the back.  I was put off by the large number of kitchen workers taking their break outside of the restaurant that backs into the parking.  I also didn't like seeing the numerous servers inside the restaurant all chatting with one another waiting for something to do.

Hype wasn't real. 

The food here is supposed to be Spanish (fusion) but a lot more like American. I tried several dishes and they were all just ok... Nothing stood out. The sangria was grossly watered down. 

You would enjoy coming here with a large party for drinking purpose because it's more like a quantity over quality place. 

If you are looking for real Spanish tapas in LV, Jaleo at Cosmopolitan is the better option. Don't be fooled by the stars on Yelp.....They are fake anyway.
I like it. Good selection of tapas and everything I've tried is very good. They currently have half off sangria. $3.5 per glass!!

Delicious food for a really reasonable price! I love coming here with friends. It's such a cool atmosphere and the service is usually great. Get the pitcher of red sangria! It's nice and refreshing and a bit strong. I was feeling it after the first glass lol my favorites here are the stuffed dates and the chorizo clams. We ordered all sorts of different plates and a mixed paella. Everything came out accordingly so we always had food on the table while waiting for the paella (they let you know it's gonna take about 30 minutes.) They also gladly brought us more bread and butter when we asked for more. The paella and the mushroom puff pastry was a bit too rich for my liking but it was still good. We had a great time here. We left feeling super full, satisfied, and a little tipsy ;)

I LOVE this place.... it's a MUST GO to when I come to Vegas.  This time I brought my girlfriends and we really went to town!!  We came here to eat an early dinner before our show.  Ordered about 12 dishes to share among 4 of us.  We could've done with just 10 as the meat dishes were huge!!  But we managed to eat everything plus down a pitcher of white Sangria which is a MUST!!  so light and refreshing!!

Food came out pretty steadily...  We started with the Apple and Manchego salad! SO GOOD - slivers of refreshing green apples and manchego cheese (which is light and not over whelming) along with chopped smoked almonds to give that extra crunch!

We then got the warm spinach salad - WOW!  So MUCH - perfect for four of us - very lightly dressed - loved the artichoke hearts and feta that came with it!!

We loved EVERYTHING we ordered.... their tuna tartare with bits of fresh avocado to be enjoyed with crispy taro chips!  WE LOVED their Veggie Empanada... I actually wished I could've eaten a whole one myself!  The crust was crunchy - with warm fresh veggies - SO MOUTHWATERING GOOD!! Then there's the mushrooms that were stuffed with chicken, chorizo and cheese!! so good... then you can never go wrong with their fried calamari!! :)  A nice surprise was the octopus!  had a bit of a bite - spice but the octopus was SO tender... grilled to perfection!!  Loved their lamb chops (we had to order 2 as each order comes with 2 lamb chop).  Had SO much lentils... was crazy - that's the one thing we couldn't finish... OH and their ribs - scrape off the bone deliciousness!!  OH and the other nice surprise was the Shrimp with the sweet and sour sauce... shrimp cooked perfectly but that SAUCE.. yes - wipe clean with the bread goodness and even dipping our calamari in the sauce was AWESOME....

Overall we had a GREAT time - rolled out of there... the one thing about service which was frustrating was we needed our bill so we can run to our show...  the waiter forgot and I had to chase him down after 10 minutes... UGH...  but other than that - great and fun place to get a variety of tasty tapas and DELICIOUS refreshing drinks!!  A MUST GO to place when visiting Vegas!

Nice atmosphere. Excellent customer service. Its a Tapas Bar...small portions appetizers. Just a handfull of full dish/menu. Ordered the beef skewer...wow tasty. The hubby ordered the petite sirloin.he was happy with his choice.

Just FYI: on the pricey end...but its worth it...at least for me

The sangria is excellent!  Get the pitcher. Everything we ordered was fabulous.  Service was also great.  You will enjoy.  Shrimp, ceviche, octopus oh yeah and the dates wrapped in bacon are awesome!!!
Disappointed. After reading the reviews it was a let down. Food was just ok and service was poor. I would suggest going to a different  place.
Found the place a few years ago and every time we go to Vegas we always stop and enjoy some lunch and sangria! We usually order 4 plates and share, the staff is always very pleasant!

This place is worth checking out. It provides a comforting & spacious atmosphere plus delicious tapas & sangria. Come with a group and order many items collectively so that everyone can try a multitude of dishes (as one would at a dim sum restaurant). I recommend the bacon wrapped dates, shrimp diablo, lamb, skewers with filet mignon/shrimp/ chorizo, fries, octopus/potato dish, mac n cheese, and of course the red sangria :) Service was good. Expect around a total of $30/person in order to leave very satisfied.

Came here during the week and had great service all around. The host and our waiter had great customer service and anyone who dropped food off at our table were very friendly. The food is amazing and the atmosphere is fantastic!! It's been a while since my husband and I have been down here so when we went it was the exact same delicious food! Can't wait to come back again real soon!!

This place gets a big thumbs up from me! A great place to share food with a group of friends. Just to name a few, we got the bacon wrapped dates, tuna tartare, mac & cheese, and more! The tuna tartare came with taro chips, which were very light and complimented the raw tuna perfectly.
