I was hesitant about trying the bacon wrapped dates, but it was one of my favorite dishes of the night. The saltiness from the bacon paired well with the sweet juicy dates. Firefly is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas!!

Perfect late night meal. Every bite was flavorful yet light. The ribs were perfectly cooked and the steak and mushroom skewers were melt in your mouth. We also ordered the Serrano ham and manchego cheese plate, empanada, fries and calamari and have no complaints. Everything was perfect.

What a nice change of pace! I was visiting  head for work and getting tired of eating on the Strip. The reviews don't lie....this place is phenomenal! 

A local eatery with delicious food and even better prices! There were four of us dining and we all got 2-3 tapas each and it was more than enough! 

Enjoy!

My first love for tapas started here in 2009, at the other location where it was always crowded and there was no place to walk. The old location was much more entertaining.

The food was great. Their butter is so good I can eat a whole tub of it. My husband still loves this place and like Pinball HF we come here every visit to LV. 

I don't like this place much anymore because I have had better. They lost their touch. The warm salad is just warm lemon juice on greens. So plain. Should change up the menu, or go back to the old menu. Tapas is an adventure to me but Firefly decided to get married. 

Four stars because he loves it and I think it's ok. Worth a try. All our friends now love this place. 

They use to give out really cute matchboxes but not anymore. Boo.
Excellent experience. First time doing the Tapas thing and was not disappointed. The food and drinks were perfect and I would highly recommend it.

I really don't get the rave reviews about this place. To me the food was mediocre at best and way overpriced!  I tried a couple of the tapas including the steak and mushroom skewers, Mac and cheese, this baked egg thing and the stuffed mushrooms. Each dish was tapas sized and looked pretty but it didn't taste that great to me at all. 

The Mac and cheese was not bad. Very creamy rather than cheesy actually, but it wasn't special or great. The beef skewers were wayyyyy saucy. The whole plate was covered in 3 types of sauce. Although presented nicely as the sauce made pretty patterns, the skewers weren't that flavorful and the beef was chewy!  The egg thing was a super disappointment. It had the same roasted red pepper garnish as the Mac and cheese and beef skewers ( how lame.. Same garnish for all your dishes?) with a piece of potato inside?  It was very flavorless. The stuffed mushrooms were ok. I've had better. The mushrooms were good.. the chicken paste they stuffed it with was kind of weird. 

It's a nice big place with nice outdoor seating and a full bar. Service was good, ambiance was good, parking was good. Everything was pretty great except the food haha. I will not come here again unless someone chooses to eat here for their birthday. :(.

This was our first time here and we came as a party of 3. We ordered the mixed paella, and it was fantastic! The paella was more than enough for the 3 of us. I also ordered the sangria, and it was very good. The waiters were very attentive and friendly. The customer service was excellent. The atmosphere was nice but there was loud music playing so it was hard to make conversation. Nonetheless, I would highly recommend this restaurant.
Really good sangria; food is really good. Nice venue for a party or a small social gathering with friends.

Great food. Good selection but not too much. I had friends from out of town and they really enjoyed trying and sharing everything. No one was disappointed with their selections. Service was impeccable. Will definitely go again.

Now my new favorite place to eat!!!
Ordered a few items and all were/are AMAZING! Ambience and service were just as amazing as the food. 
I can't recommend a favorite dish because they were all equally delish! We ordered the Lamb chops, Smoked salmon bagel, Goat cheese toast, Skewers (Fillet, mignon, shrimp, chorizo), Mushroom tartar, and spicy calamari...can't recall if we ordered more. MUST TRY!

They lose a star for the service we received from our waiter, Ivan. He was disengaged, unfriendly, and seemed annoyed which put a damper on our reunion with our friends.
The drinks were high priced and not good. No one liked their drinks. The pear ginger martinis were syrupy sweet. We asked for spicy margaritas and there was no heat at all.
BUT, the food was AMAZING. Huge selection of delectable tapas. The croquettes were delicious and everyone's favorite. The stuffed dates were little flavor bombs. The clams with chorizo were amazing. We asked for more bread THREE TIMES to sop up the sauce and never got it. Eggplant around goat cheese was delish. Chicken tinca empanadas were good. Our least favorites were the stuffed piquillo peppers and chorizo stuffed mushrooms (which needed a sauce).
I would come again for the food but if we got service like we did last night again, I would never come back.

Our review looks like most of the other 163 not recommended ones hidden at the back section. Ready, hit and miss has become more on the miss side. This trip was special as we drove over for wife's birthday. We come to LV every month and eat here every time. It was @ 10:00 pm and we were seated next to 2 tables of 2. Our server a Ukrainian girl came over after say "15 minutes" and took our drink order. Never told us her name, failed to describe sangria, left to get drinks. About that time both couples on each side told us here is where the fun starts. Twenty minutes later she returned with one of the two drinks. She said I'll be right back. I said wait we want to order!  She took our order and again split. Now 40 minutes into this celebration she returns with the drink. I asked how do we get bread ?  One of the bus boys brings out "cold hard bread". What seamed like days, our food comes out and she drops and tried to split. I ask her if we could have warm bread. She can only give us what is ready in the kitchen. I explained we have dined here at least 35 times and have never been told that. A busboy returned with warm bread. She never came back to see if everything was ok, if we wanted to order anything else, or need another drink. We had dessert and left thinking do we ever want to return again! Walked into dark scary parking lot in back to find our six week old car smashed in the back and broken tail light. Go ahead hide us in the back so no one can see us.  Just like you will never see us again.

Last minute decided to try this place out with my boyfriend and our friend. The service was great, super nice waiter. Ordered our foods and drinks and it was out pretty quick. It was all so delicious! Especially loved the stuffed dates. Going to be back when I'm in town.

Firefly had amazing food and great cocktails. My favorite dish was the bacon wrapped stuffed dates. The bread and butter they bring out to your table is amazing as well as the stuffed peppers. The service was great, it was a little loud, but not too bad. I would definitely come back for tapas.
Omg food was seriously DELICIOUS! Great Service, outdoor patio was spacious and nicely lit. Sangria was definitely a 10. Definitely a place to try if you want to share and try different flavors!

I was skeptical to come back here, but my friend was insistent on getting tapas. I thought the food was okay, but it wasn't mind-numbingly amazing and mouth watering.

AMBIANCE: 4 - I'm not gonna deny that this is a really nice venue. It is dimly lit with very organized tables inside. Also, they let you sit wherever you want to. With the dim lights, and sitting with my best friend "alone" in the lounge--it was pretty romantic haha! The whole place is very lounge-like, and actually pretty comfortable. 

SERVICE: 3 - As with many places, the service was pretty good in the beginning, and got slower and worse towards the end! Most of the food came out fast, but some of them came out an hour later than the rest! 

FOOD: 3 - I don't have any food that I really want to shine a light on. None of it really popped out at me or was really amazing that it was worth mentioning. Probably the best part of the meal was my strawberry mojito, which was pretty well done! 

I'm going to say this as a generalization, because this happened with all the dishes we ordered. The food taste was average to above average. But, with every dish there was major problems such as really dry meat, it sometimes tasted off or not right, or the cheese that they used wasn't as luxurious tasting compared to the rest of the dish. 

In conclusion, it was good, but it wasn't great. 

Lastly, I don't wanna be one of those people, but I think I should mention this anyway..My friend and I both got stomach aches not long after we ate. I had never eaten there since 2010 or 2011 and my friend had never eaten at Firefly previously. 

My real complaint is that they should have kept the Firefly on the west side open instead of this one!

I absolutely love this place and I always come here. Whenever friends are in town or I am trying to impress a friend with a Vegas local hot spot, this is my go-to place. 
My favorites include:
Apple and manchego salad
Tuna Tartare
Stuffed Dates
Scallop / Excargots
Petite Filet
Last time we visited we ventured out of the comfort zone and ordered some plates for the very first time. My new favorite is actually the Herb-roasted chicken. It is so juicy and flavorful. So many restaurants miss on chicken but this just hit the spot. It also comes with delicious crispy fries and it is very filling.

I was dreaming of their Paella since ordering in on my birthday in May and I ordered it again this time but something went terribly wrong. It was super salty and I could taste the rice distinctively as though it was not flavored well. I advised the waiter who alerted the chef. The manager was very kind. He came to our table and apologized and took the Paella off our bill. We would have loved to order one more but we had already waited 40 minutes for this one to cook and had a place to go after so we decided to pass. I love how they handled the situation. We are still loyal and will be back in the future for sure!

We also ordered their sangria pitcher and that was wonderful. It is very smooth and fruity, I think it is perfect for a light weight but only if you are sharing ;)

Overall, besides the wonderful food, the decor is beautiful with slight dim lighting. The noise level is a little higher if you sit inside but they also have outside seating with beautiful lights. It is all very fresh and exciting.

This was an excellent tapas option, with reasonable prices and delicious food. Additionally, they have a fairly extensive gluten free menu, which was an added bonus for our party. The atmosphere was great for a dinner before a night out on the town. Must-try dishes include the ever-classic bacon wrapped dates, the ahi tuna skewers, and the ribeye. Additionally, I didn't try the paella, but the sangria was decent.

Have not been here since they moved from a block away. Big n spacious, with a valet that has a sh*ty attitude. Even if i ask what you perceive to be a stupid question. ..you should still be pleasant in your response. Since i hadn't been to the new location,  and the lighting is dark the place looked closed, and the valets were just setting up their stand, so i asked if the bar was open. Response with tude was "i guess, it should  be". Anyway, didn't eat,  just stopped by for drink and see the decor. Good for drinks. And self park your car!!

This place is my go-to when I'm in Vegas. I've also eaten at fancy places on the Strip, but I'll take Firefly over them! I've only had their tapas, drinks, and Big Bowl salad, but everything has been amazing. For tapas, I've tried: mushroom tart, chicken skewers, petite filet, stuffed dates, ham croquetas, apple and manchego salad, garden variety salad. Each dish has been beautifully presented with a tantalizing combination of flavors. Their sangria and Fly Mule are awesome too! Really, I don't think you can go wrong with anything here. I'll try their paella sometime, but can't seem to get away from the tapas!

We were a party of six celebrating a friend birthday and we didn't mention to any one that we are celebrating a birthday..but they still manage to bring a cake just because they overheard us and this is going above and beyond the duty and we really appreciated it.besids the food you can't go wrong with any on the entree. 
Love this place
What a pleasant surprise.  Food, service and ambience were well above average. I can't believe locals won't swamp this place.  Tourists are lucky to find it.

This is my third Firefly review and of course third times a charm! I cannot find anything wrong with this concept. Tapas options are spectacular chilled, hot, seafood, meat and poultry. I haven't tried dessert because I'm usually full by then, but I can only imagine they are inspired.

Portions are a steal with prices ranging with smaller tapas $4 to hearty paellas $20. And believe me, you'll want to share that paella!! It's a lively place that I always think of going with a large group. But I must note, this new bar is large and the separation from the restaurant makes it comfortable to kick back with their sangria on your own as well.

The staff is friendly and attentive. The bartender is knowledgeable & smiles. And now this new space is bright, clean and inviting. I'm glad to see them bouncing back from the bad press they received from the shutdown.

After all, mistakes happen, and we all deserve a second chance! Wait to go Firefly! I'll see you again very soon I'm sure.

Love the new location on Paradise... as much as I enjoyed the original, they had outgrown it and were in desperate need of a larger space. The parking is not great in the back of the building, but outside of that this is a huge improvement. They fit plenty of seating and you don't feel like you are right on top of the people next to you as you were in the previous location.

Love that they have a full size bar now with plenty of seating. Food was as good as always... I have a very hard time not ordering the Serrano Sliders every time I go to Firefly. It's pretty sad actually.

Wish them luck with the new location and hope they learned their lesson and continue to monitor their staff/food more closely moving forward.

Absolutely the greatest tapas restaurant for locals! Great Latin nights every Friday! Food comes in small tapas portions and it comes out pretty fast! Paella is to die for, just keep in mind it takes about 30-45 minutes to be made! Stuff is super friendly end it is a must visit destination when you come to Vegas!!

This is one of my favorite places, delicious and quick service. Must try the Apple
Manchego salad it it amazing!

We flew in & were looking for something little to eat. We found this place & were excited to try it after reading the reviews ESP about the stuffed dates! We sat down & I bet it took a server ten mins to greet us. We were not only ready with our drink order, but our food order. I had their house infused vodka martini & my husband a Moscow mule. Mine was watered down, remade (I mean stirred as the server said) & then it tasted like cough medicine. My husbands mule he said was good. We ordered the stuffed dates, stuffed peppers, flashed fried patron peppers, roasted pork Empanada, & scallops escargot. The stuffed dates were fine, but not amazing along with everything else except the stuffed peppers....they were good! So I would not go back, but at the end of things they did take off my martini even without asking. I like that, that's the way you want a restaurant to do business! Of course we never did figure out who our server was...we saw three & never one consistently.

If you like Spanish cuisine. This is a must try in your list. 
They have tapas which are small plates or shareable appetizer. They have seafood paella. It takes 45 minutes to make because it made to order. So super fresh. 
I haven't been here since they got in trouble back in 2012. They used to have several location. 
I miss going to the one in Fort Apache and Sahara. Wish they would open one in centennial hills we need more options in the hills.

Great sangrias! Great vibe. 

This is a great place to get away from The Strip. It's got a mix of locals and travelers. It's more laid back and not crazy feeling. So I like the vibe. It feels like a not-so-crazy Happy Hour. The lamb chops were good. Paella was average. For a Spanish-style place, I expected better paella. Bacon wrapped dates were great (but isn't bacon wrapped anything)?! I love their sangria.

I came here on my last visit to Vegas with pretty high expectations given the 4.5 star rating, reviews, and photos. I love tapas so I was excited to give this place a try! I will say that half the tapas we ordered were pretty good and the other half just didn't do it for me.

Here is what we ordered:

Chicken Skewers $8.50 - These were served cold and the meat was dry. I did like the garlic cream sauce so that saved this tapa even though I was disappointed with the cold meat.

Shrimp Ceviche $9.50 - The presentation wasn't all that but the taste was fresh, lemony, and delicious. I was surprised since it didn't look like it would have much flavor (see pic)

Tierra y Mar Skewers $11 - Thank you for serving up a nice piece of tender filet mignon as it should be. The shrimp and chorizo added a nice flavor to this skewer along with the salsa verde.

Apple & Manchego salad $6.50 - I love manchego cheese and apples but this salad definitely lacked flavor, nothing too special about. It was missing something but if you like manchego and apples that's exactly what this tapa is about. 

Albondigas $7 - If you like Chef Boyardee then you will like these meatballs because that's exactly what they taste like. I wasn't too fond of the flavor and it was a disappointment.

They do serve complimentary garlic bread with a sweet almond butter. This was definitely addicting stuff! It was sooooo good we ordered another round.

My girlfriend ordered the Sangria and had to send it back because it was overly sweet. Our waiter was very kind about replacing her drink. So just FYI the sangria is pretty sweet!

Overall this place has reasonable prices but the tapas could be hit or miss. I'm glad I could check this place out!
Yum! My favorite late night stop. Firefly never fails at making me happy! Food is flavorful, drinks are perfectly balanced and the ambiance of the restaurant is sexy. Happy hour is also great.

We have been wanting to try this place the last couple times we've come out to Vegas..   We had three adult diners. Really wanted to like this place but we all came away thinking it was just OK. Very noisy. Could not really even converse with one another. Our waiter, Ivan, the hostess, the manager and the rest of the staff were great, very professional. The food was not bad, nor was the pitcher of sangria. Its just that nothing was great

My husband and I visited here last night. The entire experience from beginning to end was perfect. The girls at the front desk were polite and helpful, the waitress, other servers and manager were incredibly attentive. Drinks were lush, especially my cocktail. I cant remember the name of it but it had mezcal and kahlua in it. The food was incredible; tasty combinations and huge portions. We shared 7 plates between us, not anticipating the size but demolished the lot. The stuffed dates and the roasted heirloom carrots are a must. The petite filet and the chicken skewers were also awesome. We cannot wait to go back and try more of the menu.

Some of the best in Town! I could eat the bacon wrapped dates all day! I love the selection at Firefly, but the amount of delicious food makes it difficult to not order the same things every time I go back. The lamb chops were perfect and they had skewers with shrimp/filet that were packed with flavor! I also recommend the tomato soup, which is served with Fireflies take on a grilled cheese sandwich. It brings back childhood memories in a classy way. Firefly is a great place for a date, night out with the girls, or celebration with friends. The atmosphere varies from fun to romantic,and that's what makes it such a classy place to be! I'm a wine drinker, but I will say that their white and red sangrias are both delicious

Omg amazing customer service and amazing food!!! Great portions! Everything on the menu was so amazing!!!! Definitely coming back and the music was great amazing ambiance. Definitely a long wait but totally worth it!
Food was amazing and the music was great. I would recommend this place to who ever loves a friendly and happy atmosphere.
My favorite Vegas brunch joint!! Everything is soooo good! The paella is to die for!!
Fantastic! Went for lunch, can't wait to go back for dinner. Service, atmosphere, and of course the food were all top notch.

I've had Firefly bookmarked for some time now and I was finally able to check it out this past weekend for my Birthday.

I made a reservation for 8 people and when we got there, we were seated right away. Although, I would have preferred to be seated in the main dinning room, we were sat in the room adjacent to the bar. Our server greeted us right away and offered up his suggestions on drinks. We opted for the pitcher of Watermelon Mojitos. It was so refreshing and tasted great!

We knew that we wanted to try the Mixed Paella so we put in an order right away since it takes about 40 min to make. 

Here's a breakdown of what our table ordered:

Mixed Paella

Chorizo Plate

Serrano Ham & Manchego Cheese

Stuffed Dates

Camarones a la Diabla

Chicken & Chorizo Stuffed Mushrooms

Babyback Ribs 

Chicken Tinga Empanandas

Stuffed Peppers

Tierra y Mar Skewers

Everything tasted amazing but my top 3 favorite dishes of the night hands down had to be the Stuffed Dates, Mixed Paella & Camarones a la Diabla! The stuffed dates were so good, we ended up ordering 2 more orders of them! We just couldn't get enough of their goodness! 

Only complaint of the night was that the room we were seated in was extremely hot. It started to get uncomfortable in there. 

All in all, I would highly recommend dining at Firefly next time you are in the Las Vegas area. You will not be disappointed!

Met some friends here for a birthday party...she loves it here...I came for the company.

First of all, parking is retarded here.  If you don't care about people parking your car, DO THE FREE VALET.  I drove my boat back there trying to find a parking space, and I couldn't find ONE space I felt comfortable leaving my car.  I ended up parking in the hotel parking lot next door and walked over after leaving the frustration known as Firefly's parking lot.

I wanted the Firefly fries that I've grown to enjoy...They come with Parmesan, Herbs, and an Aioli for $6.  Since I knew I was gonna order another plate or two in addition to the fries, I decided just to spend the money for the steak and fries :P

14oz Ribeye ($20): Red Wine Sauce, Cabrales Bleu Cheese, Firefly Fries and Aioli. Surprisingly large ribeye for the money! It was a good steak, cooked perfectly, but the sauce/seasoning was a little distracting. Still good though!

However, the fries were undercooked and stupid oily.  Like "dripping off your fingers" OILY.  I should have returned them, but my steak was cooked perfectly, and I thought it was a waste to turn over the plate.  They probably would have just brought me a new side of fries, but that's in hindsight. 

So you can still get a decent value at Firefly...just factor in bad parking and a hint of inconsistency and you'll probably be fine!

Pics :
Great menu, especially the vegan / vegetarian one! Great service, tasty food.

Great menu! Lots of vegetarian options.  My husband had scallop "escargot" which he said was delish- and it sure did smell it.  He lived his tuna kabobs too.  They had a lot going on that looked really good.  I had veggie empanada.  Amazing!  And I was pretty full after that! But I still had veggie "crab cakes" and OMG I need to learn how to make them! So good! We had a blueberry mule and amaze balls!!

My (now) husband and I had our reception dinner at Firefly and I cannot say enough great things about it.

We planned our entire wedding from across the country, so we put our trust in the 5-star yelp reviews Firefly already had. We were a little nervous booking a dinner for over 30 guests having never tried the food, but in this case, the reviews were absolutely right.

HUGE shout out to Fernanda! She totally put us at ease, helped us make our reservation, choose our menu, answer any questions, and everything in between. She was super helpful, got back to us quickly, and adjusted the contract to our needs. We wound up having a few more guests than we originally anticipated, and they were more than accommodating. 

When we arrived for dinner, they had a private room set up for us. Fernanda was actually there with Regina and Neo; they all took really amazing care of us the entire night. Every single tapa was top notch and the drinks were amazing (sangria and mojitos were especially fantastic). People are still raving about how great the food was, even the few picky eaters we had with us. My sister, who doesn't eat seafood, actually came up and went "OMG did you try the shrimp?!". That says a lot! Firefly also allowed us to bring in our own cake (they recommended an amazing bakery, Freed's), set up a table for it, and brought it to the back to cut and serve all the guests. Everyone's drinks were full all night and we all left extremely satisfied.

I want to come back to Vegas just to come back to Firefly! It was the best meal we had our entire trip and the staff is amazing.

Excellent food and service!

Visited this place based on the reviews on Yelp and I wasn't disappointed. The service was quick and the food was great.

We were coming out for a late dinner tonight and knew the restaurant would be closing at 2pm. As a courtesy to the restaurant, we called an hour ahead and told them we'd be arriving at 1:30, and asked if they would mind seating us and taking an immediate order. They said it was fine. So we drive across the city, excited to eat at one of our favorite restaurants, only to find out that they would not seat us once we arrived (30 minutes before closing time). We informed the hostess that we called and she said it was her that we talked to, to confirm the reservation. She then went on to to explain that they decided to close early because they changed their mind. They did not bother to call us back. They were unapologetic, and could care less that two loyal customers had just driven across the city to eat there. It felt like they just spit in our face. I'm familiar with the restaurant business so I know it's not just the hostesses fault, but management is to blame. I'm disgusted that any restaurant would do that to someone. SHAME ON YOU FIREFLY. I'll be leaving this review on every outpost and review site that i can find. Hope it was worth it.

Amazing ... A culinary orgy for the palette ... The tag team style service keeps the food coming including killer Garlic bread almond butter and homemade green olives ... We ordered bacon wrapped dates with an almond inside (awesome), fish sticks (mediocre) ... The mushroom tort, stuffed peppers, chicken and pork empanadas were epic ... I LOVE this place ... A must return for me ...

GREAT Spanish joint in Vegas!!! Authentic Spaniard food and LOVE the ambience. Make sure to order the sangria pitcher and the Spanish sausage. ALWAYS busy during dinner time. GREAT crowd and chic too!!

The chef is amazing, the tapas and drinks are wonderful! Specifically the mango mojito, cucumber martini, chicken empanada, apple and manchego salad, garden variety salad, lambchops, andtomato soup. The dessert platter was great as well!

This restaurant has some extremely good tapas.  It is a smaller restaurant and can get quite crowded, but it is worth it.  The food and drinks are so delicious.  I don't think I've tried anything that I didn't like.  The staff is very friendly and attentive.  Nice environment.

I went with a party of 8 during their happy hour last Friday night. (Monday-Friday from 3PM-6PM). We had an excellent server named Pepe, who I will likely request again in the future. He always had a smile on his face and was very attentive given the size of our group and that it was a busy Friday night. I have a shrimp allergy and when I was disappointed that I couldn't try the tierra del mar skewers, Pepe offered to make one of the three skewers all beef so that way I could have some. It came out on a completely separate dish which makes my allergies happy. This was also great for my boyfriend since he loves shrimp but usually doesn't get to order it due to my allergy. We also ordered their truffle fries and albondigas (a staple every time we visit) as they never disappoint! We then tried the ham and cheese croquetas which were great but were just very small - 3 pieces each about 2 inches in size. I probably will not get those again. Lastly, we enjoyed 4 pitchers of the red sangria, half priced during happy hour. The sangria is, and has been, the reason I keep going back and back!

Came here for a CES networking event and was blown away with the food! We had stuffed dates, garlic chicken skewers, ham and cheese croquettes, and paella. They also passed artichoke crostini and tomato chutney toast. It was all amazing! My favorite was the dates stuffed with an almond, rolled in bacon and cooked with a red wine reduction, melted in my mouth with a little crunch from the almond. I would recommend this place to anyone. Exceptional for sharing as the plates are all served tapas style.
The Best bartenders in las vegas and great service aways ..red Sangria always a great start to drink .. Ask for karen as your fav bartender
Excellent small plates. We had baked cod, lamb chops, vegetable empanadas and tomato soup. Everything was great. Great service at 1:15am too. Lots of music outside with dancing. Fun place!

Mmm first night in Vegas my cousin took me here. We got a lot of plates which are small, so it's easy to share and get a lot ! We got goat cheese which was  hot n delicious !  Scallops in garlic sauce, pork empanadas, ceviche and the apple salad are all a must !!! The cocktails are pretty good ! I forgot the name of the drink but one had a shot of Jalapeño juice !! Mmmm!!

This is a MUST try restaurant when visiting Las Vegas! They have a live salsa band and a dance floor of to the side of the restaurant. The restaurants looks and feels sexy inside with the decor.

They had a long list of tapas categorized by proteins an also had paella's to share. My friend and I started our food adventure with the tomato soup and mini grilled brie sandwich ($7.5). the brie threw us off because were expecting the traditional grilled cheese flavor, yet it was good. The ahi tuna skewers ($10)were also a big hit with us; mango, basil, ginger-soy glaze, house pickles, and salsa verde is what this dish was mixed with. At this point with the, skewers, the soup and the complimentary bread they gave us we were getting a bit full, so we decided to share the delicious ribeye. A 14oz. ribeye with Firefly fries, aioli, red wine sauce and cabrales bleu cheese cooked medium rare ($29) was just the right thing to have. The meat and the pitcher of red wine sangria ($31) were complimenting each other perfectly.

If your into salsa dancing and great food, this is the spot to go. A lot of attractive people were around and both the restaurant and dance area are open late and is not too far off the strip.

We went to this restaurant with a large group.  We ordered the sangria and a bunch of tapas to share. The sangria was actually sweeter than I usually like it. The vegetarian paella was to die for!!!!!! The spice was one of the best I have recently tasted. 
The patty as bravas were spicier than I have had, or am used to and were not my favorite. The stuffed mushrooms and empanadas were good also!  Tortilla espanola was an average tortilla. 
Overall the restaurant had a really fun environment and was super crowded. I can see why so many people like this restaurant and continue to come visit!

Came here with the family for New Years dinner in Las Vegas.
Food was delicious and plentiful! Something for everyone. Been to the one in Sherman Oaks, CA and both are awesome spots for dinner or just drinks. 5 stars!

Favorite restaurant in Vegas. I come here every time I'm in Las Vegas. They have something for everybody. Mojitos are excellent. Toast with garlic butter is delicious. The shrimp ceviche is my most favorite dish. I love their atmosphere, there service, and their food. Everything about Firefly's is AMAZING!

Had a great time here, the food is awesome we had the apple salad, the dates, and the paella. We drank red sangria. The mood is very red and romantic but seems like a fun place for all kinds of "night out" type events, a good mix of local and tourists

Got here for the first time with my girlfriend. 
The best thing I can say about the place is the service. 
If you come here for a date I suggest don't. It is very loud. 
We ordered the fried calamari tapas and the eggplant rolls with goat cheese. 
I think the calamari was too salty and on the other hand the eggplants roll were too bland. 
We also ordered the seafood ipella. 
That was ok it had the flavor. 
I suggest to come here with friends and have fun not a one on one on Friday nights.
With friends you can make as much noise as you want and drink. 
Like a local bar almost.  
I give it a 3 out of 5 because of the service. I think it was great they were always on top of everything.
This place is just amazing!! Our server Roger was just fantastic! The service from all the staff was great! I can't wait to come back!

Made reservations on some day, no problem. Environment is nice. It's dark but they had lights wear it need to be so we can see our food. Everyine was welcoming. Hottest were very kind, our waiter was very nice and on point. He new when to check up on us. 

My boyfriend and I ordered: 
lamb chop, baby back ribs with mango salsa on top, scallop escargot in Garlic, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche and passion fruit cheese cake. The only dish that was okay was the shrimp ceviche. Not enough flavor. But everything else was GREAT! I would recommend this place to all my friends. And would definitely come back.

Just went for our 5th meal here! Still loving it!
We ordered 11 dishes, 2 beers & 6 cocktails for four people. We were all stuffed and happy. The. I'll was $175 before tip.

Try the New Girl cocktail!!!

Blood orange mojito, amazing 
Fly-tai, mmmmmm
Bread and butter, loved it
Calamari, crispy and delicious
Fish sticks, a touch over done but tasty
Tomato bread, interesting... A bit soggy
Papas, OMG soooo good! And spicy!
Tortillas a la espanola, a bland waste of money

Overall, we REALLY enjoyed our meal here. The atmosphere is very pleasant (although the tables for two are far too close together. I did not enjoy listening to every word of the other people's conversations) the service was fantastic until we asked for our check so we could get to our show and the waitresses disappeared for a while. I will definitely be coming back soon to try some more dishes!!!

Really good small plates with Latin flavor. Clams, chorizo, dates, fish, mushrooms, chicken and so much more! Each one delicious. Go with a group and order two per person. Fun and tasty. The price is very reasonable too!

After our wedding at the Flamingo, we came here for our reception. The food is spectacular as well as the service. 

Fernanda and Regina took such great care of us before and during the reception, making sure everyone was taken care of.  Paul and Neo, our servers and bar tenders of the night, also deserve high praise for their efficiency and attentiveness.  

We began outside on the patio for light tapas.  Albondigas, the stuffed dates and artichoke toast kicked off the night.  Multiple trays of each were passed around to the guests, enough where I could have filled up on those had I not known what else was to come.  Although I loved all three of these starters, the albondigas were my favorite.  They were tender and juicy and full of flavor due to the Parmesan and sherry sauce.  The guests raved about the stuffed dates which had a perfect balance of sweet with the red wine reduction sauce and savory with the blue cheese.  The smoked almonds added not only another element of surprise to the mixture of flavors, but a nice juxtaposition of texture to the dates.  My mom and aunt's favorites were the artichoke toast- a perfect amount of salty crunchiness from the bread with a generous piece of warm artichoke on top,  Honestly, as I am writing this review recalling the food, maybe all three were my favorite!

To accompany the starters and the meal, we had an open bar. Being on the patio we had a separate opening to the inside bar that only our guests could order from.  No waiting at all.  I enjoyed the sangria, pretty much all night.  Both the red and the champagne sangrias were filled with fresh fruit and both had  unique flavors.  The champagne sangria was a little sweeter, perfect for dessert, while the red accompanied most of my food.  Regina brought out pitchers for all the guests to enjoy on top of whatever else they wanted to drink. Fernanda, Regina, Paul and Neo did not skip one beat!

Now on to the meal...We were moved to a private room inside.  The only downfall was that there was only a black velvet curtain separating us from another party and at times they got a little loud ( as did we I am sure).  But other than that, Firefly set up a private drink station for us to continue to order drinks from.

We began the meal with Toasted Bread, Almond Butter, and Marinated Olives.  That almond butter was so sweet; being married to the saltiness of the olives made this, again, another tantalizing combination.  Next was the paella. I have never had paella before, but now I am a paella believer!  It was filled with seafood and pork - just a whole lot of stuff! Many guests filled their plates with whichever meats they liked best. We also enjoyed the ribeye and the herb roasted chicken.  The ribeye was nicely cooked, especially in the inside if you like your meat more medium.  It was more cooked on the outside.  The sauce was reminiscent of the red wine reduction form the stuffed dates.  The herb roasted chicken was tender and we were served both white and dark meat.  As a side, we had the firefly fries, and damn that aioli was addictive.  A few guests admitted to eating multiple plate fulls of the fries the next day.

To end our evening of food, we got to savor the Chocolate "Tres Leches" Cake.  Moist and delightful, it was a perfect end to the perfect meal.  We also ordered a wedding cake from Freeds which was delivered to Firefly.  It was one of the most flavorful and delicious cakes I have every had - I recommend the almond flavored cake. 

The night was coming to a close, and we all had such an amazing time.  We were supposed to be out by 8, but our speeches went a little longer and people lingered a little longer.  The staff did not rush us out nor did we feel pressured to get out.  This wedding experience was pretty close to perfect, a word I don't use too lightly but used repeatedly in this review.

The only thing I wish is that there was a Firefly in the CLE.

Much thanks to Firefly: Fenanda, Regina, Paul and Neo!

Great restaurant simple small tapas. They have so many great selections from bacon wrapped dateds to chicken chorizo stuffed mushrooms. Amazing  this is a great little date spot. So dress up take your little lady, or guy out and enjoy some set time!!!! Oh ya and try the bacon wrapped dates, these are what dreams are made of lol.

Came here for dinner with my family & got seated right away. The food is good, were familiar with the menu. Service definitely needs improvement. The server didnt even greet us he just came over and asked if were ready? I thought that was kind of rude considering the restaurant didnt look very busy. I ordered the ceviche (as its my top fave) and it came out way after our 2 order of tapas. I didnt like that they drop off plates at the table and leave right away. I needed condiments and Im in the service industry myself, I feel like they could at least ask if we need anything else. After asking 2 people that werent my server about the ceviche, they finally brought it out. We didnt see our server much until we would look around. I know I'll be back because this is one of my favorite local restaurants. I just wish they improved their service.

Def a place to go in Vegas!
My boyfriend and I were trying to find a place in Vegas to go that was different, not over priced, and delish. We didn't want to do the traditional steak houses because honestly you can get a good steak from a good steakhouse anywhere. My boyfriend has never had Tapas before so I suggested we look up restaurants with Tapas. Firefly had good reviews so we made reservations for 6pm. When we got there it wasn't very busy yet. 

Ambiance:
The lighting is dim which is nice because it makes you feel like your the only ones in the restaurant. We were seated in a corner booth and it just made everything perfect. There is a lot of red to the color scheme and it kind of had a tacky-manly-romantic vibe to it but it fit its romantic fun feeling.

Service:
We had the best service. Our waiter was attentive, knowledgeable and all around an all star. I have worked in the restaurant industry for a good 5 years and i appreciate when someone is as good as he was. Not only was our server great.. the food runner was good, and the busser or server assistant was amazing. He did not let a empty plate sit on a table for anyone.. I saw him sneakingly cleaning up without interrupting people in the dinner conversations.

Food:
It depends what you get. All of the food we had was good. But some were just good and some were AMAZING. The portion sizes are definitely bigger than a normal tapas place which is nice and well worth the money. Some suggestions for food are.. Dates, Filet, Lamb. Those were our favorites.. we wanted to try much more but we got full fast. Not only is the food good.. omg the sangria was heavenly.. we got the pitcher and it was gone at the end of dinner.

Price:
The price is very reasonable and I'm so glad we went there. We got a pitcher of sangria and 6  tapas.. our bill was $95. We got to try all different kinds of food and get 6 glasses of sangria out of the pitcher. It is very reasonable.

The next time we are in Vegas we will be coming here!

Amazing!!
Tierra y Mar was Bomb!!

Stuffed dates are a must!!

Lamb Chops are a slice of heaven!

Red Sangria tasted like it was made with sprite. No bueno.

Desserts are not worth writing about. 

Service was OK. Though they offered us a free dessert, i think it is important to be notified in advance if there are long wait times. I like being checked up on and my server really checked in. 

I gave this 4 stars for the amazing food and unbeatable prices!!

specially loved the Scallop escargot style YUM ask for more bread for the yummy garlic butter, also faves were warm spinach salad and the steak and shrimp skewers Patatas bravas not so much, the potatoes were not hot enough and the aioli had separated. Great mojito

Went to this Tapas Restaurant on Sunday night and was pleasantly surprised. The food was on point, everything tasted amazing and the staff was incredibly nice. Definitely would recommend this to anyone in Vegas.

I always come here with a group of my friends because we are big fans of their sangria! This place accommodates big groups with convenient varieties of tapas available. From my past visits I have never ordered an actual entree because I'd usually get full off of their tapa's menu but my friend ordered a steak entree, which was pretty big and presented nicely. The food is okay but in my opinion it is on the pricey side for certain items you get. The environment is a bit dim inside setting a relaxed ambiance. The first time I came to their restaurant it was hard for me to see others in my group on the other end of the table because it was so dark. However, the other times I came after, the lighting was better. Customer service has been okay, they are nice and try to get our orders in as quick as possible. The wait is pretty long but Firefly is always busy so it is expected from this type of business. I have been a consistent customer for the past 4 years since they moved locations and each visit they get better and better.
The food was amazing! Outstanding! Simply delicious the shrimp ceviche was just out of this world good.

Have always enjoyed the food here, and this time was better than I remember!  I love that it's tapas/small plates, all reasonably priced, so I can try several things without being overly stuffed.  Great place to go with a couple friends so you can all share and just try everything!

Always pleased. I always try to get new things but it's hard because there are so many favs! Absolute orders are tuna tartar, Mac and cheese, croquettes, and dates for dessert. Sangria is good but def weak. My bf gets a flavored monitor but asks them to muddle peppers inside so it's spicy! That's a better choice!

Like this place a lot. When visiting try to keep it simple. Bacon wrapped dates, albondigas, patatas bravas , etc. 
get a pitcher of sangria and enjoy your evening!! They moved down the street from their old location so now there is more room and you don't have to wait for an hour to get a table. Still it's busy, so plan to show up lil early.

Been here twice, once a year for annual company dinner. We got package that they prepared.. food is absolutely yummy. The place is packed, I think maybe planning ahead to this place is a better bet. They have bar as well. I completely forgot to take the pictures of the food coz I was so so hungry, but nevertheless this place is worth to try.

I really love Firefly for birthday or special events. The atmosphere is very loud and exciting. Great for large groups ordering tapas or meals for sharing. Or sit at the bar and have a few drinks with a date before heading out for the night. Saturday nights is Latin night in their private room inside the restaurant, I've never been but I've heard great things about it. They change their menu periodically including ingredients on options that have been around for awhile. I absolutely love! Their Red Sangria, at $9 a glass your better off buying a pitcher for $30 and sharing. Be careful they are strong (to my liking). 

The food, tapas style, is very good! They have a ton of seafood options and of course you must have the Firefly fries, they are very garlic-y so bring some gum. I recently tried their Ahi Tuna skewers, they were decent and not too filling which was perfect to start the night with.

Was there for an early evening snack and drink, the four of us split some appetizers and a couple pitchers of red sangria. We sat o. The bar and the bartenders even though busy where very attentitive and pleasant. The food was good and tastey though i felt the portions couldve been bigger. The drinks were yummy, sangria was sweet. They have latin night on friday nights if thats your thing.

Oh hell yes. Tapas! 

Tuna tartar, sangria, creative dishes that will give you a taste for real culinary experiences. 

Broaden your horizons and go here, try 10 things and enjoy the fun atmosphere. Thank me after you've had a great meal.
Jim. FrontRangeJim.com

This is one of my favorite restaurants ANYWHERE. I was in town for work for one night and brought my coworkers here. Rave reviews from all. My favorites are the Tuna tartare, camarones a la Diablo, petite filet and stuffed dates. Try the paella as well, you won't regret it!

This is one of my favorite places to eat... food is great!! But the service was not so great.  We arrived on a monday night around 10:20pm the place was empty.  At this time we were the only ones who sat inside the restaurant.  Our server was Jesus (tall, skinny gentleman)  He greeted us with a smile, but throughout our visit.  We felt rushed when it came to ordering as if he didn't have time to be waiting on us.  I felt there were other workers in the restaurant that took care of us more than the server.  When it came time to pay the bill, we paid in cash and Jesus said he would be back with the change.  We waited, but all we saw was Jesus walking past us from the kitchen to the bar to his outside tables; He did not bother to look at us or come back to the table.  We flagged him down once we saw that he was not going to come back, only then did he say "Did you want your change?" without us having to say anything.  I will say we did not leave a good tip due to our experience.  We thought if was very rude of him to expect he deserved that tip.. We are very generous tippers but we tip based on the overall experience.  Because of that his tip went down further but it was never because of the fact that we are cheap.  We understand that people work for their tips and that is part of their income; but I also believe in excellent customer service wherever I go.  Because I love the food, i would order to go instead of dining in

Went here for a bachelorette dinner and was not disappointed. All the food was delicious, drinks were good. Sangria was a bit sweet for my taste but we had a complimentary pineapple shot at the end that was delicious. I will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas

The Bottom Line: One of our favorite places to eat in Vegas, proof positive that there are hidden gems away from the Strip.

Try:
Tomato Bread
Tomato Basil Soup
Seasonal Vegetables
Veggies and Lentils
Patatas Bravas
Firefly Fries
Baked Goat Cheese
Flourless Chocolate Cake
Red Sangria
Mojito

Pro:
Excellent date night restaurant. The lightning was just right, the service was fast, friendly, and knew when to check in or stay away. The small plates make conversation easy, though you may end up talking about the food a fair bit. Everything seemed to be designed to complement each other. 

Con:
Ordering tapas can strain the budget, but... this is worth it. Treat yourself and someone else. :)

I was in Vegas with some girlfriends for a bachelorette party and we were staying at the hotel right next door.  We ate here 2 times in 3 days if that says something about how much we loved this place.  It's a tapas place with a nice variety of dishes.  We ordered the stuffed mushrooms, the bacon wrapped dates, the mussels, some Asian shrimp dish, the apple and manchego salad, and coffee.  All the food was really great and the coffee was much needed after a long night of partying.  

We came back again with some other friends and had an issue with their steak.  It tasted really weird and the servers were so great and accommodating.  They offered to make the dish again or replace it with any other dish free of charge.  When we didn't want anything, the chef came out to apologize and sent over a free dessert platter! AND they sent us the steak anyway, which I brought home to my husband (and he said it was delicious).  

LOVED the food and the super nice service.  I don't think I've had such great service anywhere (except, of course, for those fancy pants places where it costs $150 a person).  

Highlights were the bacon wrapped dates and apple and manchego salad.  I am definitely coming back every time I'm in Vegas.

I was extremely disappointed with everything I ordered. I measure a restaurant food quality starting with the bread. Butter was frozen. Bread hard, dry. Cerviche was marginal. I ordered chorizo, shrimp, steak skewers. Flavor was marginal and chorizo was hard to chew, shrimp was chewy. The only thing I would say is that I ate late at night and perhaps the kitchen was getting ready to close. I will not come back. The bartender server was really good however.

Went here on our visit to Vegas with another couple. The food was absolutely fantastic!!! Everything we ordered was great, even got the dessert platter. We ordered four tapas and the seafood paella and dessert with two drinks, bill for the four of us was just under $100. The atmosphere was beautiful with velvet walls, rich colors and original eclectic array of art. The food was fresh and we would have loved to come on Friday instead as I heard they have live music and dancing. Either way this place is a definite must when we are in Vegas again. Missing one star because our waiter/male was inattentive and unwelcoming, he was like, "what do you want to eat" and did not engage when asked questions about the menu, only really seen him during check time. Oh well, I will still come back as this was one of my better dining experience with food and value.

Went here during a girlfriend's bachelorette dinner. It came recommended to us from some other friends as a perfect spot for a larger party such as ours, 15 loud girls. The location is definitely NOT strip, the clientele will also let you know you are not on the strip. Once we got over this though and sat down at our table we soon forgot where we were and focused on the expansive small plates menu they had. To be honest, it was a bit overwhelming but our server was happy to walk us through popular items and recommended some great items.

The list has something for everyone and prices that will save lots of cash for drinks, club entrances and whatever else you might spend your money on in vegas. 

The décor was lacking a bit in my opinion, and at the time we were there the bathroom was under construction so we had to share time with the guys bathroom (ladies in, guys out, ladies in, etc. . .) it was interesting for sure.

Overall, knowing how good the food is I would go back. It worked out for our large group as well, but if you are looking for a true vegas feel then this isn't going to be your spot.

Having been to their former location just a block or two down the road, this new location is much much nicer and slightly more upscale. The space is huge. On a Friday night this place gets very crowded. Nice ambience but can be very loud so forget about talking to the other person sitting across the table from you. 

The food quality is about the same as the old location. I asked for a red sangria, mushroom tart and firefly fries. Honestly, I remembered the red sangria to be a lot better from the old location. Delicious fries. I wasn't too crazy about the sautéed  mushroom on top of popovers.

Went last night with some coworkers.  It was my 3rd time to Firefly in about 1.5 years.  The food has always been really good but last night the food wasn't that good.  It didn't taste fresh and was frankly pretty ho hum.  I hope they get their groove back.

This place was packed Saturday night. We waited 45 mins even with a reservation. We got two pitchers of sangria as compensation but I really just wanted to sit down. My husband enjoyed the food, for me it was just ok. The service was good once we sat and ordered some food. The ac was a bit too cold as well. My husband wanted to come back and I didn't. I guess I was put off by all the waiting to be seated.
Cute but flavorful tapas plates. Great service for low price (relatively speaking)!

This place rocks!  Great hot fresh food every time which comes out relatively quick.  My 2nd time at the restaurant and 1st time at the location.

Always an excellent choice to visit.
Highly reccomended. Great ambiance, excellent food, great service. This place rocks ! My 14 year old son enjoyed our dinner here immensely. The prices are very reasonable as well.

Before I had ever moved to Vegas I saw a food network special on firefly and I always said I'd visit Vegas for THIS local spot. The next year when I moved to Vegaa I rushed down to Firefly and it has NEVER disappointed. It is one of my top favorite local hotspots. If you love tapas this will soon become one of your favorites as well!

Wanting to catch a bit after a long day of traveling and not much was open. Their late hours led me me. From the decor to the food, to the ambiance, to the service, it was all absolutely amazing. This is a MUST everytime I'm in Las Vegas!

I have to jump on the 5 star bandwagon here.  This was a great place with outstanding Tapas and we experienced very good service.  we loved the bacon wrapped figs and the hot and spicy shrimp were very very good.

I don't put out the 5 stars too often, but this earned this big time.  And the service is was very good.  We sat down with a reservation for 2 at 8pm on a Wed, the place was packed.  At first nobody came and I thought that some of the comments about the service (negative) were going to come true. But our waiter came pretty quickly and ended up being a super great guy. Even showed us the recipe for a few of the dishes.  

Off the strip and worth the trip.

This place lives up to all the hype. Came here with help from yelpers. On a Tuesday night around 7:30 the place had a decent crowd. Restaurant was full. We could've opted for a table pretty quickly but decided that the bar was where we wanted to be. 

Bartenders were pumping out some massive carafes of mojitos and sangrias. We both decided on sangrias (amazzzing)... Not overly sweet. Everything on the menu looks great. Unfortunately we tapped out after 6 dishes. Top pick by far was the bacon wrapped dates but you can't go wrong with anything here. 

Ambience is perfect. Great for small or large groups. But if you're coming with a big party be prepared to wait. Service could've been a little more personal but it wasn't bad. That would've made it 5 star otherwise. Thanks yelp for the help,

I LOVE coming to Firefly every time I visit Vegas. It's definitely one of my go to spots when I don't want to eat on the strip. They have great lunch specials, happy hour deals, and also great for date nights and dinner time. 

It is tapas style so there is plenty of options to choose from depending on your preferences. My girlfriend and I went the surf and turf route as the below will describe our order.

Scallops escargot
Tuna tartar
Lamb chops
Pallela 
I think we tried flan or an ice cream dessert I don't remember as I am writing this review over a month later. ( I know horrible procrastinator)

I have never gotten sick here and I've eaten here probably 6-7 times over the years of my Vegas trips. I love the honey butter or whatever butter they serve with the thin baguettes. They used to give olives with the bread but I guess not many people were eating it so they stop. I do believe you can request it though. Will come back as the location isn't really far from the strip either and they have a parking lot you can park in.

Oh my gosh, SO good! I got the bacon-wrapped dates that everyone was talkin' about and they are orgasmic! I also ordered the shrimp ceviche - yum! The avocados were so fresh. Lastly, the veggie samosa, which was decent, not great. My boyfriend got the filet mignon sliders; I had a bite and they were so tender and juicy! His machego mac and cheese was just alright; that kind of cheese is too mild, in my opinion, for mac and cheese. A very enjoyable out-of-the-ordinary meal for Valentines Day! We had to wait for a table, but that's to be expected given the holiday. Service was pretty good; they were very attentive. I will probably be back!
My fave when near the Convention Center.  The sangria rocks.  Any and all flavors.   Food is always great.

One of the best secrets in Vegas! My favorite restaurant in Vegas. You order A bunch of appetizers and share. The Mac and cheese, calamari, ceviche, steak skewers, and best of all... The stuffed mushrooms with chorizo!!!! Order a pitcher of red sangria and your in heaven. A must try!

It was our first time to try Firefly. The food choices looked all great and different. After we ordered several small plates each they came out in no orderly fashion. One of us had all of our plates and the other person had none. I ordered a glass of wine that never came so I asked the waiter and he ran and got it.  We were enjoying our meal and I patiently waited for my empanadas when I realized I better ask in there whereabouts. Once again the waiter ran to get them.  Once I received them I was a bit disappointed because the were burned around the edges, which left about two bites of empanada because they are small.  Lastly the oil used to cook the fish sticks was past its prime because the fish stick color was an ugly darkish brown. No good. For the foot version the service could have been better. The food is very good but attention to detail would help.

After doing an extensive search of restaurants with private rooms, we settled on Firefly for my mom's 80th birthday party and dinner for about 20 guests. Setting up the reservation, menu and contract was a simple process. The room was great, we had our own private bartender and the food was fantastic! All for a price that was very competitive. The paella, meatballs and dates were a few of my faves--delicious! The service was excellent! We had put together a 6 minute video for my mother--she had a bit of a hard time hearing it so they turned off the music in the entire restaurant--on a Friday night--for the 6 minutes so she could hear the audio. That was an awesome touch--great food, great ambience and great customer service! I would completely recommend Firefly and we will definitely be back!

I should've reviewed this place months ago, as I visited way back in January. I was in Vegas for 5 days and this was by far my favorite restaurant and I will be back the next time I'm in the area. Heard about it on Yelp and realized the hotel we were staying at our first night was right next door so I made a reservation (btw this is a couple blocks behind the strip but worth the detour). We ordered the Stuffed Dates, fries, and beef bocadillas. We may have had one more item, but I can't remember. Everything's was great although the little beef sandwiches were noticeably bland. The true MVP of our meal was the pitcher of sangria we ordered: BEST. SANGRIA. EVERRRR!! I still day dream about this stuff. The atmosphere in here is completely appropriate for a special occasion, date night, or evening out with friends. My BF had never had tapas and since he's a big eater I was nervous, but he also loved his time hear and when he found out I hadn't written a review he scolded me, lol. It was his birthday and I had made a note on my online reservation. I was dog tired from our flight and we were stuffed so I had completely forget and was ready for the bill when they came out with a birthday flan for him. I'm not ashamed to admit that I fought him for the last tasty morsel. Great place.
Best tapas options available if you want to try multiple dishes. Lots of variety. Four stars for good taste.

We were here for my BFF's birthday. I really like the food at Firefly but just like the Sahara location, service here is bad. It's just a tad bit better here. However, parking is impossible here. I had no choice but do valet on a Friday night. 

I asked for a white sangria and a glass of water as soon as we sat down. I got my sangria but got my glass of water a few minutes before we left...that's 2 hours later! But then again, we were a big group. I can tell our server was really TRYING his best.

I noticed they added more items on their menu especially desserts. My Firefly faves are Firefly fries, bacon-wrapped dates, sangria and steak and mushroom skewers and a few others but I only ordered those last night since I wasn't too hungry at 9:30pm. I did get some calamari and chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms from my friends. We also got a rib eye. It was huge and comes with fries for only $20, wow! Last night's fries were super oily though.

If you get the fries, get double aioli...it's yummy! You can't go wrong with their sangria...either red or white. Just get a pitcher and leave happy. I don't recommend the Nutella dessert and I'm a huge Nutella freak...it's something you can make at home. Pretty much everything on their menu is delicious, trust me. Just have the patience for the service and pray they won't have another health violation scare.
I love this place! I love the smaller portions. The dates are my favorite! It is a little loud but the food makes up for it.

[note: if i could give 2.5 stars, i would. alas.]

pros: great ambiance, lovely outdoor patio, good service, relatively inexpensive, free valet

cons: the food. bleh. my sister and i ordered the chicken skewers, spicy beef salad, summer veggies, and patatas bravas. everything was bland and flavorless except the potatoes, which were so spicy they were practically inedible. the spicy beef salad supposedly contained filet mignon but the beef was grey, dry, and chewy. it was also topped with a dumptruck full of crunchy wonton crisps that were all stuck in the thick, gloopy dressing so i couldn't just push them aside. i was pretty annoyed bc these weren't listed anywhere in the description on the menu. i have special dietary requirements and if i had known they were on the dish i would have made sure to order it without. i wound up sending this dish back. (our waiter did take it off the bill without me specifically having to ask though, which is always appreciated.)

service: 5/5
ambiance: 4/5 (it was just a skooch too dark and i needed my phone flashlight to read the menu like an old lady.)
food: 1/5

if you're looking for delicious tapas in Vegas i'd recommend Jaleo over Firefly. yes, it's significantly more expensive, but the food is light-years better in quality.
Best place for Tapas. Service was friendly. Atmosphere was very amazing. Prices was nice.All in all a very nice place to try out.

Our first time here was good
We sat ourselves and although we saw plenty of people walk past us. We sat for 15 minutes without menus or being acknowledged. My company went to the restroom, came back and had to ask someone for menus. 

After that. We didn't have a problem with everything else. 
Food was fast. 
The second waiter that attended to our order was quick and attentive along with the blond girl with black glasses whom I assume is the busser. She has good work ethic. We needed to get our servers attention because we wanted to order desert. She informed us that our waiter was busy but offered to pass down our order. Very much appreciated. 

The 4 Stars was Bc how it started other than that
The food was hands down Amazing
After so many years, this is still my favorite place. The food is amazing and great customer service from my favorite waiter Alejandro. Highly recommended!!!!

The food is great! Wow, full flavored and a great presentation. Service is good- they check on you, glass never empty, polite, and helpful. Food was fast. This is a first time and it wasn't busy on a weekday 11pm.

I had my mother's 60th birthday party here with preordered platters and pitchers of Sangria. The food, sangria and service was amazing! Everyone was extremely prompt and professional. I will definitely host more parties here!

I used to come here years ago and thought everything was half off on happy hour. Came in today on happy hour & nothing was on happy hour or told about the happy hour. $28 sangria was the only thing discounted to $18. Never was told by the bartender or the 3 bartenders that it's not half off, which most people assume or the server bartender tells them. Empty bar, 3 bartenders horrible service. Won't come back. Back in the day it was good.

Came for happy hour.

Got the chicken skewers and empanadas. Delicious. Skewers came with asparagus and potatoes. Empanadas came with a small salad. 

All felt like enough food for a single meal.

In total $14 before tip.

Order the stuffed dates ( bacon wrapped, smoked almonds, red wine reduction, blue cheese) 
Camarines a la diabla was perfection. 
The chicken and chorizo stuffed mushrooms needed more kick. Chicken and mushroom blended out any flavors they were aiming for. 
Seriously, just start at the top of the menu and start working your way through. I'll be back for round 2,3,4,5,etc.

This place is one of the top spots in Las Vegas, anything in the menu it's to die for just to name a few...the empanadas, chorizo stuffed mushrooms, the steak and mushroom skewers, camarones a la diabla and the list can just go on and on and to end up with the dessert the tres leches cake, I can't wait 

to go back, good thing I am local and can go anytime I want...

Firefly is a local Tapas and small plates restaurant located on Paradise Rd. in the center of Las Vegas. It's easily accessible from anywhere in the city and always open late. I used to come here all the time and accidentally burnt myself out on the place, so I had to take a break but it's been long enough so I'm back. Anytime I come here I usually start with the Stuffed Dates [bacon-wrapped,smoked almond,red wine reduction with blue cheese]. That gets me ready for the next few items that I order which are the Chicken Skewers [grilled marinated chicken breast,seasonal veggies,and roasted garlic cream]
The Petit Filet [mini filet mignon, herb cheese,roasted potatoes,mushrooms and red wine sauce]
The Baked Cod [lemon,garlic,butter and fried onion]
The Chorizo Plate [4 imported thinly sliced cured meats, cornichons, capers and mustard] and lastly
The Baked Goat Cheese [goat and garlic cream cheese, tomato sauce, Pesto and toast]. All are delicious and should be given a chance. Now for dessert well they have over ten to choose from so I'm sure you guys will find something. As far as the actual restaurant and bar the vibe is great and always fun. It's a cool hangout if you and some friends just wanna kill some time!

I ate here for the first time a couple months ago. I usually don't like to go off the strip when I am in Vegas, seems like too much of hassle. It really wasn't and well worth it. We caught an Uber from our hotel and we were there in 10 min. This was one of the best meals I have had in Vegas and that is saying a lot. Their drinks are just as good. And, it's pretty inexpensive. Every friend I have who has recently gone to Vegas I have told them to go here. So good!
Everytime I come to Vegas I tried to hit up this spot very good tapas here I'm not a drinker but the people at our table we're having sangria they look absolutely delicious

Just get the skewers and skewers an more skewers! Tappas style restaurant. Went in on a Thursday and was seated right away. The sangria is very popular here, which I am usually not a fan of because usually it's too sweet, but it's a great balance between fruit and alcohol here. I'm already a fan.

Great recommend Yelpers! Start to finish everything was delish! The restaurant while needing a lot of upgrade was clean and comfortable.  Ordered too much, not so different from most Tapas lovers, but glad we did! Notables are all the empanadas, lychee ceviche, mushroom tart, Moscow Mule, and Old Fashion Bourbon. The cocktails, not surprisingly cost about as much as the food so beware of cocktail choices. Otherwise, Firefly* is definitely a great place!
Everything was just awesome. Food came out promptly and the drinks were very good. We got there during happy hour which was an added bonus.
Outstanding food, vibe and service. A must stop in Vegas. Really really good! So many good items. Order a bunch and share!! Empanadas are a must! A great place for groups.

We ate at the old Firefly location several times when we visited Las Vegas three years ago and I was eager to eat there again.  The new location is much larger and the décor was nice.  The tapas were just as good as I remembered and we really enjoyed our lunch.  We ordered a variety of items and enjoyed them all.  As always, the bacon wrapped dates were delicious and I also enjoyed the chicken skewers over a bed of roasted veggies.  We will definitely return when we visit Las Vegas in the future.

One of the best kept secrets in Vegas!  The food here yummy and the prices are much better than those fancy steak houses on the strip.  The sangria isn't strong but is delicious!

I recommend if you plan on coming here, make reservations.  It can get busy.
Excellent place for small plate Tapas and wine. Modern Chic Decor, fun environment to go with excellent food. Service is good, staffs are friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant.

I really like this restaurant. The environment was pretty relaxed but elegant. The appetizers & drinks were great and price was reasonable. 

I suggest if you go with a group of friends (like we did) we just all ordered and did it family style. That way you all can try everything on the menu :)

I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Came to Vegas this past weekend for a weekend get away and I finally got the chance to try the place out. A lot of friends have been recommending this place but I never got the chance to go due to Vegas shenanigans I would always get caught up into. lol. 

Every dish we ordered was delish and their sangrias are to die for. I wish they were a bit stronger but its okay I'm just going to have to order my own pitcher with a straw next time ;).  Service is great and the staff are all super friendly. We must of ordered like 10 different small tapas dishes, a paella, and a pitcher of sangria and the bill came out to be about $125 for 5 people, SUPER REASONABLE!!! Unlike that Spanish restaurant they have at the Cosmopolitan, which was way too overly priced with super duper small portions that didn't even taste good. But its okay lesson learned, just go off the strip to Fireflys for your Spanish fix. 

I'm making sure every time I'm in Vegas to pencil in Fireflys for dinner. Ah! Cant wait to go back :)!!!!!

I like this place, the service always been good,flavors are well balance, nice presentation. Sangria is well prepared, a little sweet, a hint of vodka. Sitting at bar is always my favorite spot... You can see the whole place and get faster service.

This kind of reminded me of a diner that decided to re-brand itself as a tapas restaurant.  The space is large, with both indoor and outdoor seating.  The service was very efficient.  The menu was huge with sections for cold, hot, meat and seafood tapas.  

The quality and preparation were not all that great, though.  Best thing about it was that the portions were huge.  The ahi tuna skewers and spinach salad was enough for two people.  The fish,however, wasn't of a good quality and it came in some gooey sauce.  The salad was OK, with pine nuts and artichokes and feta, but needed some vinegar and flavor oomph.  The merguez sausage was odd tasting, unlike any I've had before and quite spicy.  The octopus was mealy and came in a large dish with mushy potatoes and other mushy items - odd.  The serrano ham sliders came on awful supermarket hamburger buns and the burgers were of a low quality.  The fried onions as a side, however, were the highlight of the meal. 

Considering the amount of food the prices are very reasonable.  Just like a diner.

Very fun and lively place for a late dinner with loud music and great people watching. Tons of large groups with bachelorette parties. We had a late night dinner @ 10 PM and ordered a pitcher of red sangria, stuffed dates, skewers, firefly fries and other tapas. The place was very busy on a Friday night so different people helped with our service. We were seated next to the kitchen and can hear all the hustle and bustle.

A local favorite that has grown to be known by tourist as well. I absolutely love this place. I've tried just about everything on the menu and never been let down. There are some items I simply wouldn't order again but I have never had anything I didn't like. The food comes out very fast! The fresh mojitos and sangrias are also delicious, if you have a group get the pitcher. Only reason I graded a 4 is because of the new location. The old spot seemed more authentic or...idk just a different vibe to it.

We came here for brunch on our first day in town and got a seat at the bar. We tried a couple mojitos (which I wish were on the all you can drink option menu!) and my favorite was my blood orange one. I tried the white house sangria and it was a little tart for me. The bartender was great and gave us suggestions on his favorite dishes on the menu. We ended up ordering solely off the regular menu instead of getting brunch and got the tuna tartare, the shrimp in garlic butter sauce, chicken tinga empanadas, and the filet/shrimp/chorizo skewers. While we waited, they brought out bread and butter and the butter was so amazing I could have just made a meal of the bread and butter. My boyfriend's favorite dish was the tuna, but mine was the shrimp - so flavorful. The empanadas were really good and I would get them again. I wasn't as big of a fan of the skewers, some of the meat was a little tough and the sauce wasn't my favorite. I will definitely make this a stop on our next trip!

I love this place, every time I come to Vegas this is a must locals joint to visit. It's tapas style food, and almost everything on the menu is excellent. The sangria here is also excellent and a must-have.

Firefly is a great spot to go to with friends and family. I've been here numerous times, old and new spots. The new renovation is great and spacious with a private room, great for big dinners. 

I've tried numerous items on the menu from Apple and Manchego Salad, Garden Variety Salad, Ceviche of Shrimp, Tuna Tartare, Stuffed Dates, Tomato-Basil Soup, Veggie Empanadas, Firefly Fries, Ahi Tuna & Chicken Skewers, Banana Nutella Sandwiches, & Chocolate Tres Leches. 

Most of them were 10/10, besides the Veggie Empanadas. The cheese sauce drizzle didn't do it for it. I rather of had it dry. 

Firefly knows how to take care of their customers. They even set up a long table for a big party of 20 for us even though we were seated in the back corner separated. Special treatment to make their customers happy equals 5 stars in my book!

This is a hidden gem in Las Vegas! Located at the end of the strip on the far side near the convention center, I had no idea this place existed until I was invited by friends. We showed up around the time of happy hour and I quickly saw the place fill up!

(There is valet which is complimentary aka tips only, so that's helpful when it becomes busy)

Our group decided to order a bunch of tapas, small appetizers, and share those as well as some pitchers of libations! 

I decided to stay with my go-to: red wine. However, I did have a taste of the sangria and it was delicious! 

My favorite tapas were the shrimp ceviche which was fresh and served with crunchy chips. Also, the parmesan fries were crisp and hot. The chicken skewers were tender and came with roasted veggies. 

I loved the ambiance as Firefly had in and outdoor seating and rooms for large parties like ours. My only caveat was that the servers weren't quite privy to large parties, it seemed. I should've brought cash so that I could check out quicker, like most in my group. But, I thought that most people these days used cards to pay. I ended up waiting over 30 minutes to get my check, give my card to the server, and then another 15+ to actually sign my check to leave.
Great experience the other night at the new location. Excellent food, drinks and service.
