This was a phenomenal experience and my best dining experience in Vegas so far.  The food is prepared to heart and intention, and the dining staff made us feel at home.  Beautiful plates, every bite packed with flavor, and priced very well.  I am happy.  Firefly will make you happy too!

Not the best service or nicest staff, but the chicken salad was spectacular, the veggie paella great, and the potatoes with Chipotle sauce delicious. The Chicago roast beef sandwiches weren't good, and neither were the peppers stuffed with cheese, but I have a feeling once you know what to order from this place, it would be fantastic.

I can't really rate the food, but the way we were treated was terrible. We walked in tonight, understandably there would be a wait, since we did not make a reservation. The hostess said it would be 15-20 min for 3 people. Our party of 3 could handle that. About 45 min later, we saw plenty of people get taken back to be seated, we asked about how much longer they thought it would be, and she said oh umm you guys are next. She then proceeded to take another party to there seats. On that note, we decided to leave. Very disappointing as I am sure their food is tasty.
The sangria is still the best in town. The albondigas, warm spinach salad and dates were superb! Service was fast and the staff was friendly. I definitely recommend this place.

We stopped by Firefly for some drinks and dessert after lunch. Our friend is a huge fan of Tres Leches cake and I read reviews of Firefly's being top notch. We were hanging out in the bar during football Sunday. Both of our friends ordered the Tres Leches and my wife had the Fly Tai cocktail. She liked the drink a lot and ordered a second. The Tres Leches was also delicious, so much that my wife ate about half of one of our friends before he realized it. Our other friend who is the tres leches fan said it was up at the top of his favorite tres leches cakes. 

Service in the bar was also excellent for us as the bartender was constantly refilling our drinks including my water before I could finish it. All of us would go back to try their food and also eat more desserts.

Awesome food. Took off a star for the service. Takes forever to get a table, to get a menu, to order food. Food came out soon enough, however some things were forgotten. Took forever to ask for a check.

Another good place in Vegas that is way off strip. Been to vegas a bunch lately and man the food is just overpriced and terrible on the strip. Been investigating a bunch of places like this, and Firefly gets the thumbs way up.

The food was mediocre at best and the service was slow. We had to have a member of our party help the waitress separate the checks so we could get them right. Sangria was good. That was the only upside
paid lots of money for ok tapas and burnt, dry shrimp on our paella. I also thought it was impossible to screw up a screwdriver but Firefly proved me wrong. Meh. Find something else to eat.

First ate at firefly when it was just a small restaurant tucked in the corner of a plaza, now look at it. Interior was nice, and had my boyfriend even saying he didn't feel like he was in Vegas when we ate there. Parking lot and valet was full when we arrived, but most were dancing out in the patio, and not eating inside so we were able to get a table instantly. 

Service was prompt, with waters and appetizer bread being brought out as I sat down. Boyfriend ordered the calamari and Shrimp with pepper and butter. I was crazy excited to break that yolk on top of the Huevos. 

Waters were continuously poured, food came out in a timely fashion, bread was gahhhmazing and service was good. Definitely try it!

Firefly is located off the strip, cute trendy decor.
Prices were normal not crazy as you will see on the strip. I got a glass of red sangria ($8) it was very good. My husband and I got 4 small plates and it was enough food for dinner. Dates were amazing (very small portions) eggplant was good, tri meat skewers were good and which came with steak, shrimp, and chicken and stuffed mushrooms were
Average. This place doesn't knock your socks off but doesn't knock your wallet empty either! Our bill was around $35 without our drinks.
Great place for tapas, food is great and so is the service.  Came for a snack and left satisfied

There's a lot to like about Firefly, a bustling, noisy restaurant with lots of varied food options, served tapas-style and meant for sharing. If your idea of a good time is to bring a crowd and sample many different dishes over the course of several hours, then Firefly may be the place for you. Our party of twelve thoroughly enjoyed the experience and tasted just about everything on the menu, along with several pitchers of their excellent sangria.

An added bonus for vegetarians or those with gluten allergies, Firefly has a separate menu with their vegetarian options on one side and their GF options on the other. This came in handy when ordering for our group, and made it easy to have safe meals for everyone, no matter their dietary restrictions.

If you like sangria, be sure to try some. Both the white and the red are excellent, but I preferred the red. Nice and dry, not too sweet, and a fine accompaniment to the Spanish-style tapas. Also good - their mojitos! Available by the pitcher.

My favorite items were the bacon-wrapped stuffed dates, the Padron peppers (deceptively simple, but tasty), and the watermelon sorbet at the meal's close. The sorbet flavor changes daily.

Others at our table raved about the Tierra del Mar skewers and the lamb chops. The bread and almond butter disappeared quickly.

Basically, there's enough variation on the menu to find something for everyone. But that's a little bit of the problem too. The menu feels scattered and not as cohesive as it could be.

Service is professional and fairly efficient, but at times was hit or miss. This is expected with large groups and a busy restaurant, and we never had to wait too long for beverage refills. Plus, the staff wants you to have a good time. As an example, our first order of lamb came out overdone, but Firefly was able to get another going and on the second try the lamb chops were hailed as the standout meat dish of the evening.

One final note. Don't call this a Spanish restaurant if you have an actual person from Spain in your group. It was my colleague's first time in the USA, and he was appalled that Americans think Spaniards eat this way. Live and learn! (Although he did enjoy the food and the drinks. He just took issue with anyone saying it was Spanish.)

My favorite go-to place in Las Vegas. Right behind the strip. This place is a gem!! Tapas -- but great sizes and plenty of food options to keep you & your party full and happy. I normally order almost everything and I'm completely satisfied always. 
Mac and cheese
Tuna tartare 
Baked goat cheese
Ceviche
Mojito pitcher! -- affordable and delicious 
Green tea whiskey --- best shot of your life 
Mushroom tart 
French fries!! 
The cod
Patatas brava
Even the effing Flan was good
EVERYTHING!!

Eder was the best server. He went above and beyond with everything and made sure our party was A OKAY
Best mojitos and sangria in Las Vegas. Friendly and helpful staff. Food tastes great. Good happy hour specials on drinks (half off pitcher of Mojito is my favorite).

I've been driving by Firefly for a few years now, telling my wife:  "We should really stop in there sometime."  Sometime finally came, and now I'm kicking myself for waiting so long to try this place.

It's a tapas place, so everything on the menu is a small portion, generally meant to be shared.  They all probably average around $6-9, with just a few topping the $10 mark.  Everything I tried was outstanding, and I'm looking forward to trying a bunch of new things next time.  

The restaurant itself was clean, new, and very tastefully decorated.  And the service was outstanding.  We were there maybe 45 minutes, and had no less than three people (including what I assumed was the manager) make sure everything was to our liking.  

What a great find.

This is my favorite restaurant in Vegas! As a local, I tell everyone that visits about Firefly. The atmosphere is cool and a bit fancy. Prices good.
They have a big menu of cold and hot tapas. Some of my favorites are the stuffed dates, the pork empanada, the fries, the apple and manchego salad, and the baked goat cheese. The sangria is also amazing! Great place for a birthday celebration!

Amazing yummy appetizers..
Make sure to order Bacon wrapped dates.
The lamp chops and steak were also very tasty.
I don't remember the other stuff unfortunately.
Our waiter was very nice.

Went for early dinner at Firefly yesterday and got phenomenal service by server Alejandro and mgr J. Eduardo. Tried all 3 sangrias and we decided the winner was the sparkling version (least sweet of the 3), although they're all above average, esp. the white. Scallop escargot was voted #1 of the 7 tapas we tried. I liked the bacon wrapped dates, but my husband liked the stuffed mushrooms better. Tierra Mar skewers were also fantastic. Bottom of the list was the mac 'n cheese which I thought was a little salty. Chocolate bread pudding w/ cherry, recommended by Alejandro, was also outstanding. Overall, a great night out w/ super service.

Superb, wonderful, magnificent. Yes this is as good ad it gets. Not in any way shape or form is it pretentious or snooty. Went for breakfast slash lunch and ate more than I should have. You get a bunch of small plates ( me and the wife) we ordered calamari, steak & mushrooms, lamb sausage ( only dish not worth it to me) but everything was first class the service was superb. Be back yeah for sure.
Great Small plates. Stuffed peppers are awesome. A little loud on atmosphere, maybe it's just a busy night. The food is awesome though

Disappointed from the last time I came here... first of all, it's my gf's bday and the server had a bad attitude from the start. He didn't introduce himself, my girl asked the server on recommendations on the alcohol drinks; he just named what drinks they carried. Not exactly the answer she was asking for... anywhom. I found out the name of the server, Ivan... at least that's what the busser told me. Food was brilliant. Thank you to the back of house...
Awesome happy hour! The mojitos are always amazing and the atmosphere is awesome, one of myself and my friends favorite places.
Amazing tapas place! If we were to eat this on the strip we would probably expect to pay twice the price and felt it was well worth it. Definitely worth the drive.

I heard about Firefly from the Food Network and boy was eating here worth it! We had several tapas and they were all delicious! Especially the stuffed dates....YUM! My 7 year old grandson couldn't get enough of the dates, and also really enjoyed the BBQ Baby Back Ribs with Mango BBQ sauce! We will definitely eat here when in Vegas again and it should be on everyone's must try list!

Jessie and Eduardo's service was phenomenal. Came here with 11 people (late night as we work in the industry) and honestly we had a great time. They gave us a round of shots on the house. We have been laughing, eating, drink and having an excellent time. This is my second night coming in a row and I am truly happy to have found this place, especially considering they are open late night.

Excellent food, nice casual environment on the patio (we came during the day, I can't speak for what it's like at night!), friendly service...this is a definite stop if you want a casual dining experience! 

We ordered the mac and cheese...seriously, the best I've had! The calamari was super yummy, the garlic aioli fries were amazing, and the chicken skewers were super tasty! Even the free bread that comes before the meal was delicious, it was like soft but flaky garlic bread with a really good sweet butter!
It was okay at best. Very busy as it was a Friday evening. Food was okay, nothing that I ordered was rememberable.
When I am in Vegas this is my go to always.  Service is great, food is great, drinks are great.  Menu is very diverse enough to please everyone.  Can not go wrong here!

Would've never traveled this far to go to this location (I go to the one on the west side often) if it wasn't for latin nights on Friday nights. Just like the other location the sangria is good, service is friendly and although this place is bigger than the Sahara location there's still a lack of space to move around.

They have a large patio which I can see could be nice to dine on if the weather is  nice but the problem is that Vegas usually has very extreme weather, either too hot or too cold and appropriate weather days are far and few between. Latin nights would have been so much nicer if there were misters on the patio at least or if they held the event indoors. Everyone was complaining about the heat ALL NIGHT and most people had to dance one song and sit out for five to "cool off" in the 100 degree temperature. Heat + Sangria + sweating due to dancing = super dehydration and hang over and feeling that I shouldn't go out Friday nights ever again lol 

Also I didn't know that there's an automatic 18% gratuity on drinks for a reservation. Not that we weren't going to tip but that was just a tad odd. I thought that was just for food. Just FYI so you won't be caught off guard! 

And yes after all that complaining I still give them four stars bc I think under the right conditions this could be an amazing venue.

Great atmosphere, even better food!

The scene: Loud and busy Sunday night for dinner. 

The Staff: Courteous and knowledgeable.

The Small Plates: Divine.

From the outside the place looks a little corporate with neon signage, however the food is not. Our dinner consisted of a giant pitcher of red sangria, stuffed dates, eggplant cannelloni, meat skewers (can't remember exact name), roasted pear and beet salad. 

Everything was delightful. Easy bite has great depth and flavor, and was made with love.

Desserts we had were the mini passion fruit cheesecakes, and the cherry/chocolate bread pudding. Both we above average.

I suggest making a reservation in advance, it is well worth it.

Enjoy!
The best place ever, food is fantastic, atmosphere is great, The bartender Omar super star! Thank u:)

Firefly is an excellent choice as they have a variety of dishes to choose from and they are fast at serving!  There is something for everyone's taste. Love going with a group of my friends when here on business!

I've been to this location once, the location on the west side of town, and the one they closed down the street from this one. I'm not sure what happened, their service used to be top notch at the closed location. The placing of the tables in this new location are awkwardly away from everyone, so much so you seem so far from everything (especially your server). The atmosphere is red dim light and art all over but you can't really appreciate it since it's too dark to be able to tell what things are, or the color of food on your plate. I always get the sangria pitcher, which is my favorite. Red or white, both good. Dates wrapped in bacon with blue cheese is still a favorite of mine. The salmon toast aren't that good in my opinion. The rest of the menu of good too. Depends on what you like more, sweet or salty. I haven't been back here and probably won't be for a while. However, I'm hoping my next visit reminds me why I used to go here so often.

The Tapas are really a great size, the ambience is very chill and they have music going all night long. Great place to go and have drinks with shareable plates. Extra plus that they are open until 2am for food. I had the Mac and cheese and it was really cheesy and good.

Initially, I ordered their chopped chicken salad and tierra y mars skewers.

The food took maybe fifteen minutes to come out. The first of my two dishes that came out was the chopped chicken salad, regretfully. What they produced before me was a large white chunky glob of mayonnaise. I proceeded carefully with my fork and made an attempt to identify the dish put before me. What I found were chunks of canned chicken,  shreds of endive, and grapes. The dish was composed of more maynonaise/dressing than of its distasteful counterparts, much too overdressed. This was no salad at all. I returned it to the kitchen. (1/5) Would not recommend.

I later placed an order for their garden variety salad: romaine lettuce, spinach, orange, feta, dried cherries, pine nuts, sherry vinegar, and heart of palm. The orange and dried cherries lend a nice natural sweet component to my dish, which I thoroughly enjoyed, especially since I had selected water for my beverage. This salad is priced at $7.50. What initially attracted me to their aforementioned train wreck of a chopped chicken salad I returned, was the fact that it came with a protein. I added grilled (actually GRILLED, not out of a can, like the first dish) chicken to my new salad for an additional $3 or $3.50 bringing my salad to nearly $12 grand total. Eh, should be $9.00 at most.
(4/5)

The Tierra Y Mars skewers were great. The tapas includes three skewers, stacked with filet mignon, grilled shrimp, and chorizo. (5/5)
Excellent servers, portions, and variety!  You can't go wrong with this place!  What a great find close to the convention center.

This is an easy restaurant to rate 4-stars.  We discovered it through the reviews of other Yelpers.  

The service was excellent, food very good, reasonable prices, unique dishes, nice atmosphere, easy parking.

It's where the locals eat, as well as the folks you see performing for you on the strip.  

It's where you will spend half of what you will spend on the strip, and get double the quality.  

We would check this restaurant out again next time in Vegas.
The paella is so good. I got the combo paella and a bunch of other tapas, but the paella was the star of the show. Hubs liked it as well.

This post is overdue, it has been a few months since our amazing visit and this is still one of the most memorable places we have been to. The food was great, just the perfect size portions to split between 2 people and be able to try quite a few items. 
The service was great, the atmosphere was great. Looking forward to going her again soon!

Came here twice so far and every time I am blown away at how well the sangria is and the tapas!

Definitely try the sangria. Some tapas recommendations:

-bacon wrapped dates
-ceviche
-Steak and mushroom skewers
-Shrimp and pork skewers
-stuffed mushrooms
-mac n' cheese

I'm sure the other selections are great. I'd definitely come back to try more.

Also, free valet! =]

one recommendation: They could tone down the outside music or maybe try a more intimate/romantic ambiance.

Uno de los mejores restaurantes españoles que conozco.
Es una joya de Las Vegas. Probamos la tortilla española, terrina de atún (increíble) , las empanadas, y los Chicago Beef Bocadillos. Todo delicioso. Pero lo mejor estaba al final, los postres son maravillosos!
Es el ambiente ideal para una cita, intimo y si quieres compartir con tu pareja las tapas son una buena alternativa.
Muy recomendada la Sangría y el mojito.
El servicio rápido y bueno.

I came to this restaurant with a large party (over 15 people) they initially did not want to split our check but after struggling to find a way to pay and 35 minutes later, they took 20+ minutes to split checks and bring the bills to us. This did not include the time it took to get back change and receipts. The service was not very accommodating but the food is excellent. Only come here if you have a small party

Spanish tapas thats open really really late - 2am. One of the best local food options after midnight.

The stuffed dates, Merguez (lamb sausage), and baby back ribs are excellent.

The Veggie Empanada was just ok. It had too much cream and cheese poured over it for my taste.

I've eaten in and done delivery here. They do both well. Delivery from here is a much better option than room service at most the hotels on the strip.

Nice, dim ambience for date night or drinks with friends. There's a large number of items to choose from so everyone should find a couple things they'd like. As with any tapas place, the plates are fairly small and the cost adds up quickly. Be sure to remember there's a parking lot dedicated to the restaurant out back.

The food is amazing. Pick it and it's great. Seriously. They're good at everything. 
Bacon wrapped dates, ahi stack and petite filet are the bomb. Get the infused vodka on the rocks to drink. 
Off the Strip location is perfect for relaxing and getting away from the craziness. 
Omar, is the Man! Great and verrrry personable bartender. Makes you feel like home. 
Athena is professional, yet fun. 
This place is a must every time I come here. Never ever ever had it let me down. 
Great ambience. Great patio. Great food. Seriously, just do it and you'll thank me. 
Oh, and tell Omar or Athena that Rick sent you. 
You're welcome.

This place is amazing! My girlfriend and I lived in Spain for 4 months so we are always on the lookout for good tapas. We recently came here with a large group of friends and loved it! The sangria (white and red) were delicious. We will definitely visit this place again next time we are in town. The service was quick and friendly. And it's not too far off the strip.

Great locals spot, I love anywhere you can share your food. I recommend the spicy shrimp, scallops in garlic butter, filet, dates and ahi tuna tartare.  I also love their blood orange mojitos.  Fun place to go with friends and just off the strip, without the price of the strip.

Just had dinner here and holy crap totally worth the walk from the Strip. It's a little out here so take a cab, but it's all amazing. We had the Cevacha, fish sticks,  mac and cheese and papas bravas and they were all fantastic. Extremely well priced for the portions served and good service, fast and efficient and our water always came quickly.  Also had mojitos and sangria,  both delicious and strong enough.  Great atmosphere,  a little loud but very nice.  Absolutely Check it out I will come back when I'm in a Vegas.

At the bar and this place is live!!! Patrick and Omar are BEAST!!! They work the Bar! Awesome customer service and I my wife and I felt VIP. Definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a good place with Great Service, Food,  & Drinks!!!

Ok I haven't been to the firefly in years so let's just say I was tapas intoxicated after my dinner.  Even my children were food sleepy.  It was an excellent experience for my family.  Every dish was in point!

Dude, just eat here. Eder was our waiter. We told him to bring us his five favorites. It included tuna tartare that was amazeballs. We also had cod, lamb chops, and skewers of some sort of delicious meat. Do yourself a favor and go to Firefly, find Eder, and prepare your face for greatness. PS, this is a tapas bar, not a topless bar ya jigaloo

Worst service I've ever received here, and it was for a special occasion  but the food came quickly and drinks were delicious even though the water glasses were always empty and we were left on the patio while the waiter maybe went home and we wondered if we would ever get the check. 

Of course I'll be back, I love this place. Too bad my friends had never been and were not impressed.

Our friend recommended this place to us and since we just got into Vegas we figured we'd grab lunch here.  The menu was impressive to say the least.  Just check out the pics posted to Yelp and you'll be able to get a good feel for the amazing options.  Everything we tried was awesome!  We will definitely come back on our next trip.  Be sure to check this place out!

THE BEST RESTAURANT IN LAS VEGAS. HANDS DOWN. Anytime anyone recommends a restaurant in vegas, this is the one I recommend. It never disappoints, I've been coming here for years!! 

The following is what I recommend::: 
Tuna tartare
Shrimp ceviche 
Mushroom tart 
Veggie empanadas 
MAC N CHEESE 
Baked goat cheese 
Baked cod 
Fries 

Everything on the menu is amazing but these were a couple of my favorites. The service is impeccable. Eder went above and beyond to make sure we had the best experience ever. Firefly is the restaurant I look forward to every time I'm in vegas!!! 

 Highly recommend the pitchers. Great bang for your buck

I love Firefly. I have been to many tapas spots, but none can compare to the fire that is Firefly (Cheesy? Yes. Accurate? Also, yes).

I would say this is the best low-key tapas spot in Vegas. And no, I am not including anything with an address on LVBLVD (read: low-key). The menu is reasonably priced for small-plates, and the waitstaff is both attentive and knowledgeable about their food and drinks. I especially love the dessert sampler, which comes with approximately 5-6 desserts for tasting (the Lemon-Berry tarte is my favorite!). In addition, the Firefly fries are delicious, I love the ceviche of shrimp, mushroom tart, and the Manchego mac'n' cheese is to die for! The fried calamari is also a win here. 

I hope that you go, and experience the love of tapas that is Firefly. Yes, they had issues. Yes, those have been resolved. 

Go. Love the tapas.

I haven't been back to Firefly in years because of the crazy salmonella outbreak that happened at their two previous locations. If you don't know what happened, there used to be a location in Henderson and one where Tacos and Beer is right now (same owners). There was a huge salmonella outbreak in the Tacos and Beer location that made a ton of people sick and hospitalized, including some friends of mine. The health department then checked their Henderson location and it had to be shut down because of the health grade. 

The only reason why I came back was because my friends wanted to go and it is conveniently located near our office. I ordered the Firefly burger, which was actually pretty good. The fries were a bit under seasoned but the burger had really good flavor. They have a vegan menu here too if you're into that. I didn't order sangria because I had to go back to work. I won't be coming back just because I'm still not over the whole salmonella thing, sorry!

Firefly is excellent for groups as the small plates makes it easy for sharing. On the expensive side, the atmosphere is mellow and beautiful with drapes and low lighting. Service is personable, authentic, and quick. Our waiter Carlos was extremely accommodating to our gluten intolerant friend, made sure to tell her everything that had gluten in it. He also ensured her that the items that are gluten free do NOT share the same equipment as gluten items. She was able to eat without fear. 

The bathrooms were a bit horrid, but that's depending on the guest, if you catch my drift.

Only for adventurous eaters. Don't go if you don't want to try something new. I'm tempted to take away a star for the crowds and the noise, but I don't want to hate on them for being too popular. Five stars. Great prices for what you get.

My date and I decided to check out the new Firefly, just a block away from the old one. I enjoyed the spacious and hip interior, along with some ambiant music playing over the restaurant chatter. We didn't check out the bar but we did order some quenching sangrias since they were half off all month long. I'm not the tapas expert but the menu has a lot to choose from. Bacon wrapper dates were my favorite, along with the diablo shrimp and stuffed mushrooms. The staff was very friendly and attentive as well.  I will definitely make a return here very soon!

TAPAS, amazing, just simply fantastic, delicious, so many to choose from tapas.
The stuffed dates wrapped in bacon were the most spectacular, delicious thing ever, camarones a la diabla oh my word. Just simply delightful, we were embarrassed we kept wanting to dip the bread in the sauce, it was the perfect amount of sweetness and perfect kick of spice, the most wonderful shrimp a la diabla. The Chicken and mushroom paella is new, different, but a very well made, and delicious paella, never tried anything like it, very tasty and flavorful.
We pigged out here, literally, we had 4 tapas, anything you choose will be amazing, plus paella, and Sangria. I am definitely planning on coming back here, most definitely, our waitress was very kind, sweet, and welcoming, very helpful also to when it came to tapa choosing.
Delicious Sangria and food! The paella was superb. Service was perfect. Prices were great. We would definitely come back! Come here when you're free.

Very good! The two $$ is a bit deceiving as it really depends on what you order. Fortunately I loaded up on freebies at the Embassy prior to visiting here so was able to stay in the two $$ range but if I went hungry, it would have easily been in 3 $$$ territory.

Still very good food but parking was a bit of pain.
Nice location off strip.  The food was amazing and served in a great social manner.  If I lived in Vegas I would be a regular.

After great hesitation following the mishaps of this restaurant involving the health district, my hubby and I decided to return.  The variety of foods are still amazing.  My favorites are still the warm spinach salad, artichoke toast and empenandas.  

I am a BIG Mojito fan and decided to stray away from the original Mojito and try the blood orange Mojito, sure glad that I did... Super yummy and refreshing.  Staff were kind and attentive.  We will definitely be back, with the expectation that there will be no further issues involving the health district.

The reason for four stars is that due to one of the restrooms being out of order, both males and females had to share one restroom.  Before entering, I had to check with the hostess to ensure that the restroom wasn't being occupied by the opposite sex..
My wife and I love this place. We frequent this establishment a few times a month. Great dishes and great drinks. The atmosphere is awesome too.
Great tapas. Great spot for a date. Had the burger and some chicken tapas and mixed skewers. Delicious.
Always great. I've been going here for years and while the atmosphere has improved... the service and food is still great. Love, love, love this place. And the Rib-Eye is fanominal.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a vegetarian-friendly place for a nice dinner while briefly staying in Vegas.  I did some web-searching and cross-referencing and Firefly seemed to fit the bill.

It was a Saturday night and we arrived at Firefly at about 8:00p.  After about 5 minutes we were seated on the heated patio that was beautifully strung with red and white lights and really just seemed to be an extension of the dining room.

Drinks were tasty: sangria and dirty martinis, and we were offered a nice crusty bread with compound butter consisting of schraicha, honey and almonds.  It was really good!

We ordered two cold plates and two hot plates.  The green apple manchego salad and pisto were real standouts.  All the plates were reasonably priced between $4 and $6.

For dessert: the caramel flan with almond biscotti was sized very well and tasted perfect! Not too-eggy and velvety smooth.

All-in-all a great dining experience.  I would definitely recommend this to a friend!!

I had the best grilled scallops, grilled chicken.....topped off with excellent chocolate and cherry bread pudding for dessert!!  Great bartenders tonight taking care of everything!!  This place is HIGHLY recommended!!

We went here on monday 03-09-15 at 8 pm with a group of 20 people.   Food and service were great.  We had the house sangria and some mojitos both were fantastic.   The food was good but the flavors were not quite as exciting as I had hoped.  I will definately be back.
Service on point as usual and the food is amazing.  Keep up the great work and hopefully we Las Vegas we see another location again.

We come here every time we're in Vegas since we have discovered them several years ago. This is our third time here. Bacon wrapped dates, albóndigas, tomato soup, tuna tartare, and Serrano ham and manchego crochets. All delicious.
We loved Firefly! Everything we ordered was full of flavor! The garlic shrimp was amazing and the wait staff were all very friendly and helpful!

Great food. Really wonderful, especially if you consider the price. 

Ambiance- relaxed, pleasant. Fancy enough to go before a night out. Laid back enough for a casual meal.

Service- wonderful service! Waiters are not pushy, very willing to answer questions and give suggestions. Personable and fast. Clears dishes quickly, refills waters, great overall. 

Food: lots of vegetarian options. I hear the meaty ones are good, too.

- Paella: large cast iron skillet- looking thing, which serves 3-6, not 2-4, was tasty and flavorful. *** Really does take about 40min., so order it first. 

- Manchego mac & cheese: creamy & cheesy. Not overly salty

- Tomato soup: how come I can't get that flavor at home? Rich and smooth, just the right balance of tomato-sweet-salty. 

- Mushroom puff pastry thing: creamy. With mushrooms that weren't overlooked- great texture. 

-  Veggie empanadas:  crispy crust, and a filling of who-knows-what deliciousness. Outside wasn't too thick, and the filling was plentiful. 

Sangria- 2 kinds: sparkling white or traditional red. Both were tasty, but most ppl preferred the red.

Check this place out.

I love Tapas but this place wasn't very good at all. The only thing that was good was the bacon wrapped dates and those are pretty hard to mess up. We ordered a variety of dishes and the meat dishes were dry and the salad was bland. The service was horrible. We had to ask for water twice since they never brought us anything to drink and barely even saw our waiter. We had to ask the person clearing our table for our check. Won't be going there again.

Pretty good food!  i just loved the ambiance of this place.  The portions are a little small, so you have to order more dishes to be full.  But if you just want a light bite to eat, this place will definitely hit the spot.

Synesthesia: the production of a sense impression relating to one sense or part of the body by stimulation of another sense or part of the body. 

The taste of this food exceeds the synesthetical beauty of all I've seen here so far in Vegas and surrounding lands- the beautiful Hoover dam, the breathtaking Red Rock Canyon, the tasteful tits in the magazine kiosks advertising the college girls in need of tuition money. Maybe it's the mojotos talking, but WOW! What a meal. If I was stranded on a desert island with one restaurant for the rest of my life, it would be this place. Long live Firefly!

The food was amazing the service was impeccable when we got there the manager Carlos greeted us upon our arrival and had a hostess Seat us then Neo our server was very descriptive with his suggestions  he suggested the mac and cheese which was ammmaazzeebbaaalllss and the tuna tartar needles to say I will comeback as soon as I get a chance 2
Great ambiance and value for your $. Best strawberry mojitos (made with fresh fruit) and the portions are excellent. A must try if you've never been

Wow a very excellent eclectic blend of flavors.

Terrific service and ample menu choices.

Great meal with my friends. Cheaper than expected,  more delicious than we planned for.  Each dish offered a new texture or flavor. Wait staff was friendly, accommodating,  and happy to serve. Come here for a good dinner!!!!

Went to this place earlier with my bestie. It was both our first time here and i must say food was really good. Was able to enjoy the happy hour and it was all worth it. Had a drinks named The New Girl, it was bomb. Babyback ribs and chicken skewers was delicious and tasty.  i will definitely come back.

Been to Vegas many times, and never had a chance to try Firefly until recently. Sadly, the food was not worth the wait.

Sangria - No. Not strong enough, and way too little fruit flavor for a drink that claims to have been marinated for 3 days. Did feel like the pitcher was never-ending, just never-ending sugar juice.

Stuffed dates - No. Recommended by server. Tasted like BBQ sauce.

Stuffed peppers - No. I prefer the Peruvian version. This was a bit overly cheesy (and I love cheese).

Pulpo asado - Eh. I've had better.

Camarones a la diabla - No. Tasted Chinese, and not spicy at all.

Albondigas - Eh. 6 meatballs for $7. Could have had 3 In-N-Out cheeseburgers.

Lamb chops - Now we're talking. The 2 chops for $12 were very tender, and my favorite of the night (and I don't even eat lamb!).

Ambiance is not conducive to holding a conversation, anything romantic, or close to relaxing. It's probably easier to hold a conversation at Chinese dim sum restaurants than it is here, as noise is coming at you at all angles. I could barely hear my BF across the table. The only good thing was the service; my glass was always full!

Needless to say, I'll save my stomach space for Vegas meals elsewhere.

One of my favorite places to eat at in Vegas! Ever since I had my birthday dinner here a few years ago, I've been coming here every time I go to Vegas. I love tapas and was first introduced to paella and tapas on a Barcelona trip 2 years ago. Before then I never really knew what tapas were lol. My favorite things to get are either the shrimp ceviche, paella, tuna tartare, pulpo asado, steamed mussels, scallops, empanadas, or camarones al ajillo. The seafood here is super delicious and the sangria excellent!  The paella takes awhile to make so if you're gonna order that, put your order in with your appetizers. Weekends are really busy here so make sure to make a reservation or there's first come first serve seating at the bar.

Service and food were great. I just hope this place doesn't become too busy every night! 

The summer salad is refreshing and the petite filet was spot on.

Came here for HH with a friend who's local.  And oh my gosh. the food!

The HH is amazing, super awesome deals and great food to choose from.  I would definitely suggest the bacon wrapped dates, it's insane how good it tastes!!  I would recommend it for the HH for sure, not sure about the regular hours 

Super nice place too :)
Great food! Atmosphere is good. Does get busy at times, best to call ahead and make a reservation. The drinks are amazing, and the service is great.

We chose this place (long distance! I live in WI, my daughter in AZ) for a cocktail reception after my daughter's wedding strictly based on reviews and price. So glad that we did! This was a wonderful experience for us. We had about 35 people and the coordinator (I wish I remembered her name) was amazingly helpful and got us set up in a banquet room, with a separate table for the wedding cake, and spots for everyone to mingle and eat. Kept checking in with me to make sure all was good. We had three appetizers (so yummy!) and an open bar. The bartender Miguel was super great and took food orders for a few people who wanted a full meal. All the guests loved the food, the atmosphere and their experience. Most of all my daughter was happy! Thanks Firefly for helping make her day as special as possible!

LOVE THIS PLACE! If you come to Vegas, you must try Firefly. It's super cute and the food is SO good. My favs are the apple & manchego salad, the bread and butter they give you, and the mushroom and filet skewers. Everything I've ever had is good, so you really can't go wrong. If I could give it 6 stars, I would!!!

Those of you who know me or have read my reviews know that I generally only review a restaurant for which I completely disagree with the average reviews on Yelp.  I figure a great restaurant with 5000 reviews praising their establishment doesn't need another similar review for someone to wade through.  This is not one of those occasions.

I suppose I should have seen the stale, tough bread as a sign.  If I did, I chose to ignore it.  Overall, the food was hit-and-miss.  The apple manchego salad was nice - light and refreshing.  The ubiquitous bacon-wrapped dates were fine, the recommended shrimp, chorizo and filet skewers disappointing and the also-recommended grilled octopus just terrible.  Neither seafood option was fresh - the octopus was tough and tasted off, with a miss-matched sauce and generic potatoes.  The filet was fine, but the shrimp were frozen and in short supply.  The chorizo almost non-existant.

My real issues here are with the restaurant in general.  This was, by far, the most unimaginative, pretentious, poorly-executed and disappointing tapas restaurant I have ever been to.  The menu is just plain boring.  Come on, this is tapas!  Give me something exciting I've never seen before.  Give me crazy combinations and flavors.  At least give me something simple done perfectly.

I know this is Vegas, but off-the-strip Vegas.  House music?  Really?  An entrance like a steak house out of the 60s?  Pretentious waiters and bartenders who would rather talk to each other than their customers?

I have heard about this place for years, had friends recommend it and was anxious to try it.  Maybe it just can't live up to the hype.  Don't waste your money in town where great food is everywhere.  It's not worth the drive.  It's not worth the money.  It's not worth eating here at all.

Great place if you want to get off the busy strip and go to a place that's not crazy overpriced. It's usually pretty packed here even late at night past 9 PM. Food is solid and service is good as well. Their fried tempura fish is da bomb and so is anything with shrimp. Their steak tapas is pretty good as well. Try to sample as many small plates as you can since the portion sizes are smaller.

after years of coming to vegas, i finally was able to try this place out. 
i don't know why i didn't come here sooner.  i for one, love tapas, and this place nails it right on the head.  the food, service, atmosphere was great! 

we ordered the following below: 
stuffed bacon wrapped dates, artichoke toast, rack of lamb, Octopus with spicy tomatoes and potato, and stuff mushroom. 
The best items were the artichoke toast.  omfg.  it was like little bits of heaven.  do yourself a huge favor, and get this.  the stuffed mushrooms, is something you can skip.  not too appetizing.  

this place has a fun vibe to it.  i heard that some nights they have a live band come in and play.  call ahead and check. so come down to firefly and order yourself a sangria and enjoy your night.

They also have free valet for your car.

True story, I came here with my mom and girlfriend and we were seated next to a table of Vietnamese strippers.

Best dinner ever.

Alright, now that I've gotten that off my chest, onto the review!

Firefly is awesome. Period. We piled up plate upon plate of dishes, each one more delicious than the one before. Instead of eating some overpriced frou frou garbage on the Strip or succumbing to your newfound poverty and eating 99c hotdogs, please get in a cab or car or whatever and head to Firefly.

There's something for everyone. You like to kill and consume four-legged animals that run through the plains? They got it. Perhaps you're more of a follower of Poseidon and it's swimming creatures that get your tummy rumbling. You're covered there as well.

On the real real, I'd probably drive back Vegas on the stupid I-15 just to eat here again.

This place is conveniently located a few streets off the strip behind the Linq hotel.  The place itself is huge and there is parking in the rear and valet parking up front. The lighting is dimmed inside.  My group of 4 ordered the following items:

Mixed Paella - $26 - All the paella dishes take about 40 minutes to prepare so I placed an order for this as soon as we arrived.  They are also highly customizable.  My mixed paella consisted of shrimp, mussels, clams, calamari, chicken, veggies, hold the chorizo (as I don't eat pork).  This was the star of the night as this dish was bursting with flavors and had quality ingredients.  The dish is designed for 2 to 4 people to share.

Pulpo Asado - $10 - Another one of my favorites was the grilled octopus with potatos, tomato, and a paprika-lemon vinaigrette.  It wasn't as soft and tender as my favorite tapas place, but it was still very good.

Scallop Escargots - $10.50 - This dish consisted of scallops baked in garlic-herb butter and the presentation gave the affect that they were escargots.

Tinga Empanada - $4 - This tapa was a bit small and consisted of 2 crispy chicken empanadas, tomato, onion, and chili-lime crema.  This dish was good as well.

Petite Filet - $13.00. - The filet mignon was tender and I asked them to prepare the dish without the red wine sauce.  This dish wasn't bad, but I would probably order some of the other tapas.

By the time we finished our meal there was a huge wait.  I really enjoyed the meal and would highly recommend ordering the mixed paella as some of the other tapas weren't really filling.  Service was extremely fast for the tapas that we ordered and our water glasses were filled through the night.

Great ambiance.
Great service. (Even the manager came up to my husband and I)
The FOOD IS AMAZING. 
Ribs, fries, seafood...all of it! 

If you are staying on the strip, you have to get here to eat. You won't be disappointed!

I love the small tapa dishes here! we were there as a party of 7 so we got to try so many different dishes. To start off the service was very warm and welcoming. Both the red  and white sangrias are sooo good! I also recommend the empanadas with the chicken or the veggie, the apple and manchego salad was aaamazing!!!The only one I am not a huge fan of was the chicken skewers it was a bit dry. We put in 2 orders of the mixed paellas, of course we definitely did not finish it so we took it to go. We were staying at an Airbnb, after the 7 of us came back from partying tipsy, tired  and starving late at night ... we just heat up the paellas in the microwave and they are the perfect comfort food before going to bed!!

Food is excellent. My favorite thing to order are the empanadas, they never disappoint! Whenever I go with groups of people we always get the paradise mojito pitcher,  it is delicious and a great value! Portions are a bit small I wish they served more of their amazing food!

This new location is much larger, cleaner, and better overall than the original service. I'm glad I gave it a try because I k ow I was hesitant to. 

Bravo, job well done. You earned my patronage back.

What a great place for a large group party. I came here for a friend's rehearsal dinner and had a fantastic time. We had the private room and 'it was just cozy and intimate. 

I enjoyed the various tapas that were ordered. The highlight for me was the chorizo clams, mac n cheese, and the steak. That steak hit the spot. It was cooked a perfect medium rare. I don't know if I was famished or just jet lagged but that steak was gooood.

The sangria was very light and very dangerous. I shared a pitcher with my friend and we totally destroyed it. I went with the sparking white sangria and later on the classic red. Thank goodness for cab service!!

The service was spot on considering how many people were present (about 20 ppl).

I had a great time with my friends. I highly recommend it.

Got here only a couple of minutes before happy hour ended absolutely love the red sangria pitcher for $18.00 like 6 drinks worth easily... ordered the tuna... calamari... and filet mignon everything was delicious. Will definitely come back just wish they had music for ambience lol

I have been here twice, once for a girl's dinner about 4 years back and again recently for a bachelorette dinner with 28 people. The food is tapas style and the prices are really cheap (well, compared to SF and LA tapas prices) for the quality of food. We ordered about 10 different dishes to share between the four of us, along with a pitcher of their sangria (large pitcher for only $28!!) and we were all STUFFED! 

Our favorite stand out dishes include the scallops "escargot" (juicy scallops in a butter pesto sauce), the bacon wrapped dates, shrimp diablo, clams and mussels. I'm sure everything is yummy because there was not a dish I did not enjoy out of the 10 that we shared. This restaurant will be bookmarked for all my future trips to Vegas! It's great for groups or a romantic dinner and food came out hot and fast.

Third time here and it's consistent.  The food is authentic and the service is just right. 

FOOD: very solid authentic tapas. If anything the portions are too big which is not a terrible problem other than it limits what you can try in one sitting. Again - 3 visits and everything was very good. 

SERVICE: Just right in my opinion. Not too aggressive but very attentive. Water was always filled and setups changed when needed without a bunch of fanfare. Perfect. 

My server tonight was listed as Night on the bill - well done,  thanks.

The 5 stars goes to our dinner and our server, which was absolutely wonderful. We were a party of five and ordered the chicken & mushroom paella, two pitchers of the red sangria (my favorite over the white) and several tapas. The bacon wrapped dates are by far the best I've ever had, the pork empanadas and roasted red peppers are also a standouts. All the others were great as well. Although we enjoy this place a lot, it was our first time bringing out of town family members here and they were beyond impressed with the food, ambiance and service. 

HOWEVER: I must note that the valet parking here is RIDICULOUS!  It's like FIVE feet from the entrance. We initially parked in an open spot out front NOT marked for valet, only to have the jerky valet guy bitch us out for parking in a "valet" spot. So we backed out of the spot, drove about two feet and gave him our keys to valet....and he parked it in just about the same damn spot! I don't get it, but whatever. Wasn't thrilled about tipping him either, but the fiancé did. 

Definitely my favorite restaurant in Vegas. Despite the idiot valet situation. I think we would have had a better time if we weren't all put off by the valet guy. Lame.

We went there last night as a group. My friends wanted tapas and I found this place online. I also asked around and the feelings were all positive. The reason I didn't give a 5star is because they auto added a gratuity. I truly despise that. This is Vegas and hospitality and guest service are expected. All interactions like this should be 5star no matter where you go. That being said, lets talk about the food. ITWAS SOOOO GOOD.  there was 6 of us and we all ordered 3 tapas so u can imagine what our table looked like. I didn't get the waiters name, slight deduction for that as well, but he made suggestions to me based on what my friends ordered and they were spot on. i got to try the shrimp tempura, the filet, the steak on a stick, the ahi tuna, the scallops, empanada ( chicken ), stuffed pepper, the spanish chorizo, the ham, and the mini bagles and salmon. everything was so good. had a stella draft. it was kind of tiny to be honest and this is coming from a non-drinker. either way yo will not be disappointed !  the amount of food they put on each plate is actually pretty significant. enjoy !!!

I would probably rate it a 4.5. I had been eyeing this place for a couple of weeks and knew that it was a must try. I found a Groupon so I was even more excited. The food and atmosphere was really amazing (a little dark but romantic since I was with my hubby). So comfy/cozy and it wasn't crowded (Tuesday lunch time). The stuffed dates, stuffed mushrooms, chicken skewers, fried shrimp, mac and cheese and pear martini were definitely memorable. I'm coming back next time I'm in Vegas.  The only negative was the dried bread they served as a appetizer but I didn't pay for that lol.
So damn good. Great for a date, party, or family. Service is amazing and the environment is killer! Huge vegetarian menu....i can't what to go back.

Great food options for all.

Great service.

Great huge bar.

Must go and it's right off the strip.

Petite Filet is the best bang for the buck!

Just had an absolutely wonderful anniversary dinner at Firefly! Apple/Manchego salad, mushroom tart, firefly fish sticks, and the petite filet. Topped off with a complimentary flan desert. EVERYTHING was spectacular. The apple salad was fresh and crisp, fabulous palate cleanser between meals. Service was on point, hostess, busser, server, everyone was friendly and attentive, but not intrusive. Overall great experience and we will definitely be back on our next trip!

Made a reservation on Open Table. Found parking easy, we were seated right away. All the dishes we ordered were amazing, great flavors, seafood and steak cooked perfectly. Authentic and so much detail put into every dish, even the smallest tapas and dessert. Very busy and pretty loud but I would still recommend for a date night. We were checked on a lot for more orders and refills even with the place packed. Will definitely go back.
We come here on Friday nights for Salsa night and it never disappoints. Bartenders are super nice even as busy as they are and the drink prices are reasonable. The interior is beautiful.

Firefly is a good Tapas restaurant.  The restaurant is quite large, so it's not too difficult to get a reservation.  Also, the service was fast enough, and the food was enjoyable.  There was nothing that blew me or Mr. Riches out of the water, but it was a good Tapas meal.  This is more a spanish tapas restaurant.  We went with a large group, so were able to try quite a few dishes.  The stand out for me was the diablo shrimp. Out of all the dishes, it was definitely the best!

If you are in Las Vegas, and want to venture slightly off the strip for some reasonably priced good food, give firefly a try!

Made reservations for a bachelorette group of 21 here and the food did not disappoint!! Our waiter was attentive to our needs and time restraint since Magic Mike was our next stop! The food was amazing especially the seafood paella at the end!! Will definitely come back!!

A friend of mine and I found a groupon for this place and decided to come here for lunch. Upon arriving she had told me about their salmonella incident. This of course scared me and I told her I did not want to have lunch here anymore, but she assured me that the new location was fine and that they had really good food. So I gambled with my health and we decided to come anyway. Sure enough the food was delish!

Stepping into firefly I noticed the environment was nice and clean. The walls were painted with warm, dark tones. The overall atmosphere was pleasing. You even had the option to sit outside, but with the sun beaming out we decided to enjoy our meal inside where it was cool. 

We stuck with the groupon and ordered multiple tapas and not one of them was a disappointment. My favorite tapas would have to be the mushroom and steak skewers and the smoked salmon toast. The steak skewers were tender, juicy, and flavorful. And the smoked salmon toast..yuuum! Their dishes were served with abundant flavors. And before I forget to mention, their firefly fries are really good; the dipping sauce served with it really compliments the fries. 

The servers were also nice. I never had to ask for a refill because my cup would already be filled. I would definitely come back to try their other tapas or entres.

Tapas not bad, a bit disappointed in their paella
Don't understand why firefly can get 4.5 stars on yelp. 
Recommend spicy shrimp and ceviche shrimp tapa :)
I come here every time I visit Las Vegas, when I lived in Vegas they were my favorite tapas restaurant and they still are! Reasonable pricing, great service and excellent food!
Really great restaurant off the strip. Diverse menu, tons of flavor, reasonably priced. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas.
Love the scallops, shrimp a la diabla, cheesy potatoes, ambiance is great and staff is attentive. If you ask for bread it comes with garlic butter.

What can I say... I love this place the Tapas are truly delicious! They are always fresh and quick. My only complaint was the seafood paella. There was a couple muscles that tasted and smelled very foul (not their fault though). I think we may have had a bad batch of muscles. Regardless, they took wonderful care of us. And everything else was on point (as it always is). A few of my favorites are the chicken skewers, the steak and mushroom skewers, firefly fries, Serrano ham sliders, the hot spinach artichoke salad, and the abinadagos (meatballs).  They are meticulous and our servers were always ensuring our glasses were full. My favorite time to go is during happy hour I believe the day time is from 3-5pm and then from 11pm-1am. The pitchers of sangria are $18.... and believe me they are worth every penny. This is one of my favorite spots in the valley!

All I wanted was a delicious meal. Thanks firefly! ..and lucky me to have stumbled in during happy hour. The albondigas were full of Italian flavor, cheesy and only 4 dollars. Such a steal. I also had the hot spinach salad it was fresh and everything went together perfectly. Lastly, I had the tierra y mar skewers. So much goody on such a small stick. There are so many options that have mbut attention I look forward to revisiting this place. I also tried their berry infused vodka. I dont typically like sweet drinks, but this was smoothe and almost tasted like straight grape juice. Bartenders were nice and attentive.

AMAZING DELICIOUS Seafood Paella!! The only downfall was we didn't see the note on the menu that it took longer  for the paella to come out( I guess for cooking time), so as we ate all the other wonderful scrumptious tapas, we were all stuffed by the time the paella was served. It looked so delicious we all had to try it (stomachs protesting) and man it was soooooo delicious! It was by far the best paella I've eaten. The seafood was not overcooked, rice perfect, wonderful spices! All the tapas we ate were delicious! The staff was very attentive and friendly. My cousin and I even got a 3 piece dessert because it was our birthdays!! Will definitely be coming back here on my next trip to Vegas!

I love this tapas place. The quality of their food is always really good. What a fun atmosphere with lively music and art. This place can get really busy so definitely come in non peak hours. Their service is good and really quick. We dined for 4 hrs one time, felt no rush.

-Mussels in coconut curry are delicious.
-Summer Salad... The burrata cheese is to DIE for! It literally melts in your mouth, perfect texture and the outside is not overly thick. One of the best burrata cheeses I've ever had. 
-Paella comes in a good portion. Although, I could go with more crunchy toasted rice from the bottom of the pan.
-Sparkling white sangria is so good and refreshing. 
-Baked goat cheese was ehh... Not bad but not that exciting of flavors. 
-Always love the Grilled Veggies in mint sauce.

Very small plates. Yes I know it's tapas and in typical Vegas style they are even smaller plates and the drinks are as well. 
 2 sodas
 1 martini
 3 plates
$60

Off the strip and out of this world!  This place is worth the short detour from the strip!  Great outdoor dining and amazing ambience.

Even though they serve tapas the portions are decent size.  Everything  was expertly prepared succulents and delicious. You will not be sorry if you make the trip here.

Save room for the chocolate cherry bread pudding!  Your welcome!!

You can't go wrong when you're ordering a pitcher of Sangria.

Made a reservation before leaving the house and waltzed right in. Okay, not really, we did have to wait a few minutes because there was a line of people at the host stand, but it wasn't more than 10 minutes before our table was ready. Nahum was our server and he was on point. He checked back often but wasn't overpowering the table and he was SO NICE!

The menu is huge and the plates are tapas style so it's easy to over order. A few highlights for me were the Scallop Escargots with the buttery herb sauce and the Chicago Beef. Oddly, my table mates weren't as big of a fan of the Chicago inspired sandwiches but they are east coasters so perhaps they have more to compare it to. I also loved the Hearts of Palm *Crab* Cakes. They are vegan, so don't expect crab, but I loved the texture and flavor. 

A few misses were the Serrano Ham & Cheese plate and the Seafood Paella. The cheese on the plate was flavorless and the paella was very bland.

The pitcher of red sangria was amazing though and for how busy this place is, the food comes out super fast. This was my second time here and although it's not my favorite spot in Vegas, it's close to my house and worth the price.

OMG the selection and the quality, impeccable.  with service to match!

The EXCELLENT:
- mushroom tart
- steamed mussels
- camarones a la diabla
- scallop escargot
- tuna tartare

The GOOD:
- stuffed dates
- patatas bravas -

The OK:
- tierra y mar skewers
- manchego mac n cheese
- pork Empanada

strawberry mojitos are made with the fruit, however the mango is made with the syrup, per suggeston from our waiter, thank you for the honesty!  the sangria is probably 3 times stronger than the mojitos just to give you an idea though..

wow i would definitely come here again, with a party of 6 or greater so you can all try the different dishes!

Bomb dot com!! Good food good drinks and live Latin music! Super hip, super trendy and good vibes!! Good for groups. Good for dates. Good for a big ass group of dates! Haha! Salsa dancers come and get down!!
Amazing food, great atmosphere, good service and below average bloody Mary's. Try the stuffed dates!

Oh man.... this new building and location is amazing. It's huge! Relative to the old location that they had overgrown years ago, this place is the size of Costco. But the best thing is their food is still nothing short of Yelp 5-star quality. Service is solid to! While I do miss the old location in terms of number of parking spots and small cozy feel, this place is much more suited to the amount of volume they do.

Went here for a friend's bachelor party and we were rolling pretty deep (like 20 of us).  I was appointed to order for the table and was very glad to.  We got 13 different tapas (3-4 sets of each) and some paella.  The paella was OK.  If you get it, get the seafood one.  I've had some pretty good paella and it set the bar really high.

Make sure to start with their Sangria (I got the red).  It was delicious!  They say they marinate it for a minimum of 3 days and it definitely shows.  So smooth and bomb.

Pros:
+ Restaurant had a nice ambiance
+ Friendly staff (the owner came out and even bought us a couple rounds of drinks for the bachelor party).
+ Waiter was knowledgeable about the food
+ Huge selection of tapas to choose from (could make things difficult)

Cons:
- Not exactly on the strip, but worth it for a nice dinner.

Food highlights:
+ SCALLOPS "ESCARGOTS" - these scallops were amazing!!  My favorite dish here!!!  They were cooked in the escargots container thing and the garlic herb butter hit the spot so well.  Definitely get this!!
+ MANCHEGO MAC 'N' CHEESE - super cheesy but very delicious.  Can never go wrong with mac n cheese
+ CHORIZO CLAMS - clams with chorizo in a sweet and salty sauce.  I believe it came from the clams and the the chorizo.
+ Lamb skewers - tender and did not have a gamey taste to it
+ CAMARONES A LA DIABLA - big shrimps cooked to perfection. nice and crunchy with a sweet and spicy chili sauce that complemented it very well.
+ STUFFED DATES - bacon wrapped dates... crispy bacon wrapped with dates inside.
+ TIERRA Y MAR SKEWERS - shrimp, filet mignon, chorizo sausage.  AWESOME COMBO!!! enough said.

I'd definitely come back to this place.  Just make sure to come with a decent crowd so you can order a bunch of tapas.

Here's a pic of our group:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/firefly-on-paradise-las-vegas-3?select=8HSstljGNrImSBq9jKy9hQ#8HSstljGNrImSBq9jKy9hQ

Went back a second time a few weeks later, and unfortunately it wasn't as good as the first visit.  The service from our main server was very impersonal and infrequent (although another person who was mostly serving drinks and floating around the whole room was very friendly and helpful).  Also, the food seemed less well flavored and presented.  Perhaps the kitchen staff was different that night.

I would try it a third time, but I would lower my expectations a bit.
Really enjoyed the food and drinks. the patio was nice and service was good. will definitely be back. place looks like its very popular.

This place is mouthwateringly great! All the good things I've heard and read on about this place is nothing but all true! You have to come check it out yourself really to judge it but I can promise you won't be disappointed at all! Great atmosphere great food great drinks and most of all service is absolutely impeccable! Will be back in the future!

Off-strip, but a quick drive/cab ride. Happy hour is a great deal.

Not particularly fancy, but reliable well-priced small plates. Pretty much everything is good, fantastic cocktails, and beautiful covered patio. I'm a big fan.
A team favorite! Great for large groups. The food is fast and delicious. There is something for everyone.

My boyfriend and I decided to try Firefly because we were in the area looking for brunch. We found out brunch is only on Sunday's but they made up for it. We ordered the fire fly fries to start, chicken skewers and the Tierra y Mar. Both were excellent! The chicken was fabulous and had so much flavor. The fries were delicious as well. Our server, Nahum was very helpful in offering suggestions. The atmosphere is relaxing and pleasant. Reasonably priced for the quality of food. Very impressed, will definitely be returning.

We are visiting from out of town and this place was great.   Food was superb.  We ordered six different items and they were all excellent.  There was a 30 minute wait so we ended up sitting at the bar.  Servers were on itn. Very helpful and the food came out quickly.   Would definitely come back!

Firefly has always been a favorite of mine but we recently had our after wedding dinner there and it was incredible. Fernanda was the banquet contact and she made it so easy and was so flexible with our changes. Manuel and Omar took care of us once we arrived. My only criticism might be they did their jobs too well. The tapas came out very quick and everything tasted amazing! They were also great with the bar service. I couldn't have asked for a better place to host all of our family and friends.

My husband and I were in Vegas in October and couldn't wait to go back to 
Firefly! When we heard they shut down we were so bummed. I just loved the atmosphere at the old location. We always take our friends  whenever were in town. I dream about the pardon peppers and bacon wrapped dates. We had no problem getting a table around 8:30 or so on a Monday night. The new place seemed almost bare it's so much bigger. We sat across from the kitchen next to each other looking into the kitchen thru the swinging door. Not what  we had in mind . I hate being to close to the kitchen traffic. We decided to move to the bar. It's a really nice addition. We were the only ones at the bar when we sat down. By the time we left it was 3/4 full. Restaurant appreciation night I believe. We always order red sangria but heard the white was really good. Our bartender offered to let us sample it . We still went with red. 2 of us will down a pitcher!  We are in Vegas you know! We were brought some yummy bread and omg! That butter is the best stuff ever! I forgot about the butter!  We ordered our usual , 1 order of bacon wrapped dates, then pardon peppers, such wonderful chile flavor not spicy a little salty, I believe they are flash fried, but I think the order was a little smaller than it use to be. They are so addictive. I found 1 place in Denver to get them but not the same  restaurant vibe. We decide we need more dates and then the cream cheese stuffed peppers. The sauce and cheese and peppers! Yum! Our bartender told us about the garbanzo beans. We had never had them roasted in the shell before. We liked them.  And then more stuffed peppers! That was our fav. Dinner in Vegas as always. Just sit and graze. Every bite was a party in my mouth! The bartenders were on top of the water and plates and very friendly. The manager stopped to see how everything was and we chatted for quite a while.  He was eager to hear our comments. When he found out we were in the bar biz in Denver he even gave us the locals discount! That was a really nice thing for him to do. I can't remember names as it's been too long. I should have written this sooner.  But life happens.  The food is as good as ever at the new location.  The atmosphere in the dining room I'm not sure I'm sold on. Something's missing. The kitchen really stands out too much. It's just really open for everyone to see. I missed the intimacy of the old place. Will we be back? Absolutely! If it's warmer I'm looking foreword to sitting on the patio! You guys do a great job!

I am not quite sure how this plays get so many high reviews I definitely know that a lot of my friends liked it it was probably my very first experience with Tapas
 We ordered several dishes one that particularly was delicious with the fags but I know we ordered multiple items I wasn't too crazy about the place because of the menu but I know that I hated the location I think that's the worst part but at least there is parking 
And the service was definitely good
It's not a place that I would visit on a regular basis
Very tasty food, and great service. Portions are a bit larger than most tapas, and each new dish prompted me to try another.

The steak skewers are very rich tasting.

The caramel flan was delicious. 

Pricey but an interesting array of flavors that will quench your overall cravings.

Delicious! If you're looking for something to wake up your taste buds you must go here. We've been here several times and enjoy many of the different tapas. I suggest trying the croquets, bacon wrapped stuffed dates, manchego Mac and cheese, albondigas, & empanadas. Those are just a few of the amazing dishes they have. They are priced just right for all the food and have excellent atmosphere.

Really good food. Came with a groupon( 30 for 50) We ordered the Garden Variety Salad, Spanish tortilla, fries, meatballs, ribs, chicken skewer, pork empanada and garlic shrimp.  They forgot to bring us the ribs, but we were so full by the time everything else came that we just didn't say anything.  The salad was very good, very refreshing.  I'd totally get a salad here because you need the acidity of the dressings to break up the other proteins you order.  The sauce on the tortilla was WAY too spicy for me.  I had to send it back and have them remake it.  The shrimp were too spicy as well, but I just picked off the red flecks of pepper and that was ok. 

The service was good, if not a little rushed.  There was no rhyme or reason to the way the dishes came out.  We didn't drink so can't comment on that, but the food was great.  The complimentary bread was delicious too.

Despite all the issues this establishment has had historically it has never failed to deliver when I've gone. I usually start off with a mojito but last night switched to mescal mule, it was delicious and hit the spot. Also steering away from ordering the usual chorizo and clams, we ordered the ham and manchango plate, scallops, tuna skewers, and apple and manchango salad. All were spot on and would order them all again. The scallops were decadent!  Love this place!

Still the place to go. Food & Service at the bar are great! We love the ambience and has nice music.
The dates have always been my favorite and my girl loves the scallops. Finish the night with chocolate tres leches!

Firefly is a great place for tapas and drinks! They're famous for their red sangria so I recommend getting a pitcher of that. It's my go-to drink! I have been here so many times and I just haven't gotten a chance to write a review. I order probably 6-7 dishes every time I'm here. My top favorites so far are their bacon wrapped dates, mushroom tart, tierra y mar skewers, scallop "escargots", steak&mushroom skewers, and their camarones a la diabla. The bacon wrapped dates is a nice blend of sweet and salty, with a dash of creaminess from the cheese crumbles. I can have all 5 to myself, honestly. The mushroom reminds me of cream of mushroom soup over puff pastries. It's so delicious! The tierra y may skewers is a little bit of everything from shrimp, chorizo, and I think some beef. The scallop "escargots" are exactly what they sound like, they're scallops made how escargots are normally made on the escargot platter with the butter herbs. The butter herbs is so delicious. After eating all the scallops, I enjoy dipping my bread in the butter. For the steak and mushrooms, it's steak and mushrooms! How can you go wrong with that. The camarones a la diabla are shrimps in a somewhat sweet and spicy sauce. It's to die for. I also love dipping my bread in the sauce. Maybe the only reason that I don't write this review is because it makes me hungry! Haha.
 
The service is very subpar. In all honestly, they should just hire more employees because it takes long to get your order in, to get more orders, to get a refill or anything. Plus the guys are not very pleasant, but oh wells! Can't expect 5 start service from such a busy place. Parking sucks so maybe just bring a couple dollars for the valet? And it's a very noisy atmosphere so don't expect to go here for a quiet dinner. Definitely try this place out.

Going by Yelp reviews. We chose this restaurant. We had a wonderful dinner & great loud & happening atmosphere. We love tapas and this place has something for everyone, even the in-laws who had never been to a tapas place. I definitely recommend this place. Thanks for great time & dinner while visiting Las Vegas!

Off the strip and I got to give up the props. Trendy, clean and priced right. Tapas and cocktails after work are just the ticket for locals or just a great place to visit for out of towners. Full bar for cooling off. I ordered the old fashion.. one of the best I've had. Great for a date, with friends or family. Noise level is about a 7 on a scale of 1-10, music is modern but no rap, rock or country. Great place, I recommend it.

Love this place!!! Me and my husband went here for an early dinner one week and were so happy with the service the food and even the prices. A friend was telling me how this restaurant was once shut down for health violations but don't panic its under new ownership :) 

Our waitress was a super friendly women who checked in on us often and let us order as we go. Not something I recommend if your really hungry, the food did take a little longer coming out then I had hoped.

And its best to come with friends and share you plate.

But I do recommend that you order the desert platter its to die for!

One of my favorite places! It's tapas so it's a fun small plate to try different things and share. The pomegranate mojitos are my favorite drink, why get a glass when the pitcher is cheaper! The stuffed mushrooms with chorizo are amazing. I also have never liked blue cheese but being stuffed in the dates is a whole new spin and melts in your mouth. The paella is also very delicious with many ingredients but it does take a while to cook so order first. Latin night is always a good experience and can't wait to go back. The almond butter served with bread is unbelievable.
The chicken empanadas are so good! The place itself is a bit small and the ceilings are low which make it very loud inside. We could barely hear each other talk but the food was good!

We were invited by friends for dinner (party of 6 for tapas and drinks) We were seated right away. Our friends chose to sit on the patio, so I didn't get to see the inside. The patio faces a busy 6 lane roadway with no real view, and no garden between you and the street, only the sidewalk. The waiter never brought my drink. We ordered loads of tapas to share which ranged in price from $8 to $12. The dated wrapped in bacon with blue cheese were delicious, but overcooked. The steak and mushroom skewers were such a disappointment - ordered medium - they were tough and were fat and gristle, so we left them uneaten. The calamari was good, the roasted vegetables were mushy and flavorless, the veggie empanadas were forgettable but served on a nice bed of greens that we all enjoyed. Then there was the ribeye steak - we ordered it medium rare, but it was so rare no one ate it and the steak knife they served it with wouldn't cut the steak! The shrimp tempura, the shaved steak sandwiches and the big pasta bowl were the favorites. The shrimp tempura had enough shrimp for 5 to taste and also was on a pile of vegetables tempura that were delicious. The steak on the sandwiches was hot and tender, served on delicious fresh rolls, with a chopped cold vegetable relish topping and we cut them into 4 generous servings. The pasta was angel hair with a red sauce that was just spicy enough to perk up the taste buds without burning them. The food was served hot as each dish is brought out as it is ready, so no one really ate at the same time.  Plates were not cleared, so we ended up with piles of plates, and they never offered us clean tasting plaes. Our friends had a pitcher of peach sangria, which they reported was delicious. I was in it for the company, and some of the food was good, but I have no desire to return.

Excellent. So, this place is better than any place I have eaten on The Strip. I am comparing it to places like Julian Serrano (way better) and China Poblano. There were vast vegetarian options for my wife. It is worth a cab ride or renting a car. I had the ceviche, which was great, and the camarones di diabla were amazing. Lots of meat choices, too. The service was wonderful. We come to Las Vegas three times a year and this is going to make it part of our regular places not to miss. When it's not too hot the outdoor patio is a great place to sit
Ehh.. I guess I kinda like this place. They got some cute little tapas and a so so wine list. When I got no place to go for my wine nights, I will return~

My favorite spot in Vegas!

The palla is amazing! The tapas... Omg you can't go wrong after several visits and nearly sampling everything u am damn near an expert at this place! Oh let me tell you about the burger! Damn, it's bomb! It's close to a chimi from the BX!

3.5 stars for food.
We had ceviche of shrimp, padron peppers, scallop "escargots", petite filet, seafood paella and banana nutella sandwiches for lunch. Our favorite were the padron peppers and petite filet. My medium-cooked filet was surprisingly prepared to perfection, really tender and juicy. The scallop "escargots" was good as well but the portion sucks. Both ceviche of shrimp and seafood paella were way too sour and tasted bland. The banana nutella sandwiches were OK, looked better than it tasted. 
All in all, reasonable price with average food. Service was good.

During our trip to Vegas we ventured off the strip to go to Firefly.  At the end of the trip everyone said it was their favorite place out of all the restaurants we went to and I have to agree!  I made a reservation a week ahead of time for a party of 6 and they called the day before to confirm. The ambiance is dim lit, energetic, loud and fun! 

It's the perfect place to go to with a group because you can try a little bit of everything. We ordered and ate family style and everyone seemed to enjoy it. All that was left was empty dishes! Some of our favorites were the stuffed dates, baked goat cheese, and the steak and mushroom skewers. 

Out of the 6 of us 5 were sharing the tapas and 1 person ordered an entree. The tapas came out all at once, but our friend with the entree had to wait 15 minutes before hers came out so that sucked since we all felt bad she didn't have her food at the same time as everyone else. We could have clarified a bit better when we ordered. Since the tapas came out all at once I'd recommend ordering in courses especially if you are ordering half the menu like we did. The service was good and only got a little slow at times, but they were slammed so its to be expected. 

In comparison to all the restaurants on the strip we visited, the food at Firefly was better and it was a lot cheaper since you aren't paying for the celebrity chef's name. 

We also had fun with the GIF maker on the way out!
